description: James Vincent Napoli, the reputed boss of the late Vito Genovese's Mafia family, was arrested yesterday and charged with operating the country's largest policy gambling operation with a yearly handle put at hundreds of millions of dollars.

title: Rejected Wife Thinking Of Next Life in Seattle
description: EGLIN AIR FORCE BASE, Fla., May 7 (UPI)A Vietna mese woman who threatened suicide after she was rejected by her American husband's family says she is thinking about starting a new life in the United States with a Seattle family.

title: Ticonderoga to Fall Again, and Again...
description: TICONDEROGA, N.Y., May 7Two years ago Jane Lape put a notice in the New England Genealogical & Geneological Register seeking out descendants of the 83 Green Mountain boys who had rowed across Lake Champlain with Ethan Allen.

title: Coach Stays With Players Even After School Season
description: While it is not uncommon for youngsters to spend most of spring and summer playing baseball, the Don Bosco Tech players have a rare luxury indeed  the opportunity to play those six months under their coach, Robert O'Brien.

title: DR. A. BELA WINDHOLZ
description: Dr. A. Bela Windholz, an obstetrician and gynecologist who had practiced here for the last 12 years, died yesterday at Flower and Fifth Avenue Hospitals. He was 86 years old and lived at 170 West 73d Street.

title: 2 Brothers Are Arrested After a Melee at Hospital.
description: Two brothers who had sought psychiatric treatment at the emergency ward of Greenpoint Hospital in Brooklyn were arrested yesterday after they became involved in a melee with two police officers and a fireman who were at the hospital

title: Consumers Battle Another Con Ed Rise
description: More than 30 witnesses testified in behalf of consumers against a request by the Consolidated Edison Company for a 21.7 per cent increase in eletricity rates. The increase would ?? the utility $456.4million.

title: Burns Wins 2 Matches, Gains in Golf
description: PINEHURST. N. C., May 7 (UPI)The defending champion. George Burns of Port Washington, L. I., won two matches today to reach the quarterfinal round of the North and South amateur golf championship.

title: CASTRO URGES U.S. TO EASE EMBARGO
description: HAVANA, May 7 (AP) Premier Fidel Castro strongly arged the United States tonight to begin a partial lifting of its trade embargo against Cuba by resuming shipments of food and medicine here.

title: 3 LABELLE VOICES CARRY AUTHORITY
description: Labelle's appearance at the Harkness Theater on Tuesdaythe first time any group of this kind has performed therewas essentially a repeat of its precedentbreaking debut at the Metropolitan Opera House last October. It was, however, scaled down somewhat to fit the smaller dimensions, of the Harkness. But if the costumes and staging were not quite so extraordinary, the voices of the three members of Labelle remain so.

title: Antiwar Activist a Suicide in U. N. Garden
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 7Charles R. Hook 3d, an antiVietnam war activist from a wealthy and prominent family, walked into the nearly deserted garden of the United Nations this morning and shot and killed himself beneath the flowering cherry trees.

title: People in Sports
description: Muhammad Ali has been Dent a letter by Eleanor Holmes Norton, New York City Human Rights Commissioner, suggesting that Ali apologize for the allegedly racist statements he made about Tony Perez, the Puerto Rican referee who officiated at Ali's heavyweight championship title defense against Chuck Wepner in March.

title: Union Club Is Robbed Twice Within a Month
description: For the second time in less than a month, the staid Union League Club, oldest in the city, was invaded by holdup men yesterday.

title: 5 Hell's Angels Accused Of Beating Man to Death
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., May 7 Five members of a Hells Angels motorcycle club were arrested today and charged with stomping a 39yearold motorist to death after a midnight traffic dispute last Friday.

title: Personal Finance
description: When a chemical engineer lost his job earlier this year, he went to a jobcounseling organization and paid more than $1,000 for advice to help him find a new one. He also flew to Chicago and Detroit for job interviews.

title: The Schomburg Collection Marks 50 Years
description: One of the country's largest collections of black history, literature and art is still in the same home it started in 50 years ago, though a new library has been promised for years and the present one is considered unsa??e.

title: 3 ALLIED LEADERS ASSURED BY FORD
description: WASHINGTON, May 7President Ford personally assured three of America's closest allies today that the United States would not, forget its worldwide responsibilities or turn inward as a result of the setbacks in Indochina.

title: I.T.T. Sees Profit Upturn in Second Half
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., May 7 Harold S. Geneen, chairman of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, predicted today at the company's generally peaceful annual meeting that I.T.T.'s earnings would improve in the second half of this year.

title: CITY HELD BETTER AT AIDING ADDICTS
description: Health Commissioner Lowell E. Bellin said yesterday that the city could do a better job of caring for the patients now in the private profitmaking methadone clinics, but that there was not enough money or personnel to do the job.

title: Head of U.D.C. Inquiry Pledges No Whitewash or Witchhunt
description: The head of the special state commission named to investgate the trouble of the Urban Development Corporation promised yesterday that there would not be a whitewash or a witchhunt and said that his panel would hold public hearings in the fall and hoped to have its report shortly after that.

title: Leeds' Tickets Sold
description: LEEDS, England, May 7 (UPI)Leeds United has sold all its 8,000 tickets for the European Soccer Cup final against Bayern Munich in Paris on May 28.

title: Director Defines Duality of Hollywood
description: Hollywood is an extraordinary kind of temporary place, John Schlesinger said recently, Buildings disappear just like fortunes and reputationsthe instant dispensability of all of us working in movies!

title: 7 CBS Moses Begins June 21
description: CBSTV announced yesterday that the special Biblical series MosesThe Lawgiver, a coproduction of RAI Television of Italy, and ATV, Ltd., of London, would be televised on six successive Saturday nights at 10 o'clock begining June 21. The six onehour dramas are based on the Book of Exodus and will feature Burt Lancaster as Moses, Anthony Quayle as Aaron. Ingrid Thulin as Miriam and Irene Papas as Zipporah.

title: 2 Ships Quit Suez
description: Two West German freighters trapped in the Suez Canal for eight years sailed to the Mediterranean yesterday. They were the first large vessels to leave the canal since it was closed by the ArabIsraeli war of 1967. Page. 3.

title: Vagrants on Skid Row Want Refugee Status
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., May 7 (UPI)The vagrants on this city's skid row want President Ford to designate them as refugees and build a tent city as he has done for arriving Vietnamese.

title: Stoneham Ready to Sell Giants
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 7 (UPI)Horace C. Stoneham, who moved west in 1958 because of low attendance at New York's Polo Grounds and was faced with the same problem here, said today he was ready to sell the San Francisco Giants. I have made up my mind to sell, and my one hope is that whoever buys the club will keep it in San Francisco, Stoneham, whose family has owned the Giants since the early 1900's, told the directors of the National Exhibition Company, which owns the franchise. We have several people interested in buying the club.

title: Kissinger Bars Quitting As Unwise at the Moment
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 (Reuters)Secretary of State Kissinger said it would be a disservice to the United States if he left office at present.

title: U. S. STARTS PLAN TO MAKE UTILITIES SHIFT TO COAL USE
description: WASHINGTON, May 7The Government announced today the start of a program of mandatory conversion of electric power plants to coal, a program that ranks high on the Aoministration's list of actions to save oil.

title: Ballet: Coppelia Shines
description: The New York City Ballet's 1974 production of Coppelia by George Balanchine and Alexandra Danilova sparkles and zips along like no other version of this ballet.

title: Claremont Colleges Seizure Is Ended by Court Order
description: CLAREMONT, Calif., May 7 (AP)  Students and faculty members who staged an Administration building sitin at the Claremont Colleges ended their 13hour occupation last night when served with a Superior court order.

title: 6 CABINET MINISTERS RESIGN IN LEBANON
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 7Six of the eighteen members of the Lebanese Cabinet resigned tonight in protest over the handling of the clashes last month between rightwing members of Phalangist party and Palestinian guerrillas.

title: Carey Prepares New Cuts in Budget
description: ALBANY, May 7Governor Carey will announce within the next few days new budget ceilings for the major state departments, based on cuts his budget officials have worked out with the heads of the departments in meetings during the last two weeks.

title: Pakistani Provincial Cabinet Named, Ending Direct Rule
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan, May 17 (Reuters)A new Cabinet was sworn in today in Pakistan's NorthWest Frontier Province, ending three months of direct rule by the federal Government following the assassination of a senior minister.

title: Johnson Stars in Japan
description: TOKYO, May 7 (UPI)Dave Johnson hit, a tworun homer and drove in two runs on sacrifice flies tonight to help the Yomiuri Giants defeat the Yakult Swallows, 72, before 43,000 fans.

title: Reporter Jailed in Scotland For Refusal to Name Source
description: GLASGOW, Scotland, May 7 (UPI)A High Court judge ordered the chief reporter of a Glasgow newspaper jailed yesterday for refusing to divulge the name of a news source.

title: The
description: Though I was only eight years old at the time, I will never forget the tears in my father's eyes as we crossed the Hungarian border one cold November night in 1956. My brother, a little over a Year old, slept in blanket strapped to his back. Mother held dad's hand and mine. We had just walked twenty miles searching for the border.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Banks Oppose Bill by Proxmire To Make Data on Loans Public
description: WASHINGTON, May 7Representatives of banks and of savings and loan associations testified today in opposition to a Senate bill that would require them to make public their savings and investment patterns.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Federal judge in Brooklyn ruled yesterday that Rabbi Meir Kahane, head of the militant Jewish Defense League, was entitled to be served kosher food while in prison for parole violation. In a 46page opinion, Judge Jack B. Weinstein said the Constitution required that the defendant's need to practice an important tenet of his faith be respected. Rabbi Kahane has been serving his sentence in a halfway house in Manhattan from which he has been given several hours of liberty each day to eat at a kosher restaurant and take part in morning and evening prayer services. The ruling conflicts with a decision handed down on Monday by Federal Judge Thomas P. Griesa in Manhattan, who denied two members of the Jewish Defense League their bid for kosher food.

title: POPE GIVES EULOGY FOR MINDSZENTY
description: ROME, May 7Pope Paul VI paid tribute today to the indomitable fortitude of Joszef Cardinal Mindszenty, who died in Vienna yesterday, while describing him as controversial and tormented.

title: FARM UNION PEACE IS SEEN ON COAST
description: FRESNO, Calif., May 7Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. sent to the Legislature today a farm labor relations bill that he said would provide the machinery to end the bitter, often violent 10yearlong dispute between the International Brotherhood of Teamsters and the United Farm Workers in the vineyards and lettuce fields of California.

title: PRICES MOVE UP ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market rose yesterday in decreased trading.

title: Airline Expects '75 Loss
description: Allegheny Airlines, which has applied to the Civil Aeronautics Board for a $9.9million subsidy for 1975, said yesterday it expected to operate at a loss of about $14million this year.

title: TV: WNET Panorama30 Years After VE Day
description: One thing about WNET/13: it rarely thinks small. As part of its springmembership drive this week, the station has elected to recreate nothing less than World War II. Under the general heading of A Time to Remember, it is marking yesterday's 30th anniversary of VE Day with a hefty schedule of special programing, from America's Victory at Sea series to Israel's The Sat Blow, a twohour documentary the holocaust.

title: STOCKHOLDER SUING 6 BRANIFF OFFICERS
description: A $1million damage suit has been filed in the Federal District Court in Dallas against six officers of the Braniff International Corporation by Richard B. Dannenberg, a New York lawyer, who asserts that he owns 103 shares of the company's stock.

title: A Time for Amnesty
description: In reiterating the theme that the war in Vietnam is over, President Ford has taken the sensible and politically constructive view that this is the time not to look back in anger but to move forward to a better understanding of America's role at home and abroad. Mr. Ford is clearly right to insist that the Vietnamese refugees offer an immediate opportunity for Americans to reaffirm their principles as a responsible and humane peopleas those Congressional liberals who have temporarily forgotten their liberalism need to be reminded.

title: Marine Chief Confirmed
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 (UPI) The Senate confirmed today the nomination of Lieut. Gen. Louis H. Wilson Jr. as commandant of the Marine Corps. He was also automatically promoted to the rank of full general.

title: County Aides Get 49% Raise
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 7 (UPI) The Bucks County commissioners and representatives of the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employes signed a wage contract today giving 500 county employes a 48 per cent wage increase over the next three years.

title: Schmidt Bids Germans Not Overdo Repentance
description: BONN, May 7 (Reuters)Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany today paid tribute to the 55 million victims of World War II, but said Germans should not run around in sackcloth and ashes forever.

title: Pittston Holders Defeat Mining Disclosure Plan
description: RICHMOND, Va., May 7Appalachian citizens and religious organizations seeking substantial corporate disclosure about stripmining activities involving major coal and electric power companies were rebuffed today at the annual shareholders meeting of the Pittston Company, the nation's largest independent coal company.

title: Agencies Run Into Snags In Resettling of Refugees
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 7The effort to resettle rapidly the thousands of South Vietnamese refugees arriving it this country has been fraught with difficulties so far, according to many of those involved in the relief project.

title: Saigon Restores Its News Links
description: International communications with Saigon were reopened yesterday for the first time since the Communist takeover exactly one week earlier, and Western newsmen who had remained behind were able to file dispatches.

title: Concert: Kubelik Conducts Smetana's Ma Vlast
description: Ma Vlast  My Country. It is not often that New Yorkers get a chance to hear, seriatim, the six symphonic poems of the Smetana cycle. Indeed, only one of the six has any currency here, and that is, of course, the deservedly popular Moldau.

title: A NeedlePoint Nude Now Traffic Stopper
description: The needlepoint nude that hangs in the window of Mrs. Carole Breslow's recently opened knit shop on Kinderkamack Road in Park Ridge may not be great art, but it has proved an instant comcercial success.

title: 2 Ships Quit Suez
description: Two West German freighters trapped in the Suez Canal for eight years sailed to the Mediterranean yesterday. They were the first large vessels to leave the canal since it was closed by the ArabIsraeli war of 1967. Page 3.

title: Registration by Mail
description: Voter registration by mail, a reform that has already been successfully introduced in a number of states, stalled in Albany because of possible constitutional questions that have led to differing approaches in the Senate and the Assembly.

title: Results of School Elections in Suburban Counties
STATE IS PRESSING $215BILLION PLAN TO CLEAN WATERS
description: New York State has cleared the way for a $2.5billion Environmental Public Works Program  the largest effort of its kind in the nation  that state officials say will mean the construction of 205 projects within the next five years to clean up the state's lakes, rivers and streams.

title: Braves Send Allen To Phillies in Trade
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 7 (AP)Dick Allen, who left Philadelphia with the promise never to come back, was traded back to the Phillies today.

title: A Bat for the Hitter in Dick Allen
description: He left Philadelphia as Richie Allen and now he's returning as Dick Allen, which doesn't mean he's a changed man. But there is one constant about him. He's a hitter. And a hitter always makes that evident in small ways. Three years ago when Willie Mays reported to the New York Mets, his first Question was. What time do I hit? Two months ago when Henry Aaron was about to take batting practice for the first time with the Milwaukee Brewers, he said, Let me get my bat. To a hitter, a bat is as necessary as an attache case to an attorney, as a scalpel to a surgeon, as a broom to a street cleaner. When the Phillies reintroduced Richard Anthony Allen yesterday as the Main Line's main man, he was handed a bat as a propa white ash Jay Johnstone model, 38 inches, 36 ounces', used by a new teammate. For the next two hours he held onto that bat as a child holds a security blanket. As he talked with newsmen, he gripped it and leaned on it, fondled it almost. When he posed for photographers, he swung it. When he finally departed for his Bucks County horse farm in Perkasie, Pa., he took the bat with him. Dick Allen is a hitter again.

title: Oil Industry Challenges Outer Shelf Plan
description: LOS ANGELES, May 7The growing idea that the right to explore the nation's offshore oil resources should be separated from the right to produce, to yield greater environmental and economic benefits for the public, was vigorously chal. lenged by the oil industry today.

title: No Tenured Leadership
description: Ever since the Legislature abolished tenure for the city's principals and other supervisors in 1971, the Council of Supervisors and Administrators has been lobbying for reinstatement of such permanent job security. Although there has been virtually no public debate on this issue, a bill to reinstate supervisory tenure is currently moving quietly toward enactment.

title: 17 CITY FOOD PLACES CITED AS VIOLATORS
description: The Health Department has cited 17 more food establishments for having failed two inspections showing lapses from the City Health Code. If violations are not corrected by a third inspection, the establishments will be closed. The establishments, and the dispositions follow:

title: Chess:
description: Alla Kushnuir has been the secondranking woman player in the world for a decade. Three times the challenger for the crown held by Nona Gaprindashvili, in 1965, 1969 and 1972, the 32yearold Mrs. Kushnir is excluded from title competition this year.

title: BedfordStuyvesant Selected by I. B. M. For Assembly Plant
description: The International Business Machines Corporation announced yesterday that it would build a 167,000squarefoot plant in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn. The plan won the prompt and enthusiastic endorsement of Mayor Beame.

title: U.S. and Soviet Suspend Parley on Arms Until June
description: GENEVA, May 7The United States and the Soviet Union announced today the recessing of their talks here on the limitation of strategic arms until June 2 to enable the delegations to return to their capitals for consultations.

title: Surgery for Goring
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., May 7 (UPI)Butch Goring, a center for the Los Angeles Kings of the National Hockey League, underwent surgery today for a shoulder separation he sustained last September in training camp, He wore a brace during the season.

title: Hialeah Receives Reprieve
description: MIAMI, May 7 (AP)The 50year tradition of thoroughbred racing at stately Hialeah appeared safe for another year today when the Florida Board of Business Regulation awarded the track next year's touristseason dates.

title: Is There Fashion In Hanoi's Future?
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, May 6 (Agence FrancePresse)After long years of war, the streets of Hanoi may soon be brightened by the colors of women's fashions.

title: 2 of Ships Trapped in '67 Leave Cleared Suez Canal
description: CAIRO, May 7Two West German freighters trapped in the Suez Canal for eight years sailed for the Mediterranean at dawn today. They were the first vessels of this size to sail the canal since it was closed by the ArabIsraeli war of 1967.

title: TornadoShocked Omaha Wondering About Future
description: OMAHA, May 7  Julie Wagner chewed on a hamburger, and stared down at the gaping cement basement filled with rubble, including an upsidedown refrigerator and an oldfashioned child's highchair.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: BedfordStuyvesant Selected by I. B. M. For Assembly Plant
description: The International Business Machines Corporation announced yesterday that it would build a 167,000squarefoot plant in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn. The plan won the prompt and enthusiastic endorsement of Mayor Beame.

title: BOTH SIDES CLAIM SCHOOL VICTORY
description: Both sides proclaimed victoryeven before any votes have been countedin Tuesday's hardfought school board election in District 1 on the Lower East Side.

title: Lon Nol Is Accused
description: CAMP PENDLETON, Calif. May 7 (Reuters)The former Cambodian President, Lon Nol, was paid $1million by his own Government to leave the country, the man who took over from him said here today.

title: HOUSE PANEL VOTES REPEAL OF BUS TAX
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 (AP) The House Ways and Means Committee, moving toward its final decisions on an energy tax package, voted today to repeal the 10 per cent tax on buses used in intercity public transit.

title: Business Briefs
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, May 7 (UPI)Venezuela will lower its oil output to 2.2 million barrels a day this year, Finance Minister Hector Hurtado said today. Earlier this year, the Government announced output would average 2.8 million barrels a day. Later this figure was lowered to 2.6 million, then to 2.4 million.

title: Shrunken Dream
description: The cost of the American dreamthat rosecovered cottage or splitlevel ranch in suburbiais now up to $41,300 (new) or $35,600 (used) and is unavailable to anyone with an income of less than $23,300. Since the average, family's income is half of that, the average family is just out of luck.

title: Common Market Buoys Israeli Spirits With Accord to Cut Tariffs
description: JERUSALEM, May 7  A comprehensive new trade agreepent that will gradually eliminate all protective tariffs between Israel and the European Common Market will go into effect July 1, Israeli officials said today.

title: Bombs Killed 16, Hurt 106 In First 3 Months of Year
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 (UPI)  Sixteen persons were killed and 106 injured by bombing incidents in the first three months of 1975, a substantial increase over the first quarter of 1974, the F.B.I. reported today.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: LEST WE FORGET Theater people like to joke about East Lynne as the quintessence of oldstyle melodrama, with a betrayed heroine and virtue reigning triumphant. Yet few people really know the antique play, since it has all but disappeared.

title: President's Proclamation
description: WASHINGTON, May 7Following is the text of a proclamation by President Ford specifying the last day of the Vietnam era to qualify for veterans benefits:

title: Oil Profit Refund Asked
description: SAN DIEGO, May 6 (UPI)The State Public Utilities Commission recommended yesterday that the San Diego Gas and Electric Company return to customers close to $10million in profits from the sale of excess fuel oil last year as excess profits.

title: NEW RULERS HOLD BIG SAIGON RALLY
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 7The military committee ruling Saigon made its first public appearance today as its members addressed 30,000 people at a rally marking the surrender of the city a week ago.

title: New Hospital Construction Opposed
description: WASHINGTON, MAY 7A consumer advocacy group called today for a nationwide moratorium on a new hospital construction, charging that the country has 350,000 more hospital beds than are needed and that the surplus wastes billions of dollars a year.

title: People in Sports
description: Muhammad Ali has been sent a letter by Eleanor Holmes Norton, New York City Human Rights Commissioner, suggesting that Ali apologize for the allegedly racist statements he made about Tony Perez, the Puerto Rican referee who officiated at Ali's heavyweight, championship title defense against Chuck Wepner in March.

title: SAIGON RETURNED 250 PLANES TO U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, May (UPI)Some 250 Americanmade aircraft of the South Vietnamese Air Force were turned back to the United States in the last days before Saigon's surrender the White House disclosed tonight.

title: Fund Bill Gains in House
description: WASHINGTON, May 7The House Judiciary Subcommittee on Immigration voted unanimous approval tonight of a bill authorizing such sums as may be necessary to pay for the transport and resettlement of 130,000 Indochina refugees in this country.

description: FRESNO, Calif., May 7Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. sent to the Legislature today a farm labor relations bill that he said would provide the machinery to end the bitter, often violent 10yearlong dispute between the International Brotherhood of Teamsters and the United Farm Workers in the vineyards and lettuce fields of California.

title: 5 HELL'S ANGELS HELD IN KILLING
description: BRIDGEPORT Conn., May 7 Five members of a Hells Angels motorcycle club were arrested today and charged with stomping a 39yearold motorist to death after a midnight traffic dispute last Friday.

title: FOREIGNERS CROSS CAMBODIA BORDER
description: ARANYAPRATHET, Thailand, Thursday, May 8The final group of some 550 foreigners expelled from Cambodia by the new Communist Government arrived this morning at the Thai frontier and began the long process of entering Thailand.

title: Soviet Is Granting A Limited Amnesty To Mark VE Day
description: MOSCOW, May 7  The Soviet Union said today that it would release from prison an undisclosed number of its citizens.

title: F.A.A. Announces Accord With Air Traffic Controllers
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 (AP) The Federal Aviation Administration announced today that it had reached agreement with the Professional Air Traffic Controllers Organization on a twoyear labor pact.

description: New York State has cleared the way for a $2.5billion Environmental Public Works Program  the largest effort of its kind in the nation  that state officials say will mean the construction of 205 projects within the next five years to clean up the state's lakes, rivers and streams.

title: WNET's Electric Company To End Production in 2 Years
description: The. Electric Company, the companion program to Sesame Street designed to teach fundamentals of reading to children in the primary grades, will cease production after two more years of programs, according to officials of the Children's Television Workshop, the nonprofit production company.

title: Stuart Mudd, a Microbiologist At U. of Pennsylvania, Is Dead
description: Dr. Stuart Mudd, a prominent microbiologist who retired in 1959 as professor emeritus of microbiology it the School of Medicine of the University of Pennsylvania, died Tuesday at his home in Haverford, Pa. He was 81 years old.

title: DELAYS FOR TOLLS GETTING SHORTER
description: Elinor Goldstein called it a disgrace. Olivia Watkins said it was lousy. And David Manser had expected to be in Brooklyn yesterday morning instead of stalled in traffic at the approach to the Holland Tunnel in Jersey City.

title: State Church Council Calls for Attica Amnesty
description: ALBANY, May 7 (UPI)The New York State Council of Churches today came out in support of a legislative resolution calling for amnesty for all persons involved in the 1971 Attica prison rebellion.

title: Byrne Signs Bill to Guard Rights of Mental Patients
description: TRENTON, May 7 (AP)Governor Byrne signed legislation today that its chief sponsor said makes New Jersey the first state to provide legal guarantees for the civil rights of patients in mental institutions.

title: TRIBUNAL REVERSES 2 MURDER VERDICTS
description: ALBANY, May 7 (AP)The State Court of Appeals today reversed the murder convictions of Elverton P. Freeland and Edward G. McKnight of Buffalo and ordered new trials for them.

title: SADIE JONES POPE
description: Sadie Jones Pope, widow or noted architect John Russell Pope, died Tuesday at her home, 950 Fifth Avenue. She was 88 years old. Mr. Pope, who designed the Jefferson Memorial in Washington, died in 1938.

title: Albany Votes to Require City GunPermit Applicants to Show Proper Cause
description: ALBANY, May 7By the barest possible margin, the Assembly today passed a bill that would require an applicant to show proper cause before being granted a license to keep a handgun at home or in a place of business in New York City.

title: Harmonica Workers to Learn by Playing
description: HICKSVILLE, L.I., May 7Nobody ever said that the employes at Ford had to drive cars, or that the workers in a cigarette factory had to smoke. But the employes at the M. Hohner Co. harmonica factory here were getting many queries that they could not answer, so the company asked a classical harmonica player to give 16 volunteers lessons during their lunch hour.

title: Byrne Tries to Oust Port Aide He Named But Meets Defiance
description: TRENTON, May 7Governor Byrne asked Ralph C. DeRose today to resign his $30,500 a year post as the New Jersey member of the bistate Waterfront Commission because of an alleged conflict of interest, and in an unusual transoceanic exchange, he was rebuffed.

title: Ford Ends Vietnam Era and Terminates G.I. Wartime Benefits
description: WASHINGTON, May 7President Ford formally declared that today was the end of the Vietnam era in a proclamation ending wartime veteran's benefits for new military recruits.

title: N.L.R.B. Sets Rules On Bargaining Units In Health Care Field
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 (UPI) The National Labor. Relations Board, in eight split decisions today, laid down landmark ground rules for labor organize ing in the private health care industry.

title: Rise in Agricultural Prices Reverses A 4Month Decline in Wholesale Index
description: WASHINGTON, May 8  A rise in typically volatile agricultural prices reversed a fourmonth decline in the Government's wholesale price index last month, but the underlying figures continued to signal much less inflation in the economy.

title: U.S. FOOD FOR ASIA IS BEING DIVERTED
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Nearly 100,000 tons of food was: headed for Cambodia and South Vietnam when their governments fell, American officials said today.

title: Reynolds Metals Earnings Drop 27.4%
CBS Is Disappointed By Sales Overseas Of Haldeman Show
description: The twopart CBS News interview with H. R. Haldeman, for which the former White House chief of staff during the Nixon Administration was paid $50,000, had a disappointing sale overseas, according to an official of Viacom International, which distributes CBS News programs outside the country.

title: Index of Stocks Registers An Increase of 4.06 Points
description: The stock market moved in a narrow range yesterday and closed slightly higher.

title: U.S. Financial Aide Pleads No Contest
description: John B. Halverson, former president of U. S. Financial, Inc., a West Coast building and mortgage company, has pleaded no contest to four of the 66 counts of fraud originally brought against him last year in the United States District Court for the Southern District of California San Diego.

title: CRABIEL IS TOLD OF OUSTER PLAN
description: TRENTON, May 8Governor Byrne has told Secretary of State J. Edward Crabiel that he would go as far as abolishing Mr. Crabiel's office, if necessary, to oust him from the Democratic State administration.

title: Notes on People
description: Once known variously as the First Lady of South Vietnam and the Dragon Lady, Mrs. Ngo Dinh Nhu made her first public appearance in this country since her husband and his bachelor brother, President Ngo Dinh Diem, were assassinated in 1963. Vietnam has fallen many times but that does not mean it is foreverthis will be the shortest time, Mrs. Nhu said on the NBCTV Tomorrow show broadcast early yesterday morning.

title: Reputed Drug Trafficker Cleared in Bribery Case
description: Leroy (Nicky) Barnes, whom law enforcement authorities have described as one of the nation's major drug traffickers, was acquitted last night in Bronx Criminal Court of a charge of attempting to bribe police officers.

description: George Baker, the Walt Disney artist who entered the Army and created the Sad Sack cartoon character, died Wednesday of cancer in the Alhambra Medical Center on the campus of the University of California, at Los Angeles. He was 59 years old.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Theater

title: U.S. 'o Review Refugee Orphan Status
description: SAN FRANCISCO. May 8The Immigration and Naturalization Service is reinvestigating many of the 2,000 or so Vietnamese children rushed into this country last month in an attempt to determine whether any are not really orphans and therefore not eligible for adoption.

title: Train Trestle Collapses
description: EFFINGHAM, Ill., May 8 (UPI)About 25 cars of an Illinois Central Gulf freight train fell into or around Little Salt Creek, seven miles east of here today, when a wooden trestle collapsed. No injuries were reported. The 50car train was westbound on a spur line that runs between Palestine and Effingham.

title: 2 School Guards Arrested
description: Two school safety officers assigned to Board of Education headquarters at 110 Livingston Street, Brooklyn, were arrested here yesterday on charges of grand larcency in the theft of $6,450 in payroll checks. The two were identified as Louis Gioe, 33 years old, of 229 East 29th Street, and Evelyn Lopez, 36 of 2348 Prospect Avenue, Brooklyn.

title: Saigon and Phnom Penh Action To Resolve Oil Claims Expected
description: PARIS, May 8The Communist Governments of South Vietnam and Cambodia have decided to try to resolve a dispute over the boundaries of their continental shelf before authorizing further oil exploration in the South China Sea and the Gulf of Siam, according to French sources.

title: U.S. Dismisses Charges Against Executive Here
description: William O. Gohlke, a former Seatrain Lines executive, has been exonerated of Federal charges that he gave selective illegal rebates to shippers using Seatrain's facilities.

title: Connecticut Senate Votes Rise Of $125Million in New Taxes
description: HARTFORD, May 8  The Connecticut Senate today approved tax increases of $125millionmainly in higher corporation taxes, a widened sales tax and a revived tax on dividends.

title: American's Brief Brush With Arrest and Death
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 8Some of the foreigners who stayed behind after the American evacuation of Phnom Perth learned quickly and at first hand that the Communistled forces were not the happy go lucky troops we had seen in the initial stage of the Communist takeover.

title: DOUBLEAGENT ROLE FOR McCORD HINTED
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., May 8 (UPI)A newspaper reported today that it had obtained documents from Federal investi gators showing that the Central Intelligence Agency might have set up the bungled Watergate breakin to expose the White House plumbers.

title: Alexander, Ashe Reach W.C.T. Semifinal Round
description: DALLAS, May 8  John Alexander had no trouble disposing of Roscoe Tanner tonight, but Arthur Ashe had to work hard to beat Mark Cox as the first round of the World Championship Tennis playoff finals was completed. Alexander will face Ashe and Rod Laver will play Bjorn Borg in tomorrow night's semifinals.

title: 24 Consumers Union Employes Fighting Layoffs
description: MOUNT VERNON, May 8Consumers Union, beset by rising costs and falling circulation, is preparing to dismiss 24 fulltime employes after having laid off 35 mostly temporary workers in December.

title: Morgenthau Asks Court to Throw Out 3 Itkin Indictments
description: The Manhattan District Attorney's office moved yesterday in Federal District Court here to dismiss three indictments against Herbert Itkin, a lawyer and Federal informer whose testimony helped prosecutors obtain convictions and indictments in several notable cases. Among those who were sent to jail as a result of Mr. Itkin's cooperation with Federal prosecutors were James L. Marcus, a City Water Commissioner in John V. Lindsay's administration, and Carmine G. DeSapio, the former Tammany Hall leader.

title: People in Sports
description: Dick Allen showed he wasn't adverse to keeping early hours if necessary by appearing at Veterans' Stadium in Philadelphia at 8:45 A.M. yesterday for a private batting practice session. The controversial slugger, acquired by the Phillies from Atlanta on Wednesday along with Johnny Oates, a catcher, for three minor leaguers and an undisclosed amount of cash, batted for the better part of two hours against a batting practice pitcher.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
EVERY BRUNDAGE OF OLYMPICS DIES
description: GARMISCH  PARTENKIRCHEN, West Germany, May 8 Avery Brundage, the American multimillionaire who for 20 controversial years as president of the International Olympic Committee fought for what he considered purity in sports and amateurism in world athletic competition, died today in this Bavarian village. He was 87 years old.

title: Weekly Retail Sales Up 6%
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $1.09billion, up 2 per cent from the yearearlier $1.07billion. Total retail store sales were about $11.01billion, up 6 per cent from last year's $10.38billion.

title: The Vietnam Disaster and U. S. Security
description: WASHINGTONIn our attempts to appraise the significance of the Vietnam disaster, we must reflect on its bearing on our national security. If we mean the protection of our most important national valuables wherever found against dangers from whatever sources, it is obvious that in the collapse of our Vietnam policy we have suffered loss of protective power in many forms.

title: Rosenau Reports Creditors Accept New Arrangement
description: Rosenau Brothers, Inc., a leading maker of children's wear, said yesterday that its creditors have accepted an amended plan of arrangement, which it filed in Federal District Court in Philadelphia in March in its Chapter XI proceedings under the Federal Bankrupcty Act.

title: Grief and Animosity In an Embassy Haven
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 8 For the 800 foreigners, including this correspondent, who spent two weeks in the French Embassy in Phnom Penh after the Communists took over, the time seemed like a chaotically compressed generation of life.

title: France Marks VE Day For 30th and Last Time
description: PARIS, May 8 (Reuters)France celebrated the anniversary of the Allied victory over Nazi Germany in World War II for the 30th and last time today.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: MINNEAPOLIS, May 8 (AP)  The Miami Dolphins wanted Bob Hayes, the Dallas Cowboys' wide receiver, but balked because they were afraid they might have to give up another star receiver, Paul Warfield. The story was recounted today by Hayes's agent, Michael Nachwalter, in a deposition read at the trial of a pro football players' suit seeking to overturn the Rozelle rule.

title: The Search For Leaders
description: SAN DIEGO, May 8Wherever you go in America these days, you find a longing for new beginnings and new leaders. After Vietnam and Watergate, even the supporters of Ford, Rockefeller, Reagan, Jackson, Humphrey, Muskie and the other candidates in their sixties seem to be vaguely dissatisfied and hoping for something different, something younger and more in tune with the coming age of the 1980's.

title: HOUSE PANEL CUTS AID FOR REFUGEES TO $405MILLION
description: WASHINGTON, May 3  A House Appropriations subcommittee today cut President Ford's request for $507million for Indochina refugees to $405million and said that the relief program should be funded with this sum for the next 14 months.

title: NADER AND CHAMBER ARGUE TRUST LAWS
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (UPI) Ralph Nader the consumer advocate, and the United States Chamber of Commerce clashed today over whether the nation's antitrust laws should be strengthened.

title: BROWNING IS FINED BY U.S. CUSTOMS
description: MORGAN, Utah, May 8 (AP) The United States Customs Service said yesterday that it had fined two subsidiaries of the Browning Arms Company, the weapons maker, more than $249million for alleged undervaluation of imported firearms and other merchandise.

title: On 125th St., the Recession Is Either a Boom or a Bust
description: The recession, which has sounded the death knell for small businesses throughout the country, is being felt on 125th StreetHarlem's major business arteryin peculiar and sometimes conflicting ways.

title: Ford's Second Quarter Is Seen Ending in the Black
description: DEARBORN, Mich., May 8Henry Ford 2d, chairman of the Ford Motor Company, said today that he expected the company to operate in the black in the second quarter of 1975 after losing $10.6million during the first three months of the year.

title: Nationalities Identified
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 8 (AP)The French Embassy said today that the newly arrived group from Phnom Penh consisted of 230 French citizens, 140 Pakistanis, 40 Indians, four Americans, three Swedes and one person each from Japan, Singapore, Hong Kong, Lebanon and Thailand. There was also an undetermined number of Chinese and Indonesians, the embassy said.

title: Hanoi Says Communists Raided Saigon Airport With U.S. Planes
description: HONG KONG, May 8 (Reuters  North Vietnam made public an account today of what it described as one of the South Vietnamese Communists' boldest exploits in the last days of the Vietnam war  the bombing of Saigon's Tan Son Nhut airport by captured United Statesbuilt planes.

title: Cambodia's Move In Emptying Cities May Fill Food Need
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 8 (Agence FrancePresse)  The revolution being carried out by Cambodia's new rulers is a mixture of elements so baffling, so radical and so peculiar that there are a host of questions and no sure answers.

title: Research Libraries To Close Saturdays As a MoneySaver
description: Officials at the New York Public Library have decided to close the system's research libraries on Saturdays, starting May 31, to save money.

title: Research Libraries To Close Saturdays As a MoneySaver
description: Officials at the New York Public Library have decided to close the system's research libraries on Saturdays, starting May 31, to save money.

title: Gentry of Braves Placed on Waivers
description: ATLANTA, May 8 (AP)Gary Gentry of the Atlanta Braves was placed on waivers today for the purpose of giving him his unconditional release.

title: No Police Leapfrog
description: The decision of an impartial panel on a police wage dispute has saved this city from ruinous renewal of the interunion pay leapfrogging that has brought New York close to insolvency.

title: Kenya Apparently Tries to Quiet Critics
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, May 8Five persons have been imprisoned on charges of spreading rumors as the Government of President Jomo Kenyatta apparently stepped up a counterattack against its critics and enemies.

title: SAUDIS REASSESS NORTHROP DEAL
description: GARDEN CITY; L,I, May 8 (UPI)At the urging of the Pentagon, Saudi Arabia has begun a reappraisal of an aircraft maintenance contract renewal with the Northrop Corporation that could result in the payment of a $45million agent's fee, according to a report published today.

title: School Sees Football in Its Future
description: Football is coming to Sheepshead Bay, but the Board of Education must decide when. A fundraising drive conducted by students and supported by faculty and the community has raised enough money to outfit a junior varsity squad in the fall. But salaries for coaches and game officials must be paid by the board, and that is a problem. With widespread municipal layoffs and cutbacks, the city does not have much money for new programs.

title: ExWeicker Aide Will Head Intelligence Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, May 8A. Searle Field, a former Senato investigator in the Watergate case, will be named staff director of the House Select Committee on Intelligence early next week, Congressional sources said tonight.

title: Expansion of Port Authority Bus Terminal to Start in September
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey announced yesterday that construction would begin in September on the longdelayed expansion and improvement of its midtown bus terminal on Eighth Avenue.

title: '70 Humphrey Aide Is Convicted Here In Dairy Fund Case
description: Jack L. Chestnut, manager of Senator Hubert H. Humprey's 1970 senatorial campaign, was found guilty yesterday of arranging for and accepting an illegal corporate campaign contribution.

title: Assistant Dean of Medical Center Slain at Home
description: An assistant dean at the Downstate Medical Center in Brooklyn, was fatally stabbed in his home early yesterday, apparently during an argument with an acquaintance, the police said.

title: Reading and Bates Drilling In $50Million Iranian Deal
description: The Reading and Bates Offshore Drilling Company of Tulsa, Okla., announced yesterday that it had reached a $50million agreement with two Iranian banks to form an Iranian private joint stock company to acquire and operate nine land oildrilling rigs that it owns and that are now operating in Iran.

title: Top Bordeaux Wines To Go on the Block
description: LONDON, May 8So much excess wine is lying around European cellars and warehouses that Common Market economists are talking about a wine lake. Prices are plummeting as dealers unload, and now even the wealthy Rothschilds are dumping.

title: MORE PROTEST PLAN TO CUT CITY U. FUNDS
description: There were more student and faculty protests yesterday against Mayor Peame's proposals to cut almost $70million from next year's City Universi?? budget.

title: CONTROLLED PLAN FOR LIQUIDATION OF PENNSY URGED
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The Justice Department advised HoUse Commerce subcomittee today that a controlled liquidation or auction sale of the Penn Central and six other bankrupt railroads in the Northeast was the preferred way for restoring a competitive rail transportation system in the region.

title: Wallace Criticizes U.S. On World War Policy
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP)Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama recently told a group of foreign correspondents he believed the United States may have been fighting the wrong people in World War II.

title: SINGER CRITICIZED BY SHAREHOLDERS
description: After reporting a loss of $10.1million in 1974 and $3.7million in the first quarter of 1975, the Singer Company told its stockholders yesterday that an improvement was anticipated for the rest of the year

title: Text of Statement at News Conference
description: Following is the text of introductory remarks made at a news conference in Saigon by Lieut. Gen. Tran Van Tra, the new military commander, as broadcast in Vietnamese by the Saigon radio and translated and transmitted from Bangkok, Thailand, by The Associated Press.

title: People and Business
description: A senior New York bank economist, Donald E. Woolley of the Bankers Trust Company, agrees with other cabservers that the recession is slowing but feels that the recovery will be a gradual one.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, MAY 9, 1975

title: Time's Bicentennial Advertisers
description: Six advertisers, each of which had to buy a minimum of four pages for $210,000, are in the special Bicentennial issue of Time magazine that will be out next week.

title: 8 CITY DETECTIVES HELD IN DRUG CASE
description: Eight former members of the Police Department's narcotics unit were accused in an indictment yesterday of accepting $40,000 in bribes to release two narcoticsdealing suspects they had taken into custody in a Riverdale motel.

title: Theater: Polly, Sequel to Gay's Beggar's Opera
description: On the front cloth of the charming 18thcentury theater Robert U. Taylor has devised (of which more later) for the Chelsea Theater Center of Brooklyn's production of John Gay's Polly is inscribed a quotation from an Ode by Horace. It reads: Raro antecedentum scelesteru.m Deseruit pede Poena claudo, which translates as: Rarely has Punishment. though halt of foot, left the track of the criminal in the way before her. And, it may be added: Rarely do sequels, even if not lame of leg, beat much of a track after the original that went before them. And Polly is a sequelthe continuation of the cautionary tale of Polly Peachum and Captain Macheath that, as the saying went, made the theater manager Rich gay and Gay rich in The Beggar's Opera.

title: Program Marking End Of War Set for Sunday
description: A coalition of antiwar groups announced plans yesterday for a gathering in Central Park Sunday afternoon to celebrate the end of the Indochina war and to mourn those who died in the conflict.

title: CONFEREES SLASH DEFENSE FUNDING
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The Joint SenateHouse Conference Committee on the Budget agreed today to cut next year's defense spending by $3.3billion from the figure requested by President Ford.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: Anyway you look at them, learning disabilities are confusing. Confusing to the people who suffer through them to the otherwise capable child who can't read, for instance, or to the parents, perhaps blameless, who blame themselves for the failure. The term is confusing in itself: You know that handicaps such as deafness can be educationally disabling, but deafness is not a learning disability.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, MAY 9, 1975

title: Polystyrene Prices Cut
description: CHICAGO, May 8 (UPI)The standard Oil Company (Indiana) said today its Amoco Chemicals subsidiary had cut prices of polystyrene resins by 3 cents a pound to 27 cents for the generalpurpose resin and 28 cents for medium and highimpact grades.

title: Mets Lose to Pirates, 42, AsKison and Robinson Star
Black Caucus Asks Refugee Aid Link To Help for Needy
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Members of the Congressional Black Caucus called on the Administration today to tie aid for Vietnamese refugees to aid for the poor and jobless already suffering in the nation:

title: ABRAM FISCHER OF SOUTH AFRICA
description: CAPETOWN, May 8 (Reuters)  Abram Louis Fischer, the former leader of the banned South African Communist party who was serving a life prison sentence, died today at the age of 67.

title: Treasury Will Sell $2Billion in Notes
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (Reuters)  The Treaury said today it would sell up to $2billion in twoyear notes next Wednesday.

title: Soviet Takes Credit for Defeat of Germany on 30th Anniversary
description: MOSCOW, May 8Inspired by communism, the Soviet Union won World War II almost singlehanded, although it got some helpgenerally too little and too latefrom its American and British allies.

title: WILLIAM FULLEN, TRANSIT EXPERT
description: William G. Fullen, long recognized as an expert on city transit, died yesterday at the Peninsula Hospital Center in Far Rockaway, Queens. He was 87 years old and lived at 157 Beach 145 Street, Rockaway Beach.

title: Assembly Votes Return Of Wampum to Indians
description: ALBANY, May 8Five symbolic wampum belts will be returned to. the Onondaga Indians under a measure passed by the Assembly today after a debate that verged at times on levity but ended reasserting the solemnity of the occasion.

title: Evacuation Convoy to Thailand: Arduous Trip Through the Secret Cambodia
description: BANGKOK. Thailand, May 8 The evacuation journey by truck to Thailand from Phnom Penh, were hundreds of foreigners had been confined in the French Embassy compound for nearly two weeks, gave a brief but revealing glimpse into the covert spy system and communally organized countryside of the Cambodian Communistsa glimpse that as far as is known no Westerners had ever had before.

title: Brezhnev Says End of Conflict In Indochina Will Help Detente
description: MOSCOW, May 8Leonid I. Brezhnev said today that he hoped the end of the wars in Indochina would lead to a further relaxation of tensions between the Soviet Union and the United States.

title: CORRECTION AIDE QUITS STATE POST
description: Morton G. Van Hoesen, administrative head of the State Commission of Correction, resigned yesterday in the aftermath of charges that the watcndog agency had concealed irregularities and possible crimes by orison authorities.

title: H.E.W. Is Resorted to Have Operated a Job Referral System in '69 in Violation of Civil Service Rules
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 Robert E. Hampton, chairman of the United States Civil Service Commission, six years ago found officials in the Department of Health, Education and Welfare operating a political job referral system that violated commission rules, but he did not disclose it, according to commission files.

title: More Foreign Refugees Leave Cambodia
description: ARANYAPRATHET, Thailand, May 8Two Red Cross nurses, one carrying a sick French infant, the other the child's intravenous feeding bottle held high. led the way today as the last group of foreigners to be evacuated from Cambodia crossed the border here.

title: Bulls Triumph, 89 to 79, For a 32 Playoff Edge
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 8 (AP)Chicago clamped down on Golden State, and with Chet Walker and Jerry Sloan providing excellent outside shooting, the Bulls scored an 8979 victory over the Warriors tonight.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market rose yesterday on increased trading.

title: Brezhnev Says End of Conflict In Indochina Will Help Detente
description: MOSCOW, May 8Leonid I. Brezhnev said today that he hoped the end of the wars in Indochina would lead to a further relaxation of tensions between the Soviet Union and the United States.

title: 3 Killed in Louisville Fire
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 8 (UPI)Two men and a young woman died today in a fire apparently set by an arsonist in an apartment building above tavern across the street from neighborhood fire station. Deputy Coroner Robert Carter said that George Weber, 41 years old, and Frank Schneider, 53, occupants of separate thirdfloor apartments, died of apparent smoke inhalation. Mrs. Connie neighbors, 18, who lived in a secondfloor apartment, died of burns and smoke inhalation. Mr. Carter said.

title: Famed Trot Has TV Spot On Aug. 30
description: As underexposed as a cornfield for years, the Hambletonian will trot onto the nation's television screens this season for its golden jubilee.

title: The O.A.S. Assembly
description: It Is a sad commentary on the current standing of the Organization of American States that despite all that going on in the hemisphere, it will probably take up no more important business at the annual General Assembly, which opened in Washington yesterday, than the routine election of a SecretaryGeneral to succeed Ecuador's distinguished Galo Plaza Lasso. There are plenty urgent problems affecting the American statesand progress may be made on some of them in informal consultations during the twoweek Assemblybut the O.A.S. itself will be only incidentally involved.

title: City's Store Sales Show Biggest Decline in 5 Years
description: New York City's major department stores showed the largest sales decline in April in more than five years. It represented the sixth consecutive monthly drop from corresponding figures a year earlier.

title: Critic's Notebook: One of Art's Surprising Swerves
description: Ideas first mooted in art often jump the tracks the way pollen crosses the Atlantic Ocean: against all expectation. One of the ideas behind cubism as it was pertected before 1914 by Picasso and Bracque can he summed up in the words. Violins are women, right? And it caught on stringed instruments of every kind made their way into art as metaphors, barely disguised, for the female body. (Only the bull fiddle resisted feminization.)

title: MARLBORO PLAYERS IN FINE GHOST TRIO
description: The men of the Marlboro Trio have such individual and collective depth of chamber music experience that their playing, at the Hunter College Playhouse on Wednesday night, could hardly be faulted in matters of ensemble rapport or interpretive unity. The scrupulous technical control of Mitchell Andrews, pianist; Charles McCracken, cellist, and Gerald Tarack, violinist, also lent solidity to their conscientious performances of Trios by Haydn, Ives and Beethoven.

title: Saigon Regime Holds a News Parley
description: The military commander of Saigon held the Communist administration's first news conference since it came to power April 30 and reported that both the Soviet Union and China had transported food to South Vietnam.

title: California Congressman Booked For Bribery and Embezzlement
description: SANTA ANA, Calif., May 8 (AP)Representative Andrew J. Hinshaw, Republican of California, was booked at the Orange County jail today on charges of bribery, embezzlement and misappropriation of public funds while serving as county assessor.

title: CURBS ON LOBBYING MAPPED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, May 8A comprehensive bill to regulate all lobbyists, including anyone who spends more than $250 a year to influence legislation, has been drafted by the leadership of the Legislature and is being considered by the Ethics Committees of both houses.

title: '70 Humphrey Aide Is Convicted Here In Dairy Fund Case
description: Jack L. Chestnut, manager of Senator Hubert H. Humphrey's 1970 senatorial campaign, was found guilty yesterday of arranging for and accepting an illegal corporate campaign contribution.

title: DIVORCE BILL LOSES IN BRAZIL CONGRESS
description: BRASILIA, Brazil, May 8 (AP) The Brazilian Congress voted down a bill to legalize divorce today after two months of national controversy.

title: Restaurant Reviews
description: Talk to people who are supposed to know, and you'll hear that the restaurant business is on the rocks, but you wouldn't think it from the way new ones keep opening. Here are a couple of very good ones that offer modified ethnic cuisinesGreek at Diogenes. 937 Eighth Avenue between 55th and 56th, and Indian at Tandoor, 40 East 49th.

title: McGovern's Plan Scores With Cubans
description: HAVANA, May 8 (AP)Senator George McGovern said today he proposed to Premier Fidel Castroand Mr. Castro liked the ideathat baseball and basketball be used to help break down the hostility between Cuba and the United States.

title: Obituary 3  No Title
description: Pittsburgh Nun, 103, Dies

title: An Ordeal by Blacklist Is Portrayed on Stage
description: It was in 1951, when Conrad Bromberg was 15 years old, that his father, J. Edward Bromberg, died. By then a halfdozen years of resistance to prodding by various unAmerican activities groups had turned the father from a prominent actor into a man who found it Almost impossible to get a job.

title: In Memoriam
description: SEGALSandra Roome. In memory of Sandra Roome Segal, who died Thursday, April ?? 1975, from the many friends who loved her??

title: Music: Baton for Pianist
description: Daniel Barenboim, Monday's piano recitalist in Carnegie Hall, was Wednesday night's conductor with the New York Philharmonic in Avery Fisher Hall. In shifting roles, however, he did not change his musical personality. An individualist and a romantic, even, perhaps, oldfashioned, he made the orchestral program sound profoundly personal. As such, it was inclined to irritate, stimuate or please, but at least there were striking ideas and attitudes to come to grips with.

title: DR. EDGAR MAYER, CHEST SPECIALIST
description: Dr. Edgar Mayer, a specialist in chest diseases, died Thursday at Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 85 years old and lived at 880 Fifth Avenue.

title: CONTROLLED PLAN FOR LIQUIDATION OF PENNSY URGED
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The Justice Department advised a House Commerce subcomittee today that a controlled liquidation or auction sale of the Penn Central and six other bankrupt railroads in the Northeast was the preferred way for restoring a competitive rail transportation system in the region.

title: Lebanon Facing Political Crisis Over Fighting With Guerrillas
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 8Lebanon is facing a political crisis after the resignation of six Cabinet ministers yesterday. There is speculation here that Premier Rashid alSolh will resign tomorrow.

title: BANKS' RESERVES INCREASED BY FED
description: The Federal Reserve added almost $1billion a day to reserves in the banking system during the week ended Wednesday as the Treasury increased its deposits at the central bank, an action that makes commercial banks more cramped for endable funds.

title: Wood. Field and Stream: On Rainbow
description: More than 14 tons of rainbow trout were dumped into Lake George a short while ago, one of the largest troutstocking operations on a single lake ever undertaken in New York State.

title: Engman Scores Regulation of Business
description: LOS ANGELES, May 8Lewis A. Engman, chairman of the Federal Trade Commission, called on the nation's businessmen today to take the initiative in supporting efforts by the Ford Administration to reduce Government regulation of business because powerful internts, both private and public, he said, are mobilizing to defeat the reform effort.

title: Putnam Named Bell Aide
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 8 (AP)Duane Putnam, a former coach with the Atlanta Falcons of the National Football League, has been named an assistant coach of the Philadelphia Bell in the World Football League. Putnam will be the Bell's defensive line coach under head Coach Ron Waller.

title: Business Briefs
description: The savings banks of New York State gained $205million more in deposits than they lost in April, the Savings Banks Association of New York reported yesterday.

title: Attica Sentences
description: John Hill was sentenced in Buffalo yesterday to a term of 20 years to life for the murder of William E. Quinn, a correction officer who was fatally beaten at the start of the 1971 Attica prison rebellion. A codefendant, Charles Joseph Pernasilice, was given a term of up to two years for attempted assault on the guard. Page 70.

title: Senate Approves a Bill to Outlaw Cheap Handguns
description: TRENTON, May 8  Legislation outlawing cheap handguns, commonly known as Saturday night specials among law enforcement officials, received, final unanimous approval in the Senate today.

title: Advertising
description: Since 156 East 52d Street changed from apartments to offices 11 years ago, it has become a microcosm of the advertising industry.

title: Cambodia Reds Are Uprooting Millions As They Impose a Peasant Revolution
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 8  The victorious Cambodian Communists, who marched into Phnom Penh on April 17 and ended five years of war in Cambodia, are carrying out a peasant revolution that has thrown the entire country into upheaval.

title: Hiring Thaw
description: Mayor Beame's attempt to convince skeptics in the financial community and elsewhere that he is truly committed to a balanced budget won't be helped by the disclosure that the Mayor has partially lifted a citywide hiring freeze in order to accommodate members of the Board of Estimate.

title: Molloy, La Salle Gain Track Titles
description: Archbishop Molloy won the A division crown and La Salle was the B division winner yesterday in the 52d annual Athletic Association of Private Schools outdoor track and field championships at Randalls Island.

title: Mrs. Gandhi, Met by Criticism, Drops Internal Security Bill
description: NEW DELHI, May 8Prime Minister Indira Gandhi abruptly withdrew a controversial bill today after a storm of charges that she was attempting to impose a dictatorship in India.

title: Court Orders Vesco to Pay $5.6Million
description: NEWARK, May 8A New Jersey Superior Court Judge ruled today that the fugitive financier Robert L. Vesco must pay the stockholders of the defunct I.O.S., Ltd., a default judgment of $5.6million.

title: Hearings Open Today On Charter Revision
description: The State Charter Revision Commission will hold the first of a series of public hearings today on its preliminary recommendations to revamp the city government so that it is more responsive to the needs of local communities.

title: California Seeks Delay in Offshore Production Rights Auction
description: LOS ANGELES, May 8Cali fornia, foremost among a score of coastal states involved in the controversy over proposed largescale offshore oil production, unlimbered a new tactic of resistance today.

title: CITY BALLET STAGES STARS AND STRIPES
description: Only the sophisticated are naive enough to believe that George Balanchine is joking in Stars and Stripes, a ballet he created in tribute to John Philip Sousa.

title: Defense Defended
description: A nervous world, watching Washington for indications of the role the United States will play abroad in the wake of the Indochina defeat, is beginning to get some reassurance that this country's posture will not be one of renunciation of global responsibilities.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Despite more intensive efforts to get out the vote, the turnout in New York City's Tuesday community school board election was the apparently the lowest since the start of decentralized school operations here in 1970.

title: Jones of Padres Stops Reds, 30
description: Randy Jones, who won 8 games and lost 22 last season as a rookie for the San Diego Padres, pitched a fourhit shutout last night in beating the powerladen Cincinnati Reds, 30, in the Reds park, Riverfront Stadium.

title: Bettors Will Pick Own Numbers In New Daily Lottery in Jersey
description: NEWARK, May 8Governor Byrne announced today that a new, daily pickyourowndigits lottery, which state officials said was the first of its kind in the country, would begin operations in New Jersey on May 22 for a sixmonth est period.

title: WALDHEIM MEETS WITH HANOI AIDES
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. May 8  Secretary Genera Waldheim and North Vietna mese representatives have discussed the opening of Hanoi's first diplomatic observer office here, a United Nations spokesman said today.

title: CORRECTION
description: A headline in The New York Times yesterday incorrectly identified the Union Club as the site of a holdup. The holdup actually took place at the Union League Club, which was incorrectly described as the oldest club in the city. The Union Club is believed to be the oldest.

title: 2 Schoolboys on N.B.A. List
description: Lured by the prospect of big  money contracts, Bill Willoughby and Darryl Dawkins will attempt to follow the lead of Moses Malone and make the jump from high school to pro basketball.

title: Attica Sentences
description: John Hill was sentenced in Buffalo yesterday to a term of 20 years to life for the murder of William E. Quinn, a correction officer who was fatally beaten at the start of the 1971 Attica prison rebellion. A codefendant, Charles Joseph Pernasilice, was given a term of up to two years for attempted assault on the guard. (Page 70.)

title: Hayden Medalist In Richardson Golf
description: HEWLETT HARBOR, L.I. May 8Gary Hayden, who won the 1974 William D. Richardson Memorial golf tournament with a spectacular chip shot, made an impressive move toward defending that victory today by winning the medal of the 27th annual amateur invitation event.

title: JAPAN RAIL STRIKE STRANDS MILLIONS
description: TOKYO, May 8Workers on the government railways went on strike throughout Japan today.

title: A SEALAW DRAFT READY AT PARLEY
description: PARIS, May 8The conference on the law of the sea in Geneva has drawn up a draft charter for the oceans providing for an international authority to exploit the ocean floor in joint ventures with countries or companies, a 200mile economic zone in which coastal states will have control of all marine resources, and a 12mile territorial offshore limit of full sovereignty.

title: Chrysler of Britain Offers Plan to Prevent Walkout
description: LONDON, May 8 (Reuters)The Chrysler Corporation's British subsidiary, faced with a walkout of 4,000 workers this weekend, proposed today a plan for employe participation in the ownership and management of the company.

title: About New York
description: The doctor said I'd probably be out of commission for three months after I broke my hip, Joanna Simon, one of the three singing Simon Sisters, said the other night.

title: Prices Unchanged For Sugar Futures; Potato Trade Hectic
description: World sugar prices closed unchanged yesterday on the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange. Traders reported dull trading in this and other markets due to observance of Ascension Day in some European countries.

title: A Representative From Texas Doodles House Tedium Away
description: WASHINGTON, May 5The hearing room is too hot, the overhead lights are too bright. As the witness drones on, some committee members doze; others yawn and wonder when it will all he over.

title: Morgenthau Aides Move to Dismiss 3 Itkin Indictments
description: The Manhattan District Attorney's office moved yesterday in Federal District Court here to dismiss three indictments against Herbert Itkin, a lawyer and Federal informer whose testimony helped prosecutors obtain convictions and indictments in several notable cases. Among those who were sent to jail as a result of Mr. Itkin's cooperation with Federal prosecutors were James L. Marcus, a City Water Commissioner in John V. Lindsay's administration, and Carmine G. DeSapio, the former Tammany Hall leader.

title: Books of The Times
description: It is difficult to be against Robert and Suzanne Massie's Journey, the autobioraphy of a couple who bore and raised a classic hemophiliac. For one thing, it recounts the intense suffering of a child in endless pain, so if you have tears to shed, prepare to shed them endlessly. For another thing, it is the story of parents who refused to abandon either hope or love despite every devi??ish temptation to the contrary, so if you are capable of being inspired, prepare to be so by Journey. For still another thing, it serves any number of worthy causes. It tells us precisely what hemophilia is not, thereby dispelling the clichd notion that the disease invades only aristocratic bodies (while Queen Victoria passed it along to a number of her descendants, hemophilia is by no means exclusively the disease of kings) and clearing up the popular impression that it kills by bleeding its victims to death through tiny cuts (on the contrary, external bleeding is a minor threat; the real danger is posed by internal injury to vital and joints).

title: SchoolElection Turnout Is Worse Than in 1973
description: The voter turnout in Tuesday's community school boards election in the city was apparently lower than the disappointing 1973 turnout, the Board of Elections reported yesterday.

title: HOUSE PANEL CUTS AID FOR REFUGEES TO $405MILLION
description: WASHINGTON, May 3  A House Appropriations subcommittee today cut President Ford's request for $507million for Indochina refugees to $405million and said that the relief program should be funded with this sum for the next 14 months.

title: Hill Gets 20 Years for Attica Murder
description: BUFFALO, May 8John B. Hill was sentenced today to prison for 20 years to life for the murder of William E. Quinn, a correction officer who died from a beating in the opening minutes of the 1971 Attica prison rebellion.

title: 6Game Victory Puts Buffalo in Final Round
description: MONTREAL, May 8The National Hockey League was assured tonight of its first allexpansionclub championship final when the Buffalo Sabres turned back the Montreal Canadiens, 43. The defeat eliminated the last of the six establishment teams, four games to two, in the semifinal round.

title: Witty Lynn Redgrave Spices 'Happy Hooker'
description: "The Happy Hooker," which arrived yesterday at the Plaza and other theaters, is not to be confused with "The Life and Times of Xaviera Hollander," the pornography film that played the World Theater some months ago. "The Happy Hooker" is not pornographic.The movie is a cheerily amoral New York comedy about greed and lust in the land of opportunity. It's based on the book of the same name by Miss Hollander, who was once named Secretary of the Year in her native Netherlands and then went on to become one of Manhattan's most successful madams, written in collaboration with Robin Moore and Yvonne Dunleavy.In the title role the film has the enormously talented Lynn Redgrave slim, chic and irrepressibly comic as a young woman who strides confidently up the primrose path to wealth and ill fame.I haven't read the book, so I have no idea how the movie's Xaviera compares with the original. I suspect that this one is the result of the happy collaboration of Miss Redgrave, William Richert (the producer of "Derby"), who wrote the screenplay, and Nicholas Sgarro, who directed the film. Individually and collectively they've had the good sense to put on instead of put down.Miss Redgrave's Xaviera isn't one to fret about bygones or missed opportunities. She has the resilience of Little Orphan Annie with none of the fabricated innocence. She's a woman who always listens to herself. Early in her career, when a man she thinks she loves walks out on her, leaving her with an envelope full of large bills, she says the hoary old obligatory line rather huffily: "You make me feel like a whore." As soon as she has said it, however, you are aware that she realizes, with wickedly shrewd self-perception, that this is her call in life.Moralists may object to the fact that the film steers carefully clear of any of the seamier aspects of big-time prostitution. We are given the impression that Xaviera refused to pay for police protection and that she did so because of her scruples. When thrown in the overnight lockup with a bunch of tough streetwalkers, Xaviera's girls are as shocked as debutantes forced to hitchhike to the ball."The Happy Hooker" doesn't deny degradation so much as it airily ignores it in the interests of comedy.The film, which never quite gets around to Xaviera's deportation from this country in 1972, is told in flashbacks cued by her arrest and arraignment for running her brothel. Her memories are uncluttered by feelings of remorse. At one point she tells us with Miss Redgrave's touch for comic solemnity: "True. I'd gotten myself into a business that wasn't very romantic, but because I liked it, I was able to bring something special to it."Mr. Sgarro has brought something special to the film by surrounding Miss Redgrave with some of New York's best actors, including Elizabeth Wilson, Lovelady Powell, Nicholas Pryor, Tom Poston, Conrad Janis and Trish Hawkins, with an assist from abroad by Jean-Pierre Aumont. Among other things, the film is a fine advertisement for local talent.Having been derived from such unlikely subject matter, "The Happy Hooker" is doubley surprising. It's a witty work. Lynn's mother and father need not be embarrassed.

title: Ford's The One
description: If President Ford is bluffing about his determination to run for election in his own right next year, he is doing a persuasive job of it. The sevenman committee that met to begin planning his campaign this week was one that any Republican candidate would wish to have in his cornerexperienced, able, spanning the traditional GoldwaterRockefeller split, a guard neither old nor avant.

title: At the U.N., Women's Year of Disgrace
description: LONDONDespite the fact that all the nations represented at the United Nations oppress women in all degrees and in all manners, many to the point of slavery and mutilation, and are truculently uninterested in forfeiting the privilege, some good guys at the Secretariat decided that 1975 should be International Women's Year.

title: MAIL TO CONGRESS AGAINST REFUGEES
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The volume of mail received by members of Congress on the resettlement of Vietnamese refugees in this country has varied widely, but, whether heavy or light, the letters have been hostile more often than not.

title: STEINBRENNER STUDY DEFENDED BY S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP) A spokesman for the Securities and Exchange Commission defended today the use of two directors of the American Ship Building Company on a threemember committee that inves tigated illegal political contributions by the corporation.

title: Commodity Price Index Off 3.5 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials fell to 195.4. from 198.9 last week.

title: Saigon as It Fell and Just After: A Newsman's Diary
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 8We rode to Independence Palace hoping to see Lieut. Gen. Tran Van Tra, the chairman of the military administration committee for Saigon under the new Revolutionary Government.

title: The Pop Life
description: Avantgardism is invading progressive rock music with everincreasing frequency these days. And in discussions of such music, references to classical avantgarde composers crop up continually. Rock fans realize that a lot of progressive pop, especially by the various synthesizer bands, has been heavily influenced by certain classical composers. But they don't really know much about those composers.

title: HISTORIAN CHOSEN AS U.S. LIBRARIAN
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Daniel J. Boorstin, the Pulitzer prizewinning historian will be norninated by President Ford to be the nation's 12th Librarian of Congress, a wellplaced Administration official said today.

title: BEAME PRESSES FOR U.S. AID BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 Mayor Beame joined today with his Democrat counterparts from half a dozen other cities to press Congressional leaders to pass a bill he said was the key ingredient to the Federal aid he wanted to balance his budget next year.
