description: WASHINGTON, May 9For 25 years David A. Phillips has been, by trade, a spy, and, although he might protest the labelhe would call himself a clandestine employe of the Central Intelligence Agencyhe does not apologize for the occupation.

title: Hiss Appeals to Court in Boston To Reinstate Him as a Lawyer
description: BOSTON, May 9The highest court in Massachusetts heard an appeal today for Alger Hiss, 70 years old, to be readmitted as a lawyer here on grounds of good character and a good record since his release from prison in 1954.

title: High Spaniards Suggesting Franco Quit
description: MADRID, May 7  Highly placed Spaniards in both the civilian and military spheres, ranging from conservative monarchists to socialists, are seeking to get Generalissimo Francisco Franco to leave office quickly. They want to begin a program of democratic reforms under his successor, Prince Juan Carlos de Borbn.

title: 9% CUT IN BUYING OF ARMS IS ASKED BY SENATE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, May 9The Senate Armed Services Committee, setting the stage for the annual defense debate in the Senate, proposed today a reduction of about 9 per cent in the Defense Department's weapons procurement and research programs in the coming fiscal year.

title: Business Briefs
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, May 9 (AP)venezuelan political sources said tonight that they were satisfied with a statement by the Gulf Oil Corporation that it had riot paid bribes to polticians or officials to remain in business in the country.

title: 18 U.S. Missionaries and Field Workers Remained or Were Captured in Vietnam
description: Eleven missionaries and field workers from three American service organizations decided to stay in Vietnam and seven others from a fourth group were captured when Ban Me Thuot fell, according to organization spokesmen.

title: CORRECTION
description: It was erroneously stated in The New York Times of May 1 that a Frenchbuilt turbotrain on the way to Boston developed trouble and had to be towed back to Penn Station. Actually, the locomotive was built by an American concern, United Aircraft Corporation, now United Technologies Corporation.

title: No Empty Ritual
description: David Cohen, acting president of Common Cause, raised several important issues concerning the confirmation process in testimony recently before the Senate Interior Committee, which has been considering the nomination of Stanley K. Hathaway to be Secretary of the Interior.

title: Higher Consumer Cost Held No Factor In Ordering Utilities to Shift to Cod
description: WASHINGTON, May 9The Federal Energy Administration said today that it would not take higher costs to consumers into account in deciding which electric generating stations would. be ordered to convert to coal from oil or natural gas.

title: Rutgers Police Given Approval To Carry Guns 24 Hours a Day
description: CAMDEN, May 9Rutgers University's board of governors unanimously approved today the request of the university police for the right to carry weapons 24 hours a day.

title: Arab and Israeli Parties Said to Agree to Meeting
description: TEL AVIV, May 9Chancellor Bruno Kreisky of Austria has obtained an agreement by the Labor party of Israel and the Arab Socialist Union of Egypt for a meeting under the auspices of the Middle East Committee of the Socialist International. The time and place have not been fixed.

title: 48,000 REFUGEES JAMMED ON GUAM
description: OROTE POINT, Guam, Saturday, May 10The South Vietnamese refugee population on Guam continued to grow rapidly today as more than 8,000 new refugees arrived here on three merchant ships, including one vessel that left Saigon after the capital fell to the Communists.

title: Books of The Times
description: It is easy to see why Michael Shaara's The Killer Angels, which has just received the Pulitzer Prize for fiction, was so honored. It is a novel about the Battle of Gettysburg, a subject of almost hypnotic fascination to laymen and military historians alike, and Mr. Shaara's narrative conveys the drama, the courage and the heartbreak of those days.

title: 2 Escapees From Bergen Are Seized in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, May 9 (AP)Two convicts who the authoritie?? said escaped from a New Jetsey jail were held today by Chicago police who located one of the fugitives in the Cook County Jail.

title: John Taylor Bottomley Marries Nina Laughlin
description: In the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More yesterday afternoon, Nina Laughlin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alexander Mellon Laughlin of New York and East Hampton, L. L, was married to John Taylor Bottomley of North Hampton, N. H. He is a son of Dr. and Mrs. George T. Bottomley of Little Boars Head, N. H.

title: REFUGEES CALLED NO HEALTH HAZARD
description: The settlement of Vietnamese refugees in the United States poses no significant public health risk to the United States, epidemiologists from the Public Health Service's Center for Disease Control in Atlanta reported yesterday. Their conclusion was based on preliminary examinations of 77,576 refugees who arrived at Guam and Wake Island as of last Wednesday.

title: Schlock ArtFor $2.50 You Don't Get Dewdrops
description: The interior decorator could have been played by Rosalind Russell; the young executive by Cary Grant. She, with a white coat draped over her arm, sunglasses folded in her hand, a portfolio tucked under her arm, followed her client as he paced the Edward S. Frisch gallery on the 17th floor of the Design Center at 979 Third Avenue. The young executive paused in front of a white abstract painting, pulled back his chin, furrowed his brow and looked aslant at the canvas.

title: Ray Phillips, Celebrated Hermit Of Maine Coast Island, Is Dead
description: MANANA ISLAND, Me., May 10Ray Phillips, who left the hustle and bustle of New York City more than 40 years ago to become the state of Maine's most celebrated hermit, died yesterday morning in his driftwood home on this island. He was 83 years old.

title: Baruch College Wins First CUNY Track Title
description: Richie Crabbe, George Bailey and Gerry Mortensen each posted double victories to lead Baruch College to its first team title in the City University of New York track and field championships yesterday.

title: How to Order Olympic Tickets
description: Ticket application forms to the 1976 Summer Olympics in Montreal will be available Thursday in all 2,300 retail and catalogue stores of Montgomery Ward, the exclusive distributor of the tickets in the United States.

title: Great Event: Ticonderoga Falls!
description: TICONDEROGA, N.Y., May 10By the photographers' early lights, a latterday band of Green Mountain Boys seized Fort Ticonderoga today, reenacting in a cheerfully incongruous, mixture of Revolutionary history, and modern technology the capture of the strategic British post on a cliff above Lake Champlain.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SUNDAY, MAY 11, 1975

title: U.S. Women Bow, 21, in Cup Tennis
description: AIX EN PROVENCE, France, May 10 (AP)Evonne Goolagong beat Julie Heldman in singles, then teamed with Helen Gourlay for a doubles victory as Australia ousted the United States, 21, in the Federation Cup tennis semifinals today. The Aussies, defending champions, will go against Czechoslovakia, a 30 winner over France, in the final tomorrow.

title: Conversations With Kennedy
description: If J.F.K. sometimes comes off as an S.O.B. in this book, well, he's my kind of S.O.B. And if the author is guilty of kissing and telling about his close friendship with the late President, then I wish he'd done more of it and shared it sooner. After 12 years of the legend as usual, Bradlee gives a portrait of the Kennedy he saw and heard in the flesha President off duty, a President trying to relax, a President in search of personal contact otherwise denied by the burdens and isolations of his lonely office. John F. Kennedy emerges not as the canonized personage whose photograph is enshrined on millions of American mantels, but bettera full, complex man with all the faults and vices seldom acknowledged in folk heroes.

title: Anna Kavan transformed her pain to art
description: She lived in many places from Burma to Scandinavia to California, and she had many different names. After reading about the character called K in Kafka, she named herself Anna Kavan, and when this collection of stories was published in England after her death it made that name famous. It should do so here.

title: Cram Course Is Set for Aptitude Test
description: HIGHLAND PARK  The Y.M. & Y.W.H.A. of Raritan Valley is again offering a course entitled How to Prepare for the College Entrance Examinations.

title: Popular in the U.S., Foreign Cars Have Troubles at Home
description: PARISTo a generation brought up with the unchanging, practically eternal German People's Car, or Volkswagen, the recent news from Wolfsburg was unsettling.

title: Henry Wheeler Chase, 79, Published Economic Data
description: Henry Wheeler Chase, founder and chairman of Economic Time Foundation, Inc., which publishes economic and other educational reports, died Friday at Greenwich (Conn.) Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived at 7 Plow Lane, Greenwich.

title: France Counters Hanoi On Recognition Issue
description: PARIS, May 10France has rejected complaints from Hanoi about delays in recognizing the South Vietnamese Revolutionary Government, saying those complaints were based on a misunderstanding, according to a diplomatic official.

title: Nordskag Victor in 184Mile Ocean Race
description: MIAMI, May 10Bob Nordskag of Van Nuys, Calif., driving a 35foot Cigarette named Powerboat Magazine Special, powered by 2/496 cubicinch MerCruisers was declared the winner of the first BacardiSam Griffith race today. His winning time was 2 hours 26 minutes on an average speed of 75.6 miles an hour.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: O.K. to plant out geraniums, but wait another week before planting seedlings of zinnias, marigolds and other warmweather annuals.... The same is true for tomatoes, eggplants, peppers and other warmweather vegetables. If the soil is warm in this cool spring beans can go in now.... Don't forget to water daily (if no rain) when vegetable/annual seeds germinate. They must have moisture to get a good start.

title: Interim Judges Named by Beame
description: Mayor Beame announced the interim appointments his Model Cities Administration, a former aide in the Controller's office and a Manhattan attorney as Civil Court judges. He also announced the permanent appointment a new Family Court judge.

title: AMERICAS NEARING ACCORD ON LIFTING CUBA TRADE CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, May 10The General Assembly of the Organization of American States meeting in Washington is nearing agreement on a formula that will lead to the lifting bf the trade embargo against Cuba sometime this summer, according to United States officials.

title: INVESTING
description: Edward T. O'Brien, paid president of the Securities Industry Association, said in a policy statement shortly before May 1, that when fully negotiated brokerage rates went into effect on Mayday there would be less negotiating between stockbrokers and clients than once anticipated.

title: Detectives Feel Hindered By Squad Revisions Here
description: In Manhattan a burglarysquad detective will not investigate a case unless the loss is $10,000 or more. And throughout the city, detectives say they are often discouraged by supervisors from pursuing cases if they have to work overtime.

title: Rebecca Hathaway Is Married To Russell Vincent Lynch Jr.
description: St. Thomas's Episcopal Church in Garrison, Md., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Rebecca Phillips Hathaway, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. E. Phillips Hathaway of Owings Mills, Md., to Russell Vincent Lynch Jr., son of Mr. Lynch of Dallas and Rose Parsons Lynch of New York.

title: Parent and Child
description: Early one Thursday afternoon last fall, Dr. John M. Driscoll Jr., director of the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit at Babies Hospital, Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center, received a phone call from a pediatrician in a town several hours north of Manhattan. A baby girlborn about 7 that morning, six weeks prematurely, weighing 3 pounds 3 ounces was critically ill with respiratory distress syndrome, the lung disease that is the biggest killer of premature babies. The infantwhom I'll call Lauraurgently needed sophisticated medical care of a type that the upstate town had neither the equipment nor the personnel to provide. When the upstate pediatrician learned that Columbia could take the child, he arranged for an ambulance, while Dr. Driscoll alerted his staff that another desperately ill baby was on the way.

title: A Day to Rejoice In Philly
description: COLOR Philadelphia red, white and blue. Today the city starts its spin into the Bicentennial with a giant street festival commemorating the Second Continental Congress, which met in Independence Hall 200 years ago. Most of the attractions will be free, and from noon to dusk more than a million men, women and children are expected to converge on bannerbedecked, treelined Benjamin Franklin Parkway, Philadelphia's Champs Elysees, to join in the celebrations.

title: The Second Nuclear Age
description: WASHINGTONIn the last few days, with scarcely, a wink of attention from the world, the experts on disarmament have been meeting at Geneva to discuss the problems of what they call the second nuclear age.

title: Blood and guts story
description: Before Bobby Massie was 6 months old, he was diagnosed as having hemophilia. Journey is about the impact of catastrophic disease on a family in a society that says, in effect, If you wish to keep this child alive, it's up to you to find the resources. Journey is remarkable not just because the Massies met the challenge, but because their book makes it possible to believe that their experiences opened to them a selfawareness they otherwise never would have known.

title: Other Asian Nations Have Insurgents At Work
description: MANILAVictory, rather than the counterinsurgency doctrines of American military theorists, has accomplished the elimination of Asia's two largest insurgencies; for better or worse, the Provisional Revolutionary Government and the Khmer Rouge must now govern. In the rest of Southeast Asia, outside Indochina, a clutch of wouldbe imitators is left with an inspirational example and a hope that some of the stilled and captured weapons in Indochina may soon find their way into their hands.

title: TV MAKES DEBUT IN SOUTH AFRICA
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, May 10 (AP)Thousands of South Africans got their first look at a television picture this week.

title: Foyt Takes Indianapolis 500 Pole at 193.976 M.P.H.
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 10A. J. Foyt, who does not relish anyone's stealing the show from him before 200,000 spectators, bounced back from a failure today, knocked hell out of myself and won the pole position for the Indianapolis 500.

title: Votes in Congress
description: Senate

title: U.S. Walk Mark Broken By White Plains Senior
description: WHITE PLAINS, May 10 Under virtually ideal weather and competitive conditions, one national and eight meet records were set and two other meet stand. ards were tied today at the eighth annual Glenn Loucks Memorial schoolboy games.

title: Mary Scheltema Wed To Eric Jay Fleischer
description: Mary Annette Scheltema Was married yesterday afternoon to Eric Jay Fleischer, who is to graduate today from the University of Maryland. The Rev. Richard Kelley performed the Unitarian ceremony in the west chapel of the university in College Park, Md.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Miss Frank Makes Formal Song Debut
description: Carole Frank's recital last Sunday evening was billed as her formal debut, but actually she has been heard here previously as a soloist and chorus member with what looks, in her biography, like every musical organization in town.

title: COURT BROADENS JOBBENEFIT PLAN
description: The State Court of Appeals ruled last week that persons who suffer psychological injuries as a result of jobrelated psychic traumas were eligible for workmen's compensation benefits.

title: Driver Hoping to Fulfill Indy 500 Dream
description: Driving down West 16th Street toward Georgetown Road, Dick Simon felt the perspiration break out on the palms of his hands. He turned his 1966 secondhand station wagon into the main gate and looked up at the big sign: Indianapolis Motor Speedway. Simon's knees began knocking.

title: Horse Show Calendar
description: TodayChildren's Services, Farmington Valley Polo Club, Farmington, Conn. Regular, green, amateurowner and junior working hunters; open and and preliminary jumpers, threegaited, fivegaited, fine harness, roadsters, hackneys, poneys, saddle bred pleasure, equitation in hunter and saddie seat. 8 A.M.

title: Civilian Patrol Looks to Sea
description: If any passersby on shore had spotted William Redden falling out of his rowboat into Jamaica Bay three times in 15 minutes one afternoon last week, they might justifiably haven given him low marks for not keeping his balance and learning from past mistakes. Fortunately, the multiple dips were all intentional.

title: Wiesner Denies a Threat
description: Dr. Wiesner, reached by telephone at Cambridge; said: I have not wirtten any threatening letters to the Prince or anyone else. That is not my style.

title: About the Mets ...
description: A cause for laughter among the Mets just before game time yesterday was provided by Jesus Alou, a righthanded batting outfielder. Asked to pose by a photographer, Alou took up a lefthanded batting stance while the Mets on the bench tittered. Mon finally gave the gag away, after two or three pictures had been taken, by lifting up his hand and changing over to his righthanded stance... . The Mets' management will observe Mothers Day this afternoon by presenting each woman attending the game with a white crew hat decorated with the Mets' logo... . The Mets' pinchhitting corps continues to excel. Before yesterday's game, Wayne Garrett had two hits in three pinchhitting tries, Alou and Joe Torre had two hits in four attempts and Ed Kranepool had three hits in five.

title: Kathleen Gordon Planning Bridal To Law Student
Effect of Tax Deductions on Donations Is Studied
description: A commission set up by John D. Rockefeller 3d and hacked by major philanthropies and corporations is studying the impact of tax deductions on giving to charities. It is also considering the creation of a watchdog organization over activities and abuses of charitable groups.

title: Letters
description: In Law and order in Chile (April 13), Victor Perera suggets that the poet Nicanor Parra, disillusioned with Allende before the coup, chose to remain in Chile and accommodate himself to the military government. Since this statement can be misconstrued to Mr. Parra's disadvantage, would like to bring to light certain facts which may set the record straight on this matter. I am myself a Chilean poet, residing in New York, and have known Nicanor Parra for over 20 years.

title: Wanted: 2 Senators In New Hampshire
description: CONCORD, N.H., May 10 It's been a long election night, said Senatorelect John A. Durkin, Democrat of New Hampshire.

title: Son of the morning, prince of darkness
description: Not every politician becomes a legend in his own lifetime. Whatever else he may have failed in, within Britain, Sir Oswald Mosley can at least claim to have succeeded in that.

title: Stones Honored by Track Writers
description: Dwight Stones, the high jumper, has been voted the outstanding athlete of the indoor track season by the Track Writers Association. He will receive the Jesse Abramson Trophy.

title: Revolution in Cambodia
description: First reports from Cambodia suggest that one of the great upheavals of history may, be taking place there.

title: Linda LaVine Wed To John G. Johnson
description: Linda Joan Johnson were married yesterday afternoon in the Lady Chapel of St. Patrick's Cathedral by the Rev. Michael Conroy.

title: Communists in Cambodia Denounce U.S.
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 10 (Reuters)  The new Government in Phnom Penh charged today that 200,000 people were killed or maimed in seven months of American bombing of Cambodia up to August, 1973.

title: Even Pinter Is Being Pinteresque
Chic Thou Art
description: Until now, Chic Anderson has been the voice of truth in the Triple Crown races, the voice that people accepted rather than questioned, the voice of an oracle that was more celestial than controversial. But when the 100th Preakness Stakes is run Saturday, people will be listening attentively to Chic Anderson's call on the CBS television network because in the Kentucky Derby he goofed. He had Prince Thou Art in the lead instead of Foolish Pleasure, the winner. In most jobs when somebody goofs, that person might be the only one who knows it. But when Charles (Chic) Anderson goofed at Churchill Downs, more than 30 million people heard his mistake. He's the voice of doubt now. But on Saturday he'll probably redeem his reputation. The amazing thing to me, he says in reflecting on his week since the goof, is that some people actually thought I couldn't make a mistake.

title: Kathryn Leaman Wed
description: Kathryn Louise Leaman, daughter of Mrs. William Gordon Leaman of Sunnyside, Queens, and the late Mr. Leaman, and Erik Albert Hanson, son of Dr. and Mrs. Howard Alfred Hanson of Middletown, Conn., were married yesterday afternoon in St. Peter's Lutheran Church here. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Dr. Ralph E. Peterson, the senior pastor, assisted by the Rev. John R. Young of the Sunnyside Reformed Church. The bride teaches in the city's schools. Her husband, a certified public accountant, is with the New York accounting concern of James D. Miller & Co.

title: Bringing Magic to Math
description: OLD WESTBURY  They call him a lifesaver, a miracle worker, a genius. At the very least a weaver of classroom maeic.

title: City University Track Summaries
description: FIELD EVENTS

title: The Capital's Liberation: A Dismal Image Fades
description: WASHINGTONAny understanding of the effects the end of the war in Vietnam will have on Washington must begin with an understanding of the effects the continuation of the war had on Washington. The war in Vietnam had come to be so much more than a warits impact on the United States Government and politics so great  that the end of the fighting itself could not be the end.

title: A DEFENSE ALERT IS VOWED IN SEOUL
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 10Concerned by recent Communist victories in Indochina, hundreds of thousands of South Koreans attended a rally in Seoul today in support of President Park Chung Hee's call for increased preparedness against possible aggression from the North.

title: Anne Bolling Blagden Is Married
description: Anne Bolling Blagden, daughter of Mrs. Augustus Silliman Blagden of Lime Rock, Lakeville, Conn., and the late Mr. Blagden, and Kerry Macdonald Douglas, son of Mrs. Zimmerman Douglas of West Islip, L. I., and Point O'Woods, Fire Island, L. I., and the late Dr. Earl W. Douglas, were married yesterday at noon.

title: Egypt's Aswan Dam Isn't Doing the Job It Might Have
description: LONDONWhen the late President Gamal Abdel Nasser signed his agreement with Moscow in 1956 to build his greatest monument, the Aswan High Dam on the Nile River, he thought he had the indispensable answer to Egypt's mounting economic problems. The dam would provide ir rigation water to double the acreage of Egypt's crowded strip of cultivable land along the river, he said, and would supply 10 million kilowatts of electricity to fuel new industrial development.

title: The Poetry of Surrealism
description: In 1924 Andr Breton published his first Manifeste du Surralisme, founding a school of poetry on the syllabus of a word coined by Guillaume Apollinaire and a mood of exasperation pervasive since the end of the First World War.

title: A Bonus Baby Tries to Come Back, and a Cruel World Laughs at His Failure
description: My brother remembered it all so wellthe nohitters, the headlines, Dick Young, Mel Allenthat when I told him what I'd written about that day at Yankee Stadium, he said: But you forgot Casey Stengel! Remember what he said when he found out about the strikeouts? I didn't remember. He said, I guess your fellas don't need no gloves when you pitch.

title: H. Bustos Domecq on Revisionism
description: Paradoxically, the notion that happened to carry the day at the World Congress of Historians recently held at Pau, in the south of Francethe concept of a pure historyis exactly what constitutes the major obstacle to the full understanding of the said congress. In open contravention of this very thesis, we have entombed ourselves in the basement of the Argentine National Library, Periodical Division, consulting a variety of the same from July of this year. The multilingual bulletin which recorded verbatim the bristling debates and the conclusion that was arrived at is in our hands. The principal theme of the congress was Is History a Science or an Art? Observers noted that the contending sides held aloft, each claiming for its own camp, the same namesThucydides, Voltaire. Gibbon and Michelet. (We shall not let pass here the pleasant opportunity of congratulating the delegate from our northern province of the Chaco, Mr. Gaiferos, who gallantly proposed to the other members of the congress that they give a preferential place to our own IndoAmerica, beginning, of course, with the Chaco, that obvious seat of more than a single worthy.) The unforeseen, as it so often does, came to pass. The thesis that aroused the unanimous vote turned out to be. as is now wellknown, the one put forward by Luigi Zevasco that history is an act of faith.

title: Fink a Bright Light In Cosmos Victory
description: Joe Fink, the indefatigable striker of the New York Cosmos, had the kind of game last Wednesday night that not many soccer players enjoy in a lifetime. Besides coring three goals, the former allAmerican at New York University was a complete soccer player, which is not common for a youth from Queens today, but could be a few years from now.

title: What's Doing in FLORENCE
description: FLORENCE REVISITED  One veteran traveler hated Florence the first time he went there. The time was midsummer, the weather was too hot for walking aroundthe indispensable mode of transportation in this particular place. Tourists mobbed the museums, spoiling the view of Botticelli's Birth of Venus. Desirable accommodations were few, table space was at a premium. Yet, July and August aside, Florence is charming, as the aforementioned traveler discovered on later visits. Ten months of the year it is great to be in this former Medici dukedom among noble Tuscan hills covered with tall cypress trees halfconcealing the palatial villas dotting the slopes. The hills, the cypress trees and the villas can be seen from many points in the center of the city, so Florence still seems to be a country town rather than the municipality of nearly half a million inhabitants that it is.

title: Gallup Poll Finds Little Evidence Of a Trend Toward Isolationism
description: Despite the recent fall of Cambodia and South Vietnan?? to the Communists, the Ameri?? can public's views on the extent of United States militar?? commitments aboard offer littl?? evidence of a trend towar?? isolationism since 1971, accord ing to a Gallup Poll made publi today.

title: N. Y. Lacrosse Club Wins
description: TARRYTOWN, N.Y., May 10The New York Lacrosse Club defeated the Metropolitan Lacrosse Club today 16 to 2, at. Hackley Field. Bruce Cohen, New York playercoach scored six goals.

title: Tours of Brookhaven Lab
description: UPTONThe Brookhaven National Laboratory has invited the public to an open house next Saturday and Sunday, allowing visitors to enter some if its facilities for the first time In its 29year history. In the past visitors were allowed beyond the gates of the nuclear research facility's 5,000acre center once a year to see carefully prepared exhibits staged in carefully specified auditoriums.

title: Joanne Graffeo Is Bride
description: Joanne Margaret. Graffeo, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. John Graffeo of Manhasset, L. I., was married at noon yesterday to Stephen Douglas Henry, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert T. Henry of Fort Wayne, Ind. The Rev. Rodger Sasse performed the ceremony in the Park Forest Church of God in Fort Wayne.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: New Plan Proposed To Assist Disabled
description: TRENTON  A fiveyear plan calling for revision of the state's laws governing the mentally and physically handicapped was proposed last week by the New Jersey Developmental Disabilities Council.

title: Lakeland Is Selected Best Dog at Springfield
description: WEST SPRINGFIELD, Mass., May 10A Lakeland terrier, who will be 6 years old in August, gave a lesson to his younger rivals today as the British import was named best of 1,598 dogs at the Springfield Kennel Club's 48th show.

title: Giants Sign 2 From W.F.L.: Linebacker, Defensive End
description: Last year, the New York Giants gave up on five players who held future contracts with the World Football League.

title: Teri L. Pattee Wed To C. Daniel Tyree
description: Teri Lanee Pattee and C. Daniel Tyree of New York, were married yesterday afternoon in the Post Chapel at Fort Douglag, Utah, by the Rev. David Goddard, a Roman Catholic priest.

title: Coghlan Hits 3:56.2 In Mile Run At Pitt
description: PITTSBURGH, May 10 (AP) Eamonn Coghlan of Villanova posted a time of 3 minutes 56,2 seconds today in winning the onemile run at the fifth annual Pitt outdoor invitation track meet. Coghlan's time was the first under 4 minutes in western Pennsylvania.

title: Which Excesses Are the Critics Attacking?
description: In his review of the Shaliko Company's production of Ghosts [A Kung Fu Version of Ibsen, April 13], currently running in repertory with Brecht's The Measures Taken at the Public Theater, Walter Kerr levelled two main criticisms at our production and touched upon a third. The first two, besides being trivial, are false; the thirdwhich involves an interpretation of the play he came close to graspingis the key to our production, as it is indeed the key to Ibsen's play.

title: Pamela Maglio Bride Of Jonathan Devorkin
description: Pamela Rose Maglio and Jonathan Brant Devorkin, who are buyers for the R.H. Macy department store, were married yesterday afternoon. State Supreme Court Justice John C. Marbach performed the ceremony in the courtyard of the Sleepy Hollow Country Club in Scarborough, N.Y.

title: Student Film
description: While time and the bulldozer continue to wipe out more of the remaining signs of another period, the Kingsborough Historical Society, a group sponsored by the Kingsborough Community College at Manhattan Beach, has been trying to dig up the history of a colorful area of Brooklyn.

title: Suffolk G.O.P. Maps Plan for Election Campaign
description: BLUE POINTResponding to criticism that the Suffolk Republican party was not open enough and energetic enough, Edwin M. Schwenk, its chairman, has started program to attract more voters and party members through such measures as the establishment of new youth and women's clubs and a directive to party officials to renew such oldfashioned methods as door  todoor campaigning.

title: Elizabeth Shaw May Married To Ralph P. Jessen, Bank Aide
Ideas & Trends
description: Scholars have generally agreed that the explosive character of human population growth began in the 18th century. But why, after milleniums of near zero growth, it happened then is still a matter of debate.

title: TV VIEW
description: CYCLOPS

title: The Region
description: The State of New Jersey, having failed to enact a progressive state income tax, has decided to raise money with what amounts to a regressive tax. It has added a numbers game, traditionally most popular in poor and especially in black neighborhoods, to its lottery.

title: The State of the City
description: Millions have viewed this implausible metropolisthe Empire City or the 51st Statewith similar awe, admiration and concern. Its services are often erratic. Its lit

title: A Marvelously Foolhardy Locust
description: When you get to southern California you've gone, about as far as you can go. Another few steps and you walk into the Pacific. southern California is the far edge. It's where the continent runs out. It's America at the end of the dream, which what Nathanael West's small, classic novel, The Day of the Locust, is all about. It's also the unrelenting theme of John. Schlesinger's virtually epic film version of the novel about life on the seedy fringe of Hollywood in the 1930's.

title: The gang that couldn't rule straight, by Jimmy Breslin
description: I remember precisely where I was on that Saturday in July when the House Judiciary Committee voted to impeach Richard Nixon. I was on the baseball field at Laguna Beach High School in California, guarding second base for a team of the White House press corps, then losing to a squad of very agile cocktail waitresses. With a portable radio pressed against my ear, I announced to my brethren that the vote had been taken. As we trotted off the field to prepare for the day's response from Ronald Ziegler and his ventriloquist, I thought, there must be more apt places to be at this time. There were, and Jimmy Breslin was there.

title: Adieu to a Lady Among Autos
description: If cars have a gender, that one was a she, and she was black and beautiful and her initials when pronounced in French said goddess. The lady was Citreon DSla deesseentered the world on Oct. 6, 1955, at the Paris auto show and left it last Wednesday after 1,415,718 of her sisters had ambled off the assembly line.

title: Dog Fanciers Are Supporting First Aid for Humans at Shows
description: In this column last month, we related how a handler and a judge had died of apparent heart attacks at dog shows. We said that at canine events, which draw thousands of persons (Chicago had 31,089 paid admissions), medical attention frequently is needed. Although a veterinarian is required to be on hand to provide for the dogs, all too seldom has provision been made to handle the injured exhibitor or spectator.

title: Do I hear violins?
description: There are good reasons for social dancing, the best having to do with survival: with the control of the elements, with food, with procreation. However, there has been only one reason accepted Christian Europe, and it is a lesser one: courtship and other releases of happy animal spirits. That is, outside of the theater and entertainment. This article is not about entertainment. Ever since the Christian church threw dancing out of its ritual in the 13th century, there have remained only these reasons: courtship and jollity.

title: If Concordes Are Coming, They Won't Sneak In
description: Tentative American approval for Britain and France to start Concorde supersonic transport service to the United States next year has provoked a debate in which the issues are proving a lot more complicated than anyone anticipated.

description: The story of the Argonautsof Jason and Medea and the Golden Fleeces is at least 28 centuries old and has survived on sheer magnetism, for it has no single classic chroniclerno Homer to sing it into perpetuityand exists in no single authorized version. It has been pruned, sterilized and

title: Canadians Seek to Spur National Consciousness
description: MONTREAL, May 10Surveying Canadian highschool students last winter, a publisher discovered that most had no idea what percentage of their country's population spoke French or who the Governor General was.

title: Eight Free Agents Signed by Jets
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., May 10A total of 343 players turned out for a New York Jets' freeagent camp at Hofstra University and the club today signed eight of them to oneyear contracts. They will report to the Jets' training camp here on July 15.

title: Hearing Set on Ocean Parkway Plan
description: The State Transportation Commissioner, Raymond T. Schuler, has announced that a public hearing on the proposed reconstruction of 4.8 miles of Ocean Parkway will be held on June 18 at 7:30 P.M. in the auditorium of Junior High School No. 62, 700 Cortelyou Road in Brooklyn. Referring to the various alternative plans under consideration, Mr. Schuler said: The hearing will permit a full discussion of the issues before our department makes a recommendadation.

title: A MARXIST ARTIST IN HAMBURG SHOW
description: HAMBURG, West GermanyAn hour's drive from here lies East Germany, a country whose Communist ideology has led to widespread ignorance of its art in the capitalist West, An important exhibition here of 120 paintings and sketches by Will Sitte, the foremost German representative of socialist realism, has tried to fill the gap.

title: Arab Nations Create Industry Unit
description: CAIRO, May 10 (Reuters)Egypt, Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and Qatar have signed an agreement to establish a multimilliondollar organization to develop industries including weapons manufactureit was announced here tonight.

title: Inspector Uncovers Drugs in Shipment Of Cashews
description: A Hoboken, N. J., customs inspector, made suspicious by an unlikely address, ferreted but an ingeniously concealed shipment of about 500 pounds of topquality hashish from India and led to the arraignment yesterday of five Indian nationals in New York City, authorities reported.

title: James Dolce Weds Wendy Silliman Nancy Ganz
description: Wendy Bennett Silliman, daughter of Frederick B. Silliman of Fairfield, Conn., and James Cluen Dolce, son of Dr. and Mrs. John J. Dolce of Rye, N. Y., and Wolfboro, N. H., were married yesterday afternoon.

title: Simon Says U. S. Won't Aid In Financial Rescue of City
description: WASHINGTON, May 10Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon announced tonight that the Federal Government would not act to save New York City from its financial crisis.

title: H. C. Schonberg Weds Mrs. Cornell
description: Helene Thomas Cornell, a former production manager of Channel 13 here, and Harold C. Schonberg, the senior music critic of The New York Times, both of New York and Shelter Island, N.Y., were married yesterday afternoon. Justice of the Peace Chester Sherman performed the ceremony at the home of the bridegroom on Shelter Island.

title: Endpaper
description: Yes, the fat man said, I've spent the last 17 years in this pursuit. More armagnac, Mr. Staid?

title: Coed Beats Schoolboy In Karate
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., May 10 In the main event of the Professional Karate Organization championships at the Nassau Coliseum tonight, Joe Hess knocked out Ernest Hyman in the third round to capture the vacant heavyweight title.

title: New Physical Education Building for Ramapo
description: MAHWAHA new Physical Education Building and Stainless Girl, a lifesized nude in polished steel by J. Seward Johnson Jr., will be dedicated Wednesday at Ramano College.

description: May 16Long Island Sports Car Association meeting at Pandora's Bos, 83.30 Jericho Turnpike Woodbury, L.I., P.M. All interested persons welcome.

title: Capture of Ticonderoga Led to Saratoga Victory
description: TICONDEROGA, N. Y.,The capture of Fort Ticonderoga on May 10, 1775, the first American victory in the War of Independence, had a military significance far exceeding the modest proportions of the battle itself.

title: Course Is Offered On Caring for Pool
description: PEMBERTON  The Burlington County College Office of Community Services will offer a special eighthour course this spring on Backyard Pool Operations.

title: Out of The Whale
description: America rewrites its history, lies about it, buries it. The heritage of whole peoples is erased and denied; the experience of generations is repressed until it can be resold as entertainment. So it has been for people of color and for women. And so it is for the American Left.

title: Doubts About Foolish Pleasure Should Be Resolved at Pimlico
description: Bill Boland, a winning Kentucky Derby jockey at the age of 16, once described his present role of trainer as a mixture of hope and despair.

title: Vietnam: How to Make A Country Whole Again
description: Deep in the Mekong Delta there is a small village known as Vi Thanh that virtually escaped the war. Settled after 1954 by fleeing North Vietnamese Catholics, the village protected itself through the years with its own militia, managing to stay aloof from the warfare that tore across much of the surrounding countryside. American troops never set foot in Vi Thanh. The Provisional Revolutionary Government forces stayed away, for the most part.

title: Miss Gaylord Plans Nuptials
description: Bradley Gaylord of Palm Beach, Fla., has announced the engagement of his daughter, Barbara Gaylord, to Robert Munro Blanchard. The wedding will be next month.

title: Answers/Questions
description: A: M.D., Bryn Mawr, Pa., asked if it was safe to use grass clippings from a lawn treated with herbicides on vegetables. We consulted Dr. Arthur Bing, Cornell University Ornamentals Research Laboratory, who said if the herbicides used were the pre emergents such as Dacthal or Tupersan, there would be no problem. Dacthal is even registered for weed control use on vegetables. However, if 2,4D has been used on the lawn within the last two to three weeks and if these clippings were to be put on the vegetable plot, there might be a problem. Wait several weeks and after a few rains to use lawn clippings where 2,4D has been applied.

title: Steven Judd to Wed Nora Beck on June 7
description: Mr. and Mrs. Burton A. Beck of Suffern Park, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter Nora Evelyn Beck, to Steven Griffing Judd, son of Mr. and Mrs. Hawley O. Judd of Bristol, Conn. The couple plan to be married June 7.

title: LISBON ASKS TALKS WITH ANGOLA UNITS
description: LISBON, May 10 (Reuters) Portugal has called for an urgent meeting with Angola's: three feuding liberation move; ments in an effort to avert civil war in the West African! territory.

title: Victorian Art on Display at Princeton
description: PRINCETON  Victorian paintings amassed by Christopher Forbes of Forbes magazine will go on display today at the Princeton University Art Museum. The collection is one of the best of its kind in the world.

title: Gothic Mania
description: A few years ago a woman of a certain taste could walk into a bookstore and at once locate the book of her choice. Jacket after jacket showed a fleeing girl in a flowing gown and a background structurea castle, bamboo hut, Chas. Addams house, igloowith a single light in the window.

title: Westfield Garden Tour to Offer Tea, Sympathy and Expert Advice
description: WESTFIELDLorraine Gambee of nearby Mountainside has been gardening all her married life. I have no fingernails, she admitted recently, and my hands are like sandpaper. I'm a dirt gardener.

title: DR. VINCENT C. WEBB, SURGEON FOR TEAMS
description: Dr. Vincent C. Webb of Glen Cove, L.I., an orthopedic surgeon, who had been on the staff of Community Hospital there for more than 35 years, died of cancer Friday at Nassau Hospital in Mineola, L.I. His age was 67.

title: Slick but Flawed War WrapUps
description: For one of television's longer running productions, in a league with Gunsmoke or The Ed Sullivan Show, coverage of the Vietnam War ran true to uneven form in the last act. When official word of Saigon's unconditional surrender was received two Tuesdays ago, at the fortuitous primetime hour of 10:30 P.M., the networks were already enmeshed in the ritual of news specials.

title: This Is California: Please Keep Out
description: A lot of silly things have been said about California, most of them at least partly true. There was, indeed, a time when the torrent of observation about the Great State of Now was so overwhelming that it threatened to inundate conventional sociology. Potentially a contribution to civilization not to be sneezed at. The place was said to be so unstable, its people so rootless, its varieties of behavior so taxing to the imagination, that nothing would bring the mess under control. As a consequence, California produced an outburst of metaphor and hyperbole unmatched in American rhetoric since the days of Davy Crockett and Paul Bunyan: The land of dreams, the window of the future, the ultimate everything.

title: Soprano Gives Appealing Recital
description: At her debut at Carnegie Recital Hall on Wednesday night, Mura KievmanMager unfurled an ample, billowy soprano, impressive for its size, flexibility and attractive individuality. A good part of Miss KievmanMager's vocal appeal arises from her basic timbre, which recalls the kind of finely spun tone and breathless vulnerability cultivated by such Slavic sopranos as Zinka Milanov and Sena Jurinac.

title: Beer Museum: A Monument to the Brewer's Art on. Long Island
description: On encountering the curator of museum, it's not unusual to search out little hints of obsestion in his charactera brightness around the eyes, a hovering sense of protection toward his exhibits. Walk ing into Ernest Oest's museumsaloon in Port Jefferson, L. I., one could be forgiven for sending a first surreptitious glance at the man's belly. Where else could there be immediate evidence of the dedication of the best part of 44 years to the draining experience of building up a museum called Memories of Beer and Brewing? A museum that has more than 5,000 domestic beer cans (no two alike) lining the long wall from floor to ceiling. That has a quartermillion beer labels lovingly installed in hundreds of books to protect them from decay. That has hundreds of trays, toasters, steins, ashtrays, bottle openers, caps and sundry items of beer memorabilia.

title: Landscapes in Stone...
description: With imagination and flair, a number of rock garden enthusiasts are creating miniature landscape's in stone containers they Make themselves: A true art form, the results are an endless delight.

title: Screening Planned On Speech, Hearing
description: MONTCLAIR In recognition of National Speech and Hearing Month, the Department of Communication Sciences and Disorders at Montclair State College will conduct a free speech and hearing screening program on Wednesday and Thursday.

title: The Golf Clinic
description: For the weekend golfer the search for a good swing is as frustrating as the quest for a hangover cure. Some players must spend the equivalent of the Gross National Product on lessons end instruction literature. Some desperately wander from one professional to another, as, a hypochondriac shops for doctors.

title: Future Social Events
description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: The Extraordinary Achievement of Arthur Mitchell
description: In the past, white dance companies, generally speaking, have been prejudiced against black dancers. I have never completely understood why, and on a number of occasions I have written about this prejudice. Contrary to a view recently expressed in these pages, I suspect the prejudice has nothing to do with the black physique, but probably did have something to do with the lack of early training once commonly encountered among black dancers. Get a wellproportioned kid of any race early enough, give him or her firstclass training, and you will probably produce, providing the child wants to learn, an acceptable dancer. That is all there is to it. So please let us have no more journalistic balderdash about whether the black body is or is not a suitable instrument for classic dancing. It is suitableand Arthur Mitchell's Dance Theater of Harlem is hereandnow living proof of it.

title: Molly Mullett
description: Molly Mullett's father had wanted a son. He is given to remarks like, I do not need a sneezley, wheezley, sniveling girl. Mrs. Mullett, a meek lady, sighs.

title: T. J. McHugh Weds Jennifer Holloway.
description: Jennifer Holloway and Thomas Joseph McHugh, who are employed by Klopman Mills at Burlington Industries, were married yesterday afternoon in the Roman Catholic Church of the Ressurrection in Rye, N.Y.

title: Imaginative LandUse Measure Gains in Trenton
description: TRENTON  Legislation embracing an imaginative planning and zoning system for municipalities was approved by the Assembly last week. The measure, which is scheduled for an early vote in the Senate, has bipartisan support, including that of the Byrne administration. If adopted, it would put New Jersey in the forefront of landuse planning.

title: ADOPTEES PLEASED MEETING PARENTS
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 10A psychiatrist who is studying first  time reunions between adults who were adopted as infants and their natural parents reports that most of the meetings were positive, enriching experiences.

title: Unofficially, Israel Is Debating What to Do
description: JERUSALEMIn the seven weeks since Henry Kissinger's Middle East shuttle ground to an unsuccessful halt, the United States and Israel have engaged in a diplomatic tugofwar over whether Jerusalem should come up with new ideas to get the negotiations started again.

title: U.S. Junior Team To Ride in Canada
description: The American Horse Shows Association has accepted an invitation from Canada to send a team to the junior international jumping compelition at the end of the sumHorse mer.

title: Staub's Homer One of Only Five Hits
description: Just before the start of yesterday's game with the Cincinnati Reds at Shea Stadium, Manager Yogi Berra complained that his Mets were finding it difficult to bunch their hits. Yesterday afternoon, they found it difficult even to make them.

title: 2,350 at Eglin
description: EGLIN AIR FORCE BASE, Fla., May 10 (UPI)The arrival today of 460 South Vietnamese holstered the population at Eglin's tent city refugee center to 2,350, just 150 shy of the camp's 2,500 limit. Base officials said that another planeload of 125 refugees, perhaps the last such flight here, would arrive soon.

title: FORD LOSING BID TO CAP U.S. PAY
description: WASHINGTON, May 10President Ford is quietly losing another multibillion dollar fiscal squabble with Congress involving his latest attempt to hold down pay rises for Federal employes.

title: Quick Turnaround Riding on Rebates
description: WASHINGTONWhat has been called by far the largest stimulus to which the economy has ever been subjected in a short period got under way last week as the Treasury began mailing out taxrebate checks on 1974 personal income tax and employers began adjusting to reduced withholding tax schedules for 1975 income.

title: Television This Week
description: OF SPECIAL INTEREST

title: Robert J. Barrett 3d Is Fiance Of Susan Hopkins Vander Poel
description: Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Farnsworth Vander Poel of Oyster Bay, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Susan Hopkins Vander Poel, to Robert James Barrett 3d, son of Dr. and Mrs. Barrett Jr. of Bangor, Me. A July wedding is planned.

title: Aeros Triumph, Lead Series, 20
description: QUEBEC, May 10 (AP.)A powerplay by Frank Hughes 13 seconds into the second, period snapped a scoreless tie, and the Houston Astros went on to post a 20 playoff victory over the Quebec Nordiques tinght. The victory brought the Aeros within one game of winning their second straight World Hockey Association championship.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: AFTER 18 HOLES OF GOLF: Richard M. Nixon as he greeted one of the people who came to see him playing a round of golf Thursday at the Shorecliffs course in San Clemente, Calif. It was his first prolonged public appearance since he left the White House. With him is Lieut. Col. Jack Brennan, his former military aide.

title: John Ekdahl Marries Mary McCarthy
description: The Roman Catholic Church of the Nativity in Fair Haven, N. J., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Mary Lynne McCarthy and John Edward Ekdahl. The nuptial mass was concelebrated by the Rev. Harry J. Sievers, a cousin of the bride, and the Rev. Joseph McEvoy.

title: Timepiece Exhibit Is Set in Millburn
description: MILLBURNWhat may be one of the most diverse collections of timepieces ever exhibited in New Jersey will be on view at S. Marsh & Sons for one week, beginning Wednesday.

title: Anthony, Bowling Victor
description: DAYTON, Ohio May 10 (UPI)  Betty Morris and Earl Anthony, 1974 bowlers of the year, combined today to defeat Ed Ressler Jr. and Judy Soutar, 475461, and take the pro mixed doubles title in the National Bowling Council's first spectacular here. Anthony had seven consecutive strikes in a 258 game. Miss Morris, who celebrated her 27th birthday today bowled 217.

title: He Bought a Building, and Surprises
description: At 36, Kenneth R. Murphy, who works by day in the electromechanical engineering department of the Grumman Corporation, is a homeowner, a housing consultant and, lately, a real estate investor and landlord.

title: Trading Daily Commute For 40,000Mile Sail
description: NORTHPORTOn June 22 Peter Tomlinson sets sall from here on what he expects to be a threeto fiveyear, 40,000  mile odyssey around the world.

title: The Theater: The $ Value of Man
description: Robert Wilson's latest theatrical extravaganza, The $ Value of Man, arrived at the Brooklyn Academy of Music in the Lepercq Space Friday night, and in many respects it proved to be more extravaganza than theatrical.

title: Suspicious Fire Kills a Mother And 5 of Her Children in Jersey
description: A mother and five of her 11 children died early yesterday in a fire in a threestory frame dwelling in a rundown section of Newark's South Side that authorities suspect was arson. The fire started on the real porch high up between the second and third floors and could only have been set by hand, said a member of the Newark Fire Department's arson squad, There was nothing in flammable on the porch itself.

title: EXHIBIT RELATES CASTRO'S UPRISING
description: HAVANA, May 10 (Reuters) A broken pipe, old rifles and hastily scribbled notes are the jewels of Havana's Revolution Museum.

title: CRUMB, THE TONE POET
description: Although there are dissenting voices, leading music critics as well as ordinary music listeners have been lining up behind George Crumb with rare show of agreement during the last few years. The American composer's recent works, such as Ancient Voices of Children and the Makrokosmos series for amplified piano, have been greeted in rhapsodic terms not often applied to modern music. To Eric Salzman, writing in Stereo Review. Crumb's works add up to some of the most poetic and atmospheric music written in this century. The New Yorker's Andrew Porter was bowled over, like just about everyone else. Alan Rich confessed in New York magazine, after hearing Pierre Boulez lead the New York Philharmonic Ancient Voices: I'm not sure mere words on paper can explain why Crumb's music makes sense; but it remains for me as powerful and moving contemporary creation as I know. Over and over, in comments on the music, a few significant words keep turning up: poetic, atmospheric, mysterious, evocative. Harold C. Schonberg summed it up The Times: In recent years George Crumb has been talked about, and praised, more than any other composer of the American avantgarde. Although Crumb takes the stance of mystical poet rather than scientist, he has become a pivotal influence in American musical development during a period when scienceor at least the apparatus of sciencehas lorded it over art and intimidated many artists.

title: New Rules, Harsh Life In Bananas
description: The banana may be one of the blandest, safest and most nutritious foods available, but it has always been the toughest to bring to market.

title: LAOTIAN STRIVES TO SAVE COALITION
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, May 10Prince Souvanna Phouma, the Premier, worked desperately today to stave off the collapse of Laos's fragile coalition Government after a series of Cabinet resignations brought to climax a week of renewed military conflict, demonstrations and political assassinations.

title: The Nation
description: Bribes, kickbacks and gifts worth millions of dollars have been for years part of the accepted overhead of American corporations in getting business overseas, a New York Times investigation has disclosed.

title: Letters to The Editor.
Sunday Observer
description: There may be a good argument for capital punishment, which the Supreme Court will articulate for us when it decides the North Carolina case later this term. If so, we ought to stop killing criminals furtively, as though it were something we were ashamed of, and do it out in the open.

title: HANOI ROLE IN ASIA IS HELD ENHANCED
description: North Vietnam has emerged as the primary military power in Southeast Asia, according to United States military analysts. The old balance of power, which rested on Americanarmed South Vietnam, has faded.

title: Troupe Gives Its Dancers Pride in Black Heritage
description: MORRISTOWN  The drums' beat IS soft at first, then faster and louder. A graceful figure rises, leaps and twirls, followed by another and another. Clad in brief, vivid costumes, the dancers weave past one another in intricate patterns.

title: So Far, Venezuela's Wealth Means Little to the Poor
description: CARACASThe slums of brick and tin still ring Caracas. The majority of this nation's 12million people live in conditions that belie the image of a major oilproducing nation with a national budget of over $10billion and greater international cash reserves than any of its Latin American neighbors.

title: Tomahawks Win, 1613
description: BOSTON, May 10  Ted Greves scored four goals and added one assist tonight to lead the Long Island Tomahawks to a 1613 victory over the Boston Bolts in a National Lacrosse League game at Boston Garden.

title: Jobless Pay System Assayed
description: TRENTONNew Jersey is borrowing from the Federal Government in order to provide unemployment benefits for its more than 380,000 jobless, and this growing indebtedness, a top state official contends, could lead to even fewer jobs in the future.

title: A Month With Morn In Eire
description: ONCE upon a time, in a laughingly unguarded moment, I said to Maggie Doyle Kelly, Ah, some day will take you home to Ireland. My 76yearold mother's reply was swift and to the point: When?

title: Ah, It's Sweet Mystery Time
description: The runaway contessa, Marietta D'Altena, has been locked in the ballroom of the Jeunesse d'Oree Club by the charming villain who plans to marry her by force. From the street below, she hears the voice of that handsome American soldier, Captain Dick Warrington, singing the melody that has haunted herAh, sweet mystery of life at last I've found thee. ... Marietta's face lights up as she triumphantly answers the refrainhe has sung my song! and I know at last the answer, it is love, loveand she joins Captain Dick in a longawaited embrace. The effect is irresistibleVictor Herbert's enchanting score for Naughty Marietta can still cast a romantic spell, and audiences at the Light Opera of Manhattan's revival of the classic comic opera this month at the Jan Hus Playhouse are once again discovering its oldfashioned theatrical magic.

title: Chile Shaken By Big Quake
description: SANTIAGO, Chile (AP)  A major earthquake struck Chile's southern agricultural region today, destroying some homes and causing damage to a hospital, but no deaths or serious injuries were reported.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: TOKYO, May 10 (AP)Queen Elizabeth II of Britain traveled to Osaka and Kyoto today to visit ancient temples and eat a Japanesestyle dinner. She and Prince Philip were to have traveled on the highspeed express train from Tokyo but had to fly to Osaka because of a transport strike. Then they drove to Kyoto, Japan's old capital.

title: Music: New Structures
description: The New Structures Ensemble probably did not plan it that way, but the program it brought in for a concert at Carnegie Recital Hall yesterday afternoon seemed calculated to grate unceasingly on the listener's nervous system.

title: Penn Trackmen Take Heps Title
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., May 10Led by a dominant group of sprinters and hurdlers, Pennsylvania gained its fifth consecutive team championship today at the 41st annual Heptagonal track and field meet. The Quakers scored 71 points, 20 more than Navy, the runnerup.

title: Peace at Home, Too?
description: The defeat of American policy in Indochina has produced, at least for now, not recrimination but a show of unity on foreign affairs between President Ford and the Democratic leaders in Congress. Together, they are sig nailing foreign nations a message that might loosely be translated as: Though everything has changed, everything remains the same.

title: Refugees Welcome Back, Saigon Tells Singapore
description: SINGAPORE, May 10 (Reuters) Singapore was asked today by the Government of South Vietnam to help any Vietnamese refugees here who wish to return home.

title: ART VIEW
description: The name of the British sculptor Anthony Caro now stands so high in the firmament of artistic reputations that we should not be surprised, I suppose, to find that the exhibition of his work currently installed at the Museum of Modern Art has been conceived less as an occasion to catch up on the progress of a living and still fallible artist than as an event calling for our unconditional esthetic surrender. It is no secret, of course, that the 50yearold Mr. Caro has been for some yearsat least since the death of David Smith in 1965the nominee of Clement Greenberg and the critical establishment over which his ideas preside for the post of Greatest Living Sculptor, and the museum has approached the task of presenting us with what It mistakenly calls a retrospective more or less in the spirit of this judgment.

title: Queen Elizabeth in Kyoto
2 GIRLS, 16, RAPED AND BURNED
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 10 (AP)The police arrested one man today and are seeking another on charges that they raped two 16yearold girls and then set them on fire.

title: Italy Has Payments Surplus
description: ROME, May 10 (Reuters)Italy had a surplus in her balance of payments in March for the first time since August, 1974, according to provisional figures released by the Bank of Italy today. The surplus was $10.1million.

title: Dining Out in Jersey
description: ** Tuckahoe Inn, Beesley's Point, Route 9, near Marmora. (609) 302244.

title: Air Strike in Iceland
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, May 10 (Reuters)  Icelandic airline stewardesses went on strike today, cuting the only passenger link between Iceland and the rest of the world.

title: Home Clinic
description: Q: My ranch type house has green asphalt roof shingles that are now about 21 years old and still in relatively good condition. I would like to maintain these so as to prolong their life by another 5 or 6 years and so plan to paint them with a protective coating. I have heard that colored aluminum paint has the advantage of keeping the roof cool in the summer, but that it causes asphalt shingles to dry out and curl along the edges; but they tell me a latex paint, will not cause curling. What do you suggest?H.S., Paterson, N.J.

title: Diocese Building Own Think Tank
description: After an onagain offagain existence dating from 1968, a new Diocesan Pastoral Council in the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn, which also covers Queens, has nearly reached the end of an agonizing 12month first phase of organization with the help of management consultants.

title: Fresh Rocky Mountain Trout That Isn't Fresh or From Rockies
description: DENVERSomething fishy is going on here. It concerns fresh Rocky Mountain trout.

title: More Classical Music on Radio
description: There were a number of omissions in the Radio Guide to Classical Music, published on this page on April 27. Since the purpose of that chart was to indicate available substitutes for the defunct WNCN, only programs with a minimum of talk were included.

title: MARKETS IN REVIEW
description: Prices on the New York Stock Exchange moved in narrow range throughout most of the week and finished slightly higher in continued active trading.

title: The Music Festivals Of Europe, 1975
description: In progress to May 26

title: Hilltop Rites to Mark Union of Churches
description: HACKETTSTOWN  An experimental joint parish formed by four Protestant denominations, and known as the Panther Valley Ecumenical Ministry, will hold an outdoor Holy Communion service today on the fiveacre site of its future house of worship. The site, on Route 517 in nearby Allamuchy Township, is just south of the Panther Valley Mall.

title: The World
description: Disagreement over the allocation of political power in a new Government for Cyprus remains the principal hindrance to a settlement there. Turkish Cypriotes, though a minority of the population, control 40 per cent of the land and 70 per cent of the economic resources, and 40,000 Turkish troops dominate the island militarily.

title: Catfish Hunter of His Day
description: When Bob Feller was the Catfish Hunter of his day, his father warned Kenesaw Mountain Landis that if he made the boy a free agent the Fellers would sue him. Either for that reason or for some other, the baseball commissioner let the Cleveland Indians keep the kid, although there was no doubt that they had violated baseball law in signing him. Unlike Hunter, who sold himself to the Yankees for $3.75million, Feller was delighted to stay with the Indians, whose general manager, Cy Slapnicka, had promised him $75 a month to pitch for the farm club in Fargo, N.D., with $500 extra if he made good, and had given him an autographed ball the pitchers had used in batting practice until the signatures were almost illegible. Financial standards in Van Meter, Iowa, in 1936, differed from those in Hertford, N.C., in 1974.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Mrs. R.M. Boyles Has ??
description: A son was horn April 23 to Mr. and Mrs. Robert M. Boyles of New York at the Lenox Hill Hospital. The child has been named Scott Harmon. Mrs. Boyles, as Jill Harmon, is a stage and television actress; Mr. Boyles is a vice president of Bankers Trust here.

title: Parade Here Backs Efforts by Chavez To Unionize Farms
description: In a parade signalling the end of National Farm Workers Week, more than 5,000 supporters of the United Farm Workers marched down Seventh Avenue from 59th Street yesterday for a rally in Union Square.

title: Miss Reighley, Richard Thune Have Nuptials
description: St. Aloysius Roman Catholic Church in New Canaan, Conn., was the setting yesterday for the marriage of Lindsey Anne Reighley, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Ward Reighley of New Canaan and Nantucket, Mass., to Richard Mason Thune, son of Mrs. Walter Norman Thune of Westport, Conn., and the late Mr. Thune.

title: New Novel
description: Curiously enough, the world events that have overtaken Loyd Little's finely balanced satire have only sharpened its point. The novel's stage is the Vietnam war in 1964, and in one remote corner of the fluid battleground the author creates a microcosm of its contradictions and ironies. The fortunes of a sixman Special Forces team stationed in the delta village of Nan Phuc continually waver between farce and tears. Officially, the detachment is nonexistent, a snafu at Saigon having listed team 34A as being shipped home to Fort Bragg.

title: Ruffian Wins Acorn for 8th Straight
description: Ruffian strengthened her status as the current wonder of the thoroughbred racing world by winning the $56,100 Acorn Stakes yesterday at Aqueduct. The Kentucky homebred tiny, owned by Mr. and Mrs. Stuart Janney's Locust Hill Farm, sped to success by 8 lengths over Somethingregal in the onemile test for 3yearolds with Gallant Trial next in the field of seven.

title: Dodgers Down Pirates, 62, On 3Run Homer by Paciorek
description: PITTSBURGH, May 10 (AP) Tom Paciorek, a fastminute starter for Los Angeles, belted a threerun homer today that carried the Dodgers to a 62 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates.

title: Mortgages: Reluctant Lenders
description: Almost everyone who has been watching the record savings inflows to savings institutions these past six months, and expecting most of the new money to be Available for home mortgages and real estate loans, has been stunned.

title: Wood, Field & Stream
description: BLOSSBURG, Pa.Sailing down an aisle of ghostly trees in the predawn gloom, a large owl passed over our heads.

title: Small, perfect, oldfashioned, newfangled
description: The Little Hotel is a small, daringly perfect novel from which all excess has been elideda method not usually associated either with its author or our century. Christina Stead is best known here for The Man Who Loved Children, a book which rocks on the torrential conversation of its hero. Her huge tale of a Paris bankinghouse, the recently reprinted House of All Nations, accumulates in telegraphic sentences, like one enormous financial communique. In her other hooks the style is clear 19thcentury England, as a gifted Australian might still hear it sounding across the waters to a broader continentrambling but precise, baroque with ideas but never obscure in the expression of them, and never mincing into the wrong poetry. Yet in all her work them are two alternative voices, the one a cataract carrying everything before or, as some think, a massive garrulitythe other witty, tender or caustic in the small way, shyly interpolated, even exquisite. This latest novel, brief as it is, raises the same questions as the big ones. And the same answers. Why is Stead's originality so hard to define? Because there's so much of it. Does her strange blend of outmoded interest in character and avantgarde sensibility have anything to say to the doctrinaire American novel?

title: Theater Benefits
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: FollowUp on The News
description: Irate consumers sometimes tell of being ripped off by improperly programed business computers. Jerry Schneider reversed the process five years ago.

title: State Charter Revision Panel Split on Collective Bargaining
description: Although the State Charter Revision Commission for New York City began hearings on its recommendations last week, its work is snagged because there is no consensus yet among the 12 members on the thorny issue of collective bargaining for city employes.

title: Miss Williams, P. J. Coutrakon Wed in Jersey
description: The First Presbyterian Church in New Vernon, N.J., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of JoAnne Will'ams, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Philip Williams of New Vernon, to Peter James Coutrakon, son of Judge and Mrs. Basil Hatton Coutrakon of Springfield, Ill.

title: One Danger of Nuclear Progress: Nuclear Waste
description: New technologies have a way of generating new kinds of garbage which, in hindsight, often turn out to be harder to dispose of than most people dared imagine. The maxim holds true for automobiles and plastic bottles, and lately the embattled nuclear industry has provided vet another example.

title: Alice Gerster Fiancee of a Lawyer
description: Alice Fox Gerster, an economist with the Chemical Bank, and James Harrington Breed, a lawyer with Dunnington, Bartholow & Miller, plan to be married this summer.

title: C.I.A. Covert Activities Abroad Shielded by Major U.S. Companies
description: WASHINGTON, May 10The Central Intelligence Agency's use of the Howard R. Hughes organization to disguise its recovery of a sunken Soviet submarine is but the most recent example of a longstanding practice in which dozens, perhaps scores, of American companies have lent their names and reputationsusually for a priceto shield covert C.I.A. activities abroad.

title: Victor Canzano Dies at 63; ExOfficer of Textile Union
description: Victor J. Canzano, an arbitrator in labor disputes for the American Arbitration Association and former vice president of the Textile Workers Union of America, died Friday of a heart attack in Warwick, R. I. He was 63 years old and lived in Westerly, R. I.

title: CHESS
description: Viktor Korchnoi failed dismally in the 24th and last game of his final candidate's match for the world championship with Anatoly Karpovhe needed a victory to tic the series, but he never came close to it. Indeed, at the point when he offered the draw which conceded the match, he was in a lost position with a pawn down.

title: Marriage Announcement 1  No Title
description: Engagements

title: ExC.I.A. Official Denies Role In Overthrow of Chile's Leader
description: WASHINGTON, May 10A former Central Intelligence Agency official who had directed the C.I.A.'s LatinAmerican operations for the last two years said today that the agen cy played no role in the overthrow of President Salvador Allende Gossens of Chile, which he characterized as a tragic event.

title: The Years of MacArthur
description: A remote and regal figure, Douglas MacArthur has fascinated Americans for more than 50 years. Since he burst upon the public consciousness as flamboyant, deathdefying brigadier general in 1918, he has inspired affection and awe as well as distrust and doubt. An autocrat out of the feudal military tradition, he seemed somewhat out of place in the 20th century, and he provoked mingled emotions among his countrymen who were steeped in the citizensoldier heritage. Lacking the common touch, MacArthur was godlike; middle initial in his name would be as blasphemous as Jesus H. Christ.

title: Emily Hoskins Gawthrop Is Bride
description: Emily Hoskins Gawthrop and Richard B. Klarberg, both of New York, were married yesterday afternoon in West Chester, Pa. Superior Court Judge Theodore O. Rogers performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents. The Rev. Kenneth L. Slagle, an Episcopal priest, offered the benediction.

title: Harriman Leaves Moscow
description: MOSCOW, May 10 (Reuters) W. Amen Harriman, the United States Ambassador to the Soviet Union during World War II, left for London today after participation in celebrations of the 30th anniversary of the defeat of Nazi Germany. During his stay, the former Governor of New York had talks with Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin.

title: An Institution as French as Pot au Feu
description: If you try to buy a package of cigarettes on a Sunday morning in Paris, you may find the nearest tobacco shop surprisingly overcrowded. If it's one of the city's many P.M.U.'s, the French equivalent of an offtrack betting parlor, a throng of Parisians will be there to play the tiered, or a big triple, one of the main reasons horse racing maintains such a feverish interest with millions of Frenchmen and women and tourists as well.

title: U.D.C.'s Eligibility Rules Keep Apartments Vacant
description: Each week, hundreds of potential tenants call the Urban Development Corporation and the rental offices in its 72 developments around the state, hoping to rent apartments.

title: Article 1  No Title
THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: WASHINGTONA visit to the seat of Government in recent days for briefings on the state of the economy and a closeup view of how the nation's policymakers are trying to cope with various issues has been a rather disconcerting experience. it nas tenned to confirm the impression that one held from a distancethat is, that the economy is still in mess and there's no convincing evidence as yet that the right prescription has been written here to aid its return to health.

title: TorontoTexas Route Set
description: LOS ANGELES, May 10 (Reuters)Air Canada said Thurs day it would start daily nonstop service between Houston and DallasFort Worth and Toronto on July 1.

title: Paperbacks
description: ALIVE, by Piers Paul Read. (Avon, $1.95.) A stark and starkly told story of human survival in extremis, about the Uruguayan rugby players whose plane crashed in the Andes.

title: Unveilings
description: GOLDREYERStella Unveiling of monument on May 18, 2 P.M. at Bayside Cemetery, 80.35 Pitkin Avenue, Ozone Park, rain or shine. EDT

title: Landlords
description: A major landlord group has begun court suits to force swifter city action on backlogged rentincrease applications submitted by owners who had made major improvements in 60 Brooklyn, and Queens buildings containing rentcontrolled apartments.

title: Gardens On the Campus
description: Haverford College is small, Quaker college for men in the Philadelphia suburbs. It has been blessed with land. Fifty years ago, much of it was farmed. There were dairy cows and a piggery. Today the farm is gone, there are new buildings, playing fields, lawns and a community vegetable garden.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2.

title: Columbia Will Drop Subsidy For The Forum After June 30
description: The Columbia Forum, a quarterly magazine sponsored by Columbia University since 1957, is seeking a new publisher, after having been informed by the university's president, Dr. William J. McGill, that he could not justify continuance of The Forum after June 30.

title: Sparks, Rock Band Known From Disks, R as Another Side
description: As rock grows more complex, studio bands become ever more frequentgroups that produce extraordinarily tricky records based on painstaking overdubbing and production effects. But these groups then find it hard to duplicate such sounds (except through the augmentation of tape recordings, which is really cheating) in live performance.

title: Clear Style Shown By French Pianist
description: Frangoise Parrot, a young French pianist who made her New York debut with an all  Debussy program last Sunday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, took a while toloosen up but when she did her playing exuded exceptional talent. Early in the recital, in L'Ile Joyeuse and Images, Book I, her performances were fluent, in a bright and clear style that sometimes made her tone seem hard and her phrasing rushed. Cool efficiency, one would have said, was Miss Parrot's forte.

title: Computers Ferreting Out Causes of Traffic Accidents
description: HACKENSACK  Although there is a difference of opinion as to whether the state's new computerized system for keeping track of highway accidents has simplified record keeping, officials involved in the daytoday operation report that it is now easier to piece together a picture of New Jersey's traffic problems.

title: Bonus Baby in the Executive Suite
A World Council of Churches Founder Says the Ecumenical Movement Is Still Viable as a Religious Force
description: When the World Council of Churches was founded in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, in 1948, it counted 147 member denominations, most of them Protestant, white American and white European.

title: To SpanishSpeaking In Chicago, Numbers Don't Mean Strength
description: CHICAGO, May 10The Mexican and Puerto Rican populations are Chicago's most rapidly growing ethnic groups, and each year this city, like many other large urban centers across the nation, shows more signs of their presence.

title: Free Park Concert Set By Jefferson Starship
