description: LAGOS, Nigeria. May 11Nigeria has cut back production of crude oil by almost a quarter since last November. The latest monthly production reports show that Nigerian production is about 1.7 million barrels day compared with its peak last year of 2.3 million barrels.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: G. M. to Offer Smallest American Car Next Fall
description: DETROIT, May 11Next fall a new little Chevrolet minicar, the first American subsubcompact automobile, will be built and sold in the United States. Smaller than existing American subcompacts such as Chevrolet's Vega and Ford's Pinto, it will be in the class of the smaller and more efficient foreign carsthe Honda, Fiat, Datsun and Volkswagen.

title: MARKET PROCEEDS WITH ISRAELI PACT
description: BRUSSELS, May 11  The European Common Market signed a trade treaty with Israel today despite a lastminute Arab demand for a delay until similar accords could be negotiated with three Arab countries, Algeria, Morocco and Tunisia.

title: Illinois Oil Spill Fought
description: MEREDOSIA, Ill., May 11 (UPI)Coast Guard and Texaco personnel, using small boats, laid chemicals, straw and other absorbent materials on 40mile stretch of Illinois River banks today to clean a major oil spill from a ruptured pipeline. High water and strong currents resulting from heavy rains foiled attempts to rig boom across the riverthe usual procedure in efforts to contain oil slicks.

title: Aide Says Senator Hruska Will Not Seek Reelection
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 (AP) Senator Roman L. Hruska, Republican of Nebraska, 70 years old, has said that he will not seek reelection when his term expires in 1977, an aide to the Senator said today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The New York Society for Ethical Culture has named Criminal Court Judge Bruce McM. Wright the recipient its annual Ethical Humanist Award. The award, intended honor an individual who has performed an extraordinary act of moral courage, fully aware of the potential cost his or her own life or career, singled out Judge Wright for his controversial practice of setting low hail in major criminal cases involving defendants with criminal records. The award to Judge Wright cites his moral courage in the vigorous application of constitutional principles in pursuit of equal justice under the law.

title: Parade Marks Israel's Founding
description: The bands blared Sholem Aleichem (peace unto you) and Hava Nigela (let us be happy) as 75,000 men, women and children marched up Fifth Avenue yesterday celebrating Israel's 27th anniversary as nation.

title: CARRIER ARRIVES IN GUAM BRINGING SAIGON AIRCRAFT
description: APRA HARBOR, Guam, Mon day, May 12The aircraft carrier Midway arrived today to unload a controversial cargo of 99 repossessed South Vietnamese military aircraft. Meanwhile, the curtailment of refugee flights to the United States continued.

title: Laotians Told by Premier Of Major Changes Soon
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, May 11The Laotian capital, braced for disturbances after a week of political and military upheavals, passed a quiet but tense Constitution Day today.

title: Meryl Spring Married Here
description: Meryl Jane Spring, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Spring of New York, was married here at noon yesterday to Michael David Mann, son of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Mann of Hewlett, L.I., and North Miami Beach, Fla.

title: Philadelphia Fete Hails 1775 Congress
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 11This city's gigantic Bicentennial festival, The American Way, was conducted under cloudless skies in balmy spring weather today, with the result that predictions of crowds up to one million appeared to have been met or exceeded.

title: Islanders Tie Series
description: In the Stanley Cup playoffs the Islanders yesterday defeated the Philadelphia Flyers, 21, at Nassau Coliseum to tie the semifinal series at 33 and set up a deciding game tomorrow night in Philadelphia.

title: Fords' Mother's Day Quiet
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 (AP) President and Mrs. Ford returned to Washington by helicopter tonight after relaxing at Camp David, the Presidential retreat in Maryland. Mr. Ford gave his wife Betty, some clothing as a Mother's Day gift and spent a quiet day swimming and playing tennis.

title: Get Out of Town
description: WASHINGTONWhat if every man, woman and child who lived on Manhattan Island were told: Get out of town. Today, on pain of death. No excuses. Start walking and don't stop until you get to farmland upstate or in Pennsylvania. When you get there, if you do, you're on your own.

title: West Berliner Accuses East Berlin in Drowning
description: BERLIN, May 11 (Reuters) The Mayor of West Berlin accused East German authorities tonight of inhumanity after a 5yearold Turkish boy drowned in the River Spree within East German territory.

title: Bonnefous in Dazzling Bugaltu With Miss Farrell at City Ballet
description: One of the first roles in the New York City Ballet's repertory for which JeanPierre Bonnefous displayed a special affinity was the male lead in Bugaku. He has continued to perform it with distinction, and Saturday evening partnered Suzanne Farrell in a lovely performance at the New York State Theater.

title: State of the City: Fiscal Shock
description: New Yorkers, have been subjected during the past half year to a series of fiscal shocks that must convince even the most cynical citizen that this time the crisis is real. Within weeks, the city faces the grim possibility that it will not be able to raise the cash needed to meet its immediate obligations. In answer to recent appeals Washington, Secretary of the Treasury Simon said flatly that the solution to the city's financial problems does not lie at the Federal level.

title: Blue Takes 7th, Beating Yankees, 75
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 11 Catfish Hunter proved a tough act for the New York Yankees to follow today. With their prosperous prodigal watching from the dugout, they were mauled for six runs in the third inning and never fully recovered as the Oakland's A's swept to a 75 victory.

title: About the Mets ...
description: Tom Seaver made a conspicuous start in yesterday's game, giving up a homer and a double to the first two Reds, Pete Rose and Ken Griffey. Manager Yogi Berra offered a possible reason for the start. Maybe the delay swearing in the WACS hurt him, Yogi said, referring to a ceremony in which five women were inducted into the Army reserve. He had warmed up and he was waiting in the dugout. Seaver, though, dismissed that excuse and said he didn't know why he had the early trouble. ... Rose who hasn't made an error in eight games at third base, made a diving stop of Jerry Grote's grounder and threw him out. ... Johnny Bench, who struck out his first two times at bat, resorted to bunting his third time up, but Seaver threw him out.

title: BERNADETTE PETERS SINGS WITH ENERGY
description: Bernadette Peters has the kind of voice that can be a disaster or a distinctiona voice that is both high and husky, delivered with a ragged squeak that sometimes has the effect of a nail scratched across glass and with a regional touch that is incontrovertibly New York.

title: Floating Dormitory About to Be Scuttled
description: HOBOKEN, May 7Despite her age, the 14,893ton S.S. Stevens, the country's only floating dormitory, has successfully spanned the generation gap, only to face the scrap heap.

title: 12.000 Michigan Acres Burn
description: GRAYLING, Mich., May 11 (AP)More than 12,000 acres of land were destroyed during the weekend as the worst forest fires in seven years scorched northern part of Michigan's Lower Peninsula.

title: Bullets Move to Final, Ousting Celtics, 9892
description: LANDOVER, Md., May 11  The Washington Bullets beat the Celtics in every phase of the game today and ended Boston's reign as the National Basketball Association champion 364 days after it began in Milwaukee.

title: Europe's Answer to Traffic Jams: Mass Transit Boom
description: Seventyfive feet under the heart of Paris a complex tunneling project will link three sections of a fiveyearold regional rail express network that already carries twice as many commuters as the Long Island Rail Road.

title: Paddle Boats in Central Park Debut
description: For decades New Yorkers have been pedaling hikes around the Central Park lake. Now they ran pedal right across with the park's latest item for recreation this spring: six shiny yellow paddle boats.

title: BULLDOZER, AMOK, TEARS UP TRACKS
description: A driverless bulldozer rumbled through the Coney Island subway yards last night and damaged 50 feet of track, disrupting service on the BMT N line, the Transit Authority police reported.

title: ARTHUR LEHMEIER
description: Arthur Lehmeicr, a former vice president of the Detecto Scales Corporation and later Eastern sales manager for BorgErickson Corporaticn, scale manufacturers, died Saturday at the Veterans Administration Hospital, the Bronx. He was 85 years old and lived in Cortland. N.Y.

title: Impasse at African Parley Hurts ArabBlack Accord
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, May 11Attempts to promote cooperation between the Arab and black African nations sharing this continent suffered a severe setback last week when delegates of 37 nations attending the 11th annual meeting of the African Development Bank failed to elect a new president for the next three years.

title: Harold Kaese, Columnist, Wrote Books on Baseball
description: BOSTON, May 11 (UPI) Harold Kaese, who retired in 1973 as sports columnist and writer for The Boston Globe, died yesterday in Massachusetts General Hospital. He was 66 years old.

title: Mets Top Reds, End Slump
description: That Pete Rose might have been safe at home plate didn't tarnish the Mets' most stirring defensive play of the season. That they made the eighthinning play and that Umpire John Kibler called Rose out were sufficient to help the Mets beat the Cincinnati Reds, 32, yesterday and snap their sixgame losing streak.

title: Cancer Center Dedicated
description: BOSTON, May 11 (AP)Massachusetts General Hospital dedicated today its Cox Center, an eightstory facility in which the hospital will concentrate most of its cancer therapy and research.

title: Princeton Gathering Makes Detailed Assessment of Problems in Establishing a Colony of 10,000 in Space
description: The most detailed assessment to date of the engineering, medical, dietary, agricultural and political problems in establishing a colony in space was carried out last week at Princeton University.

title: Critics May Delay Federal Plan To Sell Shore Oil Rights in '75
description: LOS ANGELES, May 11 President Nixon's plan for se??ing 10 million acres of offshore oil rights this year is becoming steadily more problematical and could end up with no 1975 leasing at all.

title: Economists' Views Vary On Outlook for Upturn
description: Economists, searching the horizon for signs of a business upturn, are paying particular attention to the housing market and to capital spending and its relation to price inflation. But in both areas the outlook remains murky, and economists are in disagreement on the prospects.

title: Study Finds City Incomes Fell Before Recession
description: Newly available census data indicate that the average income for New York City families started going down well before the current national recession. A new study estimates an 8.3 per cent plunge from a 1970 peak of $10.951 to $10,039 in 1972.

title: BRONX GIRL, 16, DIES IN SUSPICIOUS FIRE
description: A 16yearold Bronx girl died, apparently of smoke inhalation, yesterday despite efforts by Fireman Dennis Smith, the author of Report From Engine Company 82, to revive her.

title: SABOTEURS DERAIL A TRAIN IN ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, May 11Saboteurs derailed an Israeli freight train approaching Jerusalem early today, injuring the engineer and his assistant.

title: Youth Killed in Plunge Off Triborough Bridge
description: A 19yearold youth walking back with friends from a Spanish festival on Randalls Island was fatally injured last night when he vaulted over a low stone wall on the Triborough Bridge unaware that on the other side was 50foot drop to a lower roadway. The youth was identified as Dereck Won of 1875 Third Avenue.

title: Theater: Glorious Age
description: There are two kinds of bad shows: Those at which you wonder what the people on stage have done to deserve it, and those at which you wonder what the people in the audience have done to deserve it. There were times during the interminable brevity of The Glorious Age, which for reasons best known to the producers chose to open at Theater Four last night, when one found oneself wondering what anyone had done to deserve it.

title: Warriors Even Series With Bulls
description: CHICAGO, May 11 (AP)Rick Barry scored 36 points, 12 in the gameturning second quarter, as the Golden State Warriors scored an 8672 victory today over the Chicago Bulls.

title: Overheated Cadillac Wired for Explosion Ties Up a Parkway
description: A motorist who stopped his car on the Grand Central Parkway early yesterday afternoon because it was overheating discovered an explosive device wired to the motor and gasoline tank. The ensuing police investigation stopped traffic for an hour on the Queens thoroughfare.

title: SAIGON ANNOUNCES INTENTION TO HOLD NATIONWIDE VOTE
description: The new rulers of South Vietnam intend to hold nationwide elections and eventually to unify North and South Vietnam, according to delayed news dispatches from Saigon.

title: C.I.A. Deported to Be Easing Use Of Businesses in Spy Activities
description: WASHINGTON, May 11The Central Intelligence Agency is cutting back on the size and number of companies that it owns and has used in past clandestine activities, but it appears to retain the power to revive them if needed, Newsweek magazine said today.

title: RUTH JANEWAY CORDON
description: Ruth Janeway Gordon, a stockbroker with Edwards & Hanly, died Saturday at her home, 205 West 57th Street. Her age was 75.

title: About New York
description: Readers of the novels of Richard Condon may have wondered why his characters often bear the same names even though the settings and periods of the books are different.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Controller Assails Cost of Sabbaticals

title: Sakharovs End Fast
description: MOSCOW, May 11 (AP)The Soviet physicist and human rights campaigner. Andrei P. Sakharov, and his wife, Yelena, today ended a threeday hunger strike to protest official refusal to allow her to go to Italy for treatment of an eye disease. Mrs. Sakharov, a doctor, said that she is going blind from an injury received during World War II.

title: A GUERRILLA WAR FEARED IN KOREA
description: SEOUL, South KoreaThe South Korean analyst sat back with an anxious look and said: Frankly, I am impressed by the sophistication of the training the North Koreans get for a Vietcongtype of war.

title: City University Is Held Lax On Rising Sabbatical Costs
description: The cost of sabbatical leaves granted to City University faculty members has more than doubled in four years, from $2.4million in 1970 to $5.5million in 1974, because of a disproportionate increase in approval of such leaves by the member colleges, the State Controller's office said yesterday.

title: Freedom to Create
description: The United States Register of Copyrights, Barbara A. Ringer, has provided a needed sense of history as Congress considers a revision of the 1909 copyright law that would bring it into the modern era of communications. Our revolutionary forefathers, she has pointed out, actually went so far as to write the concept of copyright protection into the Constitution.

title: MetalPowder Shipments Reported Off 16% in Year
description: Total shipments of metal powders in 1974 fell 16 per cent to 290,760 tons, Kempton H. Roll, executive director of the Metals Powders Industries Federation, announced over the weekend.

title: Big Rise in China Oil Output Foreseen
description: PARIS, May 11Western oil specialists see China developing as one of the world's biggest oilproducing and exporting nations by the end of this decade, and possibly joining the cartel of oil states known as the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries.

title: HIGH COURT BEGINS FINAL RUSH TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, May 11The Supreme Court returns to the bench tomorrow for the homestretch drive of the 197475 term, with nearly half its cases for the year still to be decided.

title: Islanders Subdue Flyers, 21, And Send Series to 7th Game
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., May 11 Successfully walking the tightrope again in their deathdefying act, the New York Islanders defeated the Philadelphia Flyers, 21, today and tied their fourofsevengame National Hockey League semifinal series.

title: MARKET PROCEEDS WITH ISRAELI PACT
description: BRUSSELS, May 11  The European Common Market signed a trade treaty with Israel today despite a lastminute Arab demand for a delay until similar accords could he negotiated with three Arab countries, Algeria, Morocco and Tunisia.

title: Sudzina Captures Yonkers Marathon
description: YONKERS, May 11The temperature was in the low 70's and longdistance runners prefer cooler weather, which accounted for the slow times today in the Yonkers marathon, won by Marty Sudzina in 2 hours 27 minutes 37.2 seconds.

title: Kosygin Off to Libya
description: MOSCOW, May 11 (Reuters) Premier Alcksei N. Kosygin left Moscow today to visit Libva and Tunisia.

title: FLUTIST, GUITARIST, MIME SHARE A BILL
description: Andrew Bolotowsky's program Friday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, his third there in three years, was engagingly lightweight and offbeat. The flutist's partner was Robert Shaughnessy, guitarist and composer, and at the end, Jane Adler, a mime, performed to a sevenpart suite, Cosmic Park. by Mr. Shaughnessy.

title: School Board Group Will Fight Free Books to Private Students
description: TRENTON, May 11The New Jersey State School Boards Association voted yesterday to seek the repeal of a law requiring local school hoards to supply free textbooks to nonnublicschool students.

title: Article 1  No Title
Screen: Lulu the Tool, Italian Drama
Defeated Generals Register
description: SINGAPORE, May 11 (Reuters)Ten generals of the defeated South Vietnamese Army have registered at a Government center in Saigon, the Saigon radio said today.

title: Ashe Victor Over Borg
description: DALLAS, May 11Arthur Ashe, so often taunted as the world champion runnerup, won the first prize today as he took the fifth annual World Championship Tennis title in a businesslike victory over Bjorn Borg of Sweden. 36, 64, 64, 60.

title: Busing Foes in Boston Denounce Final Court Desegregation Plan
description: BOSTON, May 11  A Federal judge's final order for the desegregation of this city's schools drew sharp criticism today from antibusing leaders.

title: Pound Is Worrying Britain, But No Action Is Foreseen
description: LONDON. May 11  The sharply falling value of the pound on the world currency: markets has aroused deep concern in the British Government. but apparently no decision has been made to try to halt the slide.

title: Twin Satellites Delayed
description: CAPE CANAVERAL. Fla., May 11 (UPI)An electrical storm Friday night that may have damaged instruments in Titan 3C rocket scheduled to carry twin military communications satellites has caused postponement of the launching from Tuesday to May 19. Air Force engineers worked today to check out the space vehicle.

title: Portugal's Uphill Path
description: PRINCETON, N.J.On April 25, one year to the day after Europe's oldest dictatorship was overthrown, Portugal elected a constituent assembly. It was not simply the first free election in fifty years. For much of the country it was the first truly free election ever. In a remarkable turnout of 92 per cent, the people voted overwhelmingly for socialism with liberty.

title: Chile Gives Free Rein to Secret Police
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 5After 20 months In power Chile's military junta shows few signs of dismantling the vast apparatus of political rpession created to extirpate the Marxist cancer.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: David Merrick, Doris Cole Abrahams and Robert Colby have completed plans to present Tennessee Williams's latest play, The Red Devil Battery Sign, with Anthony Quinn, Claire Bloom and Katy Jurado. The project, which has been discussed for months on Broadway and in the trade press, will go into rehearsal Wednesday under the direction of Edwin Sherin, with the opening scheduled for Aug. 12 at the Shubert Theater here, following engagements in Boston and Washington.

title: Personal Finance
description: If you are partially responsible for an accident in New York Stateeven if the other driver was more at faultyou cannot collect any damages. That's the law here until Aug. 31.

title: Even in a Refugee Camp, a General Is Still a General
description: CAMP PENDLETON, Calif., May 11The man is short and round, and refugee camp life has not visibly affected his rosycheeked vigor.

title: ...And Don't Travel Very Well, Either
description: Passersby peer through the window of the Cat Cottage with isn'tthatcute? smiles. There are cats snoozing on the tall scratching tree, cats peeking coyly out of feline bungalows and more cats ripping up catnip mice to get high on the contents.

title: SINGAPOREAN SEES LAOS AS RED TARGET
description: WASHINGTON, May 11, (Reuters)  Prime Minister Lee Kuan Yew of Singapore said today that Laos would he the next Communist target in Asia and indicated that he felt the situation there had already gone too far to be reversed.

title: Vesuvius Triumphs In Show Jumping
description: FARMINGTON, Conn., May 11Harmony Farm's Vesuvius, ridden by Alan Severison scored an easy victory in the amateurowned jumper division today ac the concluding session of the Children's Services Horse Show.

title: EndofWar Rally Brings Out 50,000
description: About 50,000 people, including many veterans of 10 years of antiwar marches and rallies in the city, filled the Sheep Meadow in Central Park yesterday for an afternoon's celebration of peace in Vietnam and Cambodia.

title: Bridge:
description: The quality of the field in the Cavendish Club's charity invitation tournament here during the weekend was probably the highest of any pair tournament ever played in New York. Also the highest, without any challenge, were the international match point scores.

title: Supporter Threatens to Sue Coast Study Center on Its Plan to Move
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., May 11Dr. Alexander Comfort, the British gerontologist and author of the bestselling book Joy of Sex, said today that he was instructing his attorneys to take legal action against the Center for the Study of Democratic Institutions following its decision yesterday to dismantle most of its academic programs and relocate much of what remained to Chicago.

title: CREDIT PRESSURES SEEM TO BE EASING
description: The corporate bond market, which has more than $1billion in new offerings on tap this week, appears to have found a fairly comfortable trading range for its wares. The suc cessful sale of the Treasury's debt, package of $5billion last week and hints of a slight easing in credit conditions by the Federal Reserve, as well as the recent slowup in moneysupply growth, all play their part in the current market atmosphere.

title: SCHOLARS IN U.S. TURN FROM INDIA
description: NEW DELHI, May 11India, a nation whose experiment in democracy once served as major source of study on American campuses, is witnessing a rapid decline of interest among teachers and students in the United States.

title: Jerusalem: UNESCO Curb Backfires
description: JERUSALEM  A bumper crop of internationally known artists, writers, musicians, and dancers has been in Israel this spring performing, lecturing, accepting prizes and generally enlivening the cultural scene. The influx is part of a phenomenon the Israelis have dubbed the UNESCO Windfall, Several of the more celebrated visitors have come specifically to demonstrate their opposition to the Arabsponsored resolution adopted at Paris last fall expelling Israel from the activities of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization. If the purpose of that resolution was to isolate Israel culturally, it seems to have backfired.

title: News Summary and Index
description: South Vietnam's new rulers intend to hold nationwide elections and eventually to unify North and South Vietnam, according to delayed news dispatches from Saigonthe first reports of a news conference held Thursday by the military commander of the Saigon area, Lieut. Gen. Tran Van Tra, since the Communist victory of April 30. United Press International reported yesterday that General Tra hid said that he was rot sure when the elections would he held, or when the Provisional Revolutionary Government would take over from the Military Management Committee that he heads, and which administers Saigon. [Page I, Colunm 8.]

title: Welfare Agencies Cited For 50% of Payment Errors
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 (AP)  About half the errors in the nation's welfare caseload are caused by welfare agencies themselves, according to a Government report released today. The Department of Health, Education and Welfare said its examination of the Aid to Families with Dependent Children rolls between January and June, 1974, found that overpayment and eligibility errors were divided equally between recipients and state and local agencies.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, MAY 12, 1975

title: Clogged Ports and Airline Dispute Hamper Nigeria
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, May 11As a long line of cars waited at a gasoline station the other day for a tankertruck delivery, a taxi driver asked, If Nigeria is so rich in oil, why do we have a gasoline shortage?

title: 6Billion Pentagon Cut Urged
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 (UPI) Six Democrats on the House Armed Services Committee said today that the Pentagon's $28.2billion weapons request should be cut by more than $6billion before the full House approves it. Joining Representative Les Aspin of Wisconsin leader of the group, in the proposal were Representatives Bob Carr of Michigan, Ronald V. Dellums of California, Thomas J. Downey of New York, Jim Lloyd of California and Patricia Schroeder of Colorado. Their committee has already cut from $3.7billion from the request.

title: Chile Gives Free Rein to Secret Police
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 5 After 20 months In power Chile's military junta shows few signs of dismantling the vast apparatus of political repression created to extirpate the Marxist cancer.

title: Central Presbyterian Backs Madison Ave, Church Merger
description: By a vote of 60 to 58, the congregation of Central Pres by terian Church voted yesterday to seek a merger with Ma dison Avenue Presbyterian Church, provided the sale of Central Presbyterian to the Asia Society gains the approval on June 10 of the Presbytery of the City of New York. The presbytery is the governing unit for the city's 15 Presbyterian churches.

title: Surgeon Marries Arlene H. Stolper
description: Arlene Harriet Stolper, administrative coordinator of research activities at the Robert B. Brigham Hospital in Boston, was married yesterday to Dr. Sheldon Roy Simon of Wayland, Mass., an orthopedic surgeon. The ceremony, in the Emanuel Synagogue in West Hartford, Conn., was performed by Rabbi Howard Singer with Cantor Arthur Koret.

title: Thai Demonstrators Seek Expulsion of Vietnamese
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 11 (Reuters)About 2,000 people demonstrated in the town of Sakonnakhon in northeast Thailand today demanding the expulsion of all Vietnamese from the country.

title: Dallenbach Paces Indy Trials
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 11A seasoned nineyear veteran and green rookie shared the honors today in the second day of the fourday qualifying period for the Indianapolis 500.

title: SINION'S REJECTION OF CITY'S AID PLAN SCORED BY BEAME
description: Mayor Beame yesterday termed as specious and legal double talk the arguments given by Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon for the Federal Government's refusal to grant the city $1.5billion in special assistance.

title: Kelly, Nason Chairman Leaves for Consulting
description: Just after noon on Friday the work force of Kelly, Nason, Inc., learned much to its surprise that Gerald Schoenfield, the chairman, had just resigned.

title: In Memoriam
description: LEMCHENJuliusMay 12, 1945 A CHARISMATIC MAN JESSIE E. MORRIS, Daughter

title: Islanders Tie Series
description: In the Stanley Cup playoffs the Islanders yesterday defeated the Philadelphia Flyers, 21, at Nassau Coliseum to tie the semifinal series at 33 and set up a deciding game tomorrow night in Philadelphia.

title: Arab Reaction Reported
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 11 (UPI)The Algerian Government has asked the Arab League to suspend preparations for economic talks with the European Common Market in protest against the trade agreement signed today with Israel, the newspaper alAnwar reported.

title: NIXON BACKING SEEN NEEDED FOR BREAKIN
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 (AP) Alexander P. Butterfield, who disclosed the existence of the White House tapes, said today he believed that President Nixon had prior knowledge of the first Watergate breakin.

title: Variable Mortgage Rates Are Tested in California
description: LOS ANGELES. May 11 Thousands of Californians have purchased homes in the lasts month not knowing how high the interest rates on their, mortgagesand therefore, their monthly paymentswill be six months, two years, five years or more from now. variable rate mortgages, a controversial type of home financing used, relatively rarely in the past, are starting to spread over California and are providing a laboratory for changes that the savings and loan industry wants to make across the country.

title: Protest in Newark Today Slated on Teacher Cuts
description: NEWARK, May 11  A spokesman for the city's Board of Education said today that groups of parents, students and community representatives were scheduling a march that would converge on City Hall and the board's headquarters in the heart of the business district tomorrow morning to protest planned mass layoffs of teachers.

title: Overheated Cadillac Wired for Explosion Ties Up a Parkway
description: A motorist who stopped his car on the Grand Central Parkway early yesterday afternoon because it was overheating discovered an explosive device wired to the motor and gasoline tank. The ensuing police investigation stopped traffic for an hour on the Queens thoroughfare.

title: Unelected Legislators in Albany: Lawyers Who Shepherd the Bills
description: ALBANYAs lawyers go, John F. Haggerty and C. Daniel Chill do not seem that highpowered. They sport no Wall Street shingles, no Brooks Brothers outfits, no important Manhattan bar credentials.

title: TRANSPORT PLAN FOR STATE DECRIED
description: NEWARK, May 11  The Institute for Public Transportation, a nonprofit research organization, has sharply criticized the transportation recommendations made last month by Governor Byrne's Commission to Evaluate the Capital Needs of New Jersey.

title: For VE Day, the Bolshoi Goes to Bear Mountain
description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, N.Y., May 11their tutus and toe shoes left behind for the day, 90 dancers from the Bolshoi Ballet arrived here in blue jeans and sandals eager to coordinate plis with kicks to a soccer ball.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Probably the ultimate status symbol next fall will be Elsa Peretti's 18karat gold mesh bra and corselette belt, the ones that Halston showed with his fall collection on Seventh Avenue. Winning combination, that HalstonPeretti team. You know about her bud vase, diamonds by the yard and other knickknacks. They were all launched on their fashionable careers at Halston shows.

title: Mozambique Front Confers With British Official on Aid
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, May 11 (AP)  Britain and the Mozambique Liberation Front agreed today that peace and security in southern Africa, including Rhodesia, can be achieved only when the fundamental rights of the people to freedom and independence are guaranteed.

title: Supplier Is Called Focus Of State Parkway Inquiry
description: TRENTON, May 11The vender under scrutiny by State grand jury investigating purchases by the Garden State Parkway was identified by state lawenforcement official today as the Fire and Municipal Equipment Company of Monmouth County.

title: Lilacs Are Victim of a Disease That Is Linked to Air Pollution
description: The lilac, a home garden favorite in the Northeast since the time of the Pilgrims, is falling victim to a byproduct of American progress, air pollution.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: Perhaps it is part of the natural foods movement, doityourself era or whatever you may call it, but we have received more requests for homemade sausages during the past year than ever in the history of our career in food reporting.

title: Weapons Found Smuggled To 3 Sentenced in Murder
description: Explosives, knives and lock picks were smuggled into the Criminal Courts Building yesterday to three selfdescribed members of the Black Liberation Army while they were in the process of being sentenced to life imprisonment for the murder of two city policemen.

title: COURT BARS PLEA ON BOSTON PUPILS
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The Supreme Court declined today to review a decision finding the Boston public school system unconstitutionally segregated and ordering officials to prepare a plan to eliminate racial imbalance.

title: Decline in Pound Is Seen Causing Damage to Dollar
description: BASEL, Switzerland May 12Financial authorities from the leading nonCommunist industrial countries expressed concern today over the spillover on the dollar of the declining international value of the pound.

title: Official Effort to Avert Oil Price Inquiry Charged
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 The chairman of a House subcommittee has charged that the State Department's efforts on behalf of an oil company under investigation for violating Federal price and customs laws was an unwarranted intrusion into the normal processes of law enforcement.

title: Dollar Price Mixed In Trading Abroad; Gold Shows Decline
description: BRUSSELS, May 12 (UPI)The dollar closed with marginal gains and losses on European money markets today as the pound plunged to record lows against a number of European currencies.

title: City Police Tow Car Of a Major Scofflaw
description: The car used by the man designated by the city's Transportation Administration as Scofflaw of the Month for accumulating, it said, 216 parking tickets in a oneyear period, has been seized to help satisfy a court judgment for $8,045 in fines levied against the man.

title: Beame Proposals
description: Following is Mayor Beame's proposed $434.4million city tax package and the projected yields:

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Wild Turkeys
description: BLOSSBURG, Pa.He who hunts wild turkeys in spring must learn to live with fatigue.

title: CHARLES FELLERMAN
description: Charles Fellerrnan a former hotel and restaurant owner here died Friday at his home in Miami. He was 78 years old.

title: Ky Refugee Plan Opposed
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark, May 12 (AP)Gov. David Pryor said today that he did not want Nguyen Cao Ky, former South Vietnamese Premier, to set up an Israeltstyle farming kibbutz in Arkansas. Mr. Ky said yesterday that he had thought about establishing such an operation in Arkansas or Texas for thousands of Vietnamese refugees.

title: OLD SAIGON REGIME SOUGHT J.M.F. FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (Reuters)A few days before South Vietnam felt, the International Monetary Fund received a request from Saigon for $40million, informed sources said here.

title: U.S. Auto Dealerships Off Sharply in Quarter
description: DETROIT, May 12 (AP)The number of United States dealers selling Americanmade cars dropped by 213 during the first quarter in what has been described as the steepest firstquarter loss in the last 14 years.

title: SENATE UNIT ASKS $405MILLION AID FOR THE REFUGEES
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The Senate Foreign Relations Committee, moving with unusual speed, approved today legislation to aid Indochina refugees after limiting the program's cost to $405million.

title: IslandersFlyers Face a Decision
description: The New York Islanders held a critical team meeting yesterday morning to discuss travel arrangements for jetting from Philadelphia to Buffalo after tonight's game with the Flyers. That's the Islanders for you.

title: Papers Seek to Set Distributors Ceiling Prices
description: WASHINGTON, May 12Spokesmen for two major newspaper publishers asked Congress today to permit newspapers anywhere in the nation to set maximum prices that independent distributors of newspapers may charge.

title: Their Vision Was New and Personal
description: Clients did not comethey found what I did upsetting. This is funny, isn't it?

title: WIDE C.I.A. SPYING AT HOME IS DENIED
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The vice chairman of the Rockefeller Commission said today that after 18 weeks of investigation it was his opinion that the Central Intelligence Agency had never engaged in massive domestic spying.

title: Black Psychologist Fighting Use of Intelligence Tests He Says Reflect White MiddleClass Values
description: ST. LOUISFrom his office on the second floor of old McMillan Hall at Washington University here, Dr. Robert L. Williams conducts an assault on intelligence testing.

title: Key Senate Leader Assails Carey's Jobless Aid Plan
description: ALBANY, May 12The chairman of the Senate Labor Committee said today that he would not consider Governor Carey's proposal for increasing benefits for the unemployed until some provision was made to replenish the unemployment insurance fund, which has paid out $400million in benefits since the beginning of the year.

title: WNET DRAWS FIRE FOR HARLEM FILM
description: WNET/13 and the Public Broadcasting Service both said yesterday that they would proceed with the scheduled telecast next Monday of a Swedishmade documentary on Manhattan's Harlem, in spite of vociferous objections to the film by a number of prominent blacks.

title: FASHION TALK
description: The first tenant in the shiny steel Olympic Tower building at 51st Street and Fifth Avenue is the wildly colorful boutique, Roberta di Camerino, which is spreading around the world from its beginning in Venice after World War II.

title: Impaled Driver Improving
description: BOSTON, May 12 (AP)Thomas Brennan, 28 years old, impaled through the chest by a fourbyfourinch fence post on May 2, was reported to be in fair condition but on the danger list and in the intensive care unit of City Hospital today. The Brockton man was injured when his car went through a chain link fence, hit a utility pole and then a wooden fence.

title: High Peking Aide Visits Paris; Closer Relations Are Forecast
description: PARIS, May 12Deputy Premier Teng Hsiaoping of China arrived today for a sixday state visit, which the French Government has taken as a signal honor and a mark of preferential relations.

title: Police Shift Durk to Queens; Demotion Indicated by Officials
description: Police Lieut. David Durk, whose elite investigative unit recently was disbanded after a controversial Federalcity undercover operation, was transferred yesterday to the detective bureau in Queens.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Three on WABCTV Honored For Willowbrook Program
description: WASHINGTON, May 12Geraldo Rivera, Martin Berman and Peter Lance of WABCTV won the television report award at the seventh annual Robert F. Kennedy journalism awards presentation here today.

title: Mystery at Sea
description: All the maritime nations of the worldnot just the United Stateshave an urgent stake in discovering exactly what happened yesterday in the Gulf of Siam, and insuring that the normal rules of international law are observed.

title: AntiVietnamese Protest In 3d Day in Thai Town
description: BANGKOK. Thailand, May 12 (Reuters)About 1.000 demonstrators calling for the expulsion of Vietnamese from Thailand gathered for the third day in the northeast Thailand town of Sakon Nakhon today.

title: Notes on People
description: Nancy Kissinger missed a White House ceremony yesterdayher mother, Mrs. Albert B. Maginnes, had suffered a broken hipbut her husband substituted for her in a group picture of four other international women of the year taken with President Ford.

title: Kennedy Winner In P.S.A.L. Track
description: John F. Kennedy High, in existence only three years, won its first major track title yesterday. Irving Goldberg's squad captured the team crown with 70 points in the Public School's Athletic League Bronx championships at Randalls Island. Clinton, winner of the most titles in this meet, was runnerup with 52 points and Columbus was third with 43.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, MAY 13, 1975

title: WHITE HOUSE SAYS CAMBODIA SEIZED A U.S. CARGO SHIP
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The White House announced today that a Cambodian naval vessel fired on a United States merchant ship in international waters in the Gulf of Siam early this morning and forced it into the Cambodian port of Sihanoukville.

title: Illinoisan Commutes to Barnard
description: Like lots of her sister students at Barnard College, Katherine Burdette is a commuter.

title: Work Begins on City College Arts Hall
description: Leonard Davis, class of '44, who has given $2.6million toward a new City College performing arts center, remembered yesterday, as demonstrators drowned his voice out, that he met his wife at a similar campus demonstration there 31 years ago.

title: U. N. Envoy Says Vietnam's Aim is Unity
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 12A special United Nations envoy who spent three weeks in Hanoi meeting with top Vietnamese leaders said here today that unification of the North and South was the final aim.

title: DialaRide Buses Prove Too Successful to Succeed
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., May 12Less than six months after it opened, the nation's largest dial  a  ride mass transit systema doortodoor service regarded as an innovacive model for scores of other itieswas abolished last week.

title: Sanguillen Cited
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May it (AP)  Manny Sanguillen of the Pittsburgh Pirates, off to the best start in his major league baseball career, was named the National League's player of the week today. The catcher hit 636 last week, with 14 hits in 22 times at bat, raising his batting average to 372.

title: Watson Wins Golfon 65269
description: DALLAS, May 12 (AP)Tom Watson turned back Jack Ewing with a solid sixunderpar 65 today and scored a twostroke victory in the raindelayed $175,000 Byron Nelson golf classic.

title: Six Ships With Refugees Returning to Vietnam
description: SINGAPORE, May 12 (Reuters)Six South Vietnamese ships carrying refugees have left Singapore to return home, the Singapore Government said today.

title: Elephant Born on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, March 12 (UPI)The first secondgeneration elephant to be born in an American Zoo was born at the Los Angeles zoo on Saturday. The unnamed male baby, weighing 125 pounds, was born to Metu, on loan to the zoo here from Portland, Ore., and was sired by Packy, also from the Portland zoo. Packy was born on April 14, 1962.

title: Article 2  No Title
A.B.A. Championship
description: Indiana vs. Kentucky

title: High School Teachers Return to Work in Newark
description: NEWARK, May 12 (AP)Most secondaryschool teachers returned to work today, school officials reported, after last week's sickouts to protest staff cuts planned for next year.

title: Himalayan Peak Is Climbed
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, May 12 (Reuters)Two Austrians and a West German reached the summit of the 27.625foot Himalayan mountain of Yalungkang on Friday, it was announced here today. The mountain has been climbed only once before.

title: Teamsters Threaten Strike If Farm Bill Is Enacted
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif. May 12 (AP)Teamster leaders said today that there would be an industrywide agricultural strike in four states July 15 if Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr.'s secret ballot farm labor bill was enacted.

title: WALTER KINSELLA, ACTOR, DIES AT 74
description: Walter A. Kinsella, an amateur track star who turned his success as a commercial model into a longacting career, died Sunday at the Inglemoor Nursing Home in Englewood, N. J. He was 74 years old. A longtime resident of the Lambs Club here, Mr. Kinsella lived for a year at 40 Central Park South before being admitted to the nursing home in January.

title: NEW ASIAN DANGER IS SEEN BY KISSINGER
description: ST. LOUIS, May 12Secretary of State Kissinger expressed concern today that the Communist takeovers in Cambodia and South Vietnam and the apparent collapse of the antiCommunists in Laos might lead to Soviet expansionism in Southeast Asia.

title: American Denies Charge He Joined Plot to Kill Marcos
description: MANILA, May 12 (AP)A 26yearold American who was arrested in 1972 on charges of having participated in a plot to kill President Ferdinand E. Marcos denied the charge today.

title: Phone Warrants: Some Used
description: With American Telephone and Telegraph Company warrants expiring on Thursday. a number of stockholders have moved to exercise their warrants to buy the stock at $52 a share even though the price still hovers a fraction below the critical level.

title: Nursing Home Panel Told Of Fees to Find Patients
description: The Moreland Act Commission on Nursing Homes heard testimony yesterday that at least 12 private operators had paid a headhunter to recruit patients from hospitals and that at least one nonprofit institution had demanded that Medicaid applicants make substantial donations or sign over their property before admission.

title: F.T.C. TO RESUME OIL TRUST INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, May 12After marking time for more than a year, Federal Trade Commission lawyers are about to resume questioning of oilindustry executives in a major antitrust case involving the country's eight largest oil companies.

title: Treasury Bills Decline At the Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, May 12Yields declined on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Seven thousand workers of Public Service Electric & Gas Company, New Jersey's largest utility, will go on strike at 12:01 a.m. tomorrow, union officials announced.

title: Senate Cuts Space Budget And Bars New Programs
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (UPI) The Senate approved today a trimmeddown space budget that, for the first time in the history of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, permits no starts on new programs.

title: MURRAY DAVIS, 72, REPORTER, IS DEAD
description: Murray Davis, who was a newspaper investigative reporter before that specialty became widespread, died Sunday in the Sands Point (L. I.) Nursing Home after a stroke. His age was 72. He lived on Harbor Road in Sands Point.

title: Silent Winter
description: Before long, commissions, Juries and courts will close their books on the nursing home scandals. Fraud and thievery will have been exposed and perhaps punished. The Moreland Act Commission's proposals, though short of basic remedies, could offer minimal assurance that at least for a while it will not be quite so easy as before to grow rich on outrages committed against the aged. The public conscience will, with relief, move away from those places where old people are stored until they die.

title: O.A.S. SETS TALKS ON ISSUE OF CUBA
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The 23nation Organization of American States reached agreement today on meeting in Costa Rica later this year to consider lifting its 11yearold embargo against Cuba.

title: Accused Killer of 11 Is Ruled Sane Enough to Stand Trial
description: HAMILTON, Ohio, May 12 (UPI)Two psychiatrists and psychologist agreed today that James Ruppert, 40 years old, charged with killing 11 members of his family at their home on Easter, was sane enough to stand trial although suffering from a mental disorder.

title: Belgrade Names Official
description: BELGRADE. Yugoslavia, May 12 (Reuters)Vladimir Bakaric, a 63yearold jurist, was chosen today to serve as Vice President of Yugoslavia for the next 12 months, the Government announced. He replaces pot Stambolic, whose oneyear term expires Friday.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Hobart TopSeeded in Lacrosse Event
description: Hobart, considered the best college  division lacrosse team in the country, has been seeded No. 1 for the second annual National Collegiate championship tournament.

title: St. John's Captures Met. Golf Tourney
description: SPARKILL, N. Y., May 12 St. John's University won the 26th Metropolitan Golf Association intercollegiate championships at the Rockland County Club today.

title: StraceyHaffey Bout Set
description: LONDON, May 12 (UPI)John Stracey, Britain's European welterweight champion, will meet Lawrence Haffey of Canada in a 10round bout at Royal Albert Hall on June 3, the promoter, Mike Barrett, said today.

title: MINIMAL GROWTH IN JOBS EXPECTED
description: Little growth in the number of job openings in New York State is expected between now and 1980, but manpower shortages may develop thereafter because of the decline in births during the nineteensixties, according to the regional Federal labor statistics chief here.

title: AMEX PRICES UP; COUNTER IS MIXED
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange rose yesterday in decreased trading. Prices in the overthecounter closed mixed as trading also fell.

title: 2,500 Chinese Protest Alleged Police Beating Here
description: More than 2,500 residents of Chinatown, angered by alleged police brutality, marched on City Hall yesterday in demonstration that had young students protesting sidebyside with their parents and grandparents, chanting together in Chinese.

title: City Securities Fall In Sharp Reaction To U.S. Aid Denial
description: City notes and bonds dropped sharply in price yesterday as the market reacted to the announcement by Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon that the Federal Government would not act to help solve the city's severe money shortage.

title: TeenAger Kicks, Beats And Robs a Man of 80
description: An 80yearold man was kicked and beaten early yesterday by a young mugger who jumped him outside his home in Great Neck, L. I., and stole $150 despite the man's efforts to ward him off with a cane.

title: Military Men Rule in Portugal, but Confusion Reigns
description: LISBON, May 12Mario Murteira, who may be the first Portuguese Minister of the Economy to greet his callers in a sport shirt, was talking about tourism.

title: Financial Dilemma
description: The prospect that President Ford will concur today in the rejection by Treasury Secretary William E. Simon of Mayor Beame's pleas to either erase or ease the city's cash flow crisis inexorably inches New York closer to a predicament that just a short while ago was barely thinkable.

title: Hunter to Pitch Out of Turn
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 12 The New York Yankees arrived in southern California today with Catfish Hunter, a kingsized payroll, seven defeats in their last eight games, a toehold on last place and a large sign that read: Help Wanted.

title: EDYTH T. M'LEOD
description: Edyth Thornton McLeod, whose column, Beauty After Forty was syndicated in newspapers in this country as well as in South America, died yesterday in St. Vincent's Hospital. She lived at 140 Seventh Ayenue.

title: ST. JOE MINERALS BACKS STOCK SPLIT
description: The St. Joe Mineral Corporation's board of directors approved yesterday a 2for1 split of its common stock in line with an announcement made at the end of the annual meeting by John C. Duncan, president.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: Vandals Ransack And Burn Rooms In a Bronx School
description: Vandals burned three classrooms and ransacked 20 others in Community School 6 in the West Farms section of the Bronx early yesterday morning, causing damage estimated at $100,000 and forcing the transfer of 300 students to other classrooms, school officials said.

title: Lordi Would Keep Present Gaming Laws
description: NEWARK, May 12Joseph P. Lordi, the Essex County Prosecutor, today appealed to the State Legislature to amend portions of the proposed state penal code dealing with gabling offenses. He declared that current proposals would make it nearly impossible to enforce the new gambling laws in this county.

title: Riverside Ensemble Shines in Foscari
description: Grown to 57 members in its second season, the Riverside Orchestra has dropped the chamber from its title, acquired additional state funding and expanded its primary activity of giving free concerts at schools, settlement houses, senior citizen homes and parks. Under the galvanizing direction of Larry Newland, an assistant conductor at the New York Philharmonic, this semiprofessional ensemble is a shining example of how good a community orchestra can be.

title: '76 KennedyGlenn Ticket Rated as Leader in Poll
description: A Harris survey released yesterday indicates that a 1976 Democratic ticket of Senator Edward M. Kennedy for President and Senator John H. Glenn for Vice President would beat a Republican ticket of President Ford and Vice President Rockefeller by a ratio of 3R to 30. according to United Press International.

title: Judge Voids Order To Editor to Write Antigun Editorials
description: JERSEY CITY, May 12 (AP)Judge Richard F. Connors, who ordered the editor of a Spanishlanguage paper who was convicted of a weapons charge to editorialize against the illegal use of guns, dropped that part of the sentence today.

title: JAWORSKI CONFIRMS HE MADE TAPE OFFER
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (AP) Leon Jaworski, the former special Watergate prosecutor, once offered to reduce his demand for White House tapes from 64 to 18 and to withhold the fact that President Nixon had been named an unindicted coconspirator in the Watergate coverup case.

title: PROXMIRE SCORES A PAMPER FUND
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The military, forced by Congress to reduce its number of enlisted servants, is proposing to set up what Senator William Proxmire describes as a $1million pamoer fund to provide housecleaning and catering services for servantless generals and admirals.

title: Angolan Warns of Invasion Of OilProducing Enclave
description: LISBON, May 12 (Reuters).A leader of one of Angola's liberation movements charged today that a large unidentified army was preparing to invade Angola's oilproducing enclave of Cabinda from neighboring Zaire. He also warned that a threat of general conflict hung over nearby Angola.

title: LAOS LEFTIST SAYS HE HEADS FORCES
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, May 12A proCommunist general announced today that he had become the new Defense Minister of Laos. He issued orders grounding the air force and forbidding all movement of troops or military equipment.

title: Episcopal Bishops Back Leader in Contempt Case
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (UPI) Leaders of the Episcopal House of Bishops came to the defense today of their Presiding Bishop, who was cited for contempt by an ecclesiastical court in the Washington Diocese.

title: Mrs. Ford Gets Award For Aid to Handicapped
description: PHILADELPHIA. May 12 (AP)Betty Ford received the Silver Hunanitarian Award tonight for her volunteer work on behalf of handicapped, crippled and mentally retarded citizens. The Philadelphia Association for Retarded Citizens gave Mrs. Ford the award at its 25th annual dinner, which was attended by about 800 petsons.

title: Hanoi Said to Have $2Billion in Serviceable Captured U.S. Arms
description: WASHINGTON, May 12A Defense Department official said today that about $2billion worth of serviceable military equipment had fallen into the hands of North Vietnam in the collapse and surrender of the South Vietnamese Army.

title: CITY SETS RECORD ON PARKING FINES
description: Mayor Beame said yesterday that the threeweekold crackdown on illegal parkers and scofflaws had resulted in the highest collections of fines in the history of the Parking Violations Bureau.

title: Reports by Banks On Their Credit Use Draw Opposition
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (Reuters)Treasury Secretary William E. Simon and Robert Hollend, a governor of the Federal Reserve Board, said today they opposed a bill that would require large banks to report on their use of credit because they feared it would lead to Federal credit allocation.

title: ZONING SCANDAL UPSETS MIAMIANS
description: MIAMI, May 12It was a sad day for the Dade County Commission and a sad day for the county. Commissioner Beverly Phillips observed here the other day. This affair has affected our credibility and caused deep concern among citizens.

title: LENDING DECLINES IN EUROCURRENCIES
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (Reuters)  Eurocurrency lending continued to decline in the first quarter of 1975 although a revival in the Eurobond sector indicated a swing toward publicly offered loans and private placements as the principal source of longerterm financing, the World Bank said today.

title: Shah Courting Popular Support
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 12The people of Iran support their monarchy, the Shah told a visitor last year, adding proudly: You can see by the look in their eyes.

title: Group Told Vast Deposits Of Oil in World Untapped
description: TOKYO, May 12 (UPI)Giant oil fields in the world still contain an estimated 787 billion barrels of oil, delegates to the World Petroleum Congress were told today.

title: Room for Growth
description: Once the city has made a decisive turn toward responsible budget control and high productivity in its own work force, there is warrant for considerable optimism about renewed growth in the whitecollar and professional sectors of the metropolitan economy.

title: Lehman Collection at Met Opens for Private Viewing
description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art opened its resplendentand controversialnew addition last night, the Lehman Collection, with a private viewing for 600 friends of the Lehman Foundation.

title: Budget Success
description: Congress, despite its clear constitutional mandate to control the appropriation of public funds and the levying of taxes, has for decades steadily yielded power over fiscal issues to the Presidency because it lacked the selfdiscipline to control its own committees and to look at the total Federal budget in the context of the national economy. Under the new budget law passed last year, the House and Senate established committees to take the needed overview of spending and taxing decisions.

title: Market Ends Mixed
description: The stock market ended mixed yesterday in much slower trading after three consecutive sessions of advances.

title: Two Westchester Doctors Are Indicted in Lab Frauds
description: WHITE PLAINS, May 11 Two Westchester County physicians, both laboratory directors, were indicted today on charges of defrauding the County Medical Center and the Peekskill Community Hospital of $34,000 by misusing laboratory personnel and equipment.

title: Starship Concert in Park Stirs Nostalgia for Lost Era
description: The Jefferson Starship (formerly the Jefferson Airplane) opened the local summer season for pop music yesterday afternoon with a free concert on the Great Lawn of Central Park.

title: Canada, Raising Defense Spending, Likely to Stress AirSea Forces and Reduce Ground Units in Europe
description: OTTAWAA substantial increase in Canadian defense spending in the next fiscal year is likely to take the form of greater emphasis on sea and air forces and a reduction of the role of groundforce units in Europe.

title: Josef Hoffmann, the Austrian pioneer of modern, above, designed the smallfigured floral, right, 50 years before today's decorators discovered the look.
description: Both helped shape 20thcentury modernthe boxy and sausagelike chairs, the spare tables and tablewares. But the contributions each madeJosef Hoffmann in Vienna, to stant acclaim; Eileen Gray in Paris, where public recognition never camehave gone virtually unrecorded in this country.

title: Tapline Layoffs Planned
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 12 (Reuters)The TransArabian Pipe Line (Tapline) announced today plans to lay off its work force without waiting for Lebanese Government negotiations with Saudi Arabia. The pipeline, which delivered Saudi crude to the Zahrani terminal near Sidon, has been unused since Saudi Arabia stopped pumping two months ago because the tanks at Zahrani were full.

title: World Team Tennis
description: SUNDAY NIGHT'S MATCHES

title: Illinoisan Commutes to Barnard
description: Like lots of her sister students at Barnard College, Katherine Burdette is a commuter.

title: An Innovation in Beef Marketing Means Savings to Consumer
description: ATLANTAFaced with an uncertain supplyanddemand structure and what they consider a disproportionate gap between prices in the supermarket and what the farmer receives, meat producers in various parts of the country are experimenting with direct sales to the consumer.

title: FUNDRAISING CURB IS LAID TO GURNEY
description: TAMPA, Fla., May 12The prosecution's chief witness at the trial of former Senator Edward J. Gurney of Florida testified today that in June, 1972. Mr. Gurney told him to stop raising funds from builders dealing with Federal housing agencies.

title: City Securities Fall In Sharp Reaction To U.S. Aid Denial
description: City notes and bonds dropped sharply in price yesterday as the market reacted to the an nouncement by Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon that the Federal Government would not act to help solve the city's severe money shortage.

title: $434MILLION RISE IN TAXES PLANNED BY CITY IN CRISIS
description: ALBANY, May 12A $434million package of proposed New York City taxesincluding a doubled commuter tax, a big rise in stocktransfer taxes on nonresidents and increased levies on banks and businesses was disclosed here today by Mayor Beame.

title: Advertising
description: I have never in my life spent fuller days, but strangely I've never been less tired, said Alex Kroll, managing director of Young & Rubicam, U.S.A., manager of the New York office and creative director of Young & Rubicam International worldwide.

title: CAMBODIA INVITES AID FROM ABROAD
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 12 (Reuters)  Cambodia's new rulers admitted today that they faced great difficulties in rebuilding their country, and said they would be prepared to accept foreign aid.

title: Chess
description: Should you feel the urge to take up the Kings Indian Defense, there is no better example to follow than that of Svetozar Gligoric, the kingpin of Yugoslav chess for more than three decades.

title: It Takes 2 Tigers To Pitch Shutout
description: The Detroit Tigers climbed over the .500 mark last night as Vern Ruhle and John Hiller shut out the Kansas Royals, 50, on nine hits at Tiger Stadium. Leon Roberts, a rookie, hit a threerun homer to spark the victory. Ruhle raised his wonlost record to 21, but missed a chance for his first major league shutout when Manager Ralph Houk removed him after a single and a walk with one out in the eighth.

title: State of the City: Industry and Labor
description: New York City's diversified economy, long viewed as the strongest possessed by any metropolis in the world, is sick for reasons that will not disappear when the rest of the country climbs out of the recession. Cures for the city's deeprooted economic ills depend on public and private decisions that can flow only from restoration in the forthcoming municipal budget of a sound fiscal foundation for revival of industry and employment.

title: Nursing Home Panel T old Of Fees to Find Patients
description: The Moreland Act Commission on Nursing Homes heard testimony yesterday that at least 12 private operators had paid a headhunter to recruit patients from hospitals and that at least one nonprofit institution had demanded that Medicaid applicants make substantial donations or sign over their property before admission.

title: Cowfurred Among Greatness
description: President Ford, Henry Kissinger and Harold Wilson asked Sam to report to the White House last week.

title: Texas Blast Kills 4 in Car
description: DEVERS, Tex., May 12 (AP)  A leaking liquefied petrotleum gas pipeline exploded this afternoon, killing four persons trapped in a car about two and a half miles east of here on U.S. 90. There was no immediate identification of the victims.

title: Hartford Troupe Gets Award
description: Paul Weidner and the Hartford Stage Company of Connecticut have won the annual Margo Jones Award. Mr. Weidner, who is producing director of the Hartford Company, and his troupe were cited for the most significant contribution to the professional American theater. The award carries a $500 prize and a medallion. It is named for the Dallas theater founder and director.

title: Colson in Plea to Court On Approval as Lawyer
description: BOSTON, May 12 (UPI)Charles W. Colson, the former Nixon aide, today asked a Massachusetts court to let him practice law.

title: Bridge
description: Possession of the six of hearts and the considerable skill that brought him two world titles five years ago gave victory in the prestigious Cavendish Charity Invitation Pairs here Sunday night to Jim Jacoby of Dallas.

title: Torre's BasesLoaded Double Provides 32 Victory for Mets
description: Bobby Murcer returned to New York last night, but it was a boy from Brooklyn who provided the excitement at Shea Stadium.

title: La Monte Young Performs His Solo, WellTuned Piano
description: La Monte Young's The WellTuned Piano, which has been receiving its first American performances this spring at the Dia Art Foundation, 141 Wooster Street, is a long, improvisatory piano solo.

title: Clifford Durr, ExF.C.C. Aide And Civil Rights Lawyer, Dies
description: WETUMPKA, Ala., May 12 Clifford Judkins Durr, a former Federal Communications Commissioner and prominent civil liberties lawyer, died today at the age of 76.

title: Mideast Order to Xonics
description: Xonics, Inc., has been awarded en $11million contract for a telecommunications network in the Middle East.

title: Seniors' Hairlines Meet Deadline at Prep School
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., May 12 (AP)Seniors at Seton Hall Preparatory School reported for classes today with trimmed hair following their headmaster's ultimatum to shed long locks or face suspension a month before graduation.

title: Landlords, in Court, Assail Fort Lee RentRise Limit
description: HACKENSACK, May 12The owners of a dozen highrise apartment buildings in Fort Lee opened their Superior Court challenge here today to the borough's new rentleveling ordinance, which would limit the landlords to rent increases of 2.5 per cent per year.

title: JOSEPH MORNINGSTAR
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 12  Joseph Morningstar, retired president and chairman of MorningstarPaisley, Inc., manufacturer of starches, dextrines and adhesives, died today at his home on Cherry Valley Road. He was 84 years old.

title: VOTERS HOLD COOL TO BIG BOND ISSUE
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, May 12 (UPI)Assembly Speaker S. Howard Woodson Jr., Democrat of Mercer, said today he felt the public would not approve a billiondollar bond issue on the November ballot, and indicated one of $600million might be acceptable.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The owners of a dozen highrise apartment buildings in Fort Lee, N. J., opened their Superior Court challenge to the borough's new rentleveling ordinance, which would limit the landlords to rent increases of 2.5 per cent per year. Many New Jersey towns that adopted ordinances allowing landlords rent increases tied to the consumer price index are switching to flatrate increases because of the sharp rise in the index.

title: JURY HERE WEIGHS HIREDKILLER CASE
description: A State Supreme Court jury yesterday began deliberations in a threemonthlong trial in which a Manhattan businessman is charged with having hired a 29yearold drifter to kill his former business customer and friend nearly three years ago.

title: Liguori Up for Dream Mile
description: Carol Liguori has mixed feelings about watching her husband against Filbert Bayi, Rick Wohlhuter, Tony Waldrop, Eamonn Coghlan and Reg McAfee in the Dream Mile Saturday night during the International Freedom Games at Kingston, Jamaica.

title: Control of HoneywellBull to Go To France in Merger Package
description: PARIS, May 12.The French Government announced today that it would merge the nation's troubled computer producer with its rival HoneywellBull after the Americancontrolled company sold a controlling interest to French Government and private interests.

title: SEOUL OPPOSITION BACKS NEW LAWS
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 12 (AP)The chief political opposition to President Park Chung Hee declared support today for two new security measures proposed by the Government in the wake of the Communist victories in Indochina.

title: Return of Nuclear Plant Lowers Con Ed Rates
description: The Consolidated Edison Company announced yesterday that electric bills were going down next month by 83 cents for the typical residential customer.

title: Big Board's Net Income Up Steeply in Quarter
description: With gross revenues up by 10 per cent, on record volume, and operating expenses cut by 3 per cent, the New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday a net income for the first quarter this year of $1.35million, more than five times the $253,000 reported for the same quarter a year ago.

title: MILLS LAYS TROUBLE TO PILLS AND LIQUOR
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (UPI) Representative Wilbur D. Mills said today that his transgressions at the Tidal Basin and at a Boston burlesque theater were the result of blackouts caused by pills and liquor.

title: N.B.A. Playoffs
description: Chicago vs. Golden State

title: ISRAELIS SEIZE FIVE IN RAID ON LEBANON
description: TEL AVIV, May 12Israeli forces thrust across the Lebanese border last night and searched three villages for Arab guerrillas, according to an official announcement here. Five suspected terrorist collaborators were reported brought back.

title: Soviet Sailors in Boston and Americans in Leningrad: First Exchange Visit in 30 Years
description: BOSTON, May 12The first Russian warships to visit an American port since the end of World War II tied up here today.

title: British to Lift Blockade
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, May 12 (Reuters)Britain will lift her blockade of the port of Beira in Mozambique when the Portugues territory becomes independent on June 25, informed sources in Zambia said today.

title: $434MILLION RISE IN TAXES PLANNED BY CITY IN CRISIS
description: ALBANY, May 12A $434million package of proposed New York City taxesincluding a doubled commuter tax, a big rise in stocktransfer taxes on nonresidents and increased levies on banks and businesses was disclosed here today by Mayor Beame.

title: Dominican Leader Names New Chief of Armed Forces
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, May 12 (AP)President Joaquin Balaguer today named a new armed forces Chief of Staff and army commander, completing an overhaul of the top military structure.

title: Court to Weigh CitySuburb Housing Plan Merger
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether suburban counties with some record of public housing discrimination can be ordered combined with a clearly discriminatory central city in a metropolitan public housing plan to reduce racial segregation.

title: Steel Output Down; Lowest Since 1972
description: Steel production for the week ended May 10 was at the lowest level since the week of July 22, 1972, according to figures released yesterday by the American Iron and Steel Institute.

title: RETROACTIVITY PLAN ARGUED IN GUN CASE
description: TRENTON, May 12 (UPI)The state argued before the Supreme Court today that all shotguns and rifles should be registered, not just those bought after the guncontrol law passed in 1966.

title: Shipping/Mails
Thompson Films Spots For Irving Trust Co.
description: In the first TV commercials it has made for the Irving Trust Company since 1971, J. Walter Thompson changes mannequins into bank employes.

title: SHIRLEY HICKS
description: Shirley Jean Merrill Hicks, wife of E. Wyatte Hicks, an executive vice president of J. Walter Thompson Company. died Sunday of a cerebral hemorrage in Norwalk (Conn.) Hospital. She was 53 years old and lived at 178 Sleepy Hollow Road, New Canaan, Conn.

title: Paul M. Angle, 74, Historian And Authority on Lincoln, Dies
description: CHICAGO, May 12 (AP)Paul M. Angle, historian and an authority on Abraham Lincoln, died yesterday in Northwestern Memorial Hospital. He was 74 years old.

title: Levi Bars G.A.O. Access to F.B.I. Files
description: WASHINGTON, May 12Attorney General Edward H. Levi has refused to let a study team from the General Accounting Office view the F.B.I.'s investigative files, apparently setting the stage for his response to similar requests expected later this year from the House and Senate select committees examining intelligence agencies.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The chairman of the New York State Senate Labor Committee said that he would not consider Governor Carey's proposal for increased benefits for the unemployed until legislation was passed that would replenish the unemployment insurance fund, which has paid out almost $400million in benefits since the beginning of the year.

title: Saigon Radio Says Some Are Still Resisting Regime
description: Reports of continued opposition to the new rulers of South Vietnam were broadcast yesterday by the Saigon radio, but there were no direct accounts of the day's happenings from Western reporters still in the city.

title: Vacancy on Board Creates 300Case Parole Backlog
description: TRENTON, May 12Governor Byrne's fourmonth delay in appointing a new chairman of the State Parole Board has created a backlog of nearly 300 parole hearings, causing increasing agitation in the state's prisons.

title: Stake Mark Set at Big A In Vagrancy
description: Honorable Miss of the PenYBryn Stable won the $56,700 Vagrancy Handicap at Aqueduct yesterday in stakes record time. Now she finds herself with no place to go. The 5yearold daughter of Damascus unleashed her characteristic late rally to take the sevenfurlong sprint for fillies and mares by 1 lengths over Viva La Vivi in the field of eight, and in so doing was clocked in 1:22 1/5, a fifth of a second under the previous standard.

title: AMERACE SEEKING ANCHOR COUPLING
description: The Anchor Coupling Company, Inc., of Libertyville, Ill., said yesterday that the Amerace Corporation had made an offer to acquire Anchor for $13.98 a share. Based on 1,323,721 shares of Anchor outstanding, the offer from Amerace is estimated at about $18.5million. Anchor said the offer was unsolicited and its board would decide on it later this week.

title: Montreal Labor Dispute Halts Olympic Building
description: MONTREAL, May 12 (AP) The organizing committee of the 1976 Olympics tried to reassure the public today that the Summer Games will not be delayed by a work stoppage which has paralyzed construction at the Olympic site.

title: CANNES FESTIVAL IN SUBDUED MOOD
description: CANNES, France, May 12The Cannes Film Festival may still beas its director, Maurice Bessy, assertsthe cinema event of the year, but on its 28th anniversary it wears a serious, even pseudoscholarly face.

title: PLANNED ECONOMY URGED IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, May 12Senators Hubert H. Humphrey, Democrat of Minnesota, and Jacob J. Javits, Republican of New York, supported by a group of more than 100 ecoomists, business executives, labor leaders and politicians, introduced legislation today to create a system for national economic planning.

title: Age Catches Up With Celtics
description: The Celtics need reinforcements for next season. The Boston practice of adding a player, usually from the college draft, and bringing him along slowly, won't do. like the Knicks, the Celtics suddenly got old. Boston's elimination in the National Basketball Association Eastern Conference playoff final by the Washington Bullets pointed up the necessity for rebuilding.

title: Next 2 Weeks Vital to Iowa Corn Crop
description: CLARINDA, Iowa, May 10 Puffs of heavy dust were swirling up behind the tilling forks on his corn seeder as David Williams dragged it over the rich bottomland as rapidly as his tractor would go.

title: Supreme Court Will Consider Case on Computer System Patent
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (AP) The Supreme Court agreed today to consider next fall a case raising issues of patent law as it affects the computer age.

title: Oil Fever Is Raging in Alabama as Wells Are Brought In
description: CHUNCHULA, Ala., May 10When the lease buyer from the oil company came down the road one morning a couple of years ago, Ed Gwinn was more than happy to sell him the mineral rights to a 20acre patch of scrub pine.

title: Gibson Makes Emotional Plea Against Death Penalty Revival
description: NEWARK, May 12A city panel soliciting opinion on wheather the death penalty should be reinstated in New Jersey tonight heard an emotional denunciation of the proposal from Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson.

title: Power Plant Goal Is Seen as Too High By Petroleum Group
description: The Petroleum Industry Research Foundation, Inc., said yesterday that the Administration's goal of 200 nuclear power plants by 1985 is too high, while its projection of an oil import level of 4.7 million barrels a day is too low.

title: Assembly Votes to Limit Censoring of Prison Mail
description: ALBANY, May 12A bill that would provide prison inmates greater protection against mail censorship was approved by the Assembly this evening after a lengthy debate of prison reform.

title: House to Get Energy Bill Raising Tax on Gasoline
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The House Ways and Means Committee, deeply divided over how best to handle the nation's energy problems, approved today legislation that would raise the Federal tax on gasoline and take other steps designed to conserve fuel.

title: WIDE C.I.A. SPYING Al HOME IS DENIED
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The vice chairman of the Rockefeller Commission said today that after IS weeks of investigation it was his opinion that the Central Intelligence Agency had never engaged in massive domestic spying.

title: Israel Bars Publication of a Manuscript Disclosing Secret Remarks of Kissinger
description: JERUSALEM, May 12The Israeli Government has moved vigorously to block publication of a book that reportedly contains secret minutes of conversations between Secretary of State Kissinger and Israeli ministers in which the Secretary allegedly made disparaging remarks about the leaders of Egypt, Syria, the Soviet Union and other countries.

title: WNET DRAWS FIRE FOR HARLEM FILM
description: WNET/13 and the Public Broadcasting Service both said yesterday that they would proceed with the scheduled telecast next Monday of a Swedishmade documentary on Manhattan's Harlem, in spite of vociferous objections to the film by a number of prominent blacks.

title: GOING OUT Guide
