description: ARMS AND CHAIRS Jacques Offenbach's The Grand Duchess of Gerolstein is a comic opera that is seldom done here. It was last presented here in a 1957 concert version in French. Composed in 1867, it is a satire of military life and politics during the reign of Napoleon III and also mocks grand opera in general and the works of the French composer Meyerbeer in particular.

title: Dave Anderson
description: In sports the price of fame is always high, in calories. Now that his Pittsburgh Steelers are the champions of the National Football League after 42 years of frustration and failure, Art Rooney has discovered that he finally has attained the stature of the cigars that he so enjoys. Both are now in great demand after dessert. The 74yearold owner of the Steelers soon will be on the dais of the WaldorfAstoria Hotel's grand ballroom three times in less than a week. Put that record in the N.F.L. book. He will he honored Thursday night at a $150aplate dinner not Sports only benefitting four medical, educational and healthcare institutions in Ireland but also establishing the Rooney Prize for Irish literature. If he had his way, Art Rooney prebably would nominate Pat Livingston of the Pittsburgh Press for that award for suffering with the Steelers almost as much as he did. He will return to the dais Saturday night for Iona College's sports dinner, and he will be on display again next Wednesday at a luncheon sponsored by the American Iron and Steel Institute in gratitude, among, other things, for the Steelers wearing the steel symbol on their blackandgold helmets. By then Art Rooney might be wearing the steel symbol on his digestive system. But he recently warmed up for his caloric calisthenics by visiting Ireland for the first time.

title: Chief's Son Dies in Shooting
description: POTTSVILLE, Pa., May 12 (AP)Stephen Quirk, the 16yearold son of the Police Chief, Thomas Quirk, has died after being shot in the head over the weekend while participating in an alleged restaurant holdup. Mayor John Reiley has asked the state police to conduct an investigation of the shooting. The city police are investigating the robbery attempt.

title: LAOS LEFTISI SAYS HE NERDS FORCES
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, May 12A proCommunist general announced today that he had become the new Defense Minister of Laos. He issued orders grounding the air force and forbidding all movement of troops or military equipment.

title: Market Place
description: Officials of International Flavors and Fragrances, Inc., met with security analysts last Thursday and gave the Wall Streeters the definite impression that the company, which has a superior growth record, would show little earnings growth this year.

title: Spivak Retires Nov. 9 From Meet the Press
description: Lawrence E. Spivak, the creator and moderator of Meet the Press, will retire in the fall, with his last appearance on the news interview program scheduled for Sunday, Nov. 9, the day that Meet the Press celebrates its 28th anniversary on television. Mr. Spivak's 75th birthday will be in June.

title: Last Big Refugee Group Arrives on Guam
description: APRA HARBOR, Guam, Tuesday, May 13Clutching straw mats, dented pots and halfnaked children, more than 16,000 South Vietnamese refugees streamed off four merchant vessels today to begin new lives in a new land. Another ship with upward of 4,000 more refugees was due later.

title: A Summary of Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Hruska Won't Run in 1976
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (AP) Senator Roman L. Hruska, Republican of Nebraska, first elected to the Senate in 1954, announced today that he would not run for reelection in 1976.

title: Weapons Found Smuggled To 3 Sentenced in Murder
description: Explosives, knives and lock picks were smuggled into the Criminal Courts Building yesterday to three selfdescribed members of the Black Liberation Army while they were in the process of being sentenced to life imprisonment for the murder of two city policemen.

title: SADAT IN KUWAIT AT START OF TOUR
description: KUWAIT, May 12President Anwar elSadat of Egypt arrived in this muggy oil port on the Persian Gulf today on the first leg of a 10day tour that will take him also to Iraq, Jordan and Syria.

title: C.B. Baldwin Dies; New Deal Official Shifted to Wallace
description: C. B. (Beanie) Baldwin, a New Deal official under President Franklin D. Roosevelt and campaign manager for Henry A. Wallace in the 1948 Presidential campaign, died yesterday of cancer in Bethesda, Md. He was 72 years old and lived in Kent, Conn.

title: U.S. Newsmen Visit Soviet Space Center
description: KALININGRAD, U.S.S.R., May 12The Soviet Union peeled away one more layer of secrecy from its space program today and for the first time permitted foreign newsmen to inspect its main flight control center.

title: A 3YEAR PACT ENDS M'DONNELL STRIKE
description: ST. LOUIS, May 12 (AP)Machinists and aerospace workers have voted to return to work at the McDonnell Douglas Corporation, ending 12week strike that put 11,500 employes out of work.

title: Volkswagen. Puts '74 Loss at $336Million
description: BONN, May 12Volkswagen, the leading symbol of West Germany's postwar economic miracle, announced today loss of $336million in its worldwide operations for 1974.

title: United Brands Picks Chief Executive, Booth, Once of Rockwell International
description: Wallace W. Booth, a former senior executive of the Rockwell International Corporation, yesterday was named president and chief executive officer of the scandalridden United Brands Company.

title: Larry Allen, an A.P. Reporter Who Won Pulitzer, Dead at 66
description: MEXICO CITY. May 12 (AP) Larry Allen, an Associated Pre correspondent for many years and winner of the 1942 Pulitzer Prize for his war reporting, died today at his home, the United States Embassy anpounced. He was 66 years old.

title: People and Business
description: Secretary of Commerce Rogers C. B. Morton flew yesterday from Tokyo to Peking for what he said he hoped would be informal trade talks with Chinese officials. In Peking, he will stay at the home of George Bush, head of the United States liaison mission there.

title: START OF TRIAL SEEN IN I.B.M. TRUST SUIT
description: A pretrial conference yesterday at the United States Court for the Southern District of New York seemed to indicate that the often postponed trial of the Justice Department's sixyearold antitrust case against the International Business Machines Corporation would begin next Monday as scheduled.

title: Business Briefs
description: Japanese Set Indonesian Oil Loan

title: Theater
Jefferson Starship Stirs Nostalgia in a Park Concert
description: The Jefferson Starship (formerly the Jefferson Airplane) opened the local summer season for pop music yesterday afternoon with a free concert on the Great Lawn of Central Park.

title: Wedding Held Here For Anna Latella
description: Anna Marie Latella, assistant counsel in the State Office of Court Administration, was married yesterday to Francois de Nerciat, who is with the New York law firm of Donovan Leisure Newton & Irvine, State Administrative Judge Richard J. Bartlett performed the ceremony at the Barbizon Plaza.

title: Beame and Carey to Ask President Today for Fiscal Aid to City, but Rejection Is Hinted
description: WASHINGTON. May 1 2Mayor Beame and Governor Carey will take their appeal for $1.5billion in emergency finanoial assistance for New York City directly to President Ford tomorrow, but White House sources said privately today that they would almost certainly be turned down.

title: U.S. Debt Issues Soar; Corporate Market Firm
description: Demand for Treasury debt issues was strong yesterday, with aggressive buyers bidding up prices throughout the maturity list. By comparison the corporate and taxexempt bond markets were firm as buyers in those markets awaited another heavy calendar of offerings to start today. The strength in Treasury paper was illustrated by the sharp declines in yields. Last week's 90day bills closed with a yield of 5.09 per cent, compared with 5.32 on Friday. Yields on the companion 180day issue fell to 5.47 per cent from 5.63.

title: Aeros Win, 7 to 2; Keep W.H.A. Title
description: QUEBEC, May 12 (AP)The Houston Aeros, led by the fatherson combination of Gordie and Mark Howe, defeated the Quebec Nordiques, 72, tonight and captured their second consecutive World Hockey Association championsrip. The Aeros took four straight games.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE BOAT. B LotharGnther Buchheim. Translated from the German, Das Boot, by Denver and Helen Lindley. 463 pages. Illustrated with schematic drawing. Knopf. $10.

title: WHITE HOUSE SAYS CAMBODIA SEIZED A U.S. CARGO SHIP
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The White House announced today that a Cambodian naval vessel fired on a United States merchant ship in international waters in the Gulf of Siam early this morning and forced it into the Cambodian port or Sihanoukville.

title: Ramirez, Gottfried Victors in Doubles
description: DALLAS, May 12 (AP)Raul Ramirez of Mexico and Brian Gottfried of the United States won the World Championship of Tennis challenge doubles match tonight with a dramatic, fiveset victory over South Africans Bob Hewitt and Frew McMillan, of South Africa, 75, 63, 46, 26, 75.

title: Seniors' Hairlines Meet Deadline at Prep School
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., May 12 (AP)Seniors at Seton Hall Preparatory School reported for classes today with trimmed hair following their headmaster's ultimatum to shed long locks or face suspension a month before graduation.

title: Edward Baldes, Invented Mayo's Human Centrifuge
description: NEWBURY PARK, Calif., May 12 (AP)Dr. Edward J. Baldes, inventor of the Mayo, Clinic's human centrifuge during World War II, died of a heart attack yesterday while visiting relatives. He was 76 years old.

title: IceAge Climate Studied With Help of Computers
description: WASHINGTON, May 12A global picture of what conditions of life must have been like for humans during the last great ice age is emerging from computer studies of the climate largely sponsored by the National Science Foundation.

title: ADM. SHEPHEARD OF COAST GUARD
description: Rear Adm. Halert Clifford Shepheard of the Coast Guard, who was considered a leading expert in safety at sea, died Friday in Bethesda, Md., apparently of a heart attack. He was 81 years old and lived in Westmoreland Hills, Md.

title: A Skywalk Demolished In Wall St. Razing Plan
description: One of the city's few skywalks, a kind of Buck Rogersera span between skyscrapers in lower Manhattan, was demolished yesterday because it was losing one of its skyscrapers.

title: No New Financial Pressure Seen for Pennsy Before '76
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (UPI) The Penn Central Railroad probably will not have to come hack to Congress for more money before a new Governmentplanned corporation takes over early next year, one of the railroad's bankruptcy trustees said today.

title: SENATE UNIT ASKS $405MILION AID FOR THE REFUGEES
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The Senate Foreign Relations Committee, moving with unusual speed, approved today legislation to aid Indochina refugees after limiting the program's cost to $405million.

title: JAPAN'S SOCIALISTS SIGN PEKING ACCORD
description: PEKING, May 12 (Agence FrancePresse)A visiting delegation of the Japanese Socialist party and Peking's ChinaJapan Friendship Association signed a joint statement today opposing the dominant international role of the United States and the Soviet Union, Hsinhua, the Chinese press agency, reported.

title: Article 3  No Title
House to Get Energy Bill Raising Tax on Gasoline
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The House Ways and Means Committee, deeply divided over how best to handle the nation's energy problems, approved today legislation that would raise the Federal tax on gasoline and take other steps designed to conserve fuel.

title: U.F.T.Backed Slates Win 26 of 30 District School Races
description: With returns in from all but two districts, candidates endorsed by the United Federation of Teachers have now won a majority of the board seats in 26 of the 30 local school districts where the vote tally has been completed.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The White House announced that a Cambodian naval ship seized a United States merchant ship in what were said to be international waters 60 miles off the coast of Cambodia and forced it to the nearest Cambodian port. Ron Nessen, the White House press secretary, said that President Ford considers this seizure an act of piracy. He said the American ship was fired on by the Cambodian ship and immediately afterward was boarded by Cambodian naval forces. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Bonn Opposition Names Kohl to Run Against Schmidt Next Year
description: BONN, May 12Helmut Kohl was picked today by the executive board of West Germany's main Opposition party, the Christian Democratic Union, as its candidate to run against Chancellor Helmut Schmidt in the general elections next year.

title: MORE DOCTORS JOIN CALIFORNIA PROTEST
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 12 (UPI)Doctors in three more counties joined today a 12day walkout that has halted all hut emergency surgery and caused drastic layoffs in San Francisco's private hospitals Anesthesiologists in San Mateo. Santa Clara and Sacramento Counties refused to provide their cervices in some hospitals except in cases of life or death surgery.

title: Community Garden Dug Up at Contested Village Plot
description: The owner of a small plot of land in Greenwich Village, locked in a dispute with a group of neighborhood residents over the future of his site, sent a worker there yesterday to dig up the community garden that local residents had planted on the property.

title: MORE GULF DATA ASKED BY BOLIVIA
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, May 12 (Reuters)Bolivia accepted today the word of the Gulf Oil Corporation that it did not bribe government officials here. but insisted on a full investigation of political contributions the company says it might have paid.

title: Critic's Notebook: Perils of a Danceror a Producer
description: Last month at the opening of a New York season of the Jose Limon Dance Company, a dancer dropped in her tracks, and the music petered to a halt as the curtain fell.

title: Hog Futures Advance by Daily Limit
description: Nearby hog and pork belly futures jumped the daily limits on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange yesterday, continuing a recent uptrend. The sharp increase reflected some tight inventory positions, along with buying to cover short positions.

title: W.H.A. Championship
description: Houston vs. Quebec May 3 Houston 6, Quebec 2. May 6Houston 5. Quebec 3. May 10Houston 2, Quebec 0. May 12Houston 7, Quebec 2. (Hous. won championship, 40).

title: Article 1  No Title
F.T.C. GUIDELINES END ON TEXTILE MERGERS
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (AP) The Federal Trade Commission announced today that it was abandoning its specific guidelines for deciding whether to challenge mergers in the textilemillproducts industry.

title: Charges Lodged Against Itkin In Informer Days Are Dismissed
description: Three indictments against Herbert Itkin, a 48yearold informer, were dismissed yesterday. Mr. Itkin helped convict a number of public officials, union officers and members of organized crime.

title: O.E.C.D. Finds Inflation Lag Outside Britain and Ireland
description: PARIS, May 12 (Reuters)Consumer prices are still rocketing in Britain and Ireland, but inflation is being checked in other major Western industrialized countries, according to the monthly inflation report compiled by the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development and released today.

title: Jobs And Crime (cont.)
description: Twice in recent weeks the notion has been put forward in this space that there is an important link between rising unemployment and rising crime rates. Prof. Lester Grinspoon and James B. Bakelar, research assistant, both of the Harvard Medical School, have provided a thoughtful response that concedes such a link but states that the relationship is more complex and ambiguous than suggested here.

title: DR. NIELS C. KLENDSHOJ
description: BUFFALO, May 12 (UPI) Dr. Niels C. Klendshoj, scientist and businessman, died today. He was 73 years old.

title: Joe Mooney, the Jazz Pianist, Organist and Singer, Dies at 65
description: Joe Mooney, a jazz pianist, organist, accordionist and singer who had an intensely loyal following among his fellow musicians, died yesterday at Las Olas Hospital in tFort Lauderdale, Fla. He was 65 years old.

title: People in Sports
description: Mike Marshall, the Los Angeles Dodgers' tireless relief pitcher who won the National League's Cy Young Award in 1974 after appearing in 106 games, has been placed on the 21day disabled list, retroactive to May 10. He will be eligible to pitch again on May 31.

title: Need for Jobs
description: The reality is that this metropolis has experienced a profound population exchange in the postwar period, with two million whites moving out and two million blacks and Puerto Ricans moving in. The result at this stage of the newcomers' absorption is a huge pileup of unskilled and undereducated workers in need of jobs.

title: Judge Voids a Sentence That Editor Fight Guns
description: JERSEY CITY, May 12 (AP)Judge Richard F. Connors, who ordered the editor of a Spanishlanguage paper who was convicted of a weapons charge to editorialize against the illegal use of guns, dropped that part of the sentence today.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
But the Lilies of the Field Do Toil
description: A paradox exists. There is compassion for Vietnamese children, Cambodian children, Korean children, while children in our population are invisible, ignored, abused. We talk of children's rights, assign law guardians to represent their Interests in the courts, yet curtail lunch programs, limit educational opportunities, eliminate housing resources, But even more than that, in some places we turn the family structure upside down. We make the child the wage earner and the parent the dependent.

title: Policeman Is Wounded
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., May 12 (UPI)Arnold Paul Fish Jr., a rookie policeman, was shot in the head early today by another officer as they celebrated completion of a sixmonth probation period for new officers. He is in serious condition at a Knoxville Hospital. Richard Rockwell was holding the revolver when it was discharged.

title: Stans Sentence Tomorrow
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (UP) Former Commerce Secretary Maurice H. Stans, who was Richard M. Nixon's chief political fundraiser in 1968 and 1972, will he sentenced Wednesday on a five count cam 1972. will he sentenced wednesday on a fivecount can paignfinance misdemeanor, ?? court spokesman said today Mr. Stars pleaded guilty March 12. Watergate prosecutors said each of the five counts carried a maximum $1,000 fine and one year in prison.

title: Princeton Accepts Two After Clerical Error
description: Two high school seniors, one of them adjudged academically unqualified to do Ivy League work, have been offered admission to Princeton because a college secretary mistakenly sent them notifications of acceptance.

title: North Korea Is Given Warning by Kissinger
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., May 13 (Reuters)  Secretary of State Kissinger said today it would be a mistake for North Korea to test the validity of the United States commitment to defend South Korea.

title: WINE TALK
description: Cyril Ray devotes con siderable space in his book on Chateau Lafite Rothschild to the regisseur of the chateau Andre Portet.

title: Onion Farmer's Plight Can Make You Cry
description: FLORIDA, N.Y.  Northwest winds swept across the Orange County muckland here, drying the work clothes on Mary Lysack's line and raising small dust swirls above her family's 75 acres of freshly planted onions.

title: SENATE PANEL ADDS $3.8BILLION TO BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (AP) The Senate Appropriations Committee approved a $15.1billion supplemental appropriations bill today after increasing it $3.8bililon above the House total.

title: RIGHTS PANEL ASKS EDUCATION SHIFT
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (AP) Children who speak a language other than English suffer educational disadvantages in American schools and they should be taught bilingually, the United States Civil Rights Commission said today.

title: CONGRESS ASKED FOR TRADE SHIFT
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (AP) The Ford Administration, citing the unsettling reaction in Latin America, called on Congress today to amend the United States Trade Act to permit the extension of tariff preferences to Venezuela and Ecuador.

title: HARRIET CHASAN, LED JERSEY CIVIC CAUSES
description: Harriet Werther Chasan of Jersey City and Deal, N.J., a well known civilrights worker, died here yesterday at Mount Sinai Hospital. She was 66 years old.

title: CORPORATE BONUS SNOW PRICE RISE
description: It was the corporate bond market's turn to cheer yesterday as investors not only gobbled up large new offerings but also were willing to pay a bit more for older issues. The Treasury debt market, for its part, turned quiet following the sharp price advances of last Monday. And the taxexempt market was again stagnant as bigcity fiscal problems remained a dominant factor.

title: Banks Rescued the City In a Similar Plight in '33
description: The fiscal corner that the city has painted itself into recalls the shaky autumn of 1933, in the midst of the Great Depression, when the banks finally bailed the city out, but imposed a series of stringent con ditions.

title: 24 Indians Freed of Charges In Wisconsin Abbey Seizure
description: Judge Gergen said that the complaint against the 24 was technically defective and dismissed charges without prejudice. He continued bail pending possible filing of new charges.

title: Milk Drinkers Will Take In Less Fat With Their Calcium
description: ALBANYStarting on July 1, the milk that New Yorkers drink will contain less butterfat, according to new proposed regulations governing the sale of milk prepared by the State Department of Agriculture and Markets.

title: Stamford Moves Ahead With Urban Renewall
description: STAMFORD, April 1Midway into its second decade, Stamford's $250million urban renewal project is forging ahead, creating a downtown that developers say will be a showcase for cities around the country to study and admire.

title: List of City Positions Due to Be Eliminated
description: Following is the budget bureau's list of employes to be dismissed by July 1: Police Department, 525. Fire Department, 332. Sanitation Department, 791. Environmental Protection Administration, 76.

title: MAN PLEADS GUILTY IN DIETPILL FRAUD
description: NEWARK (AP)A New York man pleaded guilty today to fattening his wallet by $1.1million by selling donothing diet pills.

title: A Cat Ruffles Feathers in Central Park Sanctuary
description: A small but peaceful haven for birds in Central Park is surrounded by a chain link fence with barbed wire at the top, and bears signs alerting any unauthorized person who enters into it that he will be subject to arrest.

title: WARWATERGATE TIE IS SEEN BY ZUMWALT
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (UPI) Adm. Elmo Zumwalt said today that President Richard M. Nixon's Watergate troubles forced him to back off from secret commitments made to South Vietnam in order to push the Paris peace accords.

title: Albus 70 Leading L.I. Open
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., May 13Jim Albus of La Tourette Country Club on Staten Island has suffered the pains of bursitis in his left shoulder so badly that he did not play any golf between last August and three weeks ago when he tried just to see what I could do.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BUFFALO, May 13 (AP)The Buffalo Braves, whose general manager, Eddie Donovan, left for a similar position with the New York Knicks, said today they would wait until Commissioner Walter Kennedy's term expires May 31 before filing tampering charges against the Knicks. Former Postmaster General Lawrence O'Brien succeeds Kennedy National Basketball Association commissioner. Donovan left the Braves last month.

title: The Empty Skyscraper
description: In the soaring skyscrapers that are the external symbol of New York's commercial greatness more than a tenth of the floor space is vacanta total of 27.5 million square feet of unfilled offices. By cutting rents to half or less their original level, operators of shiny new towers in midtown Manhattan made a modest dent in their backlog of surplus space in the last year, but much of their gain was at the expense of Lower Manhattan buildings.

title: Galen Stone Is Chosen To Be Envoy to Laos
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (UPI)President Ford today named Galen L. Stone as Ambassador to Laos. He Will replace Charles S. Whitehouse, named earlier to be Ambassador to Thailand.

title: What Kind of Dominoes?
description: PARISThe only thing we know so far about the validity of a dominoes theory in Southeast Asia is that South Vietnam and Cambodia have been conquered by revolutionary armies and Laos is falling over the brink.

title: Kissinger Firmer on Detente Line
description: Secretary of State Kissinger has been off in the American heartland giving speeches in an attempt to fill a policy vacuum left by the setbacks in Indochina and to shore up his political position in Washington.

title: Laird Expects Challenge to Rockefeller
description: WASHINGTON, May 13Melvin R. Laird, a political intimate of President Ford for more than 20 years, said today that the likeliest big fight at the Republican convention next year would involve a conservative challenge against Vice President Rockefeller's renomination.

title: Staying After SchoolJust for Fun
description: Staying after school never was considered much fun. But a dozen boys and girls, from 6 to 10 years old, have found that from 3 o'clock on can be one of the best times.

title: Music: Rare Bernstein
description: Some of Leonard Bernstein's best music was written for Broadway, so that it was a perfectly normal thing for the highminded Composers' Showcase to put together a program of his theater music for presentation in its series at the Whitney Museum on Monday night. The event proved to be so attractive to the public, with the promise that the composer would answer questions from the audience afterward, that it had to be given twice.

title: Rice Dishes From Scratch: Purer, Cheaper and Tastier
description: Several flavored rice mixtures have appeared on grocery shelves, but, with some exceptions, the saving in time is minimal and generally there is the same number of utensils to wash, whether starting from scratch or with a mix.

title: Guards Fire to Halt Fight Between Manson, 2 Others
description: FOLSOM, Calif., May 13 (UPI)  Shotgun shells were fired today to break up a fight between Charles M. Manson, the convicted mass murderer, and two other inmates in the exercise yard at Folsom State Prison.

title: Judge Approves Plan to End Chapter XI for Ancorp, Inc.
description: A plan of arrangement to end the Chapter XI proceedings of Ancorp National Services, Inc., has been approved by Federal Bankruptcy Judge Edward J. Ryan of the United States Court for the Southern District of New York, it was announced yesterday.

title: Article 1  No Title
STATE TO DISMISS GUARD WHO LIED
description: The State Correctional Services Department intends to dismiss a prison guard who has admitted that he falsely accused an inmate of striking another guard at the start of the Attica prison revolt in September, 1971.

title: Refugee Funds Bill Gains in House, but Encounters Delay in Senate
description: WASHINGTON, May 13A $405million spending bill to finance the resettlement of refugees from Indochina was quickly approved today by the House Appropriations Committee but encountered at least a week's delay in the Senate.

title: About New York
description: The sun washes Upper Broadway, warms old bones, relaxes knotted muscles, soothes troubled minds.

title: Sherry Wine Vinegar: A Luxury That Makes All the Difference
description: About 10 years ago In a restaurant in Spain, we tasted an excellent gazpacho unlike any sampled elsewhere in the world. We decided that the difference stemmed from the vinegar used and determined that it must have been made from Sherry wine. We brought back a bottle of vinegar made in Jerez, where Sherry is made, and used it on random occasions. As time passed, the bottle was empty and over the years it slipped from memory.

title: Turkish Premier Is Attacked By Man Using Brass Knuckles
description: ANKARA, Turkey, May 13 (AP)An assailant using brass knuckles attacked Premier Suleyman Demirel today and fractured the Premier's nose. A Government minister described the attack as an assassination attempt.

title: FORD WILL STUDY CITY AID REQUEST AND REPLY TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 President Ford said today that he would tell Mayor Beanie and Governor Carey within 24 hours whether the Federal Government would assist the city in its efforts to find $1.5billion to pay its bills through June 30.

title: WNET POSTPONES HARLEM PROGRAM
description: WNET/Channel 13 has postponed the telecast next Monday night of Harlem: Voices, Faces, a Swedishmade documentary that has provoked strong criticism from prominent blacks.

title: In Bid With Women To Consort, Lawyer Doggerels in Court
description: Harry H. Lipsig pleaded in rhyme yesterday to become a member of the Bronx Women's Bar Association.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: Marketing specialists of the United States Department of Agriculture contend that if consumers use the canned and frozen vegetable grades they can save money:

title: Plan Due to End Dumping Of Garbage in Meadows
description: LYNDHURST, N. J., May 13The Hackensack Meadowlands Development Commission is expected to unveil here tomorrow the details of a multimilliondollar construction program aimed at phasing out Northern New Jersey's longtime reliance on landfill dumps to dispose of its garbage.

title: To Halt Nuclear Spread
description: The threat of nuclear energy to mankind, recognized for three decades but still too little controlled, lies in its dual nature. Like fire, it can be used beneficially destructively. No task confronting the United States, the Soviet Union and other advanced nationswhich supply reactors, fissionable materials and other peaceful nuclear equipment to the worldis more important than heading off an accompanying spread of atomic weapons.

title: Conferees Agree On Housing Bill To Spur Economy
description: WASHINGTON, May 13House and Senate conferees said today that they had agreed on a housing bill aimed at producing 400,000 new homes and 800,000 new construction jobs.

title: Manner of Displaying Works Raises Vital Questions
description: The opening of the Robert Lehman Collection at the Metropolitan Museum of Art brings to the New York public a new and permanent installation of Old Master paintings, drawings and decorative objects of the most outstanding quality.

title: 16 East Harlem Families Must Evacuate Buildings
description: City inspectors have warned 16 families and five businesses in two buildings in East Harlem to move immediately because the structures are in imminent danger of collapse.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The New York Times of May 3, discussing laws to protect the handicapped from job discrimination, omitted Pennsylvania from the list of states that have such legislation. There are 23 such states, not 22, as the article stated.

title: A.T.&T. Is Penalized Anew for Job Bias
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The Government said today that most Bell System telephone Companies had failed to comply fully with the agreement they signed in 1973 to end employment discrimination.

title: Refugee Group Lands in South Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 13Nearly a thousand South Vietnam: se refugees arrived in Pusan this morning, 17 days after they fled Saigon aboard two South Korean naval vessels. Upon disembarkation, they were warmly received by hundreds of citizens and port officials in Pusan, which is 210 miles south of here.

title: About Education
description: Three City University social scientists have found statistical evidence to support what common sense would suggest: that the social and economic environment in which children grow up effects their performance in school.

title: SENATE ENDS BARS TO CONSUMER BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The Senate voted 71 to 27 today to limit debate on legislation that would create an independent Federal agency to represent the interests of consumers.

title: A World in Miniature
description: The show is called Miniatures and Delicate Objects, but if you think it's all about fragile watercolors, you're in for a wee bit of a surprise. This show, at the Fairtree Gallery, is a very contemporary crafts show, and the one thing everything has in common is minuscule size.

title: Kissinger Sees Atrocity In Events in Cambodia
description: ST. LOUIS, May 33 (AP)Secretary of State Kissinger says that Cambodia is carrying out an atrocity of major proportions by forced marches and executions.

title: FORD WILL STUDY CITY AID REQUEST AND REPLY TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 President Ford said today that he would tell Mayor Beame and Governor Carey within 24 hours whether the Federal Government would assist the city in its efforts to find $1.5billion to pay its bills through June 30.

title: Jailed Marcos Foe Plans to End Fast Begun 40 Days Ago
description: MANILA, May 13 (AP)Former Senator Benigno S. Aquino Jr. has decided to end his hunger strike against the Government of President Ferdinand E. Marcos, Mr. Aquino's wife said today.

title: Easing of Marijuana Law Is Deferred in Connecticut
description: HARTFORD, May 13 (AP)The Connecticut Senate decided today to wait until next year to consider decriminalizing marijuana.

title: Asian Crises Raise Question of Risk for Reporters
description: Since the days of Richard Harding Davis and young Winston Churchill, people have had the notion that reporters, and particularly foreign correspondents, live a life of dangerous glamour.

title: Promises, Promises!
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The United States isn't very good at handling defeat, probably because it hasn't had much practice. It has been excessively selfcritical about the collapse of Vietnam and Cambodia, and now our officials seem obliged to go around reassuring everybody that Uncle Sam is a stout and dependable fellow after all.

title: Pedestrian Critically Injured By a Falling Curtain Rod
description: A pedestrian was struck on the head by a falling curtain rod at Lexington Avenue and 73d Street yesterday afternoon, the police reported.

title: The American Guillotine: It Has a Benign Blade
description: STANFORD, Calif.Since lats 1974, when recession began to strain nubile and private budgets, a number of mayors and company presidents have hit on the scheme of saving money by forcing some employes into early retirement. Such retirement seems also an attractive way to spare the careers of vouneer workers.

title: Trimmings Supplier, Forgotten in Yonkers, Is Moving Back Here
description: In June, 1972, the Conso Products Company, a major trimmings supplier to the home furnishings and apparel trades, moved to a new building in suburban Yonkers made available through its parent company, the Consolidated Foods Corporation.

title: Kissinger Backs Parley On Raw Material Prices
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 Secretary of State Kissinger said today that the United States was ready to attend a new preparatory meeting for an international energy conference and to consider international arrangements covering the prices of raw materials on a casebycase basis.

title: Plan Drafted to End Dumping Of Garbage in Meadowlands
description: LYNDHURST, N. J., May 13The Hackensack Meadowlands Development Commission is expected to disclose tomorrow the details of a multimilliondollar construction program aimed at putting an end to Northern New Jersey's long reliance on landfill dumps to dispose of garbage.

title: Market Summary
description: Tuesday, May 13, 1975 AMERICAN EXCHANGE (Volume 2,781,145 shares)

title: Bulldozers, in a Switch, Improving Life for Wild Geese on Connecticut Island
description: ESSEX, Conn., April 8From the edge of Nott Island, a swampy, scrub  covered, windswept island in the Connecticut River across from here, a bulldozer roars into action and 100 wild Canada geese struggle laboriously into the air.

title: A.T.&T. Is Penalized Anew for Job Bias
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The Government said today that most Bell System telephone companies had failed to comply fully with the agreement they signed in 1973 to end employment discrimination.

title: Police Storm Occupied Plant in Montreal
description: MONTREAL, May 13 (UPI)Two hundred and fifty policemen early today stormed an aircraft plant occupied by strikers and freed 10 hostages who had been seized and held for four hours.

title: Many in Legislature Seeking Stricter Sentences for Youths
description: ALBANY, May 13The Legislature seems determined this year to deal more strictly with young criminals, who under present law are shielded from the state prison system up to age 16.

title: Iowa Town Honors Marine Slain in Vietnam
description: MARSHALLTOWN, Iowa, May 13The flag that Marine Lance Cpl. Darwin L. Judge gave his parents a memory or two ago hung limply today in the warm spring air over a new crop of golden dandelions bursting through the lush lawn in front of their modest green ranch house.

title: Vote on Hathaway Nomination Is Delayed by Senate Democrats
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The Democratic members of the Senate Interior Committee decided today in executive session to postpone until May 21 a vote on the nomination of Stanley K. Hathaway to be Secretary of the Interior.

title: Stacks Rise a Little As Volume Expands
description: The stock market made a small gain in accelerated trading yesterday, although adverse international news late in the session erased much of the earlier advance.

title: TASK FORCE TO CHURCHES IN NEED
description: The chairman of the City Planning Commission, John E. Zuccotti, said yesterday that a task force would be created to examine the plight of redundant religious properties in the citychurches and syna gogues that, because of changing neighborhoods and shifting populations, are underutilized and in financial trouble.

title: GUAM GOVERNOR VOICES CONCERN
description: AGANA, Guam, Wednesday, play 14Gov. Ricardo J. Bordello expressed concern yesterday, over the effects on public health here if, as now seems likely, large numbers of South Vietnamese refugees remain on this island a long time.

title: Iranian TakeOver
description: The Iranian Government has ordered that ownership of many industrial enterprises be placed in the hands of the populace. Page 57.

title: Books of The Times
description: ONE MAN, HURT. By Albert Martin. 278 pages. Macmillan. $8.95.

title: 1237,000 Jars of Coffee Recalled for Shortweight
description: General Foods Corporation of White Plains has recalled by letter 237,000 8ounce jars of Instant Yuban coffee because the jars are shortweight.

title: Montreal Olympics Troubled
description: QUEBEC, May 13 (UPI)Quebec Premier Robert Bourassa said today he would sacrifice the 1976 Montreal Olympics if necessary, to restore social order to the province.

title: 5 ASIAN NATIONS DISCUSS INDOCHINA
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, May 13Five Southeast Asian nations that have subscribed to the goal of the region's neutralization began their first highlevel meeting here today since the end of the Vietnam war with widely divergent ideas on how to approach the Communist regimes in Indochina.

title: Davis to Toin Steelers
description: PITTSBURGH, May 13 (UPI)  Dan Rooney, the Pittsburgh Steeler vice president, said today that Henry Davis, a linebacker, would rejoin the club when summer training begins. Davis suffered a neck injury against the Philadelphia Eagles during the third preseason game last year and missed the entire reaular season.

title: Singh Has Drill For Preakness
description: BALTIMORE, May 13 (UPI) Singh, who did not race in the Kentucky Derby, had a light workout today in preparation for Saturday's Preakness States.

title: Environmentalists Fight Schuler on U.S. Impact Bills
description: A group Including some of New York's most influential environmentalists is attempting to block proposed Federal legislation that they say will seriously impair the National Environmental Policy Act of 1970 and make New York vulnerable to poor planning in highway and other public works projects.

title: Refugee Departure From Pendleton Delayed by Security Checks, Hunt for Sponsors and Other Snags
description: CAMP PENDLETON, Calif., May 13The original optimistic timetable for moving refugees from Southeast Asia through this processing center was beins revised today.

title: BOB WILLS DIES; COUNTRY SINGER
description: FORT WORTH, May 13 (UPI), Bob Wills, founder of the Texas Playboys and originator of Western Swing country music, died today of bronchial pneumonia. He was 70 years old.

title: HOUSE UNIT BACKS DECONTROL OF OIL
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 The Administration won an important, unexpected and narrow victory tonight when a House subcommittee approved proposed legislation that would provide for the gradual decontrol of crude oil prices.

title: City Market Basket
description: The cost of feeding a family of four in New York City remained virtually unchanged last week, advancing only 0.1 per cent on the week, the city Department of Consumer Affairs reported yesterday.

title: SAIGON ANNOUNCES 30,000 ARE MOVED
description: The Saigon radio announced yesterday that 30,000 of the more than three million residents of the capital area had been moved southward to the Mekong delta.

title: 4 YOUTHS ARRESTED IN ARSON AT SCHOOL
description: Four youths were arrested yesterday and accused of the burning and burglary of Community School 6 in the West Farms section of the South Bronx last weekend, the police reported.

title: Controller Is Appointed By The New York Times
description: John Baka will join The New York Times Company on Friday as controller of The New York Times Newspaper Division. His appointment was announced yesterday by Walter E. Mattson, executive vice president of the company in charge of the division. son, executive vice president of the company in charge of the division.

title: Senate Votes Prohibition On Consumer Agency Plan
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (UPI) The Senate voted yesterday to prohibit a proposed consumerprotection agency from intervening in managementlabor disputes being mediated by Federal agencies.

title: EqualRights Amendment Is Released For a Final Floor Vote in State Senate
description: ALBANY, May 13With theaterful of women applauding or groaning according to preference, the proposed Equal Rights Amendment was released for final Senate floor action today after one of its chief women sponsors was crossexamined by a male colleague about its effects on marriage, the Boy Scouts and stag parties.

title: Earthquake Hits California
description: PASADENA, Calif., May 13 (UPI)A moderate earthquake rumbled through a strip of southern California more than 100 miles long last night, including the Los Angeles area, but apparently did no significant damage.

title: U.S. and Israel in Accord To Expand Economic Ties
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The United States and Israel announced agreement today on a package of economic accords and issued a statement opposing Arab boycotts of companies doing business with Israel.

title: After 3 Months, House Committee Selects Lawyer to Head Intelligence Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The House Select Committee on Intelligence, in its first formal action since it was set up three months ago, named today A Searle Field, a 30yearold Connecticut lawyer, to head its investigation of Federal intelligence.

title: Insider Views the Fed
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 Why shouldn't the Federal Reserve System's key Open Market Committee disclose its monthly decisions on monetary policy as soon as they are made? Why shouldn't Congress be told of the intermediateterm aim of policy that really countsthe sixmonth target for money supply growthinstead of the rather meaningless oneyear target just disclosed by Arthur F. Burns, the Reserve's chairman? are made? Why shouldn't Congress be told of the intermediateterm aim of policy that really countsthe sixmonth target for money supply growthinstead of the rather meaningless oneyear target just disclosed by Arthur F. Burns, the Reserve's chairman?

title: Court Aides Questioned in Escape Plot
description: The police yesterday questioned court and correction officers who were among the nearly 50 persons to have been in close contact with three convicted men who on Monday were handed explosives and knives with which to escape from the Criminal Courts Building.

title: Pilot ChildAbuse Program Started in Elizabeth
description: ELIZABETH, May 13 (AP)A pilot project intended to combat child abuse and neglect was officially begun here today, and state officials said they hoped it would serve as a model for similar programs throughout the state.

title: Iran and Pan American Near a $300Million Deal
description: Pan American World Airways is close to agreement with Iran on a $300million deal designed to solve the airline's immediate financial woes and provide time for a longterm solution, including a possible merger.

title: City Is Planning to Lay Off 1,000 Workers Tomorrow
description: The Beanie administration will begin tomorrow to lay off the first of 3.067 employes to be cut from the payrolls by July 1.

title: Gov. Brown Signs Bill Legalizing All Sex Acts
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., May 13 (UPI)A bill legalizing all sex acts between consenting adults in private was signed last night by Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr.

title: People and Business
description: This year's prospects are reasonably good. J.T. Lykes Jr., chairman of the LykesYoungstown Corporation told stockholders yesterday at their annual meeting in New Orleans.

title: HOUSE UNIT ACTS ON BANKING BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (AP) Big banks would be required to disclose how they allocate credit within eight major categories under a compromise bill approved today by the House Banking Committee.

title: Mrs. Giscard Gives Awards to Donors Of Gala for Ravel
description: AnneAymone Giscard d'Estaing, wife of President Valry Giscard d'Estaing of Franc. who is here on a private visit to attend the New York City. Ballet's Ravel Festival gala benefit, dropped into the French Embassy's cultural division here yesterday to honor contributors to the festival.

title: Grand Design Puts Focus on Court
description: Architecturally, at least, there has been no attempt made to deny the fact that the Robert Lehman Collection is the centerpiece of the Metropolitan Museum's $50million expansion. The new wing has been placed directly on the axis of the museum's main entrance, and will also serve as the focal point of the vast additions now under construction along the west side of the museum building. The wing is not smallits glasscovered central garden court, while nowhere near the museum's Great Hall in size, is nonetheless more than twothirds the height of the central space of the Guggenheim Museum.

title: HOUSE UNIT DELAYS VOTE ON TELEVISING
description: WASHINGTON, May 13For the third time in a month the House Rules Committee today put off a vote no a measure that would permit the televising of the floor proceedings of the House of Representatives.

title: Red Smith
description: About halfway down the bench, a brown stain darkened the spikescarred boards of the dugout floor. A ballplayer sits here, said Frank Graham, then sports columnist on The New York JournalAmerican. When Frank was young man covering the New York Giants, there were stains like that the whole length of the dugout, for these were the old Giants, the swashbuckling crew that went cutting and slashing through the National League at the heels of their truculent leader, John McGraw. They were whiskydrinking, pokerplaying, tobaccochewing sinners, and even the writers who traveled with them carried cut plug or a pack of Beech Nut as stock equipment along with their scorebooks and typewriters. It curdles the blood to think of McGraw's reaction if he had seen one of his company blowing a sickly pink balloon of bubble gum as he knelt in the ondeck circle.

title: Iran and Pan American Near a $300Million Deal
description: Pan American World Airways is close to agreement with Iran on a $300million deal designed to solve the airline's immediate financial woes and provide time for a longterm solution, including a possible merger.

title: Article 3  No Title
Equal Rights Amendment Rejected by Illinois Panel
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., May 131 (UPI)An Illinois Senate committee rejected today the proposed equal rights amendment to the Constitution despite an appearance on its behalf by Alan Alda, star of the television series M*A*S*H.

title: City Note Trade Quiet Pending News of Talks
description: New York City bonds and notes traded inactively and prices changed little yesterday as the market awaited news from Mayor Beame's meeting with President Ford in Washington.

title: U.S. Aide Doubts Nixon Tapes Will Be Made Public Until 1977
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (UPI) Former President Richard M. Nixon's Watergate tapes and documents probably will not be made public until 1977, the chief of the General Services Administration testified today.

title: MEXICAN BUSINESS IN POLITICAL MOVE
description: MEXICO CITY, May 13The conservative forces of private enterprise have joined the complex political battle to determine the choice of a successor to President Luis Echeverria Alzarez.

title: 63% RATERISE FOUND ON BIG ELECTRIC USE
description: A survey of the nation's 24 largest electric utilities has found that electric rates for industrial and large commercial users rose on the average of 63.1 per cent during the 18month period ended in December, while residential rates rose 37.5 per cent.

title: State Shield Law for Newsmen Is Being Tested in Fresno Case
description: FRESNO, Calif., May 8Four employes of The Fresno Bee are under contempt citations for rerusing to tell a Superior Court judge how they got access to a transcript of grand jury testimony that the judge had ordered kept secret.

title: Japanese Fearful of Conflict in Korea
description: TOKYO, May 13A Japanese official, asked what longTun impact the fall of Indochina would have on Japan, jabbed the air slightly with his chopsticks and shot out a oneword answer: Korea.

title: Bolshoi's Sleeping Beauty Dazzles
EXCITY AIDE HELD IN PERJURY CASE
description: A former city official now in private law practice was arrested yesterday on charges of committing perjury during an investigation by Special State Prosecutor Maurice H. Nadjari of a reported attempt to fix a criminal case.

title: Hargrave Is GoggleEyed At First Riding Triumph
description: Kenneth L. Hargrave, a 22yearold apprentice jockey from the Cajun country of Louisiana, scored the first victory of his career on Aqueduct's sloppy track yesterday and conceded he couldn't see a thing through the entire stretch run. The triumph, in the day's first race, also marked the first success of Hargrave's mount, the $21.20for$2 Herrenfriseur. The 4yearold, owned and trained by Nick Combest, had been unable to win in 23 previous races.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A judge, accusing Governor Byrne of setting himself above the courts, has overturned Mr. Byme's recent order that a West Long Branch man be freed on bail pending appeal of extradition. In a ruling in Freehold on Monday, Superior Court Judge Patrick J. McGann Jr. held that Mr. Byrne had acted illegally in directing that Neil J. Lucas, 23 years old, be released on $20,000 bail pending the outcome of an appeal. Mr. Lucas is wanted in Las Vegas, Nev., on a creditcard fraud charge. He has been in the Monmouth County Jail since November, when Judge McGann ordered him extradited to Nevada. Mr. Lucas appealed the order, and the Appellate Division of Superior Court granted a stay of extradition.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A New Jersey appeals court ruled in Trenton that the use of quotas to correct previous discriminatory hiring practices against minority workers was itself discriminatory and unconstitutional, and was not to be enforced by the state. The ruling, which deals with a suit over hiring practices of the Montclair Fire Department, appeared to counter directly a ruling in Newark on Friday. In that case, a Federal judge upheld an affirmative action program implemented by an electrical workers' union.

title: Cambodia Said to Expel The Entire French Clergy
description: French bishops and priests who led the Catholic church in Cambodia have all been expelled from the country, a church official here said yesterday.

title: New Bond Issues
description: UTILITY BONDS

title: TU144 WILL FLY TO PARIS AIR SHOW
description: MOSCOW, May 13The Soviet Union will fly its modified version of the TU144 supersonic transport to Paris for display at the International Air Show at the end of this month, it was reported today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, MAY 14, 1975

title: Appeals Court Rejects a Hiring Quota To Assist Minorities as Discriminatory
description: ??WARK, May 13A New Jersey appeals court ruled today that the use of quotas to correct previous discriminatory hiring practices against minority workers was itself discriminatory and unconstitutional, and was not to be enforced by the state.

title: Flyers Capture Seventh Game, 41, and Foil Islander Comeback
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 13The inspiring saga of the threeyearold New York Islanders came to a close tonight as the Philadelphia Flyers finally let out the tiger and roared into the Stanley Cup finals with a 41 victory.

title: High Cost of Energy
description: The high cost of shelter for householders and business alike is pushed higher still by electric rates well above those that prevail in any other community. No city is more dependent on electric power than New York, making Consolidated Edison, the monopoly supplier, as vital an element in the wellbeing of the metropolis as City Hall.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Seizure of Vessel Called Shattering By Crewman's Wife
description: Marion Bock of Bogota, N.J., has known the lonely life of a seaman's wife during her 30 seaman's wife during her 30 married years. She has learned to fill the voids of time between voyages. She knits, collects stamps and watches TV.

title: Connors Leaving For Play in Europe
description: Jimmy Connors is going to Europe next week to prepare for the defense of his Wimbledon title June 23, but he won't be laying his reputation on the line in two of the toughest claycourt championships, the Italian open May 26 and the French open June 4. He has never won those.

title: PRICES ARE HIGHER ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the Amex and in the overthecounter market rose yesterday. Trading on the Amex rose slightly but fell in the counter market.

title: New Law Is Dislodging C.I.A.'s Secrets
description: WASHINGTON, May 13Applications under the Freedom of Information Act are slowly beginning to dislodge documents from the Central Intelligence Agency, and tidbits from the agency's secret files are floating all over Washington.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: The fiscal corner that the city has painted itself into recalls the shaky autumn of 1933, in the midst of the Great Depression, when the banks finally baled the city out, but imposed a series of stringent con ditions.

title: Notes on People
description: Something has gone out of my life, Melville H. Cane, the 96yearold lawyer and poet, said yesterday following his resignation after 40 years on the board of Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, Inc. Mr. Cane, who prepared the publishing company's incorporation papers in 1919, knew its late founder's, Alfred Harcourt and Donald Brace, at Columbia College, where he graduated in 1900 before attending the Columbia Law School.

title: American Stays Behind To Aid Saigon's Children
description: Richard Hughes, who went to Saigon, seven years ago as a freelance journalist, but decided that the suffering of the street children there was more important to him than writing, is still in the streets of Saigon with those children.

title: Taiwan's Future
description: KEARNY, N.J.President Ford scheduled to visit China this fall. Undoubtedly the Taiwan issue will again be raised at the highest level, and a compromise might be worked out in the process of improving diplomatic relations between the United States and China.

title: No Mayday for Brokers' Stocks
description: Stockbrokers had plenty of reason to sing the blues last year and, perhaps, to feel that it would be the beginning of the end when they would have to unfix brokerage commission rates on May 1.

title: DOLLAR AND POUND DECLINE SHARPLY
description: PARIS, May 13The dollar sand the pound declined sharply in turbulent foreignexchange markets today. European bankers cited the financial problems of New York City as one of the depressing influlences on the dollar.

title: EqualRights Bill Gains in Albany
description: With a theater of women applauding or groaning according to preference, the proposed Equal Rights Amendment to the New York State Constitution was released for final State Senate floor action after one of its chief female sponsors was crossexamined by a male colleague about its effects on marriage, the Boy Scouts and stag parties.

title: DOUBT IS VOICED ON KISSINGER PLAN
description: The United States willingness to consider commodity price pacts, offered by Secretary of State Kissinger in a speech in Kansas City yesterday, is not expected to mollify the poorer nations or bring stability to markets for raw materials, in the view of commodity specialists here.

title: Parents March in Newark On the 4th Day of Boycott
description: NEWARK, May 13 (UPI)Parents and students, angered by planned teacher layoffs and curriculum cuts, rallied in front of City, Hall and blocked traffic today, the fourth day of class boycotts and demonstrations.

title: JOSEPH CANCELLARE, A PHOTOGRAPHER, 73
description: Joseph T. Cancellare, a ship news photographer for 58 years for newspapers and the travel industry, died Monday at the Cabrini Health Care Center. He was 73 years old and lived in Queens Village.

title: State of the City: Housing and Energy
description: The time has come for the city or state to take over all rentcontrolled apartments. We are not asking for any cash, just mortgages covering the condemnation value of our property.

title: MANY PORTUGUESE DEPART FOR BRAZIL
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, May 13 (AP)Thousands of Portuguese refugees, fleeing political and economic change at home, are streaming into Brazil and crowding Into relatives' homes or hotels.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: SEOUL TIGHTENS POLITICAL CURBS
description: SEOUL, Souh Korea, May 13 The South Korean Government today outlawed all opposition to the Constitution and criticism of it.

title: Redskins' Allen and Raiders' Madden Answer Charges of ExQuarterbacks
description: George Allen, coach of the Washington Redskins, was disappointed in the recent conduct of Sonny Jurgenson, his former quarterback. John Madden, coach of the Oakland Raiders, said he did not especially enjoy being criticized by Daryle Lamonica, his former quarterback. Bud Grant, coach of the Minnesota Vikings, said that the way salaries were going in pro football, scales and ceilings might have to be set because the players have so little sense of loyalty. Rick Forzano, coach of the Detroit Lions said that he was out talking to luncheon clubs selling his team and trying to make friends with lienated sports writers.

title: Low Turnout Spurs Moves to Alter School Voting
description: The low voter turnout in last week's citywide school electiona little less than 10 per cent of all those eligible votedhas spurred new moves for a reexamination of a reexamination of the process for selecting community school board members.

title: Kate Smith Calls the Tune For Islanders' Swan Song
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 13 The New York Islanders' miracle ended tonight. There were a lot of reasons: the law of averages, the Philadelphia Flyers' special meeting, Rick MacLeish's three goals, the rabid fans, home ice, Denis Potvin's five penalties. But maybe most of all, it was Kate Smith, in person.

title: U.S. PACIFIC FORCE PLACED ON ALERT IN SEIZURE OF SHIP
description: WASHINGTON, May 13United States marines, warships and planes have been placed on alert in the western Pacific following the seizure of an American merchant ship yesterday by Cambodian gunboats, Administration officials said today.

title: Manner of Displaying Works Raises Vital Questions
description: The opening of the Robert Lehman Collection at the Metropolitan Museum of Art brings to the New York public a new and permanent installation of Old Master paintings, drawings and decorative objects of the most outstanding quality.

title: Beame Projects a Rise In Revenue for 197576
description: Mayor Beame has given Governor Carey revenue estimates that indicate optimism for a mild upturn in the city's economy during the fiscal year starting July 1.

title: POLLUTION PANEL ASKS FUNDS SHIFT
description: TRENTON, May 13A proposal by the Department of Environmental Protection to shift funds for water pollution control from rural and suburban projects to those in the state's cities was praised as courageous by a combination of leading environmentalists and spokesmen for the cities at a public hearing held here at Rider College today by the department's Division of Water Resources.

title: City Note Trade Quite Pending News of Talks
description: New York City bonds and notes traded inactively and prices changed little yesterday as the market awaited news from Mayor Beam's meeting with President Ford in Washington.

title: OIL TANKER, ABLAZE, SINKING OFF SAN JUAN
description: SAN JUAN, P.R. May 13 (UPI)  A Greek tanker was afire and sinking GO mile northwest of Puerto Rico today, and the Coast Guard warned that thousands of gallons of crude oil might be spilled on the northeastern shores of the Dominican Republic.

title: Muskie Assails Ford Policy On Testimony by His Aides
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (UPI) Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, accused President Ford today of adopting a ridiculous policy whereby Administration witnesses have been forbidden to appear at Congressional hearings simultaneously with their critics.

title: Chrysler Agrees to Meet With Volkswagen's Chief
description: DETROIT, May 13  The Chrysler Corporation today anrounced plans for a meeting here later this month of officials of the company and of Volkswagen, which has indicated interest in building cars in the United States.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, MAY 14, 1975

title: Speculum Musicae Plays Superb Music Superbly
description: Speculum Musicac, that extraordinary group of young newmusic virtuosos, ended on Monday its series of three Hunter College concerts, presented under the auspices of Young Concert Artists. If the program contained no surprises in terns of the sort of repertory Speculum usually plays, it did offer some superb music, superbly played.

title: Angels' Ryan Holds Yanks To 2 Singles in 50 Victory
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 13 Nolan Ryan added to the New York Yankees' miseries tonight when he stopped them on two singles while pitching the California Angels to a 50 victory that buried the Yankees deeper into last place.

title: Narrowing the Options
description: Bouncing from Washington to Albany to Washington in a frantic and apparently futile search for new financial aid, Mayor Beame has just about exhausted every hope for fiscal salvation for this hardpressed city, save one. That is the still unrealized opportunity for drastic economies at City Hall to bring an end to more than a decade of runaway spending and unbalanced budgets.

title: Silence in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Wednesday, May 14Officials of the State and Defense Departments refused to comment early today on reports that at least 800 United States marines had arrived in Thailand in response to the seizure of an American container ship by the Cambodian Communists.

title: Advertising
description: People think that we're conservative, but we're branching out, said Peter Ford McSpadden, since October president and chief administrative officer of DancerFitzgeraldSample.

title: George Vaught, Producer, Dies; Won Emmy for Nixon China Trip
description: George H. Vaught, a former radio and television network producer here and in Chicago, whose coverage of former President Nixon's China trip in 1972 won an Emmy Award for ABC News, died Monday after a brief illness at Greenwich (Conn.) Hospital. He was 46 years old and lived at Weavers' Hill, Glenville, Conn., and in Medina. Tex.

title: Veto of Farm Bill Upheld In House on 245182 Votel
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 The first attempt by the 94th Congress to override a White House veto failed today as 71 House Democrats crossed party lines and voted to sustain President Ford's objections to the emergency farm bill.

title: Italy Has Payments Surplus
description: ROME, May 10 (Reuters)Italy had a surplus in her balance of payments in March for the first time since August, 1974, according to provisional figures released by the Bank of Italy today. The surplus was $10.1million.

title: Pacetta, at Own Request, Goes Before Grand Jury
description: Albert S. Pacetta, a member of the State Human Rights Appeals Board, was questioned yesterday by a Queens County grand jury investigating charges that he had solicited a bribe of $30,000 from a physician in a discrimination case.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Consumerism and the President
description: Passage by the Senate of the bill to create a Federal agency, for consumer advocacy, all but assured now because of the successful Senate closure vote yesterday, places Pesident Ford in direct confrontation with the country's consumer forces. While he has not said he will veto the bill, he has urged postponement of action to pass it, citing reasons of economy and an alternative program he has developed.

title: Banks Rescued the City In a Similar Plight in '33
description: Banks Rescued the City In a Similar Plight in '33

title: N.B.A. Will Stage Draft on May 29
description: The National Basketball Association announced yesterday that the 1975 college draft would be held Thursday, May 29, via a telephone conference call to member cities. The Atlanta Hawks, who won the right to draft first following a coin flip with the Los Angeles Lakers, will open the draft at 2 P.M. New York time. The Lakers pick second.

title: Lebanon's Cabinet Shaken By 4 More Resignations
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 13 (UPI)Four more cabinet members have resigned in Lebanon, leaving Premier Rashid alSolh's Government with only five ministers. Beirut newspapers said today that he would resign before the end of the week.

title: Veto of Farm Bill Upheld In House on 245182 Vote
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The first attempt by the 94th Congress to override a White House veto failed today as 71 House Democrats crossed party lines and voted to sustain President Ford's objections to the emergency farm bill.

title: CAMBODIA REPORTED REVIVING INDUSTRY
description: HONG KONG, May 13 (UPI) The North Vietnamese press agency said today that Cambodia's new Government has instituted a day and night program to rebuild industrial plants in Phnom Penh.

title: Nobody is Safe
description: CORNING, N.Y., May 13 (UPI)Karen Murphy, 20 years old, became Corning's first woman police officer this month, only to have her own apartment robbed of $200 several days later. Cindy Lou Hermann, 19, was arraigned today on a charge of petit larceny in connection with the theft.

title: Iran Government Acts to Place Industry in Hands of the Populace
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 13The Government has moved to implement a decree by Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi of Iran ordering that ownership of 49 per cent of many private Iranian industrial enterprises and 99 per cent of many Government  owned concerns be placed in the hands of the Iranian populace.

title: Bridge:
description: A foursome that included three of the reigning Vanderbilt champions squeezed through to victory in the fourth and last of the Lancia qualifying contests in Miami during the weekend, thus becoming entitled to meet the Italian touring team of international stars later this month.

title: Dealers Offering A.T.&T. Shares at $52 Net
Iowa Town Honors Marine Slain in Vietnam
description: MARSHALLTOWN, Iowa, May 13The flag that Marine Lance Cpl. Darwin L. Judge gave his parents a memory or two ago hung limply today in the warm spring air over a new crop of golden dandelions bursting through the lush lawn in front of their modest green ranch house.

title: California Farm Bill Backed By Panel as Unionists Fight
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., May 13 (UPI)An Assembly committee, beset by chanting, scuffling farm workers belonging to rival unions, approved today Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr.'s bill to quell farm labor strife which has troubled California for a decade.

title: BELLEVUE CONFIRMS TIETO HEADHUNTER
description: Bellevue Hospital confirmed yesterday that for the last two years it had cooperated with a socalled headhunter who placed patients in nursing homes for a fee.

title: OFFER INCREASED BY SCHLUMBERGER
description: Schlumberger, Ltd., a company serving the petroleum industry, announced yesterday that it was increasing its tender offer for all the common shares of the Sanramo Electric Comparry to $23 a share from the $20 a share offered on May 7. With approximately 2.7 million Sangamo Electric shares outstanding, the value of the new offer would exceed $62million.

title: Open Interest
description: (In contract Monday)

title: Colonels Down Pacers, 12094
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 13 AP)The Kentucky Colonels routed the Indiana Pacers, 12094, tonight in the opening game of the American Basketball Association final playoffs.

title: U.S.Soviet Space Mission Simulation Runs Into a Communications Problem
description: HOUSTON, May 13 (UPI)Two Soviet astronauts simulated today their launching into orbit for this summer's joint mission with an American crew, but a technical problem prevented observers in the Mission Control Center here from hearing them.

title: Boston Mayor Booed By Basing Opponents
description: BOSTON, May 13 (AP)Mayor Kevin H. White faced a noisy crowd of school busing opponents in South Boston tonight and told them. You're telling me by your boos that this isn't a country of law.

title: EXCANDIDATE SUING I.R.S. IN '72 BREAKIN
description: MIAMI, May 13Evelio Estrella, a former Republican Congressional candidate whose offices were broken into in 1972, filed a $1million lawsuit in United States District Court today against the Internal Revenue Service, saying it was responsible for the breakin and was keeping some of his property illegally.

title: Kissinger Backs Parley On Raw Material Prices
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 Secretary of State Kissinger said today that the United States was ready to attend a new preparatory meeting for an international energy conference and to consider international arrangements covering the prices of raw materials on a casebycase basis.

title: Tornado Kills 2 in Texas, Damaging City Extensively
description: COLEMAN, Tex., May 13 (UPI)A tornado struck here here late today, killing two persons, injuring several and causing extensive damage in the southern section of the city in central Texas.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in The New York Times of May 3, discussing laws to protect the handicapped from job discrimination, omitted Pennsylvania from the list of states that have such legislation. There are 23 such states, not 22, as the article stated.

title: Concert
description: Composers Theater is an organization that has, according to its own figures, presented 335 works by 195 Americans during the last 10 years. On Monday night, in the first of two programs by the group this month at Alice Tully Hall, that impressive total was raised by five. Alvin Brehm conducted the Composers Festival Orchestra throughout in an unobtrusively competent fashion.

title: Peru Expropriates Gulf Oil Subsidiary
description: LIMA, Peru, May 13 (UPI)The Peruvian military Government today ordered the expropriation of the Gulf Oil Corporation's small subsidiary in Peru. The Government's com muniqu accused Gulf of notorious immoral conduct in paying bribos to officials of LatinAmerican countries.

title: NEW STAR FOUND IN ICE CRYSTALS
description: An astronomer has discovered that what appears to be newly forming star is enveloped in a dense cloud of ice crystals, the Univeristy of California at Berkeley announced yesterday.

title: City Is Flanning to Lay Off 1,000 Workers Tornorrow
description: The Beame administration will begin tomorrow to lay off the first of 3,067 employes to be cut from the payrolls by July 1.

title: AMTRAK FUND BILL SENT TO PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (UPI) The Senate passed and sent to the White House today hill allocating $1.12billion to run the National Rail Passenger Corporation through October, 1977.

title: Cubs Are Helped By Rolling Stone
description: Steve Stone is one of the reasons the longshot Chicago Cubs lead the National League East, have the best winning percentage in the major leagues and are early season candidates for Ripley's Believe It or Not.

title: Honduras Confirms Payment of a Bribe By United Brands
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, May 13 (AP)A Honduran investigating commission says it has confirmed that the United Brands Company paid a bribe to get officials to reduce the Honduran export tax on bananas. But it would not say who got the money.

title: Israeli Says Jordanians Move Tanks to Plain Along Frontier
description: TEL AVIV, May 13Deense Minister Shimon Peres said today that the Jordanian Army had advanced tanks to the plain on the eastern bank of the Jordan River in the last few days.

title: ABCTV Will Abandon Dual Anchorman Form
description: ABCTV announced yesterday that starting next fall it would abandon the dual anchorman format of its weeknight newscast. Harry Reasoner, based in New York, will be the sole anchorman, while Howard K. Smith, based in Washington, will be the only commentator.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: WHEELER DEAL Cyclists who rent vehicles from the four or five bicycle shops along the West Side area off Central Park might care to check Bicycle Renaissance (7242350) for some bonuses during this pedaling weather. As a rental inducement, this fiveyearold bike shop, one of the larger ones with a wide assortment of selections, is offering free lunches and movie tickets on weekends at 505 Columbus Avenue (between 84th and 85th Streets, a block from the Park).

title: The 3Year Rise of Islanders: From Misfits to Contenders
description: In the lonely hours before last night's improbable seventh game against the Philadelphia Flyers, someone asked the Islanders' general manager whether he cared if Kate Smith sang at the Spectrum.

title: Herald Tribune's Files Going to Queens Library
description: The morgue of The New York Herald Tribune15 million cross  indexed clippings dating to 1927has been donated to the Queens Borough Public Library, which plans to microfilm the decaying files and make them available to the public.

title: Radio Free Europe Plans To Reduce Its Staff by 100
description: MUNICH, West Germany, May 13 (Reuters)Radio FITT. Europe. the Americanfinanced station broadcasting to Eastern Europe, announced here today that it would dismiss about 100 members of its staff to save money.

title: Corn and Soybeans Advance, Spurred By Large Exports
description: Corn and soybean prices advanced on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday, partly because of substantial exports and a tightsupply situation in the Chicago area and partly because of the continued impact of the Cambodian crisis.

title: A Giant Misses Buddies
description: Throughout the years in sports there have been cries of break up the Yankees and break up the Celtics and break up the Packers. These teams, of course, had long strings of success.

title: Ashe Upset By Stone in Las Vegas
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 13 (AP)Unseeded Allan Stone of Australia upset fourthseeded Arthur Ashe, 46, 76, 64, in a first round match of the $150,000 Alan King tennis tournament today.

title: G.O.P. in Albany Skeptical of Rise in Commuter Tax
description: ALBANY, May 13Mayor Beame's proposal to double the New York City commuter tax would never pasis the Legislature, influential Republicans said today.

title: G.O.P. in Albany Doubts Rise in Commuter Tax
description: ALBANY, May 13  Mayor Beame's proposal to double the New York City commuter tax would never pass the Legislature, influential Republicans said today.

title: Nader Assails Oil Decontrol
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (AP) Ralph Nader, told the Federal Energy Administration today that its planned decontrol of domestic oil prices could add up to 3 percentage points to the rate of inflation and wipe out the economic stimulus of the recent tax cut.

title: Loews's Earnings Advance 6.3%
East Siders' Group Unites to Oust A Peep, Show and Pornography Parlor
description: Just after Christmas, a peep show and pornographic bookstore moved into the ground floor at No. 714, near 58th Street. With two socalled massage parlors already on the second and third floors of the building, Mrs. Holloway had come to call 714 a triple threat to her neighborhood.

title: Modern Museum Honors 2 Who Led It
description: With words of tribute by Vice President Rockefeller, the Museum of Modern Art last night unveiled a pair of plaques naming exhibition galleries after two key figures in its development: Alfred H. Barr Jr., its first director, and his successor, the late Rend d'Harnoncourt.

title: Radio: WOR Series Scans Pages of New Yorker
description: With the television schedule generally duller than usual these days, as reruns sink silently into the electronic ooze, it may be time once again to consider notions of radio. The box of sounds is forever in the process of being rediscovered. The process, in fact, has become the message about radio.

title: Stage: Rodgers & Hart on Broadway
LAWYERS ASSAIL STRIKING DOCTORS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 13 (UPI)A spokesman for 25,000 lawyers said today that a physiclans' strike over soaring malpractice  insurance premiums was part of a multimilliondollar propaganda campaign.

title: SENATE ENDS BARS TO CONSUMER BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The Senate voted 71 to 27 today to limit debate on legislation that would create an independent Federal agency to represent the interests of consumers.

title: New Lehman Win's Architecture and Art: 2 Appraisals
