description: BALTIMORE, May 15The draw today for post position for the 100th running of the Preakness pleased most of the trainers who represent the entrants in the race. The second leg of the Triple Crown, between the Kentucky Derby and the Belmont Stakes on June 7, the Preakness will have a field of 10 and is expected to attract a throng of 70,000 to Pimlico on Saturday.

title: Loss of Tin Cup May Aid Beame
description: Paradoxical as it seems. President Ford's rejection of Mayor Beame's plea for help in bridging the city's cashflow crisis may be of more help to the Mayor than the assistance the President did not provide. The rejection closed, in a dramatic, wellpublicized and apparently final way. one of the dwindling number of alternatives to what fiscal experts see as the only real solution to the crisismassive cuts in spending that will permit Mr. Beame to bring in a balanced budget for the new fiscal year beginning July 1.

title: Former Official Freed
description: LISBON, May 15Dr. Alberto Franco Nogueira, Foreign Minister under the Salazar and Caetano regimes, has been released from Caxias prison, near Lisbon, it was confirmed here.

title: Beame Is Accused Of Sexism in Hiring By Mrs. Greitzer
description: Councilwoman Carol Greitzer, DemocratLiberal of Manhattan, charged yesterday that the appointment of women to top positions by the Beame administration was only slight improvement over the eightyear record of former Mayor John V. Lindsay.

title: SENATORS DELAY REFUGEE AID BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The Senate today postponed until tomorrow action on authorizing a $405million resettlement program for Vietnamese and Cambodian refugees. The move could delay final approval of the legislation until early next week.

title: The Mountains of Waste
description: After inordinate delay, the city appears to be moving toward a possible solution of its staggering waste disposal problem. New York generates about 30,000 tons of garbage and other waste dailymore than London, Paris and Tokyo combined. Oldstyle landfill operations have long since loaded available waste land far beyond reasonable capacitythe Bronx dump near Pelham Bay Park now towers to the height of a tenstory building.

title: Legislature May Adjourn Until Fall, Avoiding Limits on a Special Session
description: ALBANY, May 15Bipartisan sources said today that this long, slow session of the Legislature would be probably subjected to an unusual ending next monththat it would be adjourned until late fall with the lawmakers returning on their own authority, not the Governor's, to face such posible issues as taxation and other items they have chosen to put off.

title: BUICK TO INCREASE ITS PRICES ON OPELS
description: DETROIT, May 15  The Buick division of the General Motors Corporation said today that it was raising the prices of the 1975 Opel by an average of 14.S per cent, or $487, over the 1974 model.

title: Colonels Edge Pacers, Lead, 20
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 15 (UPI)Artis Gilmore hooked in the winning basket with two seconds to play and the officials nullified a 40foot shot by Bill Keller right after the final buzzer tonight as the Kentucky Colonels gained a 9593 victory over the Indiana Pacers and a 20 lead in the American Basketball Association's final playoffs.

title: U.S. Action Backed in Europe, But Some See Gunboat Politics
description: LONDON, May 15The freeing of the American vessel Mayagez was generally approved in Western Europe today but viewed as an effort by Washington to compensate for the recent defeats in Indochina.

title: Cardinal Mindszenty Buried In Austria, Scene of Exile
description: MARIAZELL, Austria, May 15 (Reuters)Jozsef Cardinal Mindszenty, former Roman Catholic Primate of Hungary, was buried here today.

title: Favorable Report on Payments Balance Was Early Spur
description: The stock market finished lower in heavy trading yesterday despite some encouraging economic and international news.

title: Husband and Wife Accused of Making Slugs for Subway
description: A husband and wife were accused yesterday of trying to beat inflation by manufacturing hundreds of thousands of inflation beaters,slugs that could be used as subway tokens.

title: U.S.SOVIET CREWS PRACTICE LINKUP
description: HOUSTON, May 15 (UPI)Two Soviet astronauts, practicing for this summer's joint SoVietAmerican space flight, pretended today to link their ship to an American Apollo orbiting the earth.

title: Open Interest
description: (In contract Wednesday)

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: She ran from her affluent family a few months ago, a 16yearold fleeing in a car that her boyfriend rented as part of the escape plan. They raced to the airport, where the girl bought a ticket under an assumed name and flew to California. She was afraid that if her father caught her he would kill her, literally.

title: Notes on People
description: Representative Paul N. Mc. Closkey Jr., the California Republican who challenged Richard M. Nixon's bid for reelection in 1972, has hired Egil Krogh Jr., former head of the Nixon White House plumbers unit and one of the first Watergate figures to enter prison, as his new legislative assistant.

title: SCHANBERG GETTING SPECIAL POLK AWARD
description: The journalism department of Long Island University an nounced yesterday it was giving a special George Polk Me morial award to Sydney H. Schanberg, the correspondent of The New York Times who remained in Cambodia to report on the fall of Phnom Penh to the Khmer Rouge.

title: Bill Limiting Employes Of White House Gains
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UPI)The House Civil Service Committee sent to the floor today a bill that would restrict the number of employes the White House can have and how much the President can pay them,

title: A.B.A. Championship
description: Indiana vs. Kentucky

title: 2 Legislators Are Indicted In Illinois Extortion Case
description: CHICAGO, May 15 (UPI)A Federal grand jury today indicted two Illinois Republican legislators and two former officials of the State Department of Labor on charges of extortion.

title: William Fondiller, 89, Dead; ExBell Labs Vice President
description: William Fondiller, who retired in 1950 as vice president of Bell Telephone Laboratories and who was honorary president of the American Technion Society, died here yesterday while on a visit from Miami Beach, where he had been living. He was 89 years old.

title: CAMBODIANS TELL WHY THEY YIELDED
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 151 The Cambodian Government said today that it had decided to let the American merchant ship Mayagez go because our weak country cannot have a confrontation with the U.S.A.

title: City Ballet Opens Its Ravel Festival With a Gallic Turn
description: The New York City Ballet's Hommage A Ravel, a threeweek festival honoring the 100th anniversary of Maurice Ravel's birth, got off to a smashing start Wednesday evening with a gala benefit preview at the New York State Theater at Lincoln Center with three ballet premieres and a dinner party for more than 1,000 people.

title: DOCTORS COLLEGE HELD TOO COSTLY
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (AP) A new university to train doctors for the armed services should be scrapped because the costs of training will be too high, the Defense Manpower Commission recommended today.

title: PRICES OF GRAINS AND SOYBEANS DIP
description: Excellent weather and lesened concern over Cambodian events, combined to lower prices of grains and soybeans in Chicago yesterday.

title: JUDGE DISMISSES W. T. GRANT SUIT
description: A federal judge has dismissed a $5million lawsuit that the W. T. Grant Company filed early this year against three of its former realestate executives and several other defendants.

title: GENE TRANSPLANT IS STILL REMOTE
description: The use of new techniques for transplanting genes, the chemical units of heredity, to cure herditary human diseases still appears difficult and remote, a scientist who helped develop the new methods told a conference here yesterday.

title: Article 1  No Title
FEDERAL RESERVE CUTS RATE TO 6%; OUTPUT DECLINES
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 The Federal Reserve Board announced today a reduction in its discount rate to 6 per cent from 6 per cent  its first overt move toward easier money since early March.

title: Frankel Banking On His Long Shot
description: BALTIMORE, May 15When Bobby Frankel watches Native Guest graze, he can't help thinking of cowboy movies from his Brooklyn past.

title: EAGLE SCOUT KILLED ON BROOKLYN STREET
description: A 15yearold Eagle Scout and honor student was fatally shot on a Brooklyn street Wednesday night as he walked home alone after meeting with his scoutmaster, the police reported.

title: WORKERS GIVEN AID DUE TO IMPORTS RISE
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UPI)The Labor Department announced today its first decision under new trade legislation that compensates workers whose jobs have been lost because of increased imports.

title: Miss De Mille Stricken Before Hunter Concert
description: Agnes de Mille, the choreographer, was taken ill last night just before a scheduled performance, with her Heritage Dance Theater, at the Hunter College Playhouse, a spokesman for the Hurok organization reported.

title: Captain of Seized Ship Wires Thanks to Ford
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UPI)Capt. Charles T. Miller, commanding officer of the recaptured American merchant ship Mayagez, has sent the following telegram to President Ford:

title: After the Mayaguez
description: Only a profound sense of relief can follow the successful recovery of the American merchant vessel Mayagez and her crew from their brief and bizarre Cambodian captivity. By all accounts so far, the swift military operation which President Ford ordered was conducted with admirable efficiency, against nervewracking difficulties.

title: CONSUMER AGENCY VOTED BY SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (AP) The Senate voted overwhelmingly today to create an agency giving consumers a strong and independent voice inside the Federal Government. The bill, passed 61 to 28, now goes to the House.

title: Laver, Newcombe Ousted In Vegas Tennis Tourney
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 15 Both Rod Laver and John Newcombe were knocked out of the Alan King tennis tourament today as the second round was completed.

title: Austria Marks Anniversary Of Postwar Neutrality Pact
description: VIENNA, May 15Austria today celebrated in a modest ceremony the 20th anniversary of the treaty that created neutral and independent postwar nation.

title: Accord to Resolve Malpractice Issue Reached in Albany
description: ALBANY, May 15Governor Carey and legislative leaders of both parties announced today that they had reached agree: ment on legislation designed to resolve the medical malpractice crisis facing physicians and hospitals in the state as a result of a decision by the major insurer to stop offering such coverage after June 30.

title: CAMPUS SITE LIKELY FOR KENNEDY CENTER
description: BOSTON, May 15 (AP)The John F. Kennedy Library archives and museum probably will he built at the University of Massachusetts, either in Amherst or Boston, the library cornoration indicated today.

title: Praise for the President
description: WASHINGTON, May 15By nearly every measure President Ford's military venture in the Gulf of Siam was being evaluated here today as a diplomatic and domestic political triumph. The merchant ship Mayagez steaming once more through Southeast Asian waters, serves as visible symbol of United States resolve to remain an influence and, if necessary, a military presenceabroad despite the recent debacle in Indochina.

title: ANACONDA PLANT CLOSING UPSTATE
description: HASTINGS  ON  HUDSON, N.Y., May 15A few dozen of the 356 workers at Anaconda's power cable manufacturing plant gathered in small groups this morning near the huge doors of a storage area, discussing the company's announcement yesterday that it would close its Hastings plant.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: PACIFIC BREEZE If you want to see and hear a free program today at 3 P.M. by the Philippine Folk Arts Troupe, the place is the cavernous auditorium of the Philippine Center, 556 Fifth Avenue (between 45th and 46th Streets). The 20 singing and dancing young people perform periodicallya fashion show is included  as a goodwill promotional event for their country; check the center (5757922) for times.

title: Benedict Arnold Subject of Movie Seen at Whitney
description: Walter Gutman, a financial expert and patron of avantgarde film makers, obviously adores movies and, in recent years, made and appeared in a couple of underground, sexoriented features, Unwrap Me and The Grape Dealer's Daughter. And he proves he is equally devoted to historic figures in Benedict Arnold, the documentary that arrived yesterday at the Whitney Museum of American Art. If the results are not definitive, they represent a serious, if rambling, study of a period and a man he considers more noteworthy and talented than just his most memorable label as our most memorable traitor.

title: POLICE HUNT FOR 11 IN CHICAGO ESCAPE
description: CHICAGO, May 15 (AP)The police hunted 11 escaped prisoners today, three of them charged with murder, as an investigation got under way in a mass breakout at the Cook County Jail.

title: At Smith Museum, Art That Teaches
description: NORTHAMPTON, Mass.Just about the most inventive way to start a small private museum in 1879 was to buy a small painting by Thomas Eakins from Eakins himself. And that is what happened at Smith College, where the school itself is just over 100 years old and the Museum of Art  as fine an example of its kind as exists in any school in the world has been housed since 1973 in a handsome, imaginative and blessedly practical building designed by John Andrews of Toronto.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: An excessive delay by the state police in closing smokefilled section of the New Jersey Turnpike contributed to a series of crashes in 1973 that killed nine persons and injured 39 others, the National Transportation Safety Board said yesterday.

title: State of the City: A Fit Place to Live?
description: If the places where live and work were really for human habitation. Lewis Mumford once asked, why should we spend so much of our time getting away from them?

title: Strauss Calls President IIIEquipped as a Leader
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (AP)  Robert S. Strauss, chairman of the Democratic National Committee, called President Ford incompetent and indifferent today and said he was totally illequipped to lead the nation.

title: How's That, Governor?
description: Governor Carey and Mayor Beame were understandably disappointedalthough they should not have been surprisedby President Ford's rejection of their plea for emergency Federal assistance to help New York City through its fiscal crisis.

title: Thais Accuse U.S. of Breach of Faith
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 15  A Government spokesman told newsmen today that the United States was guilty of breach of faith in using Thai bases in its recovery of the American merchant ship that Cambodian gunboats had seized.

title: New Saigon Regime, Opening Victory Celebration, Offers Relations With U.S.
description: New Saigon Regime, Opening Victory Celebration, Offers Relations With U.S.

title: Protesters Mob the City Hospitals' Office
description: More than 1.000 demonstrators protesting cuts in the city's municipal hospitals yesterday tried to storm the 125 Worth Street headquarters where the board of directors of the Health and Hospitals Corporation was deliberating further economies demanded by Mayor Beame.

title: Hungary's Premier Quits, Citing Health Reasons
description: VIENNA, May 15  Premier Jeno Fock of Hungary resigned today for what he said were health reasons and was reI placed by Gyorgy Lazar, a younger man who is an expert in economic planning. The announcement came from the Hungarian news agency M.T.I.

title: Bank of Tokyo Unit In Pact to Acquire Holding Company
description: The Bank of Tokyo of California, which is 52 per cent owned by the Bank of Tokyo, announced yesterday that it would acquire all of the assets of the Southern California First National Corporation, the holding company for San Diego's largest bank. Under the terms of an agreement in principle the Bank of Tokyo will pay $18.50 a share for Southern California First National's 3,683,781 outstanding shares, or a total of more than $68,million if all shares are tendered.

title: CORRECTION
description: In The New York Times of May 2, it was erroneously reported that the Seattle City Council had rejected, by a vote of 7 to I, a resolution welcoming South Vietnamese refugees to that city. Actually, the Council, following its usual procedure, referred the matter to committee.

title: Market Place
description: Following a number of abortive efforts to dispose of the Peabody Coal Company under orders from the Federal Trade Commission, the Kennecott Copper Corporation received Wednesday an unconditional extension until Oct. 1 to unload its wholly owned coal subsidiary.

title: Doctor's Conviction In an Abortion Case Is Upheld in Boston
description: BOSTON, May 15  Judge James P. McGuire denied today a request by Dr. Kenneth C. Edelin that he overturn a jury's conviction of the doctor in an abortionrelated manslaughter case.

title: New Bond Issues
description: UTILITY BONDS

title: Park Service Turning to Public For Help in Solving Problems
description: WASHINGTONThe millions of vacationers about to fan out among the country's national parks will find an accustomed bucolic serenity. But behind the scenes, the National Park Service will be grappling with the greatest array of problems in its 59year history.

title: HOSPITAL PHONES SILENT ON COAST
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 15There is a rumor that the twoweekold malpractice crisis has forced St. Luke's Hospital to close.

title: Film: On Dracula's Trail
description: The vampire legend, which turned the bats from Bram Stoker's classic 1897 novel into big business for its many stage, screen and TV successors, is treated with the solemnity of a doctoral thesis in the partly dramatized documentary "In Search of Dracula," which descended on local theatres Wednesday. But with all respect to the research on the historic background of the bloodsucking undead, this "Dracula" is more scholarly than chilling and hardly a competitor of the late Bela Lugosi and other ersatz Draculas."In Search of Dracula," according to the film's distributors, was produced and directed by Calvin Floyd, an American working in Sweden. With the aid of Christopher Leethe Dracula of a succession of British-made adaptations of the legendas the off-screen narrator and on-screen Dracula, the film courses through Dracula country in Transylvania, Rumania, Hungary and Germany to trace authentic sites and Dracula facts and folklore. Bram Stoker, in case you did not know, never set foot in Transylvania; bat fears and worship date back to antiquity, and the prototype for Dracula was Prince Vlad, a 15th-century Transylvanian who delighted in impaling his enemies with such cruelty that he was stamped a vampire.There are contemporary fiends too, including the German who was the model for the film "M," starring Peter Lorre.A cinema aspect is added to the current somber proceedings by excerpts from other vintage films such as F. W. Murnau's 1921 version of Dracula, "Nosferatu"; the 1930 Bela Lugosi "Dracula" and a couple of silent films featuring, respectively, Mr. Lugosi and Lila Lee, and that noted vamp, Theda Bara.As a veteran "Dracula," Christopher Lee is menacing in brief impersonations of the vampire and the vicious Vlad and in intoning varied facts and hearsay about stakes through heart, sex, religion and the real Dracula castle. "There are more things in Heaven and Earth than are dreamed in your philosophy," he warns classically. Dracula devotees aside, too many "things" are unearthed in this "Search."

title: Ninth Ave. Festival Set for the Weekend
description: The Second Annual Ninth Avenue International Festival will be held tomorrow and Sunday displaying the West Side community's cultures and traditions in a milelong spectacle extending from 37th to 57th Streets.

title: Owners Deny Seized Freighter Had Any Secret Mission
description: MENLO PARK, N.J., May 16 The owners of the American merchant ship Mayagez said categorically today that the vessel, seized by Cambodian gunboats on Monday and freed last night by American marines, contained no arms, no ammunition, no hazardous or secret cargo of any type.

title: Commodity Price Index Fell 0.7 From WeekAgo Level
Red Smith
description: BALTIMORE, May 15When Foolish Pleasure and Companions leave the starting gate at Pimlico Saturday the 100th Preakness, it will he the 22d consecutive time this stakes has been run without a representative of Alfred Vanderbilt's Sagamore Farm, which is just a hoot and holler from the race track. Not since Native Dancer stood off the late challenge of Jamie K. in 1953 have the cerise and white silks of Maryland's most elegant horse farm appeared in Maryland's most celebrated race. This is not to suggest, however, that Sagamore has had no intluence on the Preakness over the last two decades. Indeed, if it weren't for Alfred Van?? lifelong involvement in racing, something other than Foolish Pleasure would he the favorite Saturday, for there wouldn't be any colt named Foolish Pleasure. There wouldn't be a Preakness contender named Singh. For that matter, if it weren't for Alfred Vanderbilt there wouldn't be an unbeaten filly named Ruffian around to captivate the public as she goes for the distaff triple crown. And the list of colts that have won the Triple Crown wouldn't include that big, showy dude. Secretariat.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: New York City and company officials hailed the opening of a new softdrink distribution plant, said to be the world's largest, in the South Bronx. Dozens of other ctities had invited the CocaCola Bottling Company of New York to move when its former plant in the Bronx became obsolete, but the company decided to stay in the Bronx, and put up a new $6million plant.

title: Tent City, Zip 96630, Pop. 38,608 Refugees
description: OROTE POINT, Guam, May 15Now, Tent City has a Zip Code.

title: About New York
description: This is how Kevin McCarthy landed the title role in Harry Outside, which opened Sunday night to highly favorable notices at the Circle Repertory Company.

title: General Counsel Is Named By the Transit Authority
description: Stuart Riedel has been named general counsel of the Transit Authority to succeed John G. de Roos, who was promoted to senior executive officer of the authority last week.

title: SHELL GROUP NET SHOWS 27.8% FALL
Praise for the President
description: WASHINGTON, May 15By nearly every measure President Ford's military venture in the Gulf of Siam was being evaluated here today as a diplomatic and domestic political triumph.

title: Burns Plans to Turn Professional in July
description: George Burns 3d plans to change his golfing status from amateur to professional about July 1, much to the relief of most amateur golfers in the Metropolitan area. The big 25yearold blond, who can outdrive most local golfers, said, I've set goals as an amateur and achieved

title: Gifts to Ford's Swimming Pool Tax Free
description: President Ford's swimming pool on the White House grounds will be built with taxfree contributions channeled through the National Parks Foundation.

title: U. S. Team in China
description: HONG KONG, Friday, May 16 (AP)Sixtyfour members of the United States track and field team crossed the border into China today for three meets against Chinese athletes beginning in Canton Sunday and Monday.

title: American Aides in Laos Are Safe but Restricted
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Friday, May 16  Student demonstrators who seized three American aid officials in Savannakhet Wednesday have reportedly allowed them to go to their homes under voluntary house arrest, but are demanding that the Americans testify against local Laotian officials at a hearing into corruption charges.

title: Books of The Times
description: Amos Elon is an Israeli who writes about his country and other Jewish questions with a perspective that defies neat slotting. His popular book, The Israelis: Founders and Sons, was one of the best pieces of recent writing to put Israel into a historical context and explain both her people and her rationale.

title: G.O.P. in Albany Rejects Beame's 640Million Plea
description: ALBANY, May 15The New York State Senate Republican leaders rejected today a renewed plea by Mayor Beame for a $640million package of aid and taxes to finance next year's municipal budget.

title: Ballet: Ravel Festival
MONEY SUPPLY UP TO RECORD LEVEL
description: The nation's money supplythe total amount of currency in the pockets of the public plus checking account balances moved up to a level averaging $289.3billion in the week ended May 7, according to data released yesterday by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

title: Polluter No. 1: The Car
description: The city still has barely begun to tackle the major single source of environmental pollutionthe motor vehicle. Transportationparticularly the private automobile, taxis and truckscontributes 97 per cent of all carbon monoxide in the city's air, 51 per cent of hydrocarbons, 28 per cent of nitrogen oxides, 19 per cent particulates and significant quantities of toxic metals. In addition, motor vehiclessome 25,000 per square mile in downtown Manhattan during peak hoursare responsible for onehalf of all street noise and usurp 37 per cent of the land area of the central business district through streets and parking facilities.

title: Tang Island: 3 Miles Of Jungle and Beach
description: Tang Island, the bit of Cambodia that United States marines stormed in the process of recovering a captured American merchant ship and her crew, is about three miles long and heavily covered with jungle.

title: CocaCola Distribution Plant Opening In South Bronx Hailed by City Officials
description: City and company officials hailed the opening of a new softdrink distribution plant, the world's largest, in the South Bronx yesterday as a vote of confidence in the city's future.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, MAY 16, 1975

title: SHIFT OF U.S. AID TO COUNTIES SEEN
description: McAFEE, N.J., May 15Federal authorities are looking more and more to counties rather than states or cities as a conduit for revenuesharing funds, the New Jersey Association of Chosen Freeholders was told today.

title: Gimbel Cuts Loss; Genesco Has Deficit
description: Gimbel Brothers. Inc., reported yesterday that its loss in the second fiscal quarter ended March 31 was $5.4million. In the 1974 quarter the company reported a deficit of $6.5million. For the sixmonth period Gimbel earnings fell 35.4 per cent to $4.2million.

title: Power Plant Strike Spreads
description: VERNON, Vt., May 15 (UPI) A strike against Vermont's only atomic power plant today spread to Brattleboro where union members refused to cross a picket line at the Central Vermont Public Service Corporation office.

title: Seaboard Line Cuts Payout
description: Seaboard Coast Line Industries, Inc., announced yesterday that it was cutting its regular quarterly dividend on common stock to 35 cents a share from 55 cents. The dividend is payable June 16 to shareholders of record June 2.

title: Bill to Produce Jobs Approved in House, But It Faces Battle
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (AP) A $5.3billion bill designed by its Democratic sponsors to finance jobproducing projects was passed by the House last night, but a SenateHouse dispute over it Is still to be resolved and a veto has been threatened by President Ford.

title: SHERMAN EWING, STAGE BACKER, 73
description: Sherman Ewing, a corporate lawyer who, with his wife, Marjorie Hughes, formed a leading team of Broadway angels in decades past, died yesterday at St. Luke's Hospital. He kept residences at 825 Fifth Avenue here as well as in Amenia, N. Y., and Sorrento, Me. He would have been 74 years old on May 26.

title: New Data Show Ozone Layer Fluctuates Substantially for Reasons That Are Not Known
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The high altitude ozone layer that protects the earth from dangerous solar radiations fluctuates substantially for reasons that are unknown, new data compiled by Government scientists show.

title: PORTUGAL OUSTS AIR FORCE CHIEF
description: LISBON, May 15 (AP)The commander of the Portuguese Air Force, an outspoken moderate, has been relieved of his post and expelled from the ruling Revolutionary Council by the Marxists who dominate it.

title: Japanese Firmly Support U.S. in Freeing of Mayaguez
description: TOKYO, May 15  Senior Japanese officials said today that their Government thought the American military action to free the cargo vessel Mayagez from the Cambodians was justified.

title: China Says Retaking of Vessel By U.S. Was an Act of Piracy
description: PEKING, Friday, May 16China, in her first official reaction to the American military operation that recaptured the container ship Mayagez, last night branded it an outright act of piracy that should be strongly condemned by world opinion.

title: Grumman Expects Profit on F14 Tomcat Jet
description: BETHPAGE, L.I., May 15The chairman of the Grumman Corporation said at the company's annual meeting today that the company had resolved its financial troubles over the production of the controversial F14 Tomcat fighter plane and that Grumman expected to make profits on forthcoming deliveries of the jet to the United States Navy and to Iran. His remarks were greeted by applause by the audience, which included nearly 1,000 people.

title: COPTERS EVACUATE U.S. MARINES AND SHIP RESCUE MISSION ENDS; TOLL INCLUDES ONE KNOWN DEAD
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 Under the cover of aerial and naval gunfire, 200 marines were lifted by helicopters today off an island in the Gulf of Siam, completing the military rescue of an American merchant ship and crew that had been seized by Cambodian forces.

title: Xerox Sees Little, if Any Profit Rise
description: WEBSTER, N.Y., May 15The Xerox Corporation probably will be able to show little, if any, profit growth this year over 1974, C. Peter McColough, chairman, told about 2,000 stockholders at the annual meeting here today.

title: 2,000 Telephone Workers Face a 4Day Week Here
description: The New York Telephone Company is planning to put 2,000 of its 5,800 telephone operators in the five boroughs on a fourday work week at four days' pay beginning July because of a drop in business.

title: Ethical Culture School Starts Its Chaotic Centenary
description: There has been chaos in the auditorium of the Fieldston School in Riverdale this week. There has been chaos in the recreation room, chaos in the room with the piano, chaos in the stairway, chaos in the hall and chaos in the girls' bathroom.

title: L. M. Rosenthal and Officer Are Suspended by S.E.C.
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission announced yesterday in Washington that it had suspended L. M. Rosenthal & Co., Inc., a New York brokerdealer, from making a market in any overthecounter security for 30 business days. The commission also suspended Stephen I. Fischgrund, a vice president of the firm, from associating with any brokerdealer for the same period. Both suspensions are effective May 27.

title: Jamaica Trying to Create Her Own Brand of Socialism
description: KINGSTON, Jamaica, May 10Socialism is lovely, the governing People's National party proclaimed this week in its campaign to establish Jamaican socialism as something special.

title: Simon Says a City Default Would Not Hurt Economy
description: Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon said yesterday that he had conducted an analysis of what the effects would be if New York City defaulted on its obligations, and concluded that the impact on the national economy would be negligible.

title: TRADING IS DULL FOR DEBT ISSUES
description: The markets for Treasury and corporate debt issues turned dull yesterday for the first time this week, while taxexempt issues remained mired because of the fiscal problems of New York City. Nevertheless, the flow of quality of ferings marketed yesterday wereeasily absorbed, arriving as they did at handsome yields and with other features that interested buyers.

title: Judge Denies McCrane Bid For New TaxCharge Trial
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., May 15 (AP)  A Federal judge today, refused to grant the former New Jersey Treasurer, Joseph M. McCrane Jr., a new trial and scheduled his sentencing for May 21.

title: Swedish TV's Harlem: Image Was Not Positive
description: Harlem: Voices, Faces will not be seen on public television Monday. Confronted with objections from some leaders in the black community, WNET/13 has postponed presentation of the film, which was produced in 1973 by Swedish film makers for Swedish television. The decision provides a classic broadcasting instance of nobody's winning.

title: People and Business
description: Carla A. Hills, Secretary of Housing and Urban Affairs, said yesterday that the nation's housing goals would not be met unless Congress enacted banking reforms to allow greater competition in the home mortgage market.

title: Fashion Editor Turns Designer
description: Catherine di Montezemolo has, in a sense, jumped over the wall. The former Vogue magazine fashion editor recently had her eye on European fashion developments when her husband's business took them to Milan. So, when she was advising her friends, Jack Bodi and Joe Leombruno, on the dress collection they were designing in Italy, she decided to take the plunge.

title: Mob Is Linked to Florida Land Fraud
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., May 15 (AP)A land fraud scheme that allegedly has bilked thousands of people of millions of dollars will not be stopped until a lot of attorneys, bankers, brokers and appraisers are slapped in fail, a state prosecutor said today.

title: Simon Sees Easing of LongTerm Rates
description: Treasury Secretary William E. Simon, whose bearish remarks earlier this spring aroused fears of an upturn in interest rates, offered some relatively soothing thoughts on the subject here yesterday.

title: JULIAN BATES DEAD; REUTERS UNIT CHIEF
description: Julian Bates, manager of media services for the news agency Reuters, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital while on a business trip here. He was 52 years old and lived in London. The cause of death was not immediately known.

title: CLASSES RESUMING AT CITY COLLEGE
description: Day classes will resume at City College today after they had been suspended yesterday because of disorders surrounding a dispute over the number of minority workers on a campus construction project.

title: CAMBODIANS TELL WHY THEY YIELDED
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 15 The Cambodian Government said today that it had decided to let the American merchant ship Mayagez go because our weak country cannot have confrontation with the U.S.A.

title: Militant on Trinidad Is Denied Clemency And Will Be Hanged
description: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad, May 15 (AP)A former British blackpower leader, Michael Abdul Malik, has failed in his bid for clemency and will be hanged for murder, it was announced late today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Housing: To Renew a Dream

title: Compromise Sought
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., May 15 (AP)In an attempt to get 165 striking anesthesiologists back to work, compromise legislation was worked out today that would assure malpractice insurance coverage for all California doctors.

title: City Starts Dismissing 3,067 of Its Employes
description: The Beame administration yesterday began dismissing the first of 3,067 employes scheduled to be cut from the payrolls by July 1, but budget officials said they were unable to specify how many of the employes had actually been notified.

title: LastDitch Attempt to Enact An Income Tax in Jersey Fails
description: TRENTON, May 15A final attempt to enact a modest state income tax for New Jersey was abandoned in the State Senate this evening, raising the prospect of a major fiscal crisis for the Byrne administration. The Senate Democratic majority caucused this afternoon and the Senate President, Frank J. Dodd, told reporters afterward that a state income tax is dead and that a vote on the tax scheduled for Monday had been canceled.

title: FEDERAL RESERVE CUTS RATE TO 6%; OUTPUT DECLINES
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 The Federal Reserve Board announced today a reduction in its discount rate to 6 per cent from 6 per cent  its first overt move toward easier money since early March.

title: Du Pont's Latest Price Cut
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc. announced yesterday another reduction of fourtenths of a cent a pound in antiknock compound prices.

title: WARREN COMMISSION BACKED BY SURGEON
description: BOZEMAN, Mont., May 15 (AP)  Dr. James Carrico, a surgeon who attended President Kennedy immediately after he was shot in Dallas 12 years ago, says he thinks the findings of the Warren Commission are accurate.

title: Rizzo Vows No Layoffs
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 15 (AP) Mayor Frank Rizzo of Philadelphia, campaigning in they Democratic primary, says he will not lay off any city employes as long as he is Mayor., Mr. Rizzo, who is running against State Senator Louis G. Hill, the partyhacked candidate in next Tuesday's primary. pledged there would be no layoffs in a campaign address last night at the Legion of Cornelius, an association of Protestant policemen and firemen.

title: Bar Groups Are Opposing Ford. Nominee
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The organized bar moved today to block Senate confirmation of William L. Knecht, one of ten men nominated by President Ford to serve on the new Legal Services Corporation.

title: Parents and Police Clash in Zoning Protest
AliLyle on Home TV Tonight
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 15 With a warning about using ropeadope strategy, Muhammad Ali will defend his world heavyweight boxing title tomorrow night against Ron Lyle, a 33yearold exconvict from Denver, in his first championship fight on live home television in nine years.

title: TIMING OF ATTACK RAISES QUESTIONS
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The American attack in the Gulf of Siam was already in progress, according to official accounts, when President Ford received word that the Cambodian Government was willing to release the American merchant vessel Mayagez and its crew of 39.

title: Business Briefs
description: PARIS, May 15Sharp reductions in imports, largely reflecting the depths of the business slump, a pickup in exports to oilproducing states and lower rawmaterial prices have combined to produce a largerthanexpected improvement in the international accounts of major nonCommunist industrial states.

title: F.E.A PROPOSING FREER REIN ON OIL
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The Federal Energy Administration sent to Congress tonight formal notice of a proposed liberalization of the exemption from price controls for oil from stripper wellsthose that have produced less than 10 barrels a day.

title: N.H.L. Playoffs
description: STANLEY CUP FINALS

title: Senator Anderson
description: New York City is the greatest city in the world. Its sheer immensity staggers the senses and the mind. It embodies the charm of San Francisco, the culture of Rome, the exoticism of Tokyo and the vitality of Tel Aviv.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Jamieson Tells Meeting Donations Were Legal
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 15J. K. Jamieson, chairman of the Exxon Corporation, the world's largest industrial company, said here today that his company had never made illegal political contributions, as some other companies have been accused of doing.

title: Hoboken Somehow, Both Private and Friendly
description: HOBOKEN, N.J.  The wonderful thing about this city is how perfectly ordinary it is. It's not spectacularly ordinary, it's simply a functioning community, Rita Christopher, a recent migr from Manhattan's East Side, said as she waited for guests in her centuryold brownstone here.

title: Victim in East River Identified as Student Missing After Party
description: The body of a man found floating in the East River near the Williamsburgh Bridge on Tuesday was identified yesterday as that of Allen Munson, a 24yearold graduate student from Philadelphia who disappeared 48 days ago after coming here to attend a party in the Soho section.

title: PRICES ON AMEX DECLINE SHARPLY
How CashFlow Figure Changed
description: ALBANY, May 15For weeks now. Mayor Beame has been saying that one of New York City's twin fiscal crises involved a cash flow shortage of $1.5billion.

title: DeBusschere Expects To Work With O'Brien
description: After Dave DeBusschere officially was named the seventh American Basketball Association commissioner in eight years yesterday, his wife, Gerri, said: Playercoach at 24 years old and the youngest commissioner at 34. I hope he isn't a hasbeen at 44.

title: U.S. OFFICIALS SAY AID HAD DIM HOPE
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Almost from the outset, the Treasury and the Federal Reserve Board rejected the claim of New York City that its financial problem was essentially a special one of shortterm cash flow and that a Federal rescue operation would therefore not set any precedents for other ciies.

title: Larva Diamond Is Found
description: MURFREESBORO, Ark., (AP) Mrs. Hall K. Blevins of Regers found a 4.32carat white diamond at the Crater of Diamonds here, the largest diamond found at the tourist attraction since it was purchased by the State Department of Parks and Tourism more than two years ago.

title: Pennsy Trustees Offer Plan for Conrail Action
description: WASHINGTON, May 15A proposal to enable Conrail, the successor to the Penn Central and six other bankrupt railroads, to be in business by early next year was put forward here today by trustees of the Penn Central. Industry and government observers had been predicting that the new, Governmentsponsored rail entity, originally scheduled to start operations next January, might never come into being.

title: 5 ASIAN NATIONS FAIL TO COMPLETE TREATY
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, May 15The Foreign Ministers of five Southeast Asian nations ended a threeday meeting today unable to complete the treaty of amity and cooperation that they were to have initialed.

title: United Brands Bribe Is Laid to Honduran
description: A Honduran commission reported last night that former Economics Minister Abraham Bennaton Ramos was the official who received a $1.2million bribe from the United Brands Company to lower a banana export tax.

title: 5 HURT IN CRASH OF A SCHOOL BUS
description: PISCATAWAY TOWNSHIP, May 15A school bus driver and four of the 29 junior high school students on her bus were seriously injured on the way to school this morning, when the vehicle apparently went out of control on a country road here and smashed into a utility pole.

title: U.S. Sees Foray for Ship As Signal to Communists
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Leading Administration officials said today that the Gulf of Siam military operation to recover the container ship Mayagez and her crew had been undertaken in part to alert North Korea and other Communist countries that the United States was ready to meet force with force to protect its interests.

title: Refugee Camp Provides a Backdrop for Vignettes on Lives Tangled in Vietnam War
description: CAMP PENDLETON, Calif., May 15The little girl in the back seat of the Toyota munched on a hamburger bun and made a few squealing attempts at English.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, MAY 16, 1975

title: Bridge:
description: Five celebrities arrived here last Tuesday for the first stage of a hectic tour that wiI 1 take them to Los Angeles, Chicago and Miami.

title: WITNESSES DEPICT OAKLAND SLAYING
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., May 15 (UPI)Defense witnesses in the trial of two reputed members of the selfstyled Symbionese Liberation Army testified today that they saw black men running from the scene of the murder of Dr. Marcus Foster, the Oakland Superintendent of Schools.

title: N.B.A. Playoffs
description: Chicago vs. Golden State

title: Article 3  No Title
Sikkim Becomes An Indian State; Monarchy Ended
description: NEW DELHI, Friday, May 16 (AP)India formally annexed Sikkim today, making the Himalayan kingdom the country's 22d state.

title: Lebanon's Premier Quits Post Over Clashes in Beirut
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 15Premier Rashid alSolh resigned today, placing full responsibility for serious fighting here last month on the rightwing Phalangist party, whose militia battled Palestinian guerrillas for several days.

title: About That Piece of the Good Old U.S. of A. in Panama
description: No gulf separating the Congress and the Organization of American States general assembly, now winding up in Washington, is greater than the tenmilewide Panama Canal Zone. That strip through the heart of a poor but proud nation, is, under a 1903 treaty, still subject forever to the United States' sovereign control.

title: G.O.P. in Albany Rejects Beame's 640Million Plea
description: ALBANY, May 15The New York State Senate Republican leaders rejected today a renewed plea by Mayor Beame for a $640million package of aid and taxes to finance next year's municipal budget.

title: S.E.C. Starts an Inquiry As Phone Offering Ends
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission launched a broad investigation yesterday into foreign dealings in American Telephone and Telegraph Company shares almost simultaneously with the close of the biggest stock offering in Wall Street history.

title: 2 PaymentsBalance Measures Showed Improvement in Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Two measures of the United States balance of international payments that the Government now regards as largely meaningless both showed improvement in the first quarter of this year, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: TIMING OF ATTACK RAISES QUESTIONS
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The American attack in the Gulf of Siam was already in progress, according to official accounts, when President Ford received word that the Cambodian Government was willing to release the American merchant vessel Mayagez and its crew of 39.

title: Grim Ulster Prospect
description: The results of the election of delegates to a convention charged with drafting a new constitution for Northern Ireland are very clearand very depressing. They confirm a further polarization of the Protestant and Catholic communities and they set up the virtual certainty another collision between the victorious Protestant majority and the British Government.

title: Stocks Dip in Heavy Trading; New Bill Seems to Ease Anxiety But Controversial Rules on Trading Still an Issue
description: Years of anxiety on Wall Street over the threat of radical new laws governing the brokerage business seemed to have dissipated yesterday, a day after Senate and House conferees agreed on a bill less onerous than many in the industry feared.

title: But Some Note the Law Requires Consultations
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 Along with the general mood of euphoria in Congress over the success of the operation in the Gulf of Siam, there was mild criticism from some Senators and Representatives that President Ford should have complied more explicitly with the law requiring him to consult with Congress in advance of military operations.

title: CORRECTION
description: In The New York Times of May 2, it was erroneously reported that the Seattle City Council had rejected, by a vote of 7 to 1, a resolution welcoming South Vietnamese refugees to that city. Actually, the Council, following its usual procedure, referred the matter to committee.

title: Ruling in Passaic That Plurality Is Majority Ends in Vote Dispute
description: PASSAIC, May 15Because of a dispute on what constitutes a majority of a vote, residents of this city are not certain whether they elected four councilmen on Tuesday.

title: Heavy Resistance Surprised the Marines
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The American marines who landed on Tang Island in the effort to free the crew of the freighter Mayagez lacked accurate information on the size of the Cambodian force on the island and were surprised by the amount of fire they met and the number of planes supporting the Cambodians, according to Pentagon officials.

title: Rebuilding Cambodia: A Daring Gamble
description: PARISThe Khmer Rouge have done in all Western specialists in Asiatic affairs, or those who were considered as such until now. The downfall of the Lon Nol regime was recognized as inevitable for a long time. But in Washington, Paris, and even in Moscow, it was taken for granted that its end would lead to the return of Prince Norodom Sihanouk.

title: Wallace Getting Campaign Royalties
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama is paying himself personal royalties from his Presidential campaign treasury for the use of his own likeness in political materials.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Newark Students Vote to End Boycott

title: 2,000 PHONE AIDES FACE 4DAY WEEK
description: The New York Telephone Company is planning to put 2,000 of its 5,800 telephone operators in the five boroughs on a fourday work week at four days' pay beginning July 6 because of a drop in business.

title: Restaurant Reviews
description: A Bientot at 9 Barrow Street (between the Avenue of the Americas and Seventh Avenue) is an exceptionally pleasant little bistro that serves a $6 dinner Monday through Thursday as well as dinner is la carte seven nights a week. (No lunches ever.) Your $6 gets you onion soup or your choice of four hors d'oeuvre; your choice of 20 entrees garnished with potato and vegetable; a green salad; and choice of four desserts, of which, let me say immediately, the cream cheese mousse with strawberries is tops.

title: Theater: Spring Tonics
description: The bracing effect of The Three Musketeers is so marvelous in its revival at the Equity Library Theater. Riverside Drive at 103d Street, that you wonder why the 1929 Ziegfeld musical hasn't been dusted off long before. A later antique, Carousel, is also in professional hands, those of the St. Bart's Players, which is doing commendably with three performances to go.

title: A Chronology of the Mayaguez Episode
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Following is a chronology of the events involving the seizure and subsequent freeing of the Mayagez. The hours are given in Eastern daylight time Cambodian time is 11 hours later.

title: Raising Some Mayaguez Questions
description: It is too early to reach final judgments about President Ford's use of military force in quickly recovering the Mayagez and her crew from their Cambodian captors. On the evidence of what is so far known, however, the following may be reasonably if tentatively suggested:

title: Yonkers to Drop Daily Double
description: The question that horseplayers have been asking since chariotrace daysWho do ya like in the double?will be asked no longer at Yonkers Raceway.

title: Text of President Ford's Report to Congress on Ship
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (Reuters)Following is the text of a letter sent early toclay by President Ford formally notifying Congress in compliance with the War Powers Resolution of 1973, of his actions in ordering the rescue of crew members aboard the freighter Mayagez. The letter was addressed to the Speaker of the House of Representatives. Carl Albert.

title: 1.6% DROP EXPECTED IN AUTO PRODUCTION
description: DETROIT, May 15Domestic auto production is scheduled to drop 1.6 per cent this week from last week's total, when output reached the highest level of the year.

title: Flyers Top Sabres, 41, As Title Series Opens
The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Ceremonies Also Mark Ho Chi Minh's Birthday
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 15 (AP)The new Government opened a threeday victory celebration today with an offer to establish relations with all countries, including the United States.

title: INVESTORS SOUGHT TO BUY CITY NOTES
description: Two groups of banksone led by the Chase Manhattan Bank and the other by the Morgan Guaranty Trust Companyworked yesterday to see if they could find enough investors to bid for the $280million of notes that New York City scheduled for sale Mon day morning.

title: Milan Museum Loses 38 Paintings in Second Theft
description: ROME, May 15  Armed thieves entered the Gallery of Modern Art in Milan's Municipal Villa early today for the second time in three months and escaped with 38 paintings, including many of the famous Impressionist works stolen in the previous raid and only recently recovered.

title: Israeli Counterterror Group Linked to Arson of Arab Bus
description: TEL AVIV, May 15A parked Arabowned bus was burned last night in the Old City of Jerusalem, and a short while later a man telephoned newspaper offices, the state radio and some leading citizens and said the arson had been the work of a new counterterrorist organization.

title: Baby Killed in Plane Crash
description: SALISBURY, Md., May 15 (AP)A small plane carrying missionaries to Haiti crashed early this morning near here, killing an infant and injuring four other persons according to the Maryland State Police. The police identified the dead infant as Jodie Brumley, 8 months old, of Walston Switch, Maryland.

title: Text of Cambodian Communique
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Following is a transcript of a broadcast by the Cambodian radio of a Government communiqu on the seizure of the American ship Mayagez. It was recorded and translated by the Foreign Broadcast Information Service, a United States Government Agency.

title: Renovation in Bronx Transforms Fox St.
description: Fox Street in the South Bronx runs for 13 blocks through what police officers describe as Fort Apache. On 12 of those blocks, the street arc strewn with garbage, the sidewalks have potholes and most of the apartment buildings are abandoned.

title: Simon Says a City Default Would Not Hurt Economy
description: Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon said yesterday that he had conducted an analysis of what the effects would be if New York City defaulted on its obligations, and concluded that the impact on the national economy would be negligible. There would obviously be a psychological effect, said Mr. Simon. But it's difficult to judge. He emphasized repeatedly that default was not the single option open to the city, saying it could instead adopt stern austerity measures and secure financial aid from the state.

title: Yankees Set Back meets, 94
description: After suffering eight defeats in 10 American League games on the road, the Yankees came back to Shea Stadium last night and roughed up their landlords, the Mets, 94, in the 13th annual Mayor's Trophy game.

title: 1973 Crash That Killed 9 Is Laid in Part to Police
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (AP) An excessive delay by the state police in closing a smokefilled section of the New Jersey Turnpike contributed to a series of crashes in 1973 that killed nine persons and injured 39 others, the National Transportation Safety Board said today.

title: Colby Reviews C.I.A. Activities In Testimony at Senate Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, May 15William E. Colby, Director of Central Intelligence, presented the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence today an overview of the covert operations of the Central Intelligence Agency in the last 30 years at a closed hearing here.

title: The Pop Life
description: Adults who stumble onto largescale rock concerts in arenas like Madison Square Garden are sometimes horrified by the totalitarian implications of the spectacle.

title: About Real Estate
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn.  In Britain, one shops downtown. It therefore came naturally to Sydney Mason, chairman of the Hammerson Property Investment Trust, Ltd., to look to downtown locations once he had decided to expand Hammerson's commercial development activities in the United States.

title: Court Challenges Byrne On De Rose's Dismissal
description: NEWARK, May 15A state Superior Court Judge today signed a showcause order telling Governor Byrne to explain in court next week why he should not be prevented from firing former state Senator Ralph De Rose as a New Jersey representative on the Bistate Waterfront Commission.

title: CONNECTICUT ACTS ON NURSING HOMES
description: HARTFORD, May 15After three months of legislative inquiry into conditions in nursing homes in Connecticut, a bill has been drawn up that would give the state the authority to impose penalties administratively and swiftly on nursing homes that fall below standard.

title: Trenton Inmates Urge Parole System With Firm Release Dates
description: TRENTON, May 15Inmates of Trenton State Prison appealed to reluctant Byrne administration officials today to enact reforms in the state's parole system that would guarantee release dates for prisoners.

title: Jonathan N. Leonard Dies at 71; Author and Time Science Editor
description: Jonathan Norton Leonard, author and former science editor of Time magazine, died yesterday in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived in HastingsonHudson, N.Y., and Sandwich, Mass.

title: Ford and Shah Confer on Middle East
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UPI)President Ford and the Shah of Iran discussed the outlook for Middle East peace today and the White House said later that both leaders were worried about a possible stalemate in efforts to obtain an ArabIsreali.settlement.

title: Public TV Lists Opera, New Series
description: The fallwinter schedule for the Public Broadcasting Service, just completed, includes a return of WNET Opera Theater after a year's absence and a new series with Lowell Thomas, the travel journalist; Jacques Yves Cousteau, the oceanographer, and Mark Russell, a political satirist who performs at the Shoreham Hotel in Washington.

title: DIRECT BRIBE BID IS LAID TO BLACK
description: Eli M. Black, former chairman of the United Brands Company, has been described by a Honduran official as having made a personal attempt to bribe former President Oswaldo Lopez Arellano of Honduras last year in an effort to gain a major reduction in banana export taxes paid by the company.

title: Shula Sells Dolphin Stock
description: MIAMI, May 16 (AP)The Miami Dolphins' coach, Don Shula, is selling a portion of his stock in the football team but says he will be head coach for at least three more years. Shula agreed to discuss the matter only to dispel speculation that he might be leaving the team he has led to two National Football League championships in the last five seasons.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The city and the Housing Patrolmen's Benevolent Association have reached agreement on a twoyear contract that will give housingpolice officers a pay increase of $2,208. Joseph L. Balzano, Housing Patrolmen's Benevolent Association president, said that the base pay for housingpolice officers with three years of service had been $15,250, but under the pact this would rise $1,220, retroactive to July 1, 1974, and an additional $988 on July 1. The base pay will then total $17,458. The increases are the same as those negotiated last July by the Uniformed Firefighters and as awarded recently by an arbitration panel to the city's police officers.

title: Queens Truck Driver Arrested In SherryNetherland Robbery
description: A 46yearold unemployed truck driver from Queens was arrested yesterday as one of the five gunmen who robbed the SherryNetherland Hotel of $900.000 in jewelry and cash in a daring predawn holdup last December.

title: WIDE COMMERCE IN BLOOD STUDIED
description: GENEVA, May 16 (Reuters)Commercial companies are engaged in a widespread trade in human blood, taken from paid donors in poor countries and shipped for sale in industrialized states, a report to the World Health Organization's annual assembly said today.

title: MRS. CHARLES ANTIN
description: Leonora Weiss Antin, personnel manager of Alexander's, Inc., in Rego Park, Queens, died Thursday of cancer at Mama Sinai Hospital. She was 48 years old.

title: U.S. Track Squad Welcomed in China
description: CANTON, China, May 16 (UPI)  The United States track and field team was greeted by a tumultuous crowd, which included the entire Chinese team, when it arrived today for the first of three goodwill meets in China.

title: Moody's Gives City Top Rating on Notes Up for Sale Monday
description: Moody's Investor's Service, leading securitiesrating agency, yesterday gave its highest grade to the city's $280million note issue scheduled for sale Monday morning.

title: Lisbon Continues to Nationalize; Moves on Rightists in Air Force
description: LISBON, May 16 (UPI)Portugal's ruling armed forces movement nationalized five more manufacturing concerns today and began an effort to remove any right  wing influence from the air force.

title: BEAME THREATENS 38,000 DISMISSALS
description: Mayor Beame, attacking what he called the Republican pincer movement in Washington and in Albany, said yesterday that he would have to cut 38,000 of the 330,000 city jobs if his $640million proposal for aid and taxes is rejected by the state.

title: Adm. Leslie Gehres Dies at 76; Unsinkable Franklin Captain
description: Rear Adm. Leslie E. Gehres, U.S.N., retired, World War ll captain of the aircraft carrier Franklin, the ship that would not die, died Thursday at San Diego. He was 76 years old.

title: People and Business
description: Rogers C. B. Morton, Secretary of Commerce, said yesterday that the United States plans to build a strategic oil reserve of 1.3 billion barrels.

title: Green, Jets' Lewis Face Rape Charge
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 16 (AP)Two players in the National Football League, Woody Green of Kansas City and Rich Lewis of the New York Jets, were arrested and charged with rape today.

title: City Officer Named To Head Troopers, State Officials Say
description: ALBANY, May 16Governor Carey has selected William G. Connelie, a New York City Police official, to be the new Superintendent of the State Police, administration officials said today.

title: Ali to Speak for Another, Aiding Carter's Defense
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 16In a rare, serious moment, Muhammad Ali dedicated his world heavyweight title defense tonight against Ron Lyle to Rubin (Hurricane) Carter, the former middleweight contender now serving a controversial triplelife prison sentence in connection with the 1966 murder of three patrons of a New Jersey tavern.

title: Benjamin Fine Is Dead in Korea; Was Education Editor of Times
description: Dr. Benjamin Fine, former education editor of The New York Times, died of a heart attack yesterday in Pusan, South Korea, where he was lecturing. He was 73 years old and was living in Key Biscayne, Fla., where he was headmaster of the Horizon School for Gifted Children.

title: 2D CAMBODIA RAID DISCLOSED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Defense Department said today that United States naval planes had made a second attack against the Cambodian mainland as part of the operation to recover the cargo ship Mayagliez and its crew.

title: World Team Tennis
description: LAST NIGHT'S MATCHES Pittsburgh vs. Golden Gate. San D?? vs Hawaii THURSDAY NIGHT'S MATCHES New York 24, Hawaii 21. Cleveland 23, Boston 21.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Public Service Company of North Carolina, Inc., said yesterday it had filed registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission in connection with a proposed public offering of 320,000 common shares through underwriters hewed by the First Boston Corporation. The natural gas distributor, based in Gastonia, N.C., said net proceeds from the proposed sale would he used to repay outstanding shortterm bank loans.

title: Officials Reported Split On China's Olympic Bid
description: ROME, May 16 (AP) Olympic officials from all over the world were evenly divided tonight on whether Taiwan should he expelled from the Olympic Games to make way for China.

title: New Hampshire Issue Pushed Back in Senate
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP)  Senate consideration of deadlocked issues in the contested Senate election in New Hampshire was pushed back another week today.

title: Prime Cut by Morgan And Bank of America
description: The Bank of America and the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company both announced yesterday that they would reduce their prime rates to 7 per cent from 7 per, cent, effective Monday.

title: A Stronger City Council Is Supported at Hearing
description: Proposals to enhance greatly the role of the City Council in the legislative and budget process were strongly supportled yesterday by civic organizaitions and, not surprisingly, by several of the Council's more active members.

title: The Two Worlds of Underwear and Outerwear Are Becoming One
description: Not since the days of the bustle and the buckram petti coat has there been so much designing going on inside fashion.

title: School Without Classrooms Unites Calhoun Students
description: Residents from the graceful canopied apartment buildings that line West End Avenue have been calling it that TV set on 81st Street, but to 900 students of the Calhoun School who participated in a ritual movingin yesterday, it is their new school building without classrooms, and most seemed to like it.

title: GULF OIL ADMITS IT ILLEGALLY GAVE 5MILLION ABROAD
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The chairman of the Gulf Oil Corporation told a Senate subcommittee today that, over the last decade, his company had made about $5million in illegal political contributions abroad, including $4million to politicians in South Korea.

title: Shah Visits Air Base and Then Meets Schlesinger
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (Reuters) Shah of Iran inspected American radarcarrying planes at Andrews Air Force Base today and then flew by helicopter to the Pentagon for talks with Secretary of De fense James R. Schlesinger.

title: 4 FISHERMEN LOST AS CRAFT IS SUNK
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., May 16 (AP)A merchant ship registered in Liberia accidentally rammed and sank a fishing vessel 63 miles southeast of here in dense fog that held visibility to 50 yards, the Coast Guard reported today.

title: A's Blue Checks Yanks, 42
description: While Vida Blue was routinely pitching his eighth victory of the season last night at Shea Stadium, Pat Dobson was displaying a variety of talents in his first appearance on the mound in a week.

title: Highway Fight in Virginia Nears Showdown
description: WASHINGTON  Build 66 Now! demanded auto bumper stickers prepared by supporters of I66, a $200million, 10mile missing link of superhighway through the Virginia suburks.

title: Noguchi Art, Unafraid of Beauty
description: The art of sculpture is, among much else, an art of conversation. Whether the physical material the sculptor employs is extremely precious, like gold, or quite commonplace, like paper, his task is the same: to convert its attributes into a conception of the imagination. These attributes condition the artist's conception, but at the same time, the conception, if successfully realized, also servesto give us a new and heightened awareness of what the attributes of a given material may ideally be. Thus, the art of sculpture is at once a revelation of a material as well as a conceptual universe.

title: Vietnam Victors Celebrate With Air Show and Party
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 16 (AP)Topranking civilian leaders of South Vietnam's Provisional Revolutionary Government are in Saigon for the big celebration of the Communist victory, but it is not clear when they will take over the government of the city.

title: ARMY CRITICIZED ON DREDGING RULE
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI) The Environmental Protection Agency accused the Army Corps of Engineers today of falsely asserting that it would have to regulate farm plowing and other activities under a proposed rule to safeguard United States wetlands.

title: T.W.A. Has Net Loss
description: The financially ailing Trans World Airlines reported yesterday a corporate net loss of $13.8million for April. Page 40.

title: Port Authority Ruling Granted Direct Appeal
description: MORRISTOWN, May 16The State Supreme Court agreed today to permit a direct appeal by the United States Trust Company on the constitutionality of the repeal of a Port Authority bond covenant by the New Jersey Legislature.

title: New State Austerity Drive Will Cut Jobs and Services
description: ALBANY, May 16  The first wave of a new austerity drive was announced today by the Carey administration. It would eliminate 840 more jobs and double fees to $2 an auto at Jones Beach and other waterfront state parks.

title: 9,000 ARE TO ATTEND FETE FOR RETARDED
description: EDISON, May 16More than 9,000 men, women and children are to gather on the campus of Middlesex County College here tomorrow for the second annual Festival for Mentally Retarded Citizens of New Jersey.

title: Top Officers Agree to Being Enjoined in S.E.C. Pact
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Ashland Oil, Inc., and three of its top officers consented today in Federal Court to be enjoined from using corporate funds for illegal political contributions and other unlawful purposes, making false or fictitious entries in its corporate books and records or maintaining any secret fund of corporate assets.

title: Elson Loses To Galindez In Eighth
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 16 (AP)Victor Galindez, Argentina, the World Boxing Association's lightheavyweight champion, stopped Ray Elson of Brooklyn in the eighth round tonight in a preliminary title match between Muhammad Ali and Ron Lyle. Galindez, 177 pounds, staggered the 24yearold American with a left and right to the head early in the eighth and then hit him with at least 15 Punches with no return.

title: G.E. PLANS LAYOFF FOR HICKORY. N.C.
description: HICKORY, N.C. May 16 (UPI) More than 300 employes are expected to be laid off at the General Electric Company's distribution transformer department here within the next few

title: 2 DAYS OF NEW JAZZ BY C.C.N.Y. GROUPS
description: A twoday Festival of New Jazz by the City College Jazz Ensembles opened Thursday evening at Shepard Hall with a program that included the premiere of a work for Jim Hall, the guitarist, and the C.C.N.Y. Jazz Band composed by Ed Summerlin, director of the college's jazz program. There was also a performance by a student sextet conducted by John Lewis, the pianist and musical director of the Modern Jazz Quartet until it broke up, who is now artist in residence at the college's Center for the Performing Arts.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO OXFORD 53311 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4: 30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY: NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900; WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAU CO. (516) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO. (516) 6691100; CONNECTICUT (203) 3117767.

title: Improved Outlook Eases Con Ed's Financial Woes
description: The financial troubles and gloomy prospect that a year ago gripped the Consolidated Edison Company of New York, the nation's largest investorowned power company, appear to be on the wane.

title: CORRECTION
description: The monument at the junction of West End Avenue, Broadway and 106th Street is in memory of Ida and Isidor Straus, who died when the Titanic sank in 1912. The monument does not commemorate their daughters, as was stated in Wednesday's About New York column.

title: Court Upholds Conviction Of Man in Jersey Drug Sale
description: TRENTON, May 16 (UPI)New Jersey's second highest court upheld today the conviction of Jesse Land, convicted of selling cocaine to an investigator from the Union County Prosecutor's office.

title: 84 Yachts Start 125Mile Race
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., May 16A fleet of 98 cruising Yachts, 64 rated under the International Offshore Rule and the rest in the Midget Ocean Racing Club Division (under 30 feet in overall length), sailed from off Larchmont Breakwater this evening. It was the start of Larchmont Yacht Club's 20th annual distance race, the first major overnight race of the season on Long Island Sound.

title: Paul Bonynge Jr., Banker, Aided Henry St. Settlement
description: Paul Bonynge Jr., who retired as a vice president of the Bankers Trust Company and who had been treasurer of the Henry Street Settlement, died Thursday in Quebec. He was 68 years old and lived in Wilton, N. H.

title: O.A.S. Plans a Meeting in July On Lifting AntiCuba Sanctions
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (Reuters)The general assembly of the Organization of American States unanimously decided today to hold a special session in Costa Rica in July aimed at lifting the sanctions imposed against Cuba in 1964.

title: BRITISH INFLATION INCREASES AGAIN
Dr. Harold Mark, 62, Dies; Cardiologist and Teacher
description: Dr. Harold I. Mark, a cardiologist, an associate professor at Flower and Fifth Avenue Hospitals and a specialist with the Union Family Medical Fund, a medical group for employes of the hotel industry here, died last Saturday in Southampton (LI.) Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived in New Rochelle. N.Y.

title: They You Know They
description: Moving vans started pulling up in front of the houses. At first, only a trickleone a week. Then, several a week. The whispering mounted. They have so many children.

title: Abuses in Medicare Put at $27Million In Last Five Years
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) The Social Security Administration says the Medicare program was overcharged $27million by doctors, hospitals and nursing homes over the last five years.

title: Pipe Bomb Explosion Still Shakes Ramsey
description: RAMSEY, May 16  The shock waves from the explosion of a pipe bomb that caused $13,000 damage to the borough's high school are still reverberating though this middleclass suburban community, which takes pride in both its school system and its young people.

title: Mobil Says It Contributed Abroad Legally; Ashland Will Halt Unlawful Political Aid
description: The issue of political contributions abroad continued yesterday to bring statements from oil companies.

title: House Ethics Unit Recommends Guide for Accepting Free Rides
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI) The House Ethics Committee recommended today that Representatives pay their own way on trips that are mainly for political purposes of personal convenience. But the committee said that taking free rides was acceptable if lawmakers did the following:

title: Ninth Avenue: Food Festival of 22 Countries
description: Manganaro's has laid in 500 extra pounds of capicollo and mortadella; Poseidon has been baking extra baklava for days, and up at La Milonga, the Argentina restaurant, Toshiaki, who bills himself as the world's only Japanese tango singer, has got some special numbers for the anticipated crowds.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, MAY 17, 1975

title: A Woman Reaches Top of Mt. Everest
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, Saturday, May 17A woman has conquered Mount Everest for the first time, the Nepalese Foreign Ministry announced today.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation announced yesterday in Pittsburgh that it had signed a $191million contract to supply two 950,000kilowatt nuclear reactors, plus nuclear fuel, to the Taiwan Power Company.

title: Senator Says Inquiry Found Gaps in C.I.A.'s Records
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The chairman of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence said today his committee's investigation had discovered gaps in Central Intelligence Agency records on covert operations, raising the question of whether the records had been lost or destroyed.

title: French Say Peking Aide Foresees War With Soviet
description: PARIS, May 16 (AP)A weeklong visit to France by Deputy Premier Teng Hsiaoping of China ended tonight. French officials said the main results were an agreement for political consultations and trade and Chinese support for French efforts to promote world energy talks.

title: DR. MATTHEW SHAPIRO
description: Dr. Matthew Shapiro, a professor of internal medicine at University Hospital of the New York University Medical Center, died here yesterday of a heart attack. He lived at 20 Sutton Place South and had offires at 801 Park Avenue. He was 76 years old.

title: 2 Top Saigon Policemen Allowed to Leave Camp
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) The last chief of Saigon's police and a top official in the national police were allowed to leave Camp Pendleton, Calif., and settle in Los Angeles without completion of security checks, the Immigration and Naturalization Service said today.

title: American Adds Steel Art to the Tuileries
description: Continued From Page 29

title: Bishop Moore Marries Brenda Hughes Eagle
description: In the small, flowerfilled Bishop's Garden at the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine here yesterday at 6 P.M., Brenda Hughes Eagle and the Right Rev. Paul Moore Jr., Episcopal Bishop of New York, were married by the Rev. Canon Edward N. West, subdean of the cathedral.

title: SILVER FUTURES CLIMB SHARPLY
description: A large amount of speculative buying by West German and French sources sent silver futures sharply higher on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange yesterday, followed by rises in price for silver futures on the Commodity Exchange in New York.

title: Balaguer's Sister Dies
description: Carmen Balaguer de Paxot, the sister of President Joaquin Balaguer of the Dominican Republic, died Thursday at her home in Santo Domingo. Besides her brother, she leaves her husband, Dr. Jos Paxot; a daughter, and five sisters.

title: Certain Legislation Gets Backers Left and Right
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Politics, as they say, makes strange bedfellows. The latest proof came this week when Representative Shirley Chisholm, the liberal Democrat from Brooklyn, introduced a bill in the House that was sponsored in the Senate by John G. Tower, the rightwing Republican from Texas. crat from Brooklyn, introduced a bill in the House that was sponsored in the Senate by John G. Tower, the rightwing Republican from Texas.

title: HOUSING PICTURE IMPROVED IN APRIL
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Housing starts improved only slightly in April but permits for new housing showed their first sizable increase since the long slump in residential construction began, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Ze' Eva Cohen Does Three New Dances And Offers Revival
description: The unifying delight of any of Ze' Eva Cohen's solo repertory concerts is to see her move from lyric to dramatic style in works by a variety of choreographers. She has unusual gifts for dramatic expression, although one felt there was too much emphasis on that side of her talent on Thursday evening at the Theater of Riverside Church in her program of three new works and a revival of one of her own early dances.

title: Books of The Times
description: A parallel can be drawn between the China of today and the China of the 19th century. When the leaders of the Alanchu Dynasty were forced to admit the technological superiority of the West, they hit on a formula for making up lost ground: Chinese learning as the basis, Western learning for practical use.
