In other words, they were determined to preserve the traditional political and social values of Chinese culture; all they would accept from the West was its science and technique. The attempt to graft the second on the first failed, and the dynasty collapsed.

title: CAMBODIANS CITE TIMING OF AIR RAID
description: PEKING, May 16 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Cambodian Embassy here said today that American planes had bombed Sihanoukville in Cambodia and the neighboring town of Ream after the captured freighter Mayagez and her crew had been released.

title: Art: Guimet's Rarities Evoke the Orient of Old
description: One of the most admirable of 19thcentury Frenchmen was Emile Guimet (1836 1918). Guimet was a research chemist of genius; but, more than that, he was a man of universal curiosity and seemingly limitless zest. What he touched, he masteredno matter whether it was archeology, the history of religions, musical composition or the invention of a new kind of synthetic ultramarine blue.

title: Visiting Representatives Lament City Fiscal Plight
description: Representatives from as far away as California who are on a fourday visit to New York expressed sympathy yesterday for the city's financial plight, but doubted whether Congress and the Ford Administration would help it.

title: R. H. Hoguet Weds Aileen Billings
description: Aileen Jackson Billings of Washington, daughter of Mrs. Alan Grant of New York and the late Alan R. Jackson, was married here yesterday afternoon to Roland Henry Hoguet of Princeton, N.J., son of the late Dr. and Mrs. Peter Hoguet.

title: The Demise of South Vietnam
description: CHARLESTON, S. C.Senior American and Vietnamese officers who observed at firsthand the collapse of the Vietnamese Army and the disintegration of morale the people have given me further insight into the recent tragedy in South Vietnam.

title: PRICES DECLINE ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market fell yesterday in decreased trading.

title: Dodd Calls Nuisance Taxes Only Way
description: McAFEE, May 16Frank J. Dodd, President of the State Senate, apologized today for a package of nuisance taxes Senate Democratic leaders put together last night to substitute for a state income tax.

title: 4 Rescued From Under Capsized Tug
description: Police scuba divers tracing the frantic taps of four crewmen trapped in an air bubble under a capsized tug off Breezy Point, Queens, yesterday rescued the men in a hectic twohour operation.

title: Space Vehicle Is Launched
description: VANDENBERG A.F.B., Calif., May 16A research and development reentry vehicle was launched early today by the Space and Missile Test Center at Vandenberg Air Force Base. No details of the launching were announced.

title: Mass Transit
description: Patrons of the city's rapid transit lines are far fewer than they were a halfcentury ago, when the population was roughly 80 per cent of what it is today and the system itself much smaller. It is easy and tempting to attribute that phenomenon to a longdeveloping revulsion against the subway's insufferable racket, discomfort and dirt, along with the pervasive feeling of insecurity it has come to convey, especially at night. Yet that interpretation reverses cause and effect.

title: Henry T. Ortlieb, Headed Philadelphia Brewery. 62
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 16 (AP) Henry T. Ortlieb, president of the Henry F. Ortlieb Brewing Company here, died Tuesday at St. Luke's Episcopal Hospital after heart surgery, He was 62 years old.

title: Pope Finds Senile Society Joyless
description: ROME, May 16Pope Paul VI, in a document blending theology with philosophy, toslay deplored the joylessness and anguish of what he termed a senile civilization.

title: Court Rejects Bid on Funds for Pennsy
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 16 (UPI)A Federal court rejected today a Government petition to allocate $52.6million to the Penn Central Railroad to meet, equipment obligations maturing between now and next March 15.

title: DR. ARTHUR SPANGLER
description: Dr. Arthur S. Spangler, Boston dermatologist who had been on the staffs of Massachusetts General and Peter Bent Brigham Hospitals, died Thursday in Boston. He was 59 years old and lived in Weston, Mass.

title: FRANK H. BOWIES, EDUCATOR, IS DEAD
description: Dr. Frank H. Bowles, an educator and administrator, died Thursday of a heart attack in the office of the International Council for Educational Development here. He was 67 years old and lived in Demarest, N. J.

title: Senate, 792, Votes Refugee Aid; Ford Expected to Sign Promptly
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Senate gave final Congressional approval today to a $405million spending bill that is expected to accelerate the resettlement of Indochina refugees. The bill, which was passed by a 792 vote, goes to President Ford, who is expected to sign it promptly even though it provides $102million less than he originally sought.

title: Gail Williams Married To Robert B. Holmes
description: The marriage of Gail Lyle Williams, a remedialreading specialist, to Robert B. Holmes, a partner in Lazard Frres & Co., investment bankers, took place here yesterday. State Supreme Court Justice Martin Evans performed the ceremony in his chambers.

title: Mrs. Crimmins Told She Must Go Bach To Women's Prison
description: Alice Crimmins was remanded to prison yesterday to resume serving a 5 to 20year sentence for manslaughter in the death of her 4yearold daughter, Alice Marie, 10 years ago.

title: An American in the Tuileries
description: PARIS, May 15Well? said Mark di Suvero, his gray eyes squinting the better to inspect the reaction of the viewer inspecting his Thunderstorm Angel.

title: N.H.L. Playoffs
description: STANLEY CUP FINALS

title: Leroy McHugh, Reporter, Portrayed in Front Page
description: CHICAGO, May 16 (AP)Leroy (Buddy) McHugh, an oldtime crime reporter who was portrayed in the play The Front Page, died yesterday. He was 84 years old.

title: Moody's Gives City Top Rating on Notes Up for Sale Monday
description: Moody's Investor's Service, a leading securitiesrating agency, yesterday gave its highest grade to the city's $280million note issue scheduled for sale Monday morning.

title: ESCAPEE HELD HERE AFTER BANK ROBBERY
description: A bankrobbery suspect who has been on the mostwanted list of the Federal Bureau of Investigation since his escape with five other inmates last March from the Federal Detention Headquarters here was captured yesterday. He was said to have been part of threeman team that escaped with about $40,000 from a Washington Heights hank in robbery earlier yesterday.

title: The Daytime Emmy Awards Presented Aboard a Liner
description: The daytime Emmy Awards were presented Thursday by the National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences in ceremonies in New York Harbor aboard a Hudson River Day Liner.

title: Beame's Last Bid
description: ??ar Shah:

title: Notes on People
description: Leonard Garment was named by President Fordyesterday to be the United States representative on the Human Rights Commission of the United Nations Economic and Social Council. Mr. Garment, who was a member of the law firm here that Richard M. Nixonjoined in 1963, was Mr. Nixon's special consultant on minority affairs and later White House counsel before resigning last year. A graduate of Brooklyn College and the Brooklyn Law School, Mr. Garment, 51 years old, has resumed practice here with another firm; he lives in Brooklyn Heights with his wife and two children.

title: 12 Die in Fire in Egypt
description: CAIRO, May 16 (Reuters)At least 12 people died and 230 were injured in a fire that swept through the Nile Delta village of Buhut on Wednesday, officials said today. The village of strawroofed huts was destroyed in a few minutes by the blaze, which was fanned by Egypt's worst sandstorm of the year.

title: KISSINGER CALLS SHIP ACTION PROOF U. S. STANDS FIRM
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 Secretary of State Kissinger said today that the rescue of the container ship Mayagez and its crew should demonstrate to the world that there are limits beyond which the United States cannot be pushed.

title: At Least 13 Die as Train Falls Into Yugoslav River
description: VRANJE, Yugoslavia, May 16 (Reuters)A bridge collapsed under an express train near here last night, sending two coaches into a flooded river. At least 13 people were killed, and 169 injured.

title: U.S. AIDES SEEKING RELEASE BY LAOS
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Saturday, May 17American officials under house arrest in Savannakhet radioed yesterday that the situation there was becoming increasingly tense. They asked the United States Embassy to persuade the Laotian Government to send senior ministers to the city to obtain their release.

title: Byrne Sees Budget Vote And Maybe New Taxes
description: MORRISTOWN, May 16 Governor Byrne said today that he thought the state would have a balanced budget, by July 1, as required by law, the beginning of the new fiscal year, and left open the possibility that he might approve a $389million package of nuisance taxes that is under consideration by Senate Democratic majority leaders.

title: White House Says Mail And Calls Support Ford
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI)The White House said today that Americans, in more than 13,000 letters, telegrams and telephone calls, have indicated overwhelming approval of President Ford's handling of the Mayagez incident.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: the usual Congressional prartice of first enacting a bill to authorize and define a Federal program and then passing at a later date a separate appropriations hill actually providing the funds to carry out the previously authorized program.

title: The Traffic Incubus
description: To clean up New York's air, the Federal Environmental Protection Agency has ordered the expansion of express bus service in Manhattan with the aim of ultimately reducing car traffic into that borough by 20 per cent. But replacement of the private automobile in Manhattan cannot be allowed to wait on that slow development, much less on a vast improvement in mass transit.

title: Shipworms Now Threaten Barnegat Bay
description: WARETOWNConstruction and operation of New Jersey's only nuclear generating plant near this coastal town has turned the adjoining Oyster Creek into a nursery for shipworms and created a spreading blight up and down Barnegat Bay.

title: Screen: Miss Berlin in Sheila Levine
Foolish Pleasure Is Favored Against 9 Foes in Preakness
description: BALTIMORE, May 16Foolish Pleasure is the one to beat in the Preakness tomorrow. John L. Grear's splendid Floridabred colt is the strong favorite over nine rivals for the 100th running of the 1 3/16mile test that stands as the middle jewel of the Triple Crown for 3yearolds.

title: BUSS DENIES TALK ON CHAPIN'S TITLE
description: Anthony A. Bliss, executive director of the Metropolitan Opera, denied yesterday that Schuyler G. Chapin was being replaced as general manager of the company. However, Mr. Bliss would not comment on a report, which circulated in musical circles after Thursday's meeting of the Metropolitan board of trustees, that the title of general manager would be abolished, effective in July.

title: 24 Held in Drugs Operation
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., May 16 (AP)  Twentyfour persons were arrested today in connection with an illegal narcotics operation that reached into nine states as well as Mexico, Julius C. Michaelson, the State Attorney General, said today. Mr. Michaelson said the investigation centered on a Rhode Island corporation called Whitebird, Inc., formed by James E. O'Connell of South Kingstown.

title: Unvrilings
description: BRAUNSTEINMeyer, Dedication of menumant in Irving memory of Meyer Braunstein of 10: 30 A.M., Sunday, May 18, at Roth David Cemetery, Elmont, Long Israng Ran or shine.

title: Mental Patient Off Tower
description: DECATUR, Ill., May 16 (UPI) A young mental patient who clung barehanded to an 80foot radio tower for more than 38 hours was talked down to safety today. The police said that James B. Suttle, 22 years old, had repeatedly threatened to jump from the tower if any one came near him.

title: Hospitals Warn of Closings
description: SAN FRANCISCO. May 16 (UPI)Private hospitals here warned today that they faced bankruptcy and permanent closure because of a financial crisis aggravated by the doctors' strike. They feared a legislative solution would be too late.

title: Boy, 15, and 3 Men Seized In Buffalo Bank Robbery
description: Two 15yearold gunmen who apparently were armed and inspired by adults held up a Marine Midland Bank in Buffalo, on Thursday afternoon. They escaped with more than $10,000 and, the police said, spent the rest of the day pass ing out cash to friends, relatives and their conspirators.

title: Color TV Sales to Dealers In April 13.9% Below 1974
description: Sales of color television sets to dealers in April ran 13.9 per cent behind the yearago level, while blackandwhite TV set sales increased by 16.3 per cent over the April, 1974, level, according to figures released yesterday by the Electronic Industries Association's marketing services department.

title: Improved Outlook Eases Con Ed's Financial Woes
Breakfast of Champions, and Losers
description: BALTIMORE, May 16They call it the Alibi Breakfast, a term that harks away back to the days when Pimlico was a dowdy dowager among American race tracks, a place of leisurely, faded elegance with a maze of meandering passages, tunnels and cul de sacs that have been replaced by a functional plant that has all the evocative charm of a boys' correctional institution. Before a fire in 1966 destroyed the baroque old Members' Clubhouse that stood alone on the first turn, there was a corner table where trainers gathered for breakfast after the morning works, show ing no special mercy to the eggs, the sausages or the truth. It came to be known as the Alibi Table and it was after a session The Times here that Jimmy Jones, then training the enormously successful Calumet Farms string, was approached by one of his grooms, a philosopher named Dog Wagon in need of fresh betting money.

title: Stokes' Award Announced
description: Red Auerbach, general manager of the Boston Celtics, announced yesterday the awarding of a $1,000 scholarship to Jeffrey Richardson of Westinghouse High School, Pittsburgh, in memory of the late National Basketball Association star, Maurice Stokes.

title: A WHITE APPLIES TO BLACK CAUCUS
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Representative Fortney H. (Pete) Stark is not exactly an average member of the House. He is a rich former California banker, a liberal Democrat, a mod dresser and given to flamguoyance, his friends says.

title: GAF CORP. IN PACT TO PURCHASE WQIX
description: The GAF Corporation, a manufacturer of chemicals and photographic products, announced yesterday that it had signed an agreement in principle to purchase WQIVFM from the Starr Broadcasting Group for $2.2million. The company said that if the sale is consummated it would return the rock station to classical music programing and would reclaim the original call letters of WNCNFM.

title: LEONARD I. SALMANSON
description: PROVIDENCE& R. I., May 16 (AP)Leonard I. Salmanson of Providence, president and founder of the Adams Drug Company, died yesterday. He was 64 years old.

title: An American in the Tuileries
description: PARIS, May 15Well? said Mark di Suvero, his gray eyes squinting the better to inspect the reaction of the viewer inspecting his Thunderstorm Angel.

title: Law Officials' Training Center Moving to Georgia Next Month
description: BRUNSWICK, Ga., May 16x0020;The Consolidated Federal Law Enforcement Training Center is moving to Glynn County, Ga., according to an announcement made today by Senators Herman E. Talmadge and Sam Nunn and Representative Ronald B. Ginn.

title: Inspiration Plans Private Stock Sale at $37 a Share
description: The inspiration Consolidated Copper Company disclosed yesterday plans to raise $31.5million through the private sale of 850,000 shares of its authorized but unused common stock at a cash price of $37 a share. The plan approved yesterday by directors of Inspiration, calls for the purchase by the Hudson Bay Mining and Smelting Company, Ltd., Toronto, of 510,000 Inspiration common shares and the purchase by the Minerals and Resources Corporation, Ltd., Pembroke, Bermuda, of 340,000 Inspiration shares.

title: Budget Politics
description: Until Wednesday night the city's budgetary crisis had been remarkably free of public politics. The urgency of the city's needs transcended partisanship. And although the undeniable reality of a liberal Democratic city pleading with an essentially conservative Republican Administration had been an important element of the city's Washington effort, great care had been taken by Mayor Beame and his advisers to be apolitical.

title: T.W.A. Reports a Net Loss for April
description: The financially ailing Trans World Airlines reported yeterday a corporate net loss of $13.8million for April and a $87million net loss for the first four months this year. In April of last year, the huge carrier reported a $3.6million net loss. The net loss reported for the first four months of 1974 was $51million.

title: Extremists Stage a Wave Of Attacks in Italian Cities
description: ROME, May 16 (AP)Extremists shot and slightly wounded a Christian Democratic politician, attacked party offices and set the apartment of a judge afire in various Italian cities yesterday and today in a wave of violence a month before nationwide elections.

title: Bishop Alexander Zaleski Of the Lansing Diocese, 68
description: LANSING, Mich., May 16 (AP)The Most Rev. Alexander M. Zaleski, Roman Catholic Bishop of the 10county Lansing Diocese, died in Miami today, it was announced here. His age was 68.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: UPTOWN The Bronx Is playing host, with the borough's Bicentennial Celebration for the City tomorrow in Van Cortlandt Park. There will he musicales, hand music, a colonial craftsmen show, depictions of Revolutionary War encampments, art exhibits and road races, which start at 11 A.M.

title: ARA Stock Split Set
description: Directors of ARA Services, Inc., approved yesterday a 3for2 split of the company's common stock, payable July 16 to record holders June 16. The regular quarterly dividend of 36 cents a share on the presplit shares, was also voted, payable June 16 to shareholders of record May 30.

title: Science of Boxing Gets Reformulated
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev. May 16 He fought an intelligent, scientific fight, said Muhammad Ali about Ron Lyle after tonight's encounter.

title: Indonesia Contrasts Rescue With Abandoning Vietnam
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, May 16 (AP)  Foreign Minister Adam Malik said today that the Mayagez affair proves that the United States neglected big problems but aggrandized small ones.

title: The GreekTurkish Talks
description: It would be hard to exaggerate the importance of the meetings under way in Rome of the Greek and Turkish Foreign Ministersthe first highlevel contact in many months between the estranged allies. Heading the agenda for Messrs. Bitsios and Caglayangil is the question of how to take to the International Court of Justice the sharing of oil resources on the Aegean continental shelf between the two countriesa highly emotive issue that has recently bedeviled relations between the Governments of Greece and Turkey.

title: Park of Korea Asks A SelfReliant Spirit In Case of an Attack
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 16President Park Chung He?? warned today that, in the wak?? of Communist takeovers in Cambodia and South Vietnam the South Korean people should not rely too much on foreign support in the event of another invasion from the North.

title: FOX FILM IS NAMED IN SUIT BY HOLDERS
description: Nine derivative shareholders suits against the Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation and its directors seek damages for the alledged premiums paid David Merrik in the March, 1974, tender offer and purchase of the producer's entire holdings in Fox at a cost of $6.8 million. The suits filed May through August, last year, also seeking to have the transaction rescinded, are disclosed in the proxy statement for the Fox annual meeting in Los Angeles next Tuesday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MOROCCAN THREAT IS SEEN BY SPAIN
description: MADRID, May 16The Spanish Ambassador to Morocco has been summoned to Madrid for urgent consultations as officials in the Spanish Sahara spoke of a threat of armed conflict with the Moroccans.

title: Alaska Quake Recorded
description: PALMER, Alaska, May 16 (IJPI)A moderate earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 5 in the Richter Scale shook houses in Cold Bay, Dutch Harbor and Cape Sarichef early today, the Palmer Observatory reported. The quake was centered 70 miles southsouthwest of Cold Bay, or 700 miles southwest of Anchorage. The quake, which caused no reported damage, occurred at 12:58 A.M. Pacific daylight time. It was not sufficient to generate tidal wave.

title: Market Place
description: Not so many months ago, major institutions began unloading the socalled niftyfifty growth stocks as one disappointing earnings report after another exploded the myth of unending supergrowth.

title: Luck on Angel Side After Aiding Orioles
Miss Maynor 1st Black On Met Opera Board
description: Dorothy Maynor, executive director of the Harlem School of the Arts, was elected Thursday to the Metropolitan Opera's board of directors. Miss Maynor, a member of the etropolitan Opera Association since 1970, becomes the first black to sit on the Met board.

title: Kosygin Meets Bourguiba
description: TUNIS, May 16 (Reuters)Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin of the Soviet Union conferred with President Habib Bourguiba of Tunisia this morning. More talks are planned tomorrow morning before Mr. Kosygin leaves after a twoday visit. The Palestinian issue was said to have been one of the topics.

title: Just What The Doctor Ordered
description: PARISOvernight, by resolute and skillful leadership in the Mayagez crisis, President Ford has seemingly moved from the doldrums of Hooverdom toward the vigor of Harry Truman. He made up his mind; he consulted political leaders; he acted; and he succeeded. Small as the incident may later seem in history, a polluting stain is being erased from the previous American image of lassitude, uncertainty and pessimism.

title: David Blumberg Weds Janice O. Rothschild
description: Janice Oettinger Rothschild, a writer active in Atlanta Jewish community affairs, and David M. Blumberg of Knoxville, Tenn., international president of B'nai B'rith, were married Tuesday in Atlanta. The ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Nathan I. Lipson was performed by Rabbi Alexander M. Schindler of New York, president of the Union of American Hebrew Congregations.

title: CORRECTION
description: The monument at the junction of West End Avenue, Broadway and 106th Street is in memory of Ida and Isidor Straus, who died when the Titanic sank in 1912. The monument does not commemorate their daughters, as was stated in Wednesday's About New York column.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Falls
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 15.2 billion tonmiles, 13 per cent below a year ago. Carloadings in the same week totaled 456,317 cars, 15.3 per cent below last week.

title: Pianistic Virtuosity Of Dorothy Donegan Marks Interludes
description: Underneath Dorothy Donegan's footstomping, headshaking exhibitionism and her flamboyant displays of keyboard pyrotechnics, there is one of the best jazz pianists playing todayor any day.

title: Blue Chips Pace Stock Dip Dow Falls 11.19 to 837.61
description: Stock prices suffered a sizable decline yesterday, with the blue chips the major casualties in much lighter trading.

title: Persian Gulf Leaders May Meet to Draft a Pact
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 16Conservative Arab governments in the Persian Gulf area have reportedly been approached about a possibility of eventually adhering to regional cooperation pact now being contemplated by Iran and Iraq.

title: Plan to Charge for Drugs Under Medicaid Assailed
description: TRENTON, May 16More than a score of witnesses, representing interests ranging from the poor and elderly to pharmaceutical and dental associations, unanimously opposed at a public hearing charging Medicaid patients 50 cents for drug prescriptions they now receive free.

title: Spoken Words Utilized To Operate Equipment
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Instead of pushing buttons and turning cranks, people can tell machines by spoken words what to do. Vocal instructions and figures can be given to computers, tape can be punched for the operation of machine tools, and luggage can be sorted. Thomas B. Martin and Marvin B. Herscher were granted Patent 3,883,850 for their programable word recognition apparatus this week, assigning the rights to Threshold Technology, Inc., Cinnaminson, N.J., a company they organized in 1970. given to computers, tape can be punched for the operation of machine tools, and luggage can be sorted. Thomas B. Martin and Marvin B. Herscher were granted Patent 3,883,850 for their programable word recognition apparatus this week, assigning the rights to Threshold Technology, Inc., Cinnaminson, N.J., a company they organized in 1970.

title: BOLIVIA OFFICIALS FACE PROSECUTION
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, May 16The Lolivian Government said today it would prosecute any officials who had received illegal payments from the Gulf Oil Corporation. But it urged public opinion, and especially the press, to remain calm while such allegations were being investigated.

title: Yugoslav Dispute With Austria Worsens
description: VIENNA, May 16The leaders of Austria gathered in palace here late one October afternoon to consider in a hastily summoned conference reports of unrest in Serbia, brought by a traveler from Belgrade.

title: Ali, After a Slow Start, Stops Lyle In 11th Round of Championship Bout
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 16  Behind on points on the scorecards of two of the three judges, Muhammad Ali suddenly registered an 11thround knockout of Ron Lyle tonight in retaining the world heavyweight boxing championship.

title: William M. Pepper Jr. Is Dead; Compiled Newspaper Dictionary
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., May 16 (AP)William M. Pepper Jr., editor and copublisher of The Gainesville Daily Sun from 1945 to 1963, died Thursday. He was 71 years old.

title: 500 Illegal Aliens Seized At Los Angeles Factory
description: LOS ANGELES, May 16 (UPI) As many as 500 illegal aliens most of them Mexicanswere taken into custody today at handbag factory by agents of the Immigration and Naturalization Service.

title: BEAM THREATENS 38,000 DISMISSALS
description: Mayor Beame, attacking what he called the Republican pincer movement in Washington and in Albany, said yesterday that he would have to cut 38,000 of the 330,000 city jobs if his $640million proposal for aid and taxes is rejected by the state.

title: Open Interest
description: Friday, May 16, 1975

title: NEIGHBORS MOURN SLAIN YOUTH, 15
description: Neighbors of Victor Szvkuc Jr., the 15yearold Eagle Scout shot to death Wednesday evening a short distance from his home in the Ridgewood section of Brooklyn, were stunned yesterday, terming the apparently motiveless murder a terrific shock.

title: Senate Approves Bill for 900,000 Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI) The Senate passed and sent to the White House today a $5.3billion measure designed to fund jobproducing projects across the country, but the bill faced a possibility of a Presidential veto.

title: CITY CLUB URGES SLASH IN BUDGET
description: The City Club of New York asked Mayor Beame yesterday for an immediate cut of $1.5billion in the city budget, a oneyear freeze of all salary and fringebenefit increases, oneyear moratorium on the redemption of all city notes and bonds, and a cut of about 5 per cent in all city salaries.

title: Texas Strike Called Off
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., May 16 (AP) A group of Texas doctors called off a strike threatened for tomorrow over malpractice insurance.

title: House Unit Agrees On Amnesty Oath For Draft Evaders
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI) A House subcommittee informally agreed today on a bill to free draft resisters willing to sign a certificate swearing their action was due to the Indochina war. The subcommittee's chairman, Robert W. Kastenmeier, Democrat of Wisconsin, whose judiciary subcommittee staff wrote the compromise proposal, said that i?? would have been futile to seek legislation granting unconditional amnesty.

title: Reform Plans for Nursing Homes Scored
description: A program of nursinghome reform backed by the state Democratic leadership was attacked at an Assembly hearing here yesterday by the industry as too tough and by Assemblyman Anrew L. Stein as too soft.

title: Law Officers' Training Center Moving to Georgia Next Month
description: BRUNSWICK, Ga., May 16The Consolidated Federal Law Enforcement Training Center is moving to Glynn County, Ga., according to an announcement made today by Senators Herman E. Talmadge and Sam Nunn and Representative Ronald B. Ginn.

title: BRIBE FROM WEST DOOMS A RUSSIAN
description: MOSCOW, May 16The head of a Soviet business organization buying Western equipment has been sentenced to death for having contracted for the equivalent of more than $500,000 in bribes from a Western concern seeking Soviet orders, it was reported today. He was said to have received the ruble equivalent of over $140,000 in cash.

title: Sadat in Jordan on ArabUnity Tour
description: AMMAN, Jordan. May 16President Anwar elSadat arrived in Jordan today for a 24hour visit during which he reportedly hopes to reduce some of the differences between King. Hussein and the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: Bridge:
Rosewall, Tanner and Alexander Win
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 16 Ken Rosewall and Roscoe Tanner swept into the semifinal round of the Alan King Tennis Classic at Ceasar's Palace today, with straight set victories, and will face each other tomorrow in the top half of the bracket. The match will be on television.

title: Williams Won't Tarry Tonight
description: KINGSTON Jamaica, May 16Steve Williams set the tone for his 100meter dash confrontation against Houston McTear tomorrow night at the International Freedom Games.

title: Arbour in Traction For Back Ailment
description: The New York Islanders' head coach, Al Arbour, who complained of back pains for most of the National Hockey League season, has been hospitalized and put in traction for an indefinite period.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Up for Auction: Lunch With a Notable
description: WASHINGTON, May 16In many ways, this is a small town with all of the flavor of a small town. The difference is that children's fathers frequently are White House assistants, Senators, Ambassadors or widely read columnists, and many mothers are Representatives, members of the Administration or lobbyists.

title: Youth Says Miss Hearst Admitted Robbing Bank
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., May 16 (AP)  Patricia Hearst acknowledged she participated in a robbery by the selfstyled Symbionese Liberation Army of a San Francisco bank, a witness at the Marcus Foster murder trial has testified.

title: Senate, 792, Votes Refugee Aid; Ford Expected to Sign Promptly
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Senate gave final Congressional approval today to a $405million spending bill that is expected to accelerate the resettlement of Indochina refugees.

title: V.I.P.'s Tour Brookhaven on Eve of Open House
description: UPTON. L. I., May 16Floyd Linton and Tom Downey found out today how nuclear energy can be used for more than just producing power.

title: ROCKEFELLER ASKS AID FOR REFUGEES
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) Vice President Rockefeller picked an audience of Republican ethnic group representatives for a speech today seeking acceptance of Vietnam refugees in American life.

title: RALPH M. CHAIT, 82, AN ANTIQUES DEALER
description: Ralph M. Chait, founder and president of the Ralph M. Chait Galleries, Inc., one of the oldest antiques concerns specializing in Chinese art in this country, died yesterday at Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 82 years old.

title: Thais, Angry With U.S., Call Their Envoy Home
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 16 Premier Kukrit Pramoj said tonight that Thailand was recalling her Ambassador to the United States for consultations after what he described as an American violation of this country's sovereignty.

title: 2D CAMBODIA RAID DISCLOSED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Defense Department said today that United States naval planes had made a second attack against the Cambodian mainland as part of the operation to recover the cargo ship Mayagez and its crew.

title: 4 IN CREW SAVED ON CAPSIZED TUG
description: Police scuba divers tracing the frantic taps of four crewmen trapped in an air bubble under a capsized tug off Breezy Point, Queens, yesterday rescued the men in a hectic twohour operation.

title: Ninth Ave.: A Food Festival of 22 Countries
description: Manganaro's has laid in 500 extra pounds of capicollo and mortadella; Poseidon has been baking extra baklava for days, and up at La Milonga, the Argentina restaurant, Toshiaki, who bills himself as the world's only Japanese tango singer, has got some special numbers for the anticipated crowds.

title: Making Contact
description: Even before the fastmoving operational details the Mayagilez affair have been fully analyzed, one obvious diplomatic lesson stands out clearly. This is the acute difficulty, in crisis circumstances, of communicating with unfamiliar and unfriendly governments either directly or through unfamiliar and unfriendly intermediaries.

title: David Arons of Gimbels Dies; Dropsie University Official
description: David Arons, executive vice president of Dropsie University in Philadelphia and a former vice president for sales promotion of Gimbels Philadelphia, died Thursday at his home in Philadelphia. He was 72 years old.

title: A.B.A. Championship
description: Indiana vs. Kentucky

title: Mets Pound Astros to Win, 102
description: HOUSTON, May 16Tom Seaver was a long way from being overpowering tonight against the Houston Astros. But, with a little bit of luck and a massive hitting attack by his teammates, he chalked up his fifth victory of the season as the New York Mets pummeled the Astros, 102, before a crowd of 10,672 at the Astrodome.

title: Military Warehouse Full of Explosives Blows Up in Israel
description: TEL AVIV, May 16 (AP)A military warehouse full of explosives blew up today in an industrial area 15 miles from Tel Aviv.

title: Russian Scientist Defects in Honolulu
description: HONOLULU, May 16A 27yearold Russian from the oceanographic research ship Dmitri Mendeleyev has defected to the United States, the immigration authorities said today.

title: Satellites Delayed Again
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., May 16 (UPI)Lighting striking near the launching pads at this space center last week, has forced a second postponement, in the liftoff launch of twin military communications satellites, Air Force officials announced today. They set 9:57 A.M. Tuesday for the launching, of the satellites aboard a Titan 3C rocket.

title: Antiques: Whaling Days
description: NEWARKIt is difficult to imagine museums or collectors limiting their exhibitions and acquisitions of whaling materials to pie crimpers, corset stays, canes, swifts, parasols and engraved cuspids.

title: A.T.&T. OFFERING IS ONLY 10% SOLD
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company, which had hoped to raise nearly $1.6billion in its huge warrantexchange offer, said yesterday on the basis of preliminary results that only about 10 per centor $160million of the totalhad been taken by investors.

title: More MinorityWorker Jobs Considered for C.C.N.Y. Building
description: A top official of the State Dormitory Authority said yesterday that his agency was exploring ways to add more minority construction workers to a bitterly disputed building project at City College without removing workers already on the job.

title: 7 Banks Hold $1Billion In City Notes and Bonds
description: The seven largest banks in New York City hold $1.25billion of the city's bonds and notes in their investment and trading accounts, reliable people said yesterday. The holdings equal 9 per cent. of the $13.3billion of city notes and bonds outstanding.

title: SCHOOLS QUERIED ON RACIAL STATUS
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Department of Health, Education and Welfare, under orders from a Federal court, today asked 115 school districts in 16 Southern and Border states to explain racial imbalances in some of their schools.

title: Business Briefs
description: The American Stock Exchange will double to 40 the number of underlying securities on which options may traded in the new Amex options market, Paul Kolton, chairman, announced yesterday. Call options on the 20 additional issues, all listed on the New York Stock Exchange, are expected to be added in an expansion program beginning in a few weeks, he said.

title: Students' Vow to Return Praised by Newark Officials
description: NEWARK, May 16Officials of the Newark Board of Education today praised a decision by the Newark Students Union to end the student boycott of the public school system and return to classes on Monday.

title: Coast Legislature Called Over Strike
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., May 16 (AP)  Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. announced today that he would call the Legislature into special session Monday to consider plans to ease a burgeoning malpractice crisis.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Employes of the wholesale meat industry in the New YorkNew Jersey area have ratified a new threeyear contract that will provide pay increases of $43.25 a week for 3,000 workers. The workers are represented by Local 174 of the Butchers, Food Handlers and Allied Workers. Their pay has ranged from $170 a week for wrappers up to $230 a week for butchers, a union spokesman said. The settlement also provides for improvements in welfare and pension benefits, he said.

title: One LongRange Study of Pill Has Yet to Find a Medical Case Against
description: SAN JUAN, P. R.Stored in a corner of the University of Puerto Rico's medical sciences center are 14,000 priceless case histories in birth control, including the uninterrupted medical records of women who pioneered the use of the pill nearly 20 years ago.

title: German Admits Taking Smithsonian Minerals
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP)A 47yearold chemist from West Germany said in Federal court today that his enthusiasm for collecting minerals had turned into a compulsion to steal.

title: 5 in Family Die in Fire
description: PITTSBURGH, May 16 (UPI) A mother and four of her children died today in a fire that swept through their twostory frame home in a small community across the Allegheny River. The father and one son escaped. The victims were Mrs. Albert Salvatore and four children ranging in age from 8 years to 3 months.

title: MALPRACTICE BILL PLEASES AND IRKS
description: Doctors and lawyers voiced opposingand almost always vehement  reactions yesterday to the State Legislature's compromise bill to end the crisis in medical malpractice insurance.

title: Shabuoth Messages Stress the Eternity Of Commandments
description: Shabuoth, the Jewish commemoration of the giving of the Ten Commandments to Moses on Mount Sinai, will end at sundown today with observances in synagogues.

title: COMPANY ASSAILS FLORIDA OFFICIAL
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., May 16 (AP)The president of a Florida land development company accused a highranking state official today of spreading serious inaccuracies in naming his company as a participant in an alleged $1billion land fraud scheme.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Museums' Staffs in Italy Call Strike Over Buralary
description: ROME, May 16The staffs of museums throughout Italy declared a oneweek strike as a symbolic protest against poor security, citing the theft of paintings from the Gallery of Modern Art in Milan yesterday morning.

title: Theater: Dark Tower
description: The Negro Ensemble Company's SeasonWithinaSeason of new plays puts the emphasis on the script and the acting. There is a minimum of props and scenery in these studio productions. Among other things, it is a chance for new playwrights to see their work on stageand for them to learn from their mistakes.

title: W. Germany Ties With Sweden
description: BERLIN. May 16 (AP) Bjorn Borg's victory over Karl Meiler today gave Sweden a split of its singles matches against West Germany in Davis Cup European Zone A quarter final competition.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, MAY 17, 1975

title: Militant Is Hanged by Trinidad After Long Fight for Clemency
description: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad, May 16 (UPI)Michael Abdul Malik, who as Michael X was a major figure in London's blackpower movement in the nineteensixties, was hanged today in his native Trinidad for the machete murder of his cousin.

title: Thais, Angry With U.S., Call Their Envoy Home
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 16 Premier Kukrit Pramoj said tonight that Thailand was recalling her Ambassador to the United States for consultations after what he described as an American violation of this country's sovereignty.

title: KISSINGER CALLS SHIP ACTION PROOF U. S. STANDS FIRM
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 Secretary of State Kissinger said today that the rescue of the container ship Mayagilez and its crew should demonstrate to the world that there are limits beyond which the United States cannot be pushed.

title: Airman Gets 10 Year Term For Attempt to Aid Soviet
description: GRANDVIEW. Mo., May 16 (UPI)Air Force M. Sgt. Raymond DeChamplain was sentenced yesterday to 10 years at hard labor and forfeiture of pay and allowances for attempting to transmit classified military documents to Soviet agents.

title: Casper In Lead By Shot
V . A ., Fearing Abuses, Tightens Controls on Schooling Outlays
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) Fearful that abuses of education benefits may he costing American taxpayers millions of dollars, the Veterans Administration has begun steps to tighten controls on veterans attending school under the G.I. Bill.

title: GULF OIL ADMITS IT ILLEGALLY GAVE 5MILLION ABROAD
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The chairman of the Gulf Oil Corporation told a Senate subcommittee today that, over the last decade, his company had made about $5million in illegal political contributions abroad, including $4million to politicians in South Korea.

title: Turk in Italy for Talks
description: ROME, May 16Foreign Minister Ihsan Fabri Caglayangil of Turkey arrived here today for weekend talks with Foreign Minister Dimitrios Bitsios of Greece on oil rights in the Aegean Sea and on the Cyprus problem.

title: Sports Today
description: AUTO RACING

title: Theater: Room Service
description: HARTFORD  To judge merely from their national coverage, an unwary observer might possibly conclude that the American resident theaters offer their patrons nothing but the most exciting theatrical fare with new plays, unusual revivals and classics, both ancient and modern, cascading over the footlights in a manner fit to whet the most jaded playgoer's appetite. This is untrue. Or rather it is not wholly true.

title: Burns's 68 Sets Mark, Wins Medal
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., May 16A 36  year  old record was broken today on the Garden City Golf Club course when George Burns 3d shot a fiveunderpar 68 in the medal round of the 65th annual Walter J. Travis Memorial tournament.

title: BRIBE FROM WEST DOOMS A RUSSIAN
description: MOSCOW, May 16The head of a Soviet business organization buying Western equipment has been sentenced to death for having contracted for the equivalent of more than $500,000 in bribes from a Western concern seeking Soviet orders, it was reported today. He was said to have received the ruble equivalent of over $140,000 in cash.

title: DR. JANE BALDWIN
description: Dr. Jane North Baldwin, physician emeritus of Vassar College, where she had been chairman of the hygiene department, died Thursday at her home in Poughkeepsie, N. Y. She was 99 years old.

title: State of the City: The Arteries of Transit
description: Like any other great city, New York is a vast social complex dependent in the highest degree on the ease with which its citizens can move from section to sectionwhether to earn a living or to enjoy the city's rich cultural resources.

title: Editorial Article 1  No Title
description: tions drag on and become in itself a point of controversy, there are strong practical considerations for pursuing this suggestion from Saigon toward renewing at least a token American representation in South Vietnam.

title: New State Austerity Drive Will Cut Jobs and Services
description: ALBANY, May 16  The first wave of a new austerity drive was announced today by the Carey administration. It would eliminate 840 more jobs and double fees to $2 an auto at Jones Beach and other waterfront state parks.

title: Back Ordination of Women
description: FROSTBURG, Md., May 16 (UPI)The Episcopal Diocese of Maryland voted today is favor of a resolution urging ordination of women as priests. It was the first day of its 191st annual convention. The delegates represented 124 congregations throughout Maryland except for the Washington suburbs and the eastern shore.

title: The Mediterranean
description: With the publication in English of the second volume of Fernand Braudel's prodigiously innovative study of Mediterranean civilizations in the 16th century, Americans can now read in its entirety what is probably the most significant historical work to appear since World War II. First published in France in 1949 and revised in 1966, The Mediterranean and the Mediterranean World in the Age of Philip II has generated international admiration and debate.

title: Masterwork Chorus Still Humming at 20
description: MORRISTOWNThe Masterwork Foundation Chorus of Morristown is 20 years old this month, thereby making it New Jersey'sand one of the nation'soldest volunteer choral associations.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A $22million contract for 398 special busesdesigned for the convenience of elderly and the handicapped has been awarded to the Flxible Bus Company of Loudonville, Ohio, by the Metropolitan Transportation Authority.

title: Peggy Stevens Engaged
description: Dr. and Mrs. Norman Stevens of Woodmere, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Peggy Lee Stevens, to William Ian Schwartz, son of Mrs. Frances Schwartz, also of Woodmere, and the late Sidney Schwartz. A June wedding is planned.

title: Ballet: Sleeping Beauty
description: One of the major roles in the original 1890 Petipa production of The Sleeping Beauty' was the mime character of Carabosse, the evil fairy. Made famous by the performance of Enrico Cecchetti, the part has traditionally, but not always, been played by a man.

title: Shah Expects Rise In Oil Price in Fall
description: WASHINGTON, May 17The Shah of Iran said today that he expected the price of oil to rise again later this year because worldwide inflation was cutting the purchasing power of the oilproducing countries.

title: LongRange P. S. C. Approach To Energy and Economy Urged
description: Edward Berlin, the publicinterest lawyer named by Covernor Carey to he the State Public Service Commission's first consumer commissioner and who faces a confirmation hearing before a State Senate committee this week, said yesterday that the problem of rapidly rising utility rates was desperate but not honeless

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: S.E.C. Inquiry Touches on Hoff a Family
description: WASHINGTON, May 17A preliminary investigation by the Chicago staff of the Securities and Exchange Commission is under way into a transfer of race track stock to relatives of James R. Hoffa, former president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, 11 months before a pension fund lent the track $4million.

title: Proof That Galileo Sought Proof
description: Whether Galileo Galllei was an exemplary member of the first generation of modern scientists or one of the last great representatives of the medieval scholastic tradition is still a matter of debate among historians of science. At issue is the extent to which the Italian astronomer and physicist used experiment to verify abstract ideas.

title: Brown U. Gets $4.1Million From Rhode Island Family
description: PROVIDENCE, May 17 (AP) Brown University, struggling for financial stability, has received bequests totaling S4.1million from a Rhode Island family.

title: U.S. EASES POLICY ON BALTIC STATES
description: LENINGRAD, May 17The United States, through its consulate here, is diluting a 35yearold policy of refusing to recognize the incorporation of Lithuania, Latvia and Estonia into the Soviet Union.

title: Soberyet drinking too much
description: Alcohol is man's original tranquilizing drug and has been used for some 200 million years. But until recently, there has been precious little information on precisely how it affects the human body and brain. Over the last several years, however, scientists have been conducting experiments into the relationships between alcohol and virtually every aspect of human physiology, with a series of ominous results.

title: Another Version of the Fatal PostGame Hockey Fight in Canada
description: The trial and conviction of a teenage hockey player for manslaughter after a rival youth died as a result of their postgame fight off the ice was the subject of a Views of Sport article by Dr. Ross Runfola, a sports sociologist at Medaille College in Buffalo. It appeared on this page last Oct. 27.

title: Fashion
Food News
description: NORTH BERGENAll the world not only loves a lover, but apparently pita bread, too. The pace at which the Toufayan Bakery here turns out the round, brownbaked bread is not fast enough to keep up with the demand, according to Harry Toufayan, whose establishment is one of the largest of its kind in the metropolitan area.

title: The Women in Crime
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 16  When women finally make it to the top as bank presidents, they are just as prone as men to grab the chance for embezzlement, the chief of the United Nations crime orevention and criminal justice section has concluded.

title: THE EAGLES SERVE LOS ANGELES ROCK
description: The Eagles' first big hit was called Taking It Easy. and the sentiments of that title have more or less defined their image ever since. This is the leading presentday day Los Angeles countryrock band. Yes, the five players can work up a decent amount of excitement when they choose. But the esssence of the sound is more relaxed, the intimate suggestions of love and tenderness.

title: Wedding Is Held Here For Mary M. Pritchard
description: Mary Manion Pritchard, daughter of Mrs. Manion J. Pritchard of Minneapolis and the late Mr. Pritchard, was married here Yesterday afternoon to Charles Patrick Durkin Jr., son of Mrs. Durkin of Bernardsville, N. J. and Boca Grande, Fla., and the late Mr. Durkin. Msgr. James G. Welders performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More.

title: This Week in Sports
description: Baseball

title: SOVIET WARSHIPS END BOSTON VISIT
description: BOSTON, May 17 (AP)Hundreds of Bostonians jammed Commonwealth Pier to wave goodbye as two Soviet warships pulled away at noon today, ending a fiveday goodwill visit.

title: OneCredit Courses in Humanities Are Offered at Brooklyn College
description: A series of onecredit, minicourses is being offered by the School of Humanities at Brooklyn College in an effort to draw students into cultural subjects.

title: Changes Urged in Senate
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (AP) The chairmen of Senate committees would change every four years under a measure proposed this week by Senators Gaylord Nelson, Democrat of Wisconsin, and Mark Hatfield, Republican of Oregon.

title: School Is Using Tennis to Raise Funds
description: ENGLEWOOD  The continuing boom in tennis is being used by DwightEnglewood School to counteract what appears to be a recessioninspired trend toward reduced contributions to private institutions.

title: Top Detective in Queens on the Move
description: Edwin T. Dreher, deputy chief in charge of Queens detectives, has been getting inquiries about catering parties and he has reached the point where he has been telling callers that he may be in the market for professional entertainers for future parties.

title: A Sephardic Service in Bulgaria: Worshipers Are Mostly Aged
description: SOFIA, BulgariaA small prayer room with a tall stovepipe as its center pillar is large enough, with places to spare, to gather in on the sabbath eve all the Bulgarian Jews who pray. The splendid highdomed synagogue next door, long out of use, gives evidence of how many prayed here once, and it was only one of several.

title: Sotheby Has Struck Oil Selling Art to Iranians
description: TEHERAN, IranIranian art lovers bought or reserved dozens of European paintings with price tags totaling $500,000 at a single cocktail partycumart show here recently, executives of Sotheby Parke Bernet, the art dealers, reported.

title: Renee Hula tar Married To Barry Nisbit Rowe
description: Renee Cosmy Hulitar, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Hulitar of Palm Beach, Fla., was married yesterday afternoon to Barry Nisbit Rowe, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Louis Rowe of Sag or, L.I., and Montego Bay, Jamaica. Canon Paul F. Wancura performed the ceremony at the Caroline Episcopal Church in Setauket, L.I.

title: Miss Schwab Is Betrothed
description: Margery B. Schwab, daughter of Mrs. William R. Deering of Laurel Hollow, L. I., and Hermann C. Schwab of Oyster Bay, L. I., plans to be married June 28 to William J. Constantine, son of Dr. and Mrs. Walter E. Constantine of Buffalo.

title: CUBAN EXILES SEE A TEST FOR CIGARS
description: TEGUCIGALPA, HondurasWhen the United States embargo of Cuba cut off the supply of the island's famed cigars to American smokers more than a decade ago, some small consolation was soon found in Havana leaf cigars made by Cuban exiles in Central America.

title: MARY TRAVERS SINGS AT THE BOTTOM LINE
description: The war that started protest songs is apparently over, with Joan Baez appearing nicely gowned on the Johnny Carson show while Mary Travers, once of Peter, Paul and Mary, working blue jeans earlier and long long gown later at the Bottom Line club Friday. Miss Travers spent last year leaning toward a kind of intelligent feminism in her songs and is today working toward some intelligent programing that includes the best of her former days (Leaving on a Jet Plane, principally).

title: They Did Their Own, in Stone
description: KINGSTON, N. Y.Masonry holds Its mysteries for most amateur home builders, but not for Stephen and Rene Rockmore. They built their house of stone550 tons of bluestone slabi quarried decades ago to make curbs for the streets of New York.

title: BRITISH APATHETIC ON MARKET VOTING
description: LONDON, May 17With less than three weeks to go before the British vote on whether to remain in the European Common Market, proponents and opponents have managed to agree on one thing: They are worried about public apathy.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LEWISBURG, Pa, May 17Charles R. Woollum, 34 years old, an assistant at Old Dominion University for the last three years, was named head basketball coach today at Bucknell University. Woollum succeeds James T. Valvano, who resigned in April to become basketball coach at Iona College.

title: Letters
description: There is something surreal, absurd, infuriating about John Hersey's portrait of President Ford just sitting there like a courteous Iron Duke, calmly directing traffic and placating an inept bureaucracy (aspiring more to teamwork than to performance) in a nation and a world coming apart at the ??earns and desperately seeking the affirmative leadership which the American Presidency is uniquely capable of providing (The President. April 20).

title: Casper, on 66 for 201, Takes 4Shot Lead at New Orleans
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 17What with selling fruit, chasing cows, raising 10 children and designing golf courses, Billy Casper has to take long layoffs from golf, and that is just the way he wants it. He comes back refreshed and eaeer.

title: Cleric Is Fiance of Dr. Violet Stephenson
description: Dr Violet E. Stephenson, director of the BedtordStuyvesant Community Mental Health Center, and the Rev Neville N. SimmonsSmith, minister of the South Congregational Church in Brooklyn, plan to be married June 14

title: A's Deal Yankees 61 Loss
description: Suppose Catfish Hunter loses to the Oakland A's today. What, then, are the Yankees to do?

title: SUIT WOULD BLOCK REZONING FOREST
description: MARQUETTE, Mich., May 17 A suit to enjoin this Northern Michigan city from changing a zoning ordinance has aroused interest throughout the Great Lakes region because of its significance for the enforcement of Michigan's environmental Protection Act.

title: Coordination Held Key Problem In U. S.Soviet Practice Mission
description: HOUSTON, May 17 (UPI)The chief flight director for this summer's AmericanSoviet space flight said today that the greatest problem discovered in a weeklong practice mission was coordination with the Russians when problems occurrecl.

title: Queens Block Associations Press Patrol Plan
description: Queens block associations are stepping up their drive to organize security and fire patrols, as well as other service programs, in anticipation of continued layoffs among crucial city agencies.

title: Editors' Choice
description: BREACH OF FAITH, by Theodore H. White. (Atheneum/Reader's Digest Press. $10.95.) The Meistersinger of our quadrennial campaign revelries turns to a darker theme: the fall of Richard M. Nixon.

title: After the Mayagez
description: A nation with the power to influence events in every area of the world, near and far, bears many burdens of decision and risk from which there is no escape. Such a nation is warily scrutinized by allies that depend upon it for their own survival and by adversaries that would probe its weaknesses of political will or military capacity.

title: Announcer Perfect In Preakness Calls
description: BALTIMORE, May 17Even Chic Anderson had to admit he went very well in the nationally televised call of today's 100th Preakness at Pimlico.

title: Sports Today
description: AUTO RACING

title: Sculptor Stresses Peace In Works
description: Moissaye Marans has always depicted themes of peace in his works. Recently, as the 72yearold sculptor reflected over half a century's worth of sketches, notes and photographs scattered around his Brooklyn Heights studio, he spoke about the philosophies that have governed his workas well as his life.

title: Astrology Session Begins
description: MONTCLAIR  Astrologers aren't fortunetellers. Our job is not to predict future events, but to help people to understand the psychological climate of their lives so that they can handle their lives better.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONWhile it may be true that economists have not come up with any grand new ideas lately for solving the nation's seemingly endless problems, a pair of them have produced this month two striking new suggestions on how the economy should be viewed and measured.

title: David Humes Weds Doris Suechting
description: Doris Suechting and David Bryant Humes, son of Mr. and Mrs. John P. Humes of Mill Neck, L. I., were married yesterday afternon in Appleton, Wis. The Rev. John C. Hanchett performed the ceremony in the First Congregational Church.

title: Realization Pace To Timmy Lobell
GUEST VIEW
description: NEW HAVEN The stage is set with plain, pinewood planks. Boxes, chairsall of them constructed from bare unfinished boardsserve as scenery. Through sliding doors we perceivechiefly a lighting effecta path, to be much traveled, to a dungeon and to death. Like the setting, this is a stripped, unvarnished Richard III. The panoply of Richard is reduced (no armies swirl in battle) and there is a calm, almost conversational quality to the delivery of much of the dialogue, which is perfectly suited to the intimacy of the Long Wharf. Shakespeare's play is reduced in stagesize, but not in dimension.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Marriage Announcement 6  No Title
