description: Choreographers frequently feel constrained by the limits of a studio, but few invent such imaginative ways to open up the space as does Laura Foreman. She presented two dances from repertory Saturday at the New School, both of which used areas not usually included as danceable.

title: Humphrey Says Dairy Gifts Almost Made Him Retire
description: MINNEAPOLIS, May 18 (AP) Senator Hubert H. Humphrey says he came close to quitting public life as a result of illegal contributions to his campaigns by a dairy cooperative.

title: African Parley Calls for Free Press
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, May 17A conference of journalists and publishers has concluded here that government ownership of the press is potentially dangerous to the survival of its freedom.

title: Jersey Consumer Notes
description: There is something for consumers to ponder in the latest tentative tax package proposed by the State Senate majority. The legislation shifts the burden of providing most of the money needed to balance the state budget from an income tax to the existing sales tax.

title: Kent State Civil Trial Opening Today
description: CLEVELAND, May 18Gov. James A. Rhodes and 52 members of the state's National Guard go to trial tomorrow in what is expected to provide new forum for the unraveling of the Kent State shootings of five years ago.

title: Captain of the Mayaguez Says Marines Invaded Wrong Island
description: SINGAPORE, May IS (AP)Marines invaded the wrong Cambodian island trying to rescue the crew of the captured freighter Mayagez, the captain and crew members said today.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa, May 18 (UPI)  Shinsuke Shoji of the Memphis. Tenn., Gym School captured two first places in six categories in the men's individual competition of the Amateur Athletic Union national gymnastics championships yesterday. Ann Carr of the Philadelphia Gymnastics Club won the women's individual competition. Shoji took tp honors in the parallel bars with 18.375 points and first in vaulting with 18.4.

title: Bolivia Demands Gulf Oil Name Recipients of Gifts
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, May 18 (Reuters)The Bolivian Government demanded today that the Gulf Oil Corporation identify without delay or ambiguities all the people here who received political contributions from the company.

title: Stewart to Get Rangers' Post
description: Ron Stewart, who played 21 seasons in the National Hockey League, is expected to be named coach of the New York Rangers today, replacing Emile Francis, who will remain as general manager.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: U.S. WEIGHED USE OF B52'S IN CRISIS
description: VIENNA, May 18The United States was considering using B52 bombers against the Cambodian mainland after the seizure of the freighter Mayagilez last week if the carrier Coral Sea had not arrived in the area by Wednesday, a top United States official said today.

title: Dance: A Joint Concert
description: Carla Maxwell, a leading member of the Jose Limn Dance Company, and Stanley B. Sussman, a composer who has conducted for the Martha Graham Dance Company since 1966 as well as other dance troupes, offered a joint concert of dance and music Saturday night at Larry Richardson's Dance Gallery.

title: LOPEZ, AT 81, BACK ON BANDSTAND HERE
description: Vincent Lopez, who made his debut as leader of a dance band 59 years ago in the Pekin Restaurant at Broadway and 47th Street, is back on the bandstand again. Mr. Lopez, who is 81, is leading a sevenpiece band at the Riverboat, Fifth Avenue and 34th Streethis first New York appearance since he wound up a 26year engagement at the Taft Hotel nine years ago and moved to Miami.

title: New jersey Briefs
description: Albert Shanker, president of the American Federation of Teachers, told New Jersey teachers that the education field might experience massive layoffs within the next few years but that educators must not sacrifice contract benefits for job security.

title: SHAH DENIES JAILING 40,000 DISSIDENTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 The Shah of Iran said today that his Government was holding fewer than 3.000 persons in jail on charges related to terrorist actions.

title: U.S. WEIGHED USE OF B52'S IN CRISIS
description: VIENNA, May 18The United States was considering using B52 bombers against the Cambodian mainland after the seizure of the freighter Mayagez last week if the carrier Coral Sea had not arrived in the area by Wednesday, a top United States official said today.

title: A Colorado Inmate Is Killed And 3 Are Hurt in Skirmish
description: CANON CITY, Colo. May 18 (UPI)  Colorado State Prison officials said that an inmate was killed and three others were injured today during a skirmish in the prison.

title: Judith Stone, Copy Editor, Wed To Aaron Appelstein, Violinist
description: Judith Stone, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert J. Stone of Teaneck, N. J., was married yesterday afternoon to Aaron Appelstein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Appelstein of Laurelton, Queens.

title: L. I. Golf Is Taken By Koch
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., May 18Gary Koch and George Burns 3d, members of the United States Walker Cup team, battled to the 19th hole today in the final of the Walter J. Travis golf tournament before Koch triumphed. He sank a ninefoot putt for a birdie that gave him the victory as Burns was down in par.

title: Tanner Is Victor In Final
description: LAS VEGAS, May 18Putting away a backhand volley on the 20th point of a tiebreaker in the final set, Roscoe Tanner won the Alan King tennis tournament today and $30,000, plus a $24,000 car, by beating Ross Case, 57, 75, 76.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Mary Beame threw out the first ball, thereby officially opening the Fashion Tennis Center and Mart on the second floor of 512 Seventh Avenue, near 37th Street. Unofficially, since it opened earlier this year, the threequarter size court has been used for practice sessions and lessons by tennis buffs, who are no rarer in the garment center than they are anywhere else in the country.

title: HIGHWAY SNIPER FIRE A PUZZLE IN TEXAS
description: SHERMAN, Tex., May 18 (UPI)  The police searched highway overpasses and embankments without success today for shells or other clues to the identity of one or more snipers who wounded seven persons while firing at trucks and buses from at least two positions last night.

title: Sealyham Again Wins Top Award
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., May 18A Sealyham, who has been on a tremendous winning streak during the last month, swept to her 19th top award today at the 73d Long Island Kennel Club Show. She was Mrs. Dorothy Wimer's Welsh import, Ch. Dersade Bobby's Girl from Churchtown, Pa., and she was handled by Peter Green.

title: MISS RAITT SHARES BILL WITH GOODMAN
description: Bonnie Raitt made her annual pilgrimage to New York, appearing at Carnegie Hall on Saturday, her talents unimpaired and undiminished. She is a white woman who can latch onto a black blues song with ease and also use songs from such trendy contemporaries as Eric Andersen and Jackson Browne.

title: City Budget Bureau Cranking Up Its FrugalityEnforcing RedTape Machine
description: There is a joke making the rounds in the city's Budget Bureau these days.

title: Europeans Expanding and Improving Fast Intercity Train Service
description: PARISIn the rugged Apennine country between Rome and Florence Italians are tunneling through mountains and bridging valleys for one of the first of Europe's new highspeed railroad lines, capable of 155 miles an hour.

title: Personal Finance
description: Recently I ordered some tires from a mail order company to be picked up at a catalogue desk in one of its stores. When I paid for the tires, I found I had been charged sales tax on the shipping charges. If you have this merchandise mailed to your home, this tax is not charged. Why?

title: City Pay Increases Lag Behind Private Sector's
description: Pay increases for New York City municipal workers in clerical office jobs, data processing, skilled trades and custodial services between April, 1973, and April, 1974, were below those in private industry here, a study made by the United States Labor Department's Bureau of Labor Statistics showed yesterday.

title: BROOKHAVEN G.O.P. FACING INQUIRIES
description: HOLTSVILLE, L. I., May 18The Suffolk County District Attorney's office disclosed today that it was investigating the payment of nearly $1million in legal and rental fees to Brookhaven Republicans in connection with the construction of the huge Internal Revenue Service Center here.

title: New Voting Law Faces AllOut Legal Challenge
description: WASHINGTON, May 18Dean Burch came out of the first meeting of President Ford's informal campaign planning committee, at which he had presided, and remarked:

title: Casper Victor in Golf By 2 Strokes on 271
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 18For a while it looked as if Billy Casper was in trouble, but he hit three consecutive birdies and successfully backhanded a 9iron today to win the New Orleans Open, the same golf tournament he won in 1958.

title: Beame's Nephew Arrested In Criminal Mischief Case.
description: Barry Cohen, the 33yearold son of Mayor Beame's stepsister, was arrested yesterday morning and charged with criminal mischief in connection with the smashing of windows of several cars in front of his home in the Flatbush secion of Brooklyn, the police reported.

title: Guaranteed Income Floor
description: The answers to welfare's problems of human and fiscal wreckage do not lie in indefinite extension of the drives to banish chiselers or to put welfare mothers to work that have been periodic through all the three decades since the Great Depression.

title: Susan Agay, Student, Is Married
description: Susan Louise Agay, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Denes Agay of New York and Norton, Va., was married at noon yesterday to Charles Joseph Rothschild 3d. son of Mr. and Mrs. Rothschild Jr. of Teaneck, N. J., Rabbi Louis Sigel performed the ceremony in the White and Gold Suite at the Plaza.

title: Baby, Born After Stabbing Of Mother, Is Well on Coast
description: VAN NUYS, Calif., May 18 (UPIAn infant boy who had been cut free from his mother's womb, apparently after the mother had been stabbed, was reported in good condition today in Children's Hospital. The mother died and the woman who brought the baby to the hospital was under arrest.

title: City Budget Bureau Cranking Uplts FrugalityEnforcing RedTape Machine
description: There is a joke making the rounds in the city's Budget Bureau these days.

title: Mrs. Ford Asserts Husband Will Seek A Full Term in '76
description: LOS ANGELES, May 18Saying that she feels marvelous, Betty Ford denied today reports that her husband would not seek a full term as President next year.

title: 105 Montclair Pupils Pick Their Schools
description: MONTCLAIR, May 18One hundred and five pupils have been accepted in a, program here that allows their parents to decide what elementary schools they will attend next fall.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Jewish Charities Aided In a OneDay Drive Here
description: In the most ambitious oneday fund  raising effort for Jews, particularly in Israel and New York City, 8,000 volunteers yesterday dispersed through the greater metropolitan area on behalf of the United Jewish Appeal and the Federation of Jewish Philanthropies of New York.

title: NATO Ministers Will Discuss the Lack of Arms Standardization
description: The defense ministers of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization this week will tackle the alliance's oldest and most complex internal problem: the financial waste and military weaknesses arising from duplication and lack of standardization in weapons and equipment.

title: FORA PLANS BILLS TO EASE CONTROL OVER TRANSPORT
description: WASHINGTON, May 18The Ford Administration will send Congress this week the first of three proposals aimed at fundamentally changing the way the Federal Government regulates transportation, a move that may become the principal domestic focus of President Ford's campaign to be elected next year.

title: Recently Published Books
description: GENERAL

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
In Memoriam
description: ABRAMSGeorge. In Loving Memory of my dear husband. ESTELLE.

title: 3 Killed in Fire as Gate Blocks Window
description: Trapped in a rear bedroom where an antiburglar gate on the window prevented escape, Chanee Strenger, 33 years old, and her two young sons died early yesterday in a Brooklyn fire. Her husband and young daughter were critically iniured.

title: Presbyterians Vote Against Accepting Homosexual Group
description: CINCINNATI, May 18The General Assembly of the threemillionmember United Pres byterian Church has refused to recognize a homosexual caucus as an unofficial organization of the church.

title: JAMES HAYES DEAD; TV DIRECTOR WAS 60
description: James Hayes, a television director and producer, died Saturday of cancer in Norwalk (Conn.) Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived in Weston, Conn.

title: Bayi's Tactics Set New Style
Books of The Times
description: In the long run, there will be as many versions of Watergate as there are observers to describe it. As the reporternovelist Jimmy Breslin puts it in How the Good Guys Finally Won: There were many people and many forces responsible for the end of Richard M. Nixon in the summer of 1974. It is difficult to determine which set of men and circumstances were most responsible. The full story never will become altogether clear in our time. Who becomes famous so often depends upon the politics of the academic world years later. some historian will gain access so bundles of dusty letters, and the historian promptly announces that the author of the letters is a great force in history. He will receive the Sumner Prize for Originality. It usually matters not how much actual value the man had in his time. But of course Mr. Breslin has a theory, based on his own particular way of seeing the world. And it yields a set of men and circumstances he thinks the most responsible. It was not the press, or the courts, or even the lawyersto benefit whom, Corruption ... was built into the government structure as if it were notarizedwho finally brought down President Nixon. No, it was the Pols, as they're called up in Bostonthe men whose viral containers in [their] genes held, who knows, a couple of thousand years of the ability to control, to calm others, to decide without being abrasive, to be affable while the insides boil.

title: RUTGERS EVOLVES PLANS ON GARBAGE
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, May 18A yearlong study of solidwaste disposal alternatives for the Hackensack Meadowlands has concluded that regional resourcesrecovery plants would be the more economical approach to solving North Jersey's garbage problem.

title: Blacks Link Job Woes To Employers' Racism
description: Eartha Warring came North to go to Hunter College, where she hopes to major in sociologyprovided she can get the financial assistance she needs. She wants to work eventually with retarded kids.

title: Comparison of Plans For Waste Disposal
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, May 18  The following chart, which accompanied the Rutgers wastedisposal report, shows estimated net operating costs or profit per ton of garbage for three disposol systems at varying rates of disposal. An asterisk indicates the system is not considered economically feasible or technologically possible at that rate of waste disposal:

title: Dr. Joellen Werne, Psychiatrist, Bride
description: The marriage of Dr. Joellen Werne, chief resident in psychiatry at the Stanford University Medical Center, to Dr. John Sumner Smolowe, a secondyear resident in psychiatry at Stanford, took place yesterday afternoon in Roslyn, L. I.

title: 2 on Charter Commission Decry Issuing of Report by Goodman
description: Two members of the State Charter Revision Commission for New York City charged yesterday that the chairman, State Senator Roy M. Goodman, Republican of Manhattan, had bypassed other members of the body in issuing a summary of preliminary recommendations on Saturday.

title: Arleen Roseman Wed To Steve Mermelstein
description: At Temple Hillel in North Woodmere, L. I., yesterday, Arleen R. Roseman, daughter of Mrs. Arthur S. Roseman of Woodmere and the late Mr. Roseman, was married to Steve A. Mermelstein, son of Mr. and Mrs. Max Mermelstein of Brooklyn. Rabbi Abraham Reiman performed the ceremony.

title: N.B.A. Championship
description: Golden State vs. Washington May 18Golden St. 101, Wash. 95.

title: Saudi Arabia Sets 5Year Plan With Investment of $140Billion
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, May 18Saudi Arabia's Council of Ministers approved today a fiveyear economic plan of stupendous proportions calling for a 8140billion investment.

title: 196 Refugees Leave U.S. For Resettling in Canada
description: Nearly 200 Vietnamese refugees were flown from two United States relocation centers yesterday to new lives in Canada, according to The Associated Press.

title: TWO BLACK LEADERS INVITED BY VORSTER
description: CAPE TOWN, May 18 South Africa has invited President Felix Houphouet Boigny of the Ivory Coast and President William R. Tolbert of Liberia to visit and government sources here are confident that they will accept.

title: New O.A.S. Secretary General Alejandro Orfila
description: WASHINGTON, May 18When Alejandro Orfila gives a dinner party he does what no other Ambassador accredited to Washington can dohe serves wines, reds and whites, with his own label, that of the Orfila vineyards the yards of western News Mendoza, in Argentina. It is characteristic of the man who, in the last 18 months, has earned the reputation as Washington's most sumptuous party giver since Perle Mesta.

title: Ship Rescue Toll 5 Killed, 16 Missing, 7080 Hurt
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 Secretary of Defense James R. Schlesinger announced today that the number of American casualties in last week's effort to rescue the freighter Mayagez and her crew was larger than initially reported.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: FROM AFAR Two loan exhibitions of works by modern artists of Africa have opened at the American Museum of Natural History, Central Park West at 79th Street. One is A Contemporary African Arts Festival, on loan from Chicago's Field Museum of Natural History and housed in the American Museum's Gallery 77 through Aug. 17. Egyptian Tapestries, in the Akeley Gallery, comes here through the Smithsonian Institution Traveling Exhibition Show.

title: Hospitals in Crisis
description: Matching the welfare story in sadness is the lugubrious record of the nineteen municipal hospitals, a system without parallel in any other city, which keeps going up in cost and down in quality of care despite an endless series of wellintentioned attempts to boost efficiency and medical standards.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: CANCELED ORDERS VEX GRAIN TRADE
description: A rising number of cancelladons of grain and soybean orders by foreign nations is worrying leading American exporters and is causing concern, about the sanctity of contracts. Traditionally, world trade has operated on the basis of a high degree of honor among exporters and importers regarding contractual obligations.

title: Sihanouk Off to North Korea; Backs Seizure of U.S. Ship
description: PEKING, May 18 (Agence FrancePresse)  Prince Norodom Sihanouk and Princess Monique of Cambodia left here today by special train for visit to North Korea, the Chinese press agency Fisinhua reported.

title: James Whitman, Pianist, 17, Bows at Carnegie Recital
description: Whoever pushed James Whitman into making his thoroughly premature debut at Carnegie Recital Hell on Saturday afternoon ??cks awareness of current professional standards. The 17yearold high school senior obviously has talent. He is studying composition and conducting as well as the piano, he plans to enter Yale University next year as a music major.

title: Sally Shapiro Is Remarried
description: Sally Rosensweig Shapiro and H. Erich Heinemann were married yesterday morning in Temple Emanuel of Great Neck, L. I., by Rabbi Robert S. Widom.

title: Bridge:
description: The Lancia touring team gained heavily against New York in the first of its four matches in this country at the New York Hilton Hotel Saturday night, and gave the large audience watching on VuGraph a dramatic evening's entertainment.

title: Sheriff's Aides Try to Help Wild Man Found in Swamp
description: TAMPA, Fla., May 18 (AP)Sheriff's investigators and translators questioned today a Chinese seaman known locally as the Wild Man of the Green Swamp, calming Ms rears and piecing together the story of his eightmonth survival in the wilds of central Florida.

title: Organized Distortion
description: The organized lobby against landuse planning once more frantically disseminating fanciful misinformation about this important legislation, revived since its defeat last year. The myths being circulated include charges that sponsors of the House billled by Representative Udall of Arizona for the Democrats and Representative Steelman of Texas for the Republicanswant to impose national zoning on the country or even contemplate outright Federal confiscation.

title: Stage: Unfunny Comedy
description: The Negro Ensemble Company has won its greatest success and established its reputation as one of our primary sources of new American plays with such naturalistic drama as Ceremonies in Dark Old Men, The River Niger and The First Breeze of Summer.

title: New York Lacrosse Loser
description: MILFORD, Del., May 18The Maryland Lacrosse Club defeated the New York Lacrosse Club, 148, today and handed New York its fourth loss in eight games. Bill Blanchard, with three goals and two assists, paced the New York attack.

title: Toros' Forward Uses Speed to Plague Goalkeepers
description: Steve David, the former police officer in Trinidad who chased fugitives on foot because of his speed, continues to be a menace to goalkeepers in the North American Soccer League.

title: Japanese Pay Top Yen for Met Tour
description: TOKYO, May 15  The classified ad in the Englishlanguage weekly read airily:

title: Tempest, a Maxi Yacht, Is Edlu Race Winner
Bromley Captures Westchester Title
description: ARMONK, N.Y., May 18Peter Bromley of Mount Kisco won the annual Westchester men's tennis championship today by beating Andy Finn of White Plains, 26, 76, 64, in a 2hour battle at the Armonk Tennis Club

title: A's Get Martinez
description: The Oakland A's acquired a utility infielder, Teddy Martinez, from the St. Louis Cardinals yesterday in exchange for a minorleague pitcher, Steve Staniland, and a player to be named later. Martinez formerly played for the New York Mets.

title: Article 1  No Title
Fred Silverman Will Leave CBSTV to Head ABC Program Division
description: Fred Silverman, vice president in charge of programs for CBSTV since 1970, will join the American Broadcasting Companies on June 16 as president of ABC Entertainment, the division that develops programs and talent for the ABC network.

title: George Keegan. ExMember Of Transportation Board
description: George Keegan, a member of the Board of Transportation from 1940 until his retirement in 1945, died Saturday in St. Elizabeth's Hospital. He was 97 years old.

title: SADAT WILL SPEAK FOR ARAB NATIONS AT FORD MEETING
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, May 18President Anwar elSadat, winding up a weeklong tour of four Arab nations, declared here today that he had obtained a mandate to speak for the Arab world, not just Egypt, when he meets with President Ford in Salzburg, Austria, on June 1.

title: About New York
description: Tournament bridge is different in Europe than it is here, said Harold Ogust. It's bridge the way it Used to bea sport for the lite, played in casinos in dinner jackets. Here it's for the masses. More than 20 million people play regularly.

title: New Code of Ethics And Disclosure Law Proposed for State
description: The Ethics Committee of the State Senate is proposing new code of ethics and a law requiring public financial disclosure covering virtually every member and employe of the legislative, judicial and executive branches of state government, including employes of all public authorities.

title: Pair of Jacks Nets Nevadan $200,000 In Poker Series
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 18 Brian Roberts won the 1975 world series of poker yesterday by winning the final pot of $115.500 on a pair of jacks in Hold 'em poker, a variety of seven card stud popular in Texas.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: With a certain reservation we will print an inquiry about gumbo from a reader and former New Yorker now living in Louisiana who asks that his name not be mentioned.

title: MARCHI SAYS AID TO CITY DEPENDS ON BUDGET CEILING
description: State Senator John J. Marchi said yesterday that Mayor Beame would have to commit the city to some ceiling on spending in the coming year to get state aid, but added that the ceiling amount would be negotiable and part of the political process.

title: Slump Killing Black TeenAgers' Hopes
description: Tens of thousands of black and Puerto Rican teenagers in New York City, are piling up at the bottom of the recession. With no jobs and no prospects of jobs, they are abandoning their dreams of education and their belief in the other institutions of a civilized society, and are slipping back toward the drugs and hustling of the street.

title: The Way They Stand Today
description: Monday, May 19, 1975

title: Market Is Sensing Stocks Correction
description: The stock market may be entering its longawaited correction after the fabulous gains of recent months, but the consensus on Wall Street holds that any price pullback will be limited.

title: Katie Brennan, 35, Taught Cooking, Aided Legislators
description: Katie Sheldon Brennan, founder of the Brennan School of French Cuisine and a former government aide, died Saturday of cancer in Mount Sinai Hospital She was 35 years old and lived in Irvington, N. Y.

title: TOLL RISES TO NINE IN LEBANON BEAST
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 18Two more children died today of wounds they suffered when a mortar shell left behind by Israeli troops exploded yesterday near the southern border village of Aitaroun.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, MAY 19, 1975

title: U. S. Banks to Join French and Arabs In Institution Here
description: HOUSTON, May 18Texas Commerce Bancshares, a Houstonbased multibank holding company, has entered an agreement with European, Arab and other American banks to join a FrenchArab bank in New York City.

title: Bank of America Left $40 in Saigon
description: TAMUNING, Guam, May 15 If the new Communist authorities in Saigon succeed in opening the vault in the Bank of America office there, they will find only $40.

title: U.S. Extends Backing For Lockheed's Loans
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (UPI)The Emergency Loan Guarantees Board said today it had agreed to extend the Government's guarantees of loans to the Lockheed Aircraft Coropration for two years to Dec. 31, 1977.

title: Italians Brace for a Wave of Strikes
description: ROME, May 18Italy is bracing for a weeklong wave of strikes that will disrupt transportation and other essential services and that threaten to slow recovery from the recession. The scheduled walkouts will affect air traffic, railroads, customs operations, schools, health care and the civil service.

title: 8 Cypriote Children Star As Greeks Parade Here
description: Eight refugee children from Cyprus, dressed in colorful native attire, were wideeyed but poised yesterday in a parade that brought 85.000 people onto Fifth Avenue to celebrate the 154th anniversary of Greek independence from Turkish invasion of Cyprus last year.

title: Rangers Pick Coach
description: Ron Stewart, who played 21 seasons in the National Hockey League, is expected to be named the New York Ranger coach today. Stewart, who wound up his playing career with the New York Islanders in the 197273 season, will replace Emile Francis, who will remain the general manager. Page 37.

title: Soviet Jewish War Hero Is Said to Lose Pension
description: MOSCOW, May 18 (AP)A retired Red Army colonel in the Jewish emigration movement has been stripped of his rank and deprived of his officer's pension, Jewish sources reported today.

title: Use of Scenic Utah Area Is Debated by Old Rivals
description: SALT LAKE CITY, May 18One of the oldest debates in the West, centering on the recreational use of scenic canyon lands along the Colorado River, is again raising tempers in Utah and Arizona communities as the National Park Service holds wilderness designation hearings concerning the 1,196,545acre Glen Canyon National Recreation Area.

title: I.B.M. Antitrust Trial Beginning Here Today
description: The largest antitrust trial in history, the Justice Department's suit against the International Business Machines Corporation, begins today in the United States Court for the Southern District of New York ?? Foley Square. The judge in charge of the trial is David N. Edelstein.

title: A Changed Union City Marks Its 50th Year
description: UNION CITYWhen the town of West Hoboken and Union Hill elected to become a single, consolidated city in 1925, names like Traphagen, Rieman, Kerrigan and Rinaldo predominated among the citizens of the new community. Now, as Union City celebrates the 50th anniversary of that merger, names like Fernandez, Rodrigues, Menendez and Alvarez are more the midstream. Roughly 55 per cent of the 50,000 to 60,000 residents in this crowded suburb of 1.4 square miles are Spanishspeaking, giving it the nickname of Havana on the Hudson.

title: Tomahawks Face Wings
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., May 19  The Long Island Tomahawks of the National Lacrosse League will face the Philadelphia Wings tomorrow night at 8 o'clock in the Nassau Coliseum. In their last two games, the Tomahawks beat the Boston Bolts and the Maryland Arrows

title: BILL ON GUARDING DIPLOMATS GAINS
description: The House of Representatives approved legislation yesterday providing millions of dollars in Federal compensation to New York and other major cities for the extraordinary protective needs of visiting foreign dignitaries and resident diplomatic and consular communities.

title: Steel Production Declined for Week To 2,227,000 Tons
description: Steel production for the week ended May 17 dropped to 2,227,000 tons, the lowest level since the week ended Jan. 22, 1972, when only 2,220,000 tons were poured.

title: WNET Raises $300,000
description: WNET/Channel 13 gained 20,000 new subscribers and more than $300,000 in donations during The Spring for 13 pledge week conducted from May 2 to May 11, station officials said. Under the umbrella title A Time to Remember, the membership drive included 10 days of special shows celebrating the 30th anniversary of the en of fighting on the European front during World War it.

title: Amex Seat Price Is Up
description: The American Stock Exchange reported a scat sale yesterday at $50.000, up $7,000 from the last sale on May 13. The Amex reported last week that it would double its options trading program from 20 to 40 stocks.

title: Korea University Reopens
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 19 (Reuters)The prestigious Korea University resumed a?? classes today, 41 days after troops had moved onto the campus to end weeksof antigovernment protests.

title: Africans Spur Farmers to Meet Expanding Needs
description: KOUNDOUL, Chad Pierre Anjo, walking behind two young oxen, plowed long, straight furrows in the dark, sunbaked earth. Nearby, in the hot Sahara wind, his wife threshed and winnowed wheat, a grain once unfamiliar to her.

title: Work Stoppages Ended At 5 Schlitz Breweries
description: MILWAUKEE, May 19 (Reuters)The Jos. Schlitz Brewing Company said production was resumed today at all five breweries that had been closed in sympathy with a strike at its canmanufacturing plant in Longview, Tex.

title: Legislature Approves Mail Registration
description: ALBANY, May 19A measure that will introduce voter registration by mail received final approval in the Assembly today, amid predictions that it could have a significant effect on ruing efforts in underregistered poor areas.

title: Article 1  No Title
New Unit Maps Policy to Get Arts Funds
description: A new national committee has been set up to survey the arts and their economics with the aim of formulating a policy for support on all levels of government and private contributions.

title: Rowdyism: Games Fans Play
description: Unruly fans practicing what one psychiatrist calls recreational violence are turning America's sports events into an outlet for vulgarity and rowdyism.

title: For the Polish, He's Something to Sing About
description: When Bobby Vinton was growing up in Canonsburg, Pa., he recalled yesterday, he lived in a Polish community, went to Polish schools and until I got to high school thought everybody spoke Polish.

title: Thousands in Chinatown March in Police Protest
description: Thousands of Chinese and ChineseAmericans, chanting in Cantonese, marched through Chinatown and on to City Hall yesterday to protest an incident of alleged police brutality and, to call for an end to discrimination.

title: California and Indiana Standard Confirm They Made Gifts Abroad
description: The Standard Oil Company of California and the Standard Oil Company (Indiana) confirmed yesterday that they had made gifts and contributions to political parties abroad.

title: From the Police Blotter
description: An 82yearold man was shot to death by a 70yearold companion after an argument erupted during a Sunday afternoon card game in the back yard of an Inwood. L. I., house. The victim, Francisca Antonio Cupri, one of several elderly card players, had started to pull a small pocket knife, the police said, when Dominick Luria drew his licensed .38caliber revolver and shot the older man once in the chest. Mr. Luria surrendered to the police called to the scene at 59 Pearl Street.... A 23yearold man, Samuel H. Mendez, was shot to death in his apartment at 450 Audubon Avenue, and the police are looking for the brother of the dead man's pregnant girl friend... Charles Mills, 23, of 906 Williams Avenue, Brooklyn, was fatally stabbed after reprimanding a young man for annoying a girl in Martin Luther King Park in the East New York section. Alberto Negron, 21, of 443 Wyona Street, was arrested.

title: A.T.&T. Asks F.C.C. to Bar MCI LongDistance Calls
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company has asked the Federal Communications Commission to bar MCI Telecommunications, Inc., of Washington from operating an unauthorized long distance telephone service, United Press International reports.

title: WALKER SANDBACH OF CONSUMERS UNION
description: Walker Sandbach, executive director of Consumers Union, publisher of Consumer Reports, from 1965 to 1974, died Sunday in White Plains, where he lived. Re was 58 years old.

title: Cancer Deaths Rise
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (AP) Death rates for heart disease, stroke and accidents declined last year but the cancer death rate went up, according to a Government report. Together, the four accounted for about 72 per cent of the 1.9 million deaths in the United States in 1974.

title: Moustaki Gives Variety to Songs At Carnegie Hall
description: Georges Moustaki is really a singer for the Common Market, mixing in more European musical influences in ?? music than most other singers. Mixing in rather than mixing up.

title: LABOR ABUSES LAID TO 2 U.S. AGENCIES
description: BAYONNE, N. J., May 19Congress opened an investigation here today into allegations that the Army Corps of Engineers and the United States Postal Service permitted wide spread violations of national wage and labor laws on Federal construction projects in North Jersey.

title: Kellogg Raises its Dividend
description: The Kellogg Company announced yesterday in Battle Creek, Mich., that it was raising its regular quarterly common stock dividend to 17 cents a share from 15 cents. The dividend is payable June 14 to shareholders of record May 30.

title: The Screen: Man in the Glass Booth
Civic SharetheWork ...
description: Even as a weapon of psychological warfare in his budget battle with Washington and Albany, Mayor Beame's threat to fire 38,000 municipal employeswith heaviest concentration in all the city's most vital servicesis an obvious resort to scaremongering.

title: . . . GrabItAll Assembly
description: In blithe disregard of the budget crunch that is compelling layoffs and other austerity measures affecting the rankandfile of state and city employes, members of the State Assembly are grabbing with both hands creating noshow jobs for highpaid political hangerson.

title: Chess: On the Debilitating Effects Of Advanced Pinophobia
description: The soul of caution in avoiding pins was a certain woman member of the Marshall Chess Club, who, some years ago, was wont to open every game, whether as Black or White. with PKR3, immediately followed by PQR3.

title: North Korea in Tie to Burma
description: HONG KONG, May 19 (Reuters)North Korea and Burma have agreed to establish diplomatic relations, the North Korean official press agency reported today.

title: Survey Finds Decline in Black Populations In Capital, With a Sharp Rise in Suburbs
description: WASHINGTON, May 19The black population of the District of Columbia, the majority here for a number of years, has declined since 1970 but it has risen sharply in the surrounding suburbs, according to a amiddecade examination of population trends here by a private agency.

title: Dissection in the Biology Lab: Youngsters For and Against
description: It makes no difference to 14yearold Mary Elizabeth Rider  vegetarian, lover of animals, critic of cattle auctions  that everybody in 10thgrade biology is supposes to dissect an earthworm.

title: The Success Story of a Young Pianist
description: Like thoroughbreds at the starting gate, superbly trained, on their mettle and raring to go, America's many brilliant young pianists gather at the beginning of the season, hoping that before the year's race is over, the prize will be theirsthe critical accolade and the management contract that assure a concert career.

title: Books of The Times
description: WILLIAM SHAKESPEARE: A DOCUMENTARY LIFE. By S. Schoenbaum. Illustrated. 273 pages. Oxford. $50.

title: Xerox Shows New Computer
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 19 (UPI)The Xerox Corporation demonstrated today a complex highspeed computer that can print both forward and backward and can draw charts and graphs from keyboard signals. It operates at a speed of up to 1,800 characters a second. It will sell for $5,050 in single units or rent for $190 a month.

title: N.B.A. Championship
description: May 18Golden St. 101. Wash. 95

title: JULIUS VENNER, 57, LAWYER HERE, DIES
description: Julius Venner, a lawyer here who was also secretary to minority members of the State Senate Finance Committee and counsel to State Senator Jeremiah B. Bloom, died Sunday, apparently of a heart attack, in Caledonian Hospital, Brooklyn. He was 57 years old and lived at 395 Ocean Avenue in Brooklyn.

title: Weeden Reports a Deficit Of $876,000 for April
description: Weeden & Co., the brokerage house, reported yesterday that it lost $876,000 in April and that it had set up a $700,000 reserve against what it termed a checkkiting loss of a customer.

title: When Ford Goes to Madrid
description: To the Editor:

title: 2 PARTIES MERGE IN SOUTH AFRICA
description: CAPE TOWN May 19Two white opposition parties in South Africa have decided to merge, opening the way for a major political realignment.

title: The City University
description: The City University increasingly confronts three questions: Can the city afford the cost of running a statesized higher educational system? Can it justify free undergraduate tuition? Can it foot the bill for open admissions?

title: Physicians Radio Network Is Set
description: Physicians, the most heavily advertisedto category among the professions because they make the buying decisions for billions of dollars worth of prescription drugs, will have a radio network all their own before long.

title: 400 to 500 Deaths Predicted
description: CHICAGO, May 19 (UPI)The National Safety Council predicted today that between 400 and 500 persons would die on the nation's highways during the Memorial Day weekend beginning Friday.

title: Police Picket for Raise
description: ASBURY PARK, May 19 (AP)Policemen seeking higher wages picketed and distributed leaflets at City Hall and major roadways into this shore community today. The city and Policemen's Benevolent Association Local 6 are at an impasse over wages in contract negotiations. The police have been working without a contract since Jan. 1. Their salaries start at $10,000.

title: Stage: Arena's Dybbuk
ORDAINING WOMEN UPHELD ON APPEAL
description: CINCINNATI, May 19Presbyterian seminarians who seek ordination following graduation must accept the church's constitutional approval of women in the ministry or be barred from the rite, the denomination's General Assembly ruled today.

title: Friction in Cerro Affairs Is Disclosed
description: Details of friction between the Pritzker family of Chicago and C. Gordon Murphy, former president of the Cerro Corporation, were disclosed yesterday in the company's proxy statement for its annual meeting. It had been at the behest of Mr. Murphy that the pritzkers had made their successful takeover of Cerro.

title: CITY IS REBUFFED ON PLANS TO SELL 280MILLION NOTES
description: Three large New York commercial banks and an investment house declined yesterday to buy $280 million in bond anticipation notes offered to them without bidding by Controller Harrison J. Goldin, further aggravating the city's financial predicament.

title: Yanks Top Royals, 51 Chambliss Clouts Two
TRAINING SCHOOLS CALLED EXPLOSIVE
description: ALBANY, May 19The head of the agency that administers the state training schools for young offenders warned a State Senate Committee today that we shall have a youthful Attica unless serious overcrowding is relieved at the Goshen Center for Boys, where the courts send the most serious offenders.

title: School Prayer Bill Is Sent To Conference in Hartford
description: HARTFORD, May 19 (AP) The Connecticut Senate rejected a House version of a school prayer bill today and sent the measure to a commit tee to work out a compromise.

title: Johns Hopkins Rated No. 1 For Playoffs in Lacrosse
description: Henry Ciccarone, the lacrosse coach at Johns Hopkins, was in a reflective mood yesterday.

title: For a Tree Lady, a City's Thank You
description: In a grove of ancient elms, the tree lady received an award yesterday for distinguished service to the city of New York. She is Hattie Carthan, and she is best known for her fight a few years ago to save a rare, 85yearold magnolia from becoming the victim of a Model Cities bulldozer. The tree is 90 now and thriving. Mrs. Carthan, at 74, appears to be thriving too.

title: The Survivors
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Sweep Is Cheered By Chinese
description: CANTON, China, May 19 (AP)Many of the Americans came out wearing blue Mao Tsetung caps with the red star in front.

title: Newark Classes Near Normal As 2Week Pupil Boycott Ends
description: NEWARK, May 19Attendance in the city's public schooll system returned to nearnormal levels today as students ended a twoweek boycott protesting against impending layoffs of some teachers and cuts ?? school curriculums.

title: Democrats Weigh 2 Cities
description: LOS ANGELES, May 19 (UPI) Robert S. Strauss, chairman of the Demecratic National Committee, said yesterday that either New York or Los Angeles would be the site of the 1976 Presidential nominating convention.

title: SEARS PROFIT OFF 60% IN QUARTER
description: CHICAGO, May 19Sears, Roebuck & Co., the country's largest retailer, told its shareholders here today that its profits for the first fiscal quarter ended April 30 dropped 60.8 per cent from the yearearlier level on 2 per cent lower sales.

title: Dow Index Edges Up 0.08 To Recover Earlier Loss
description: The stock market, buoyed by a decline in interest rates, finished slightly higher yesterday after recovering most of an earlier loss in heavier trading.

title: Preliminary Funds For the B1 Bomber Approved by House
description: WASHINGTON, May 19The Hous gave an endorsement to the B1 bomber program today by approving preliminary production funds for the supersonic plane that is being de veloped to replace the B52 bomber.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
TEXAS MUSEUM BUYS LAZARUS BY DUCCIO
description: FORT WORTH, May 19 (AP) The Kimbell Art Museum announced today that it had acquired a 664yearold Italian mastcrpieca, The Raising of Lazarus, by Duccio.

title: 2 Federal Agencies Accused Of Labor Act Abuses in Jersey
description: BAYONNE, N. J., May 19Congress opened an investigation here today into allegations that the Army Corps of Engineers and the United States Postal Service permitted widespread violations of national wage and labor laws on Federal construction projects in North Jersey.

title: Communists Seize Newspaper in Lisbon
description: LISBON, May 19 (AP)Communists seized control of the Socialist newspaper Republica today and armed paratroopers barred thousands of Socialists who gathered outside to try to regain control of the paper.

title: Stewart Eyes Ranger Defense
description: As easily as he glided over National Hockey League rinks for 21 campaigns, Ron Stewart yesterday officially took over the job of coaching the Rangers, a post that has been as secure as tightrope walking.

title: People and Business
description: I have written off the 1975 model year, Henry Ford 2d, chairman of the Ford Motor Company, told news??n yesterday in Detroit.

title: PHYSICIANS' PROTEST SPREADS ON COAST
description: LOS ANGELES, May 19 (UPI) The anesthesiologists' slowdown spread to Sacramento and Southern California today while the Legislature met in a special session to seek a solution to soaring malpractice insurance rates.

title: State Seeks Solution to Building Dispute
description: State officials ?? yesterday with building contractors and a group repre?? ing black and Hispanic construction workers is an attempt to resolve a bitter constructionjob dispute that in the last week has brought bloody violence and a small army of policemen to the City Collego campus.

title: Judge as a Hostage
description: When David N. Edelstein was named to the Federal bench 24 years ago, he drove a Lincoln. Now he drives a compact Pontiac. It's a story of riches to rags, the judge said. My wife and I have been subsidizing this job out of private resources for years. On his 65th birthday in February, he could have taken senior status on the District Cour for the Southern District of New York and received a pension equal to his $40,000ayear salary.

title: Small Claims: To Get The Scofflaws to Pay
description: To the Editor:

title: COURT RULINGS VARY ON NURSING HOMES
description: Supreme Court justices in Manhattan and Queens yesterday issued divergent rulings on the legality of subpoenas issued by Charles J. Hynes, the special state prosecutor on nursing homes. nursing homes.

title: Questions on Ship Rescue Persist Despite Briefings
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 Questions about casualty reports and other matters related to the Mayagez incident persisted today despite new explanations from the White House and the Pentagon.

title: HANOI AIDE TERMED KEY MAN IN SAIGON
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 North Vietnam's fourthranking Politburo member, who for the last eight years secretly coordinated activities against Saigon, was reported today to have emerged as the apparent political leader in South Vietnam following the Communist takeover.

title: Contract Awards
description: A $40.37million contract to complete construction the Veterans Administration Hospital in Loma Linda, Calif., has been awarded to the Centex's Corporation's wholly owned subsidiary, J. W. Bateson Company, Inc.

title: Appointee to Head Arts Council Promises to Rule Out Politics
description: ALBANY, May 19Defending her appointment as the new chairman of the State Council on the Arts. Joan K. Davidson told a legislative hearing this evening that she would never tolerate the application of political pressure on the council.

title: U.S. AGENTS PUSH A BROAD INQUIRY INTO GRAIN TRADE
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 19Federal agents, conducting a sweeping investigation here and in other ports, are piecing together a picture of corruption in the handling, grading and weighing of grain that raises questions about the integrity of United States standards and the quality of grain shipments to foreign buyers.

title: Toward Full Detente
description: To the Editor:

title: DR. NATHAN MILLMAN
description: Dr. Nathan Millman, director of regulatory affairs at the Ortho Pharmaceutical Corporation, with which he had been associated since 1941, died Saturday in Somerset (N. J.) Hospital. He was 59 years old and lived at 463 Bayberry Road, Somerville, N. J.

title: Connally Criticizes Ford With Suggestions Here
description: A month after his acquittal on a bribery charge, former Treasury Secretary John B. Connally emerged from seclusion yesterday to begin a political comeback attempt by criticizing President Ford and Congress for lack of leadership.

title: In Venezuela's Slums, People Ask: Where Has All the Oil Money Gone?
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, May 19What has happened to the oil money? they ask in the hillside slums that hover over this affluent petroleum capital.

title: I.B.M. Antitrust Suit Opens With U.S. Seeking BreakUp
description: The largest antitrust case in history, the United States vs. the International Business Machines Corporation, opened yesterday in Federal Court for the Southern District of New York with Justice Department attorneys indicating that a considerable portion of their attempted proof of monopolistic practices would come from I.B.M.'s own internal documents and data.

title: Mail Registration of Voters Wins Final Approval in the Legislature
description: ALBANY, May 19A measure that will introduce voter registration by mail received final approval in the Assembly today, amid predictions that it could have a significant effect on voting efforts in underregistered poor areas.

title: Bridge: New Yorkers' Stretch Drive Overcomes the Lancia Team
description: A tremendous stretch drive by a brilliant young New York foursome playing at the New York Hilton here Sunday night against the Lancia touring team brought them not only a notable victory but also five Lancia cars.

title: $1.6 Million in Damages
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. May 19 (UPI)A Circuit Court jury has awarded a paralyzed dentist and his wife $1.6million in damages from a Lake Worth neurosurgeon. The ruling means Dr. John E. Schwab will have to put up more than $500.000 of his money to pay damages, not covered by his mapractice insurance, for performing spinal surgery that draplegic, after a car crash.

title: AMEX STOCKS UP AS VOLUME DIPS
description: Prices on the America Stock Exchange rose yesterday, although volume dropped somewhat. However, both prices and volume fell in the overthecounter market.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, May 19The inflow of savings Into savings and loan associations last manth was apparently at a record level for April, the United States League Savings Associations reported today.

title: COALITION PLANNING EQUAL RIGHTS DRIVE
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (AP) A new coalition that says it represents 23 million women is planning a national fundraising drive to bolster the campaign for ratification of the equal rights amendment.

title: Obituary 5  No Title
description: ELIHU D. SARASOHN

title: Leader of Marines In Rescue of Ship Calls Battle Heavy
description: SUBIC BAY, the Philippines, May 19 (Reuters)  United States Marines ran into more resistance than expected when they landed on Tang Island in the Gulf of Siam to help free the Mayagez. the commander of the operation said here today.

title: CONNECTICUT SEIZES 2 IN FACTORY FIRE
description: NEW HAVEN, May 19 (AP) Two of three Pennsylvania men who pleaded not guilty today to Federal charges connected with a Shelton factory explosion were arrested outside the court on state charges in the same case.

title: Alexander M. Hamilton Of American Locomotive
description: Alexander M. Hamilton, who retired in 1950 as vice president in charge of exports for the American Locomotive Company, died Sunday in Tryon, N.C., where he had been living. He was 87 years old.

title: Sato, ExPremier of Japan, Is in Coma After a Stroke
description: TOKYO, May 19 (AP)Eisaku Sato, a former Premier and a Nobel Peace Prizewinner who helped transform Japan into an economic giant during his eight years in power, collapsed tonight at a Tokyo restaurant.

title: U.S. AGENTS PUSH A BROAD INQUIRY INTO GRAIN TRADE
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 19Federal agents, conducting a sweeping investigation here and in other ports, are piecing together a picture of corruption in the handling, grading and weighing of grain that raises questions about the integrity of United States standards and the quality of grain shipments to foreign buyers.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In the Arts and Leisure Guide of The New York rimes last Sunday, the Western Wind music concert this Friday at St. Stephen's Episcopal Church, 120 West 69th Street, was listed incorrectly as beginning at 9 P.M. The concert starts at 8.

title: 2 Held in Priest Slaying
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 19 (AP)Two men were arrested today and accused of the slayings May 7 of a priest, a nun and a housekeeper, the authorities said. The men are charged with firstdegree murder and aggravated battery in the deaths inside the rectory of the St. John the Baptist Roman Catholic Church in Edgard, La.

title: E. I. du Pont Trims Its Dividend to $1
description: Directors of E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc., reduced the quarterly dividend yesterday to $1 a share from $1.25.

title: LAURENCE DEAN JR., WORKED ON ABOMB
description: WASHINGTON, May 19Laurence B. Dean Jr., a research analyst who worked on the Manhattan Project that developed the atomic bomb, died Friday of cancer at his home in Chevy Chase, Md. He was 51 years old.

title: Congressmen Urge City to Act In South Bronx Fire Epidemic
description: Several New York members of Congress charged the city administration yesterday with failure to come to grips with the outbreak of fires that has been ravaging the South Bronx.

title: Belmont: Division and/or Subtraction?
description: Foolish Pleasure, winner of the Kentucky Derby, and Master Derby, winner of the Preakness, may not meet in the third Triple Crown race. At Churchill Downs, where Master Derby has returned, his trainer said yesterday that the 3yearoldson of Dust Commander might skip the Belmont Stakes on June 7 to run in the $100,000 Ohio Derby at Thistledown on June 15. And Kenny Noe, the racing secretary for the New York Racing Association, said at Aqueduct yesterday that there was a possibility that the 107th Belmont would have to be run in two divisions.

title: American Museum Names Businessman To Head the Board
description: Robert G. Goelet, a businessman active in the city's cultural affairs, was nominated yesterday to become the eighth president of the board of trustees of The American Museum of Natural History.

title: U.S. Denies an Iranian Report Of Pegging Oil Prices to Index
description: WASHINGTON, May 19The State Department denied today Iranian press reports that the United States had agreed that the price of oil should be pegged to an index of the major products the oil countries buy from the industrialized countries.

title: Notes on People
description: Empress Farah Diba of Iran has gone on record in favor of divorce insurance in the form of a Governmentadministered alimony fund, is putting aside some of her own money to have some security and has been officially pronounced an Empress who is also a feminist by none other than Betty Friedan.

title: Ambivalence in Athens
description: ATHENS, May 19The Greek Government recently decided that six American destroyers using homeport facilities near Athens would have to leave and that an American base would have to be virtually ciosed down. At the same time the Government sought assurances that if Turkey attacked Greek islands in the Aegean Sea, the Americans would intervene.

title: Selection of Jury Starts In Kent State Civil Trial
description: CLEVELAND, May 19 (UPI) Jury selection began today in $11million civil suits filed against Gov. James R. Rhodes and 43 other persons by the parents of four students who were shot and killed and by nine persons wounded by National Guardsmen at Kent State University during an antiwar demonstration on May 4, 1970.

title: Traffic Agency Opens Hearings on Use of Air Bags
description: WASHINGTON, May 19After months of pressure from the automobile industry and the Ford Administration, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration began its final hearings today before deciding whether to require American automobile manufacturers to equip their cars with air bags.

title: A Summary of Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON, May 19The Supreme court took the following actions today:

title: DECISION DELAYED ON A CITY GARAGE
description: The city's Site Selection Board put off yesterday a decision on whether to condem?? a Block in the Westchester Square shopping district in the East Bronx to make way for a 115car municipal parking garage.

title: State Seeks Solution to City College Building Dispute
description: State officials met separately yesterday with building contractors and a group representing black and Hispanic construction workers in an attempt. to resolve a bitter construction job dispute that in the last week has brought bloody violence and a small army of policemen to the City College campus.

title: Joseph E. Brill, 7.1, Dies; Noted Criminal Lawyer
description: Joseph E. Brill, whose keen wit, colorful style and record of success made him one of the city's eminent criminal lawyers, died Sunday of cancer at the Columbus Hospital Division of Cabrini Health Care Center. He was 71 years old and lived at 530 Park Avenue.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: WARREN WILENTZ FACES TAX CHARGE
description: NEWARK, May 19A Federal grand jury today indicted Warren W. Wilentz, a Middlesex County attorney and former United States Senate candidate, on charges of failing to file income tax returns covering $885,565 in income from 1969 through 1972.

title: CONTRACT IS LET ON GARBAGE FUEL
description: The WheelabratorFrye Company said yesterday that it had contracted to supply the Jersey Central Power & Light Company with one billion kilowatthours of electricity generated from a plant fueled entirely by garbage.

title: HIGH COURT LIMITS NESTOR APPEALS
description: WASHINGTON, May 19Customers of a failing broker cannot go to court to compel the Securities Investor Protection Corporation to intervene and help protect a share of their. investments, the Supreme Court ruled today.

title: Doctor, 80, Tells How a Band of Girls Attacked Her
description: Dr. Stella Epstein celebrated a bittersweet 80th birthday in the hospital last week, half aware that her 60 years of medical practice may well have been ended by nine 13year old girls two and a half months ago. The girls wrenched her bag from her in Central Park and threw her to the ground, shattering her hip.

title: SwingYourPartners a Growing Pastime on L.I.
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I.,  She was out of breath, and a curl hung damply over her forehead. But the lady in the fluffy green skirt had a message to deliver.

title: Pekingology
description: There is a chorus in our mass media misrepresenting the significance of two important meetings in China in January, the second plenary session of the 10th Central Committee of the Com?? party and the longdelayed Fourth National People's Congress. The implication is that things are still not settled, that within China there Is instability, and that Its external policies must be watched warily.

title: FORD WILL REPEAT STRIP MINING VETO
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 The White House said today that President Ford had decided to repeat his veto of pioneering legislation to curb the environmental damage of strip mining for coal, which has been strongly supported in Congress since 1971. An effort in Congress to override the veto is expected this week.

title: Banks Are Middlemen in Note Buying
description: The groups of commercial banks and Investment firms that customarily bid for New York City notes and bonds play a pivotal role in channeling money to governments and corporations that need it.

title: FORD SETS UP UNIT TO AID REFUGEES
description: WASHINGTON, May 19President Ford, asserting that all of us are immigrants, created a 17member citizens committee today to help organize the resettlement of up to 135,000 refugees from South Vietnam and Cambodia.

title: FORD WILL REPEAT STRIP MINING VETO
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 The White House said today that President Ford had decided to repeat his veto of pioneering legislation to curb the environmental damage of strip mining for coal, which has been strongly supported in Congress since 1971. An effort in Congress to override the veto is expected this week.

title: Honduras in Bribe Action
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, May 19 (Reuters)The Government asked a criminal court here to begin proceedings against former Economy Minister Abraham Bennaton Ramos on charges of accepting a $1.25million bribe from the United Brands Company, Attorney General Serapio Hernandez Castellano said today. Mr. Bennaton is under house arrest and prohibited from leaving the country.

title: Laos Restricts Traveling A nd Orders All to Register
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, May 19The Laotian Government announced today a series of regulations restricting travel within the country and abroad and requiring every Laotian to register with the national police.

title: Tax Shift Urged to Meet Need for Capital
description: L. William Seidman, President Ford's assistant for economic affairs, said here ?? terday that army Government policies, including corporete income taxes and the double taxation of profit allocated to divdends, should be reviewed in the light of the nation's huge needs for investment capital.

title: Red Sox Hit and Run To 105 Rout of A's
description: The Red Sox and the OakLand A's sprayed 20 hits in and out of Fenway Park last night, but it was fleetfooted Juan Beniquez who scored the deciding run in Boston's 105 triumph.

title: Recital
description: Anthony Newman has managed to become a controversial figure while playing the organ, and who else but Virgil Fox has been able to achieve that distinction recently? Mr. Newman, who nobody denies is gifted, put his talents on display on Sunday night at Alice Tully Hall, where he gave an allBach recital on the hall's visually elegant and splendidsounding organ.

title: All Right, Jerry, Drop the Cookbook
description: Americans treat history like a cookbook. Whenever they are uncertain what to do next, they turn to history and look up the proper recipe, invariably designated the lesson of history.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Southern Company, an Atlantabased utility holding company, filed yesterday with the Securities and Exchange Commission in connection with a proposed offering of 11 million common shares. The holding company has said net proceeds will be used to reduce outstanding shortterm debt.

title: U.S. COURT APPROVES BUS REORGANIZATION
description: NEWARK, May 19 (UPI)A Subsidiary of Transport of New Jersey, the nation's largest private bus company, was granted permanent rights today to routes once held by four bankrupt transit companies.

title: President Hopeful Fellows Will Learn Good Government
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (UPI) President Ford welcomed 14 new White House fellows Monday and said he hoped they would learn more good than bad about the Government.

title: Partial Olympic Construction Resumes
description: MONTREAL, May 19 (AP)Work on the Olympic Village and other major Montreal construction projects resumed today as building workers ended a series of walkouts hegun May 8. However, a spokesman for the general contractor in charge of work at the Olympic stadium and the velodrome said the main Games site was still closed until further notice. The spokesman for Desourdy Duranceau, Ltd., said preparations had not yet been completed resume operations.

title: Market Place
description: Forty million employed persons who are not covered by pension plans other than Social Security now qualify for a new program that allows them to save for retirement on a taxsheltered basis.

title: Cosmos Top Metros, 21, Take Lead
description: TORONTO, May 19The New York Cosmos reached first place in the Northern Division of the North American Soccer League today by defeating the Toronto Metros 21.

title: New F.B.I. Is Explained To OldLine Leftists Here
description: The new head of the New York City office of the Federal Bureau of Investigation spent last evening addressing a group of oldline leftists, trying to convince them that the days of J. Edgar Hoover are over.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MUTED You don't expect the Brass Rail bar and lounge (called The Drinking Establishment) to be relaxing amid the hurlyburly of Seventh Avenue near 49th Street. It's rather surprising and a notbad dropby place (no cover, no minimum) before or after the theater, from the courteous host at the door to the friendly bar (reasonable prices), the English  beamed decor and leather chairs and tables. Add the entertainment, near the entrance, with performers changing about every three weeks.

title: America and the Refugees
description: To the Editor:

title: Schaefer Brewing Tells Unions It May Have to Leave the City
description: The F & M Schaefer Brewing Company, one of the city's last two beer makers, has told unions representing its 3.200 locali workers that unless they agree to major contract concessions by July 1 the company will close its Brooklyn plant.

title: Nieporte Tops Open Qualifiers
Giardino Urges Full SEEK Program
description: The Board of Higher Education persisted yesterday in its attempts to placate SEEK students angered by proposed major cuts in their program next year.

title: The Unworthy Policies
description: To the Editor:

title: Corporation Bonds Show Price Rises; More Primes Drop
description: Savings institutions, their cash inflow swelled by deposits. of Federal tax rebates continued to be active buyers of corporate debt issues yesterday, which rose in price as a result.

title: Senate Votes 4140 to Permit Arms Aid to Turks to Resume
description: WASHINGTON, May 19The Senate voted by the narrow margin of 41 to 40 today in favor of permitting the resumption of military assistance and private arms sales to Turkey.

title: HANOI AIDE TERMED KEY MAN IN SAIGON
description: WASHINGTON, May 19North Vietnam's fourthranking Politburo member, who for the last eight years secretly coordinated activities against Saigon, was reported today to have emerged as the apparent political leader in South Vietnam following the Communist takeover.

title: Tokyo Police Seize Eight Anarchists In Office Bombings
description: TOKYO, May 19The Tokyo police today arrested a group of eight anarchists on suspicion that they were responsible for a timebomb blast in an office building here last month.

title: Letter to the Editor 1  No Title
description: To the Editor:

title: Dave Anderson
description: The beef bourgignon and the shrimp newburg had heralded the coronation of Ron Stewart as the new coach of the New York Rangers, hut it was really the abdication of Emile Francis, the unfulfilled coach. With the big TV lights in his eyes at the Penn Plaza Club in Madison Square Garden yesterday, Emile Francis had introduced Stewart and, again only the general manager, he turned away as the new coach, pudgy but dapper, approached the lectern. I'll, said Emile Francis quietly, get out of the road here. And out from behind the bench. I can guarantee you. he was saying later in a darkened corner. there's no way you'll ever see me coaching the New York Rangers again. Not if they lose 10 games in a row. As a coach, I'm fini. But not really will ingly. His obsession had been to coach a team that won the Stanley Cup but that won't happen now unless he leaves the Rangers someday to join another National Hockey League club. He has accepted a dictum from the Garden's executive suite that he concentrate on being the Rangers' general manager.

title: New F.B.I. Is Explained To a Skeptical Audience
description: The new head of the New York City office of the Federal Bureau of Investigation spent last evening addressing a group of liberals and oldline leftists, trying to convince them that the days of J. Edgar Hoover are over.

title: Lake Lenape to Drop for Dam Repair
description: MAYS LANDING, May 19Two  mile  long Lake Lenape here will be reduced to mud this week while the 126yearold dam that created it is inspected and repaired.

title: Antigua to Seek TakeOver Of Natomas Unit's Retinery
description: ST. JOHN'S, Antigua, May 19 (UPI)Negotiations will begin soon for the nationalization of this Commonwealth Caribbean island's lone oil refinery, owned by the Natomas Company, the managing director of the local subsidiary said today.

title: Edith Hebald Married Here
description: The marriage of Edith Lipsig Hebald to William J. Isaacson, a partner in the law firm of Kaye, Scholer, Fierman, Hays & Handler, took place here yesterday morning. Chief Judge Charles D. Breitel of the New York State Court of Appeals performed the ceremony in his chambers.

title: U. of Penn Offers $70,000 in Bias Suit
description: PHILADELPHIA. May 19 The University of Pennsylvania has offered a woman teacher $70,000 in partial settlement of a suit charging the university with sex discrimination.

title: Garment Workers Help Union Mark 75th Anniversary
description: A workers chorus sang Solidarity Forever and gaily costumed usherettes with union insignia circulated through noon time crowds yesterday as the International Ladies Gar ment Workers Union began a celebration of its 75th anniversary at ceremonies in the lower plaza of the McGraw Hill Building on the Avenue of the Americas at 48th Street.

title: 66 Wedding Guests Killed As Indian Train Hits Truck
description: NEW DELHI, May 19 (AP)A train rammed into a truck filled with guests on their way to a wedding in central Maharashtra state today, killing at least 66 persons and injuring 18, the government radio reported.

title: FORD'S TARIFF PLAN IS GIVEN SUPPORT
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (Reuters)The Administration found some support today for its proposal to grant free tariffs to six oilproducing countries that did not join the 1973 oil embargo.

title: Cuba and Britain Sign Fact
description: LONDON, May 19 (Reuters) Cuba and Britain today signed their first economic and industrial cooperation agreement, laying down guidelines for the development of trade. It provides for the establishment of a joint commission to meet annually to review progress and prospects for economic and industrial cooperation.

title: CBS Sweeps Emmy Awards With 32
description: LOS ANGELES, May 19 CBS television swept the Emmy ceremonies tonight with 32 awards, including prizes for best comedy series, best limited series and best comedy variety series.

title: Atomic Arms Talk Opened By Gromyko and Kissinger
description: VIENNA. May 19Secretary or State Kissinger met today with the Soviet Foreign Minister, Andrei A. Gromyko, in the hope that they could begin to make political decisions to surmount the technical difficulties that have plagued the nuclear arms talks.

title: Pressmen Reelect President
description: William J. Kennedy was reelected last night as the president of the New York Newspaper Pressman's Union Local No. 2. Mr. Kennedy received 549 votes out of a total of 695 cast. He was opposed by Francis L. Higgins and Michael Stapleton.

title: SHOP TALK
description: It's not a place you would find casually. After all, it is two floors below street level in the big modem office building at the southwest corner of 57th Street and Park Avenue. But the relatively new Sherle Wagner showroom, which is open to the public, provides a plush contemporary environment to display the decorative bathroom appliances and fixtures that Mr. Wagner ships all over.

title: Albany Votes Bill to Form MalpracticePolicy Group
description: ALBANY, May 19The Legislature today approved a bill that would set up an underwriting association for medicalmalpractice insurance. Thus, it state beyond June 30.

title: Williams, Miss Rudolph Shed Leg Braces in Sprint to Fame
description: If your son or daughter is forced to wear braces or special shoes on their legs at an early age, don't despair: they could wind up running faster than ever.

title: 2,859 Degrees, a Record, Are Granted by Yale
description: NEW HAVEN, May 19Degrees were conferred by Yale University today on 2,859 men and women, more than at any commencement ceremony in the institution's long history.

title: FLORIDA WILD MAN TAKES LIFE IN CELL
description: BUSHNELL. Fla.. May 19 (UPI)An Oriental wild man who was captured in a central Florida swamp over the weekend hanged himself in his jail cell today apparently because he found out the authorities were trying to send him back to his native Taiwan, the Sumter County sheriff's office said.

title: Minister Gets 3Year Term in School Bombings
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., May 19A fundamentalist Baptist minister who led a widespread protest here against textbooks he and his followers said were corrupting children was sen tenced today by a Federal judge to three years in prison for conspiring to blow up schools. in the Kanawha Valley.

title: Advertising
description: Sports Illustrated magazine, the American Broadcasting Company and the Marketing Corporation of America in the Wabeek Building in Birmingham, Mich., have teamed up for a mammoth fundraising effort for the United States Olympic Committee.

title: Pacers Top Colonels; Trail, 31
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 19 (AP)  Billy Keller's 3point basket with six minutes remaining started the rally that lifted the Indiana Pacers to a 94.80 victory over Kentucky tonight, keeping them alive in their American Basketball Association championship series with the Colonels.

title: Federal Elections Panel Making a Delayed Start
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 The new Federal Elections Commission, which is to enforce the new rules reforming campaign financing, is not off to an auspicious start.

title: Concert Is Devoted To Music by Szell And Mitropoulos
description: Many great conductors have also composed music in their spare time, but with a few exceptions they rarely publicized the fact, and generally with good reason. Still, it is always enlightening to hear what sort of music an interpretive genius might write, and the Carnegie Rectial Hall concert Sunday night devoted to music by two great, late conductors, George Szell and Dimitri Mitropoulos, proved to be especially fascinating.

title: High Court Voids Maritime Law Splitting Collision Costs Equally
description: WASHINGTON, May 19The Supreme Court, which prefers to acknowledge past mistakes grudgingly, point by point and case by case, conceded today that a maritime damage rule it has been enforcing since 1854 is unfair.

title: Narnath, W.F.L. Talking
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., May 19 (AP)The owner of the World Football League's Chicago franchise planned his first facetoface meeting with Joe Namath tonight and the president of the league said it would know by tomorrow if the celebrated freeagent quarterback would join the W.F.L.

title: City School Board to Get Plan To Cut Substitute Teachers' Pay
description: A plan to cut the pay of 2,000 daily substitute teachers in the city from the current rate of $49.50 to $72 a day to a flat rate of $40 will be submitted, to the Board of Education next week, a top school official said yesterday.

title: JUSTICES BROADEN SCHOOLAID CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, May 19The Supreme Court struck down as unconstitutional today a Pennsylvania law providing state aid to private and parochial schools for services like counseling, testing and remedial classes and for instructional equipment like maps, records, films and projectors.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: I.B.M. ANTITRUST TRIAL OPENS: Raymond M. Carlson, left, opening case for Justice Department in Federal Court here. At right, front, is Joseph H. Widmar, also of Government. Across from him are Nicholas dell.

title: A Big Board Name Change
description: DLJ Securities Clearance, Inc., a New York Stock Exchange member, will change its name to the Alcor Securities Corporation on June 1, the New York. Stock Exchange said yesterday. The Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette Securities Corporation, another Big Board member, said the name change was designed to end confusion between the two member firms. Alcor is operated by the Alliance Capital Management Corporation, a Donaldson Lufkin money management company.

title: A.&P. Profit Hopes Dim for Near Term
description: The Great Atlantic and Pacific Tea Company does not expect to be profitable in the fiscal year ending next February, J. L. Scott, chairman said in the annual report issued to stockholders yesterday.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Rutgers Dorm Fires Under Inquiry

title: Foes of ConventionCenter Plan Renew Attack, Cite Fiscal Crisis
description: Opponents of the projected Convention and Exhibition Center, the construction of which was approved by the city's Environmental Protection Administration on Sunday, de nounced the decision yesterday, citing the city's fiscal crisis and their concern for the environment.

title: CITY IS REBUFFED ON PLANS TO SELL 280MILLION NOTES
description: Three large New York commercial banks and an investment house declined yesterday to buy $280 million in bond anticipation notes offered to them without bidding by Contrailer Harrison J. Goldin, further aggravating the city's financial predicament.

title: Saigon Says Thousands Return To Homes in Central Provinces
description: HONG KONG, May 19 (Agence FrancePresse) Tens of thousands of refugees are returning to their homes in the central provinces of South Vietnam, the Saigon radio reported today.

title: Trot Fans In No Rush For Triple
description: YONKERS, May 19The triple, a betting gimmick that got horseplayers to stay late at Yonkers Raceway in the past, apparently didn't get them out to the track early tonight.

title: Cambodia Offers Annuity
description: BANGKOK, May 19 (UPI) The new Cambodian Government offered friendship to Thailand today and denied reports that it demanded that the border be pushed half a mile into Thai territory.

title: Holiday Closings in Europe
description: Securities and foreignexchange markets were closed in most European countries yesterday in celebration of the Pentecost holiday.

title: Unions Plan Protest On High Loan Rates Imposed on the City
