description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP) The Civil Aeronautics Board fined American Airlines a record total of $150.000 today for using corporate funds for political contributions, including a $55.000 contribution to the reelection campaign of President Nixon.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: No.Amer.Soccer League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME

title: Dow Average Off 5.29; Gains Outpace Declines
description: The stock market marked time and closed irregular yesterday as investors apparently were confused by mixed economic news.

title: Making Hash of Prime
description: MIAMIThe consumption of beef has come under such heavy criticism of late that it was bound to reach the stage of incredulity. This point happened recently when U.S. prime grade beef was judged a junk food by Rood Day sponsors and lumped with other foods in that category.

title: BOND PRICES FALL IN SLOW TRADING
description: The Government securities market showed price declines yesterday in extremely slow trading, amid indications that the Federal Reserve has stopped easing credit conditions for a while. Corporate bond prices moved down by about point. while trading in New York City securities remained virtually moribund in view of the city's fiscal crisis.

title: Selection of Jury Is Slow As Kallinger Trial Begins
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., May 27The process of selecting a jury here in the robbery, burglary trial of Joseph Kallinger began slowly today with only two persons being chosen from the 32 prospective jurors questioned.

title: Unskilled and Semiskilled Face a Bleak Job Outlook
description: A bleak situation exists for unskilled and semiskilled jobseekers here, according to state and city data. This led Lucille Rose. the city's Commissioner of Employment. to renew appeals yesterday for more public jobs.

title: I.R.S. INVESTIGATORS SUE ON INFORMANTS
description: Three special investigators for the Internal Revenue Service charged yesterday that the service was interfering with their efforts to get information about organized crime, political corruption and narcotics trafficking by demanding the names of their unpaid informants.

title: VIETNAMESE ART ON SHIP APPRAISED
description: AGANA, Guam, May 27 (AP) A cargo of art objects that South Vietnam's new Government claims as stolen Vietnamese art treasures worth $150million has been initially appraised at only $70,000 to $80,000 officials said today. But more treasures still may be aboard the vessel, they added.

title: Europe Uncertain
description: Europe Uncertain

title: 145 Clemency Appeals Settled by President
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (UPI)  President Ford has signed 143 of the nearly 900 Vietnam clemency cases handled so far by his Clemency Review Board, a White House spokesman said today.

title: Pel Will Watch Cosmos Tonight
description: The New York Cosmos will attempt to regain first place in the Northern Division of the North American Soccer League tonight when they take on the Vancouver Whitecaps, who lead the Western Division.

title: A 4% Cut in IRT Service Is Planned for September
Advertising
description: Ogilvy & Mather International expects profits for the year to be up domestically and probably worldwide, John Elliott, the chairman, said yesterday at the company's ninth annual meeting, with the only soft spot in Britain.

title: Books of The Times
description: I used to enjoy John Crosby's column on television in The Herald Tribune. I remember one in particular on Arthur Godfrey, who was then a leading television personality. Mr. Godfrey had had an illness or an operation and was just returning to his audience. The occasion was too momentous for regular programing, so, according to Mr. Crosby, Mr. Godfrey simply played with his dog. He played with his dog for 20 minutes on national television.

title: Raw Materials...
description: The grand conclave of the industrial nations, meeting in Paris this week to coordinate economic policy, offers the United States an opportunity to provide muchneeded leadership for better relations with the world's increasingly radicalized developing countries.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: T. J. Ross Is Dead at 81; Public Relations Pioneer
description: T. J. Ross, a pioneer in public relations who had handled, among others, the personal affairs of John D. Rockefeller Jr., George Washington Hill, president of the American Tobacco Company, and Walter P. Chrysler, died yesterday at the Westchester Country Club in Rye, N. Y., where he lived. He was 81 years old.

title: Women's Lib in Reverse
description: STATE COLLEGE, Miss. (AP) Bill Bryan has become the first male to graduate from the Mississippi State University Department of Home Economics. Mr. Bryan, who is set for a career as an interior decorator, said he was excited about the distinction.

title: M.T.A. Gives Passenger A Token of Its Esteem
description: MINEOLA, L. I., May 27 (AP)A young woman in a hurry got a surprise gift today as she purchased the millionth New York City subway token handled by the Long Island Railroad for sale at its stations.

title: Assembly Votes to Reverse P. S. C. on Charge for Information Calls
description: ALBANY, May 27The Assembly today approved five bills aimed at curbing the powers of the Public Service Commission, including a measure which for the first time reverses a decision by the commission.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: FREERUN RUNYON Tonight, tomorrow and Friday at 8 P.M., the public will be offered a nostalgic look, at no charge, at one of Broadway's musical milestones in New York University's school theater, 35 West Fourth Street. The show is Guys and Dolls, a curiously neglected musical for almost a decade until the St. Bart's Players revived it briefly six months ago.

title: 4 Per Cent Cut in IRT Subway Service Scheduled for September
Article 4  No Title
2 Soviet Astronauts Check Equipment in Space Station
description: MOSCOW, May 27 (UPI)Two Soviet astronauts spent their third day aboard an orbiting space station today checking and setting up equipment for what could be a long series of experiments.

title: Flyers Defeat Sabres by 20 For 2d Straight Stanley Cup
description: BUFFALO, May 27Casting off the label of lucky team, the Philadelphia Flyers captured their second straight National Hockey League championship tonight by beating the Buffalo Sabres, 20. The defenseoriented Flyers won the coveted Stanley Cup just sa they had last year, 4 games to 2.

title: WriteIn Candidate Wins
description: CHICAGO, May 27 (UPI)The Rev. Francis X. Lawlor, who conducted a writein campaign, received 60 per cent of the votes today and won the Republican nomination for the vacant Congressional seat in the Fifth District.

title: Saigon Asks U. N. To Help Refugees Wishing to Return
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 27  A formal request to the United Nations for assistance in repatriating South Vietnamese refugees wishing to return home has been made by the new Government in Saigon.

title: FORD IS REPORTED ASSESSING RIVALS
description: WASHINGTON, May 27President Ford, preparing to make a lowkey announcement of his candidacy for a full term in the White House, reportedly expects his Democratic opponent in 1976 to be either Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota or Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine.

title: DODD INTRODUCES MAJORMEDICALPLAN
description: TRENTON, May 27 (UPI)Frank J. Dodd, Essex Democrat who is president of the State Senate today proposed a statefinanced health plan to protect the public against financial ruin from major medical expenses.

title: 25% of Poor Students' Aid Is Left Unspent by H.E.W.
description: WASHINGTON, May 27As the current school year comes to a close, the Federal Government has left unspent onequarter of the $535million scholarship money it gives to poor students who want to attend college.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 27 (AP) Tom Sneva, who walked away from a harrowing crash in Sunday's Indianapolis 500 auto race with mostly minor injuries, was moved today to a private room at Methodist Hospital. Although he suffered first, second and third degree burns over 15 per cent of his body, Sneva may be well enough to go home in seven to 10 days. He had been listed in serious condition as a precaution for two days while he was in intensive care. After moving to his private room, his condition was changed to good.

title: Effort Made to Hold Talks In the Malpractice Crisis
description: Aides to Governor Carey and legislative leaders yesterday began talking with leaders of the New York State Medical Society about scheduling a meeting to head off a crisis over the malpractice insurance controversy.

title: TOM DESPIRITO, JOCKEY, 39, DIES
description: Tony DeSpirito, who as a 17yearold jockey in 1952 set a riding record of 390 victories on United States thoroughbred tracks, but later suffered a series of major injuries, was found dead Monday in his apartment in East Providence, R. I. He was 39 years old.

title: Prisoners End Fast
description: VANDALIA, Ill., May 27 (UPI) Prisoners at the Vandalia Correctional Center ended a 40hour hunger strike today and officials shipped 37 strike leaders to other state prisons.

title: Justices Let Stand Censorship Order Over a C.I.A. Book
description: WASHINGTON, May 27A court order under which a former Central Intelligence Agency employe must submit all his future writing about the C.I.A. to the agency for prepublication censorship was left untouched today by the Supreme Court.

title: Shift Is Considered On Bill to Assure Counsel for Witness
description: ALBANY, May 27In the face of strong opposition from prosec??tors the chief Senate sponsor of a bill that would permit lawyers to accompany witnesses before a grand jury said today he was considering amending it to cover only witnesses who waived immunity.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, MAY 28, 1975

title: MSGR. JOSE CACELLA
description: Msgr. Jose Cacella, director of St. Anthony's Center Portuguese Mission at 443 East 135th Street, the Bronx, died yesterday. He was 92 years old and lived at the center.

title: Use of Marijuana in Horne Legalized by Alaska Court
description: ANCHORAGE, May 27The Alaska Supreme Court today issued a 54page landmark decision that, in effect, legalizes marijuana for personal use in the privacy of one's home in the 48th state.

title: TV: Tribute to My Line
description: When What's My Line made its television debut on February 2. 1950, I was struggling through the early years of high school in the Bronx. The program, carried in late prime time on Sunday nights, became a sort of official cue for the conclusion of busy weekends. The following morning it would be business as usual but, for the moment, everyone could relax and enjoy the completely predictable format with John Daly, the host, and Arlene Francis. Dorothy Kilgallen and Bennett Cerf, the regular panelists. The highlights of that incomparable silliness are distilled this evening, on ABCTV from 11:30 P.M. to 1 A.M., on What's My Line? at 25.

title: Flyers Win Cup Again
description: The Philadelphia Flyers won the Stanley Cup playoffs of the National Hockey League for the second straight year. The Flyers defeated the Sabres at Buffalo, 20, last night to take the four  of  seven  game series, four games to two. Page 31.

title: Notes on People
description: The Senate's secondranking Democratic leader, Robert C. Byrd of West Virginia, told a party breakfast in Illinois yesterday that Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, more than any other public figure, articulates the dissatisfaction and discontent that millions feel.

title: R.H. MACY LISTS $12MILLION LOSS
description: A big decline in the results of the 16store New York division and lesser ones in two other store divisions gave R. H. Macy & Co., Inc., a $12million loss in its third fiscal quarter ended May 3 against an $812.000 profit in the 1974 quarter. Sales rose 3.4 per cent to $278.4million from $269.1million.

title: Extension Is Voted On Wiretapping Law By Jersey Senate
description: TRENTON, May 27  The State Senate passed by a vote of 31 to 5 a bill today that would extend for three years a state law authorizing courtapproved police wiretaps. The bill included Senate Judiciary Committee amendments to satisfy critics who felt the origial law enacted six years ago did nnot adequately protect individual rights.

title: Exports Exceed Imports for 3d Month
description: WASHINGTON, May 27An increase in the recorded value of oil imports reduced the nation's foreigntrade surplus in April. But exports still exceeded imports by a sizable margin for the third consecutive month the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Top Sprinter Opposed To Wagering in I.T.A.
description: But several I. T. A. athletes already have been exposed to running with money on their back. And JeanLouis Ravelomanantsoa, although he survived such an ordeal earlier this year, is not ready to put his stamp of approval on general wagering at I. T. A. meets.

title: Smothered Inquiry
description: The uncooperativeness toward New York City that seems to characterize the attitude of the Federal Government these days has now spread to the Federal Joint Strike Force Against Organized Crime, which abruptly terminated a few weeks ago a promising investigation into underworld penetration of the garment district.

title: Congress and Oil Policy
description: WASHINGTON, May 27Developments in Washington and Paris underscored today as nothing has since the 197374 Arab oil embargo that energy is primarily a foreignpolicy problem. The Arab states, it will be remembered, embargoed oil shipments to the United States not when the October, 1973, ArabIsraeli war started but only after the United States began to resupply Israeli military forces.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
$1 OIL IMPORT FEE DOUBLED BY FORD; GAS PRICE TO RISE
description: WASHINGTON, May 27President Ford announced tonight that he would impose a second $1abarrel fee an imported oil beginning Sunday and that he would start phasing out price controls on domestic oil supplies later in June.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Virginia Electric and Power Company filed yesterday with the Securities and Exchange Commission in connection with a proposed offering of four million common shares through underwriters headed by Morgan Stanley & Co., Inc.; Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith Inc., and Wheat First Securities, Inc. The utility has said net proceeds from the offering would be used to retire outstanding shortterm debt, including bank loans and commercial paper.

title: The Garden Hammock Is Invited Into the House, and Makes Itself Right at Home
description: Hammocks, after being brought indoors to grace rooms that decorators had turned into  gardenslots of plants, wicker furniture, trellised wallpaper, that sort of thingare now being hung up in ordinary living rooms and bedrooms.

title: Record Fine Imposed
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board fined American Airlines $150,000, a record, for having used corporate funds for political contributions. Page 59.

title: Hearing Set On Suit by McGinnis
description: Federal Judge Robert L. Canter yesterday set Friday for a hearing on George McGinnis's lawsuit against the National Basketball Association and its 18 teams. McGinnis is challenging the N.B.A. draft and is seeking specifically to break his ties with the Philadelphia 76ers, who hold the draft rights to him. Although the suit asks that McGinnis be free to negotiate with any N.B.A. team, the Indiana Pacer star wants to sign with the Knicks.

title: Bridge:
description: Some of the hardest events to win in the metropolitan area are the various double knockout events, played annually over extended periods in New York, Long Island, New Jersey and Westchester. Retaining one of these titles is rare, and the achievement of a team in winning three times in four years is most unusual.

title: Cyprus Turks Happy at Gains, But They Count the Losses, Too
description: KYRENTA, Cyprus, May 24When Turkish troops invaded Cyprus last summer the ethnic Greeks of Limassol rounded up the ethnic Turks and held them prisoner on the hospital grounds. One of the Turks, Ali Dervish Onder, remembers thinking, This is itthis is the end of it.

title: Home Sales Lagging Despite Tax Credit
description: LOS ANGELES, May 27The traditional spring homebuying rush is almost over, and despite the lure of a tax credit of up to $2,000 it has been more a crawl than a rush. The longsought turnaround for the depressed housing industry  considered a necessary step for national economic recovery  has not yet arrived, according to the nation's builders.

title: Rupert Fothergill is Dead at 62; Led Rescue of Animals in Africa
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 27 (AP)  Rupert Fothergill, the organizer of Operation Noah, which rescued more than 6,000 animals from the rising waters behind the Kariba Dam, died yesterday at his home. He was 62 years old.

title: I.C.C. SUPPORTS A PLAN FOR RAILS
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP)  The Interstate Commerce Commission said today it supported proposals that solvent railroads in the Northeast acquire the property of several insolvent carriers as part of the reorganization process.

title: People in Sports
description: After having protested when the Washington Redskins of the National Football League released him May 1, 40yearold Sonny Jurgensen went gracefully into retirement today, turning down an offer to play for the Philadelphia Bell of the World Football League.

title: The Pressures on Ford
description: WASHINGTON, May 27You have to blink when you read the news of foreign affairs these days. Almost every time you pick up the paper, somebody is telling the President of the United States what he must do to regain the confidence of the world.

title: NESTLE IS SEEKING ALL LIBBY STOCK
description: Nestl Alimentana, S.A., the Switzerlandbased multinational corporation whose holdings include a 61 per cent common stock ownership of Libby, McNeil & Libby, the United States based food company, announced yesterday its intention of acquiring the remaining outstanding shares of this United States affiliate. The proposed cash tender offer is for the purchase of the remainder of Libby, McNeill & Libby common outstanding beyond the approximately 5.9 million common shares Nestl presently owns. It also includes an offer for 100 per cent of Libby's outstanding 5 per cent convertible subordinated debentures due Jan. 15, 1989. The total value of the deal is estimated at about $40million.

title: SUIT ASKS ACTION ON TANKER RULES
description: WASHINGTON, May 27A group of eight national environmental groups filed suit today to force the Government to release regulations concerning tanker construction that were designed to reduce the hazard of oil pollution in the world's oceans.

title: Philadelphia Toasts The Flyers
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 27 (AP)  It didn't take fans of the Philadelphia Flyers long to begin celebrating their team's second straight Stanley Cup victory tonight.

title: Turner Is Ordered To Return Funds To Scheme Victims
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (UPI) A Federal Trade Commission judge ordered today Glenn Turner, the promoter, and his associates to pay back $44million to thousands of persons victimized by a cosmeticmarketing scheme, which the judge called a virtual financial nightmare.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The New York Times/Robert Walker

title: Home Sales Lagging Despite Tax Credit
description: LOS ANGELES, May 27The traditional spring homebuying rush is almost over, and despite the lure of a tax credit of up to $2,000 it has been more a crawl than a rush. The longsought turnaround fox the depressed housing industry considered a necessary step for national economic recovery has not yet arrived, according to the nation's builders

title: Counterproductive
description: The proper Western strategies for dealing with the changing political situations in Spain and Portugal seem clear:

title: Wiretap Extension Voted By Trenton Senate, 315
description: TRENTON, May 27The State Senate passed by a vote of 31 to 5 a bill today that would extend for three years a state law authorizing courtapproved wiretaps. The bill included Senate Judiciary Committee amendments to satisfy critics who felt the original law enacted six years ago did not adequately protect individual rights.

title: CONSUMER NOTES
description: The district offices of the Internal Revenue Service are being flooded with telephone calls from irate taxpayers complaining that the Treasury Department shortchanged them on their tax rebates.

title: PERIL TO POOR SEEN IN SALVAGED FOOD
description: WASHINGTON, May 27, ReutersA government agency reported today that consumers, orphans and nursing home patients face unreasonable health hazards when they eat products sold by salvagers of damaged food containers.

title: Nairobi University Is Shut After StudentPolice Clash
description: NAIROBI, Kenya. May 27 (AP)The Kenya Government ordered Nairobi University closed indefinitely today after clashes over a threeday period between policemen and student protesters.

title: 7 G.O.P. SENATORS WITHHOLD BACKING ON A CITY BUDGET
description: ALBANY, May 27The seven Republican State Senators from New York City failed to agree today on a city tax package, and Mayor Beame, who had waited with mounting impatience all day for their answer, left for home.

title: F.D.A. EASES RULES ON SOME VITAMINS
description: WASHINGTON, May 27The Food and Drug Administration backed away today from its decision of 1973 that superpotent vitamins and minerals should be regulated as drugs.

title: West Germany's Secret Weapon
description: BONNThe first German miracle was the startling recovery from World War II, which left this country partitioned, ruined, helpless and filled with refugees. Armed with an excellent Americaninspired Constitution, led by tough, wise, old Konrad Adenauer, its factories reequipped with modern machinery, and helped by a daring ourrency reform, the hardworking German people, united in misery, began their race to prosperity.

title: Yankee Records
Proposed New Criminal Code Arouses Press's Fears on Secrecy
description: A confrontation is developing over the proposed Federal Criminal Code that many in the press believe will become the bitterest and most important between the press and the Government since John Peter Zenger was acquitted of seditious libel in 1735. For deep in the 750page proposal particularly in the sections dealing with espionage, is a thrust toward legalizing Government secrecy that heretofore has been alien to the nation's freedomofthepress tradition.

title: Justices Let Stand Censorship Order Over a C.I.A. Book
description: WASHINGTON, May 27A court order under which a former Central Intelligence Agency employe must submit all his future writing about the C.I.A. to the agency for prepublication censorship was left untouched today by the Supreme Court.

title: A FINANCE AGENCY FOR CITY UPHELD
description: ALBANY, May 27The State Court of Appeals, by a 4to3 decision, today threw out a challenge to the constitutionality of the Stabilization Reserve Corporation, a new agency through which New York City hopes to borrow $520million by the end of its current fiscal year.

title: A FINANCE AGENCY FOR CITY UPHELD
description: ALBANY, May 27The State Court of Appeals, by a 4to3 decision, today threw out a challenge to the constitutionality of the Stabilization Reserve Corporation, a new agency through which New York City hopes to borrow $520million by the end of its current fiscal year.

title: City Submits a Development Plan for the North Shore of Queens
description: The Department of City Planning recommended yesterday that much of the north shore of Queens between College Point and Douglaston be reserved for public use but that limited residential development be permitted on selected waterfront tracts.

title: DeSpirito Dies at 39
description: Tony DeSpirito, who set a record of 390 winners when he was a 17yearold jockey in 1952, is dead at the age of 39. His obituary appears on Page 44.

title: Week's Steel Output Hits a 3Year Low
description: Domestic steel production for the week ended May 24 fell to its lowest level in more than three years.

title: Sociobiology: Updating Darwin on Behavior
description: The tightly organized societies of bees and ants, the mating rituals of birds, the hunting tactics of lion prides, the social hierarchies of monkey troopsthese and dozens of other examples of animal behavior have long fascinated people. But they have rarely been offered as anything more than intriguing evidence for the remarkable variety of nature.

title: Louisiana Banker Moves to Foil Investor Who Won Board Seats
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 27A wealthy Italian investor has taken four of 10 directors' seats on the National American Bank here away from its controvercial chairman and principal owner, oilman Louis J. Roussel.

title: Environmental Rescue
description: Governor Carey's plan to utilize unexpended state bond money and recently released Federal funds in a crash program to clean up New York's waters offers an imaginative response to two pressing state problemsunemployment and pollution.

title: PUBLIC JOB PLANS HELD OVER VALUED
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 Public employment programs, which use Government funds to provide jobs, are overvalued in their ability to reduce unemployment and deliver more public services, according to a private study released here today.

title: Husak to Assume Presidency in Prague
description: PRAGUE, May 27 (Reuters)The Czechoslovak Communist party's Central Committee today named its general secretary, Gustav Husak, to succeed President Ludvik Svoboda, who has been seriously ill for more than a year.

title: U.S. Judge Francis Ford Dead; Presided at Spock Trial in 1968
description: Francis J. W. Ford the Federal judge who presided at the 1968 trial in which Dr. Benjamin Spock, the childcare specialist, was found guilty of advising young men on how to avoid the draft, died Monday in Boston, where he lived. He was 92 years old.

title: SAIGON EXECUTES 2 MEN AS ROBBERS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 27 (AP)Two men were put to death over the weekend on robbery charges here, and a picture of one of them, tied to a stake with two soldiers aiming rifles at him, was published today in the official Saigon newspaper.

title: Bingo Bandit Returns $1,200 Loot in Queens
description: A telephone caller, who told the police he had helped rob a Queens Memorial Day bingo game to call attention to lax security at such events, gave back the $1,200 loot yesterday afternoon but refused repeated pleas that he give himself up.

title: Suspect Bars Extradition
description: WAYNE, May 27 (UPI)Ronald T. Williams, a former convict arrested here for burglary, refused extradition today to West Virginia, where he is wanted in the slaying of a Beckley police officer. The police here apprehended Mr. Williams Saturday without incident after he allegedly broke into two homes,

title: In New Zealand, the Piper Waits
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand The impact of the world recession on New Zealand appears at first glance to be fairly painless, with unemployment hardly noticeable and inflation relatively modest by today's standards.

title: IRAN IS EXHORTED TO DEVELOP THRIFT
description: TEHERAN, Iran. May 27,The Iranian Premier has told his ministries to cut spending; the oil chief stresses the importance of conserving resources; the Shah has complained about the impact of world inflation on his treasury.

title: Prof. David Randall Dies at 70; RareBook Librarian at Indiana
description: Professor Randall studied mining engineering at Lehigh University and had enrolled in Harvard Law School. He was just about to take his law examination when his interest in rare books got the better of him.

title: Market Place
description: The latest shortinterest figures were released late last week, 10 trading days after the date for which they were tabulated and thus were one day later than usual.

title: For Herring Lovers
description: Raw, slightly salted herring, the first of the new season, are being flown in from the Netherlands for an unusual addition to the menu at The Oyster Bar in Grand Central. Besides ordering the North Sea delicacy at the counters and tables, customers can buy the herring from a colorful wooden cart, complete with striped awning, that is the Dutch equivalent of the hot dog cart. Dutchmen eat raw herring as a betweenmeal snack.

title: Heart Recipient Dies
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich, May 27 (AP)A Muskegon man who received a heart transplant one month ago died today at the University of Michigan Hospital here. Robert DeVries, 48 years old, died of pneumonia, but surgeons said he never recovered from the shock of two major surgical procedures April 30. The transplant was a final attempt to save his life when his own heart did not recover from an operation to repair an aortic valve.

title: 2,000 Cadillacs Recalled
description: DETROIT, May 27 (AP)The Cadillac Motor Car Division of General Motors has recalled about 2,000 cars equipped with an air cushion restraint system that may be defective. The division said that an underhood wiring harness routing, which detects bumper impact in an accident, could be faulty on the 1974 and 1975 model cars.

title: Silver and Gold Futures Register a Sharp Decline
description: Silver and gold futures, strong last week, fell sharply yesterday in a technical reaction in slow postholiday trading.

title: Crisis Eases in Beirut Amid Talks on New Premier
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 27Lebanon's political crisis eased today as President Suleiman Franjieh consulted political leaders on the appointment of a new Premier acceptable to the country's Moslems.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: PARIS, May 27Europeans are awaiting President Ford's first official trip to this side of the Atlantic with bewilderment and uncertainty.

title: Peking Cheers U.S. Victors; A.A.U. Stars May Not Try
description: Some of America's top amateur track and field athletes, angered over summer travel restrictions, may intentionally perform poorly during the National Amateur Athletic Union outdoor championships next month, Marty Liguori said yesterday.

title: Impact on Oil Imports
description: WASHINGTON, May 27Following is an excerpt from a fact sheet issued by the White House today, accompanying President Ford's address on energy:

title: U.S. AFFIRMS SHIFT ON WORLD PRICES
description: PARIS, May 27The United States, calling for a new preparatory meeting for an international energy conference, affirmed today that it was willing to consider arrangements for greater price stability for raw materials exported by developing countries.

title: Sociobiology: Updating Darwin on Behavior
description: The tightly organized societies of bees and ants, the mating rituals of birds, the hunting tactics of lion prides, the social hierarchies of monkey troopsthese and dozens of other examples of animal behavior have long fascinated people, But they have rarely been offered as anything more than intriguing evidence for the remarkable variety of nature.

title: HUMANITIES FUND AIDS BARD PARLEY
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP) A grant of $40,000 in support of the first World Congress of the International Shakespeare Association next spring was announced today by the National Endowment for the Humanities.

title: N.H.L. Championship
description: Buffalo vs. Philadelphia

title: Market Summary
description: Tuesday, May 27, 1975

title: Golf Event Reinstated For 1976
description: ATLANTA, May 27 (AP)The controversial cancellation of pro golf's Tournament of Champions was rescinded today. The event will be rescheduled for 1976.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED IN AMEX TRADING
description: Prices on the American Sock Exchange and in the overthecounter market closed mixed yesterday. Volume fell slightly on both markets.

title: Article 1  No Title
4Nation Force Finishes Clearing the Suez Canal
description: ISMALIA, Egypt, May 27 (UPI)  Commanders of the fournation naval task force clearing the Suez Canal said today that the waterway was now absolutely safe for shipping.

title: 4 OTHERS LINKED TO PRISON ESCAPE
description: The Department of Correction disclosed yesterday that four other Black Liberation Army members were supposed to have taken part in the escape Sunday night from the Brooklyn House of Detention in which one man died and a second was arrested.

title: Full Salaries Given Back To Chrysler's Executives
description: DETROIT, May 27 (AP)Top officers of the Chrysler Corporation, who took 50 per cent pay cuts last December, have had their full salaries restored because the concern's financial fortunes have improved, a company spokesman said today.

title: Food Prices Rise 1.3 Per Cent Here
description: Pork chops soared 16 cents a pound to $1.93, other pork cuts more moderately, and bottomround roast of beef led beef cuts upward with a 5 cent a pound rise to $1.88 last week. As a result, the cost of feeding a family of four in New York City went up substantially, 1.3 per cent on the week.

title: Fitzmorris Beats Hunter As Royals Top Yanks, 30
description: KANSAS CITY, May 27Al Fitzmorris, the Kansas City righthander who threw a threehit shutout and beat the New York Yankees, 30, before a crowd of 20,592 in Royals Stadiuni tonight, confessed that his tastball was nonexistent.

title: ATTICA WITNESS IN A RECANTATION
description: BUFFALO, May 27A key prosecution witness testified today that he had incorrectly identified a photograph as ?? of a former Attica inmate charged in the murder of two fellow inmates during the 1971 orison rebellion.

title: Italy Effecting Cut In Bank Rate to 7%
description: ROME, May 27 (Reuters)The Italian bank rate will be cut to 7 per cent from 8 per cent, effective tomorrow, officials announced today.

title: Country of Brooklyn Has Its Day
description: Hear ye. Hear ye, cried Abraham G. Gerges, a City Councilman from Brooklyn, who was dressed in a Revolutionaryera blue and red tail coat as he announced the beginning of Brooklyn's official celebration of the nation's Bicentennial yesterday. Welcome to the greatest country in the world . . . Brooklyn, New York.

title: A $7Million Award Granted to Youth Hurt in Hotel Pool
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP) A Federal court jury returned a $7million award today, to a youth who was paralyzed after an accident in a swimming pool at a Washington hotel.

title: Upstate Track in OTB Bid
description: In a politically explosive appeal, Finger Lakes Race Track asked permission yesterday to operate on Tuesdays so it can handle offtrack bets from New York City. Finger Lakes, a thoroughbred track in upstate Canandaigua, N. Y., has no Tuesday or Thursday action in its fiveday  a  week operation. It wants Tuesday programs during the 10 weeks in June, July and August when the New York Racing Association will be running on Sundays and closing down on Tuesdays.

title: About the Yankees ...
description: Graig Nettles's single, one of the three hits off Al Fitzmorris, extended the Yankee third baseman's streak to five games. . . . Roy White who got 13 hits in 25 times at bat, including four doubles and two triples, a .520 percentage last week, was nominated by the Yankees for player of the week. . . . The Yankees are now playing behind last year's pace. At the 40game mark a year ago they were 2020. At 41 games this year they are 18 and 23, but the Orioles, who won the division last season, were in last place. . . . Fitzmorris hadn't faced the Yankees since Aug. 27, 1972, and he hadn't started against them since Aug. 24, 1970. His career hit in the head by Nettles's knee in the game last night, suffering a slight concussion, was expected to be back in the lineup soon perhaps tonight.

title: Old Streak Ended, Giants Start Anew
description: The San Francisco Giants, whose extrainning winning streak was stopped at five Monday night in Philadelphia, started another last night in the same place, beating the Phillies. 10. in the 10th.

title: U.S. Golf Team Is Favored
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland, May 27If golfing reputations mean anything, the United States Walker Cup team should be a shooin to card the 22d victory in 25 meetings with the BritishIrish team.

title: About Education
description: At a time when there is a glut of teachers, and most major cities are gouging deep cuts in their education spending, there is still at least one area where teachers are at a premiumin bilingual education.

title: U.S. AFFIRMS SHIFT ON WORLD PRICES
description: PARIS, May 27The United States, calling for a new preparatory meeting for an international energy conference, affirmed today that it was willing to consider arrangements for greater price stability for raw materials exported by developing countries.

title: Wild Man's Ashes Returned
description: BUSHNELL, Fla., May 27 (UPI)The ashes of Hu Tu Mei. the 39yearold wild man of the green swamp who took his own life in a jail cell here May 19, are being returned to his native Taiwan. Sheriff Don Page said today. Cremation was ordered by the Republic of China Consulate General in Atlanta. Sheriff Page said.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Mets' Records
Business Briefs
description: Deposit inflows at the nation's savings and loan associations in April totaled $2.7billion, a record, Thomas R. Bomar, chairman of the Federal Home Loan Bank Board, disclosed yesterday. April is frequently a poor month for savings deposits because many withdrawals must be made to pay Federal income taxes.

title: PROF. MAX STERN
description: Prof. Max Stern, a retired associate professor of social work at Yeshiva University, died Monday at Barnert Hospital in Paterson, N.J. He was 66 and lived in Fort Lee, N.J.

title: GUIDELINES SOUGHT FOR SOLAR DEVICES
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (UPI) Unless the solar energy industry develops standards to make sure its products are safe and effective, the predicted shift to solar heating and cooling may never materialize, Virginia Knauer, President Ford's consumer adviser, said today.

title: Europe Uncertain
description: PARIS, May 27Europeans are awaiting President Ford's first official trip to this side of the Atlantic with bewilderment and uncertainty.

title: OFFICER IS GUILTY IN SHOOTING TRIAL
description: A State Supreme Court jury found a police lieutenant guilty here last night of firstdegree: assault in an incident involving him and two prostitutes, one of whom was critically shot during what he said had been an attempt to rob him.

title: Borg and Miss Evert Advance in Rome
description: ROME, May 27 (AP)The defending champions, Bjorn Borg of Sweden and Chris Evert of the United States, cruised to easy victories in the $120,000 Italian open tennis championships today.

title: Tomahawks Down Caribous, 19 to 17
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., May 27 Dave Wilfong scored six goals, fine in the first period, to lead, the Long Island Tomahawks to a 1917 victory over the Quebec Caribous tonight in a National Lacrosse League game at the Nassau Coliseum.

title: State Opera Company Celebrating Its 10th Anniversary
description: PRINCETON, May 27The New Jersey State Opera Company will celebrate its 10th anniversary here on Saturday with a masked ball at Morven, official residence of Governor and Mrs. Byrne, who will be hosts for the event.

title: A Dispute Center Opens in Harlem
description: A communitybased mediation center for minor disputes that is designed to free policemen for more serious crimes and help unclog the courts opened in Harlem. The center, at 402 West 145th Street, will employ community residents trained in arbitration and mediation to handle such cases as harassment, domestic disputes and other lesser crimes between friends, relatives and neighbors. The operation will cover Manhattan north of 141st Street.

title: At Stuttgart Ballet, Tetley Era Begins
description: The Stuttgart Ballet returned to New York last night with an American directorGlen Tetley For the first time since its debut here in 1969, the German company will not be accompanied by John Cranko, the British choreographer who molded the troupe into an international success story.

title: Grand Prix Tennis on Way Here
description: Grand prix tournament tennis is coming to the East, thanks to two local promoters. You won't be seeing Arthur Ashe or Stan Smith, because the money is not big. But the idea is to get a circuit going in this area, which is flooded with players who can't make the major events but are eager for steady competition and a chance at modest prize money.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: AIDE IN GRAIN CASE TO RETIRE IN JUNE
description: WASHINGTON, May 27 (AP) A senior Agriculture Department official is retiring in the midst of a growing controversy over his agency's role in alleged misconduct of federally licensed nspectors who are said to have cleared poorquality grain for export.

title: Kennedy in Teheran, Questions Wisdom Of Arms BuildUp
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 27 Senator Edward M. Kennedy in public appearances today after a meeting with Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi, questioned the wisdom of large arms purchases by Iran and other countries of the Persian Gulf region.

title: WILENTZ ENTERS NOT GUILTY PLEA
description: NEWARK, May 27 (AP)Warren W. Wilentz, a onetime Democratic candidate for the United States Senate, pleaded not guilty in Federal District court here today to four counts of income tax evasion.

title: Robert S. Talmadge, 29, Son of the Senator. Drowns
description: BUFORD, Ga., May 27 (Reuters)Robert S. Talmadge, the younger son of Senator Herman E. Talmadge, Democrat of Georgia, drowned late yesterDay while swimming in nearby Lake Lanier. He was 29 years old.

title: Delaware Bridge Tolls Rise
description: BURLINGTON, May 27 (UPI) New Jersey's two bridges that charge a 5 cent tollthe Burlington  Bristol and the TacomyPalmyra will charge a dime beginning July 1. The Burlington Bridge Commission unanimously voted today to double the fares on the two bridges, which span the Delaware River, to help counteract spiralling maintenance and operation costs.

title: Wagner Is Shocked By Attacks on City In Its Fiscal Crisis
description: Former Mayor Robert F. Wagner, asked last night what he would do if he were Mayor now with the city's present fiscal crisis, replied: I'd resign.

title: World Team Tennis
description: MONDAY NIGHT'S MATCH

title: Money to Have Surgery
description: MILWAUKEE, May 27 (AP) The Milwaukee Brewers said today that Don Money, third baseman, would undergo a hernia operation tomorrow and probably will be out of action three to four weeks.

title: College, School Results
Ford Address on Oil Fees and Controls
description: WASHINGTON, May 27Following is the prepared text of President Ford's televised announcement tonight of decisions to increase fees on imported oil and gradually reduce controls on domestic petroleum products, as recorded by The New York Times.

title: In Memoriam
description: HUGHESJames H. 24th Memorial Masse?? offered. It was a revelation of the was in which the love of a great man ?? as he kids exhaults the woman on when it is overt. Beauty that reaches acr?? the long years or a happy marriage has an irrestible fascination. He still liveth. Eternal rest, my dearest Jim.

title: People and Business
description: Stanley goldblum, founder and former president of the Equity Funding Corporation of America, and two other former top executives of the company began serving Federal prison terms yesterday for their major parts in directing one of the country's biggest business swindles.

title: Woman Wins $18,455 On a 5c Slot Machine
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 27 (Reuters)  A Las Vegas housewife won today what is believed to he the largest. jackpot ever paid here on 5cent slot machine$18,455.19.

title: Flyers Win Cup Again
description: The Philadelphia Flyers won the Stanley Cup playoffs of the National Hockey League for the second straight year. The Flyers defeated the Sabres at Buffalo, 20, last night to take the four  of  seven  game series, four games to two. Page 31.

title: U.N. UNIT REPORTS ON PRICES SURVEY
description: GENEVA, May 27A United Nations agency that deals with problems of the developing countries confirmed today that a group of experts reporting to it had found no conclusive evidence that such countries suffered from longterm unfavorable price movements.

title: Chinese Going to Rome
description: ROME, May 27 (AP)China will take part in its first official track and field meet in Rome on June 25 and 26. The Chinese will compete with Italy, Rumania and Spain, the president of the Italian Athletics Federation, Primo Nebiolo announced today.

title: WINE TALK
description: There is an old story about a man who orders a rare wine at a restaurant. The waiter brings the cobwebby bottle to the table, but not as gently as the customer would like.

title: Soviet Denies It Plans Bases in Libya
description: MOSCOW, May 27The Soviet Union today denied reports in the Egyptian press that it had signed an agreement providing for Soviet naval and air bases in Libya.

title: Alabama Voids Variance to U.S. Steel
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., May 17 The Alabama Air Pollution Control Commission refused today to grant the United States Steel Corporation an extra year to clean up its Birmingham opperations.

title: Saudi Economic Unit Ends 6  Week U.S. Tour
description: Saudia Arabia's first economic mission to the United States closed a sixweek, 90city tour of this country with a seminar yesterday here, at which the head of the mission said he was overwhelmed by the response of American businessmen to his group.

title: Judge Bars Review Boards at Hospitals
description: CHICAGO, May 27A Federal judge barred today the Department of Health, Education and Welfare from implementing regulations that would require evaluation of a doctor's decision to hospitalize Medicaid and Medicare patients.

title: Recent Challenges Stir Concern in Publishing Circles
description: Since the Clifford Irving hoax, which gave the public a rare peek into how publishers authenticate or fail to authenticate manuscripts, there have been several publishing ventures of late whose truthfulness, accuracy and validity have been questioned.

title: STATE TO LEGALIZE SOHO APARTMENTS
description: A new state policy designed to give legal status to thousands of socalled illegal cooperative apartments, most of them in old commercial buildings in the downtown SoHo area, was announced yesterday by Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz.

title: Sun Never Sets on Madison Square
description: In the beginning, Madison Square Garden was situated on Madison Square. Then it moved uptown to 50th Street and Eighth Avenue, then down to 32d and Seventh. And nowwell, yesterday Muhammad Ali of Louisville, Ky., and Joe Bugner of St. Ives, England, sat beneath a poster that announced: Boxing is all the way back at the Garden. In block letters across the bosom of Ali's white Tshirt were the words: Look who's back in the Garden, and accompanying this message was a portrait of the heavyweight champion of the world. Bugner's shirttront was equally literary. Me too, it read, Joe Bugner, June 30, 1975. The two were, indeed, in the Garden, but only to talk. When they fight for Ali's title they will be in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, which is some distance removed from Madison Square.

title: Rites for Charles Dean, 24, Missing in Laos Last Year
description: A memorial service was held Saturday at St. Luke's Church in East Hampton, L.I., for Charles Maitland Dean, who with a companion disappeared last Sept. 5 while traveling down the Mekong River in Laos.

title: RECOUNT WORKERS ARE INDICTED IN OHIO
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May 28Former Gov. John J. Gilligan's, Recount Planning Committee, formed after his unexpected, reelection loss last November, was indicted today for tolerating theft of state funds by several of its workers.

title: Market Place
description: As President Ford indicated Tuesday evening by tearing pages from his calendar for the television audience, Congress has done little during the past several months about energy.

title: SexDiscrimination Ban In Credit Called Costly
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 Spokesmen for major grantors of consumer credit said today that it would cost them millions of dollars to comply with proposed Government regulations implementing new legislation barring sex discrimination in the granting of credit.

title: Mrs. Sheehan Is Told by Court To Quit Women's Agency Post
description: TRENTON, May 28Patricia Q. Sheehan, the Commissioner of Community Affairs, was ordered today to resign her position as Acting Director of the State Division on Women.

title: Northrop to Talk in Paris To Aides on Fees Abroad
description: Officials of the Northrop Corporation have scheduled a series of meetings in Paris this week and next week with individuals who are likely to be named in a new report on Northrop's controversial payment of $30million in consultants' fees and agents' fees abroad, wellinformed sources said yesterday.

title: Barbara Meister's Playing Is Best in Copland Sonata
description: If Barbara Meister had played the rest of her Tuesday night program at Carnegie Recital Hall with the same poise and technical control that she brought to the Copland Sonata, it would have been a treat. The pianist's dry, rather forceful tone was entirely appropriate to he angular shapings of the sonata, and her clearcut rhythmic pulse kept the music intense and involving.

title: Companies in Vietnam Report
description: OSAKA, Japan, May 28 (Agence FrancePresse)  The South Vietnamese subsidiaries of two Japanese electric appliance manufacturers have resumed production after the takeover of the country by Communist forces.

title: BERME TO SUBMIT 2 BUDGETS TODAY, ONE A CRISIS PLAN
description: Mayor Beame is expected to submit two budgets to the City Council and the Board of Estimate todayone balanced with new state aid and taxes he is seeking and the other a crisis budget reflecting the drastic economies that he says will have to be made if no aid is forthcoming.

title: Bizarre Outbursts of Tourette's Disease Victims Linked to Chemical Disorder in Brain
description: The elderly woman and her middle  aged daughter, both simply but neatly dressed, were walking arminarm down a quiet residential street in Brooklyn. Suddenly, the daughter stopped and spewed forth an incredible string of obscenities.

title: Memorial Services
description: ??EUCKEROTHOtto H. Memorial Service for Otto H. Heuckeroth. First Congregation, at Church, 14 Brookside Rd., Darien, Conn., Tuesday June 3, 1975 at 7:30 P.M. In ieu of flowers, memorials may be made to The Professional H??rsemans Association S?? Funds.

title: Nonfinancial Companies Raise Productivity 3.4%
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 Productivity, or output per manhour, in nonfinancial corporations rose by 3.4 per cent in the first quarter of this year, the first rise since the second quarter of 1973, the Labor Department reported today.

title: KISSINGER OFFERS NEW U.S. AID PLAN
description: PARIS, May 28Secretary of State Kissinger, warning that economic issues are turning into central political issues, called on the major industrial nations today to cooperate with developing countries in building a world economy that would accommodate the interests of both.

title: $200Million Suffolk Loan To Tide Over City Studied
description: High city officials said yesterday that they were negotiating with Suffolk County administrators on a county offer to lend the city $200million or more to help it meet its $1billion cash need between now and the end of June.

title: U.S. Leads Britain in Golf, 84
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland, May 28In a strong finish down the stretch, the United States grabbed 4 of the last 5 points in the singles to take an 84 lead over Britain in the 25th Walker Cup amateur competition at this cradle of golf.

title: Contract Award
description: The Lockheed California Company, Burbank. Calif., said that Australia had announced its intention to purchase eight advanced versions of the Lockheed P30 Orion antisubmarine warfare aircraft for its longrange maritime patrol mission. The total contract will be in excess of $140million.

title: City Must Borrow to Cover Its Spending Of Taxes Anticipated but Uncollected
description: By the end of June, New York City must borrow $390milion to cover realestate taxes it has leviedand spent in anticipationbut could not collect from landlords.

title: Music: Piano Diversity
description: The format of Carla Hbner's second Alice Tully Hall concert devoted to 20thcentury piano music on Tuesday night followed much the same pattern as the first a week earlier: a number of shortish works by eight widely contrasted composers, all of it devised to show the development of avantgarde keyboard techniques over the last 70 years.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: A public offering of 1.5 million common shares of Becton Dickinson & Co., at $35.50 a share, was made yesterday by underwriters headed by the First Boston Corporation and Paine, Webber, Jackson & Curtis, Inc.

title: FUTURES SOUGHT FOR MORTGAGES
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (UPI) The Chicago Board of Trade proposed today a futures contract for trading Governmentbacked mortgages.

title: OIL COMPANIES BID FOR TRACTS IN GULF
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 28 (AP)  Oil companies hid $250.6million today for the right to search for oil and gas on tracts of the Gulf of Mexico seabottoms wellknown to oil explorers.

title: Bridge:
description: The European stars on the Lancia touring team found themselves engaged in a tough battle in Miami Beach in the fourth and final match of their American tour. They began play yesterday with a lead of 6 international match points against a fighting foursome: Dr. George Rosenkranz and Sol Dubson of Mexico City, Roger Bates and John Mohan of Los Angeles.

title: KISSINGER OFFERS NEW U.S. AID PLAN
description: PARIS, May 28Secretary of State Kissinger, warning that economic issues are turning into central political issues, called on the major industrial nations today to cooperate with developing countries in building a world economy that would accommodate the interests of both.

title: Bonds Hits Pair As Yanks Win, 62
description: KANSAS CITY, May 28After giving up a run in the first inning on no hits, Rudy May of the Yanks settled down tonight and threw a sixhitter at the Kansas City Royals to win, 62, in a game that was interrupted 28 minutes by rain.

title: Conservative Priest Will Oppose Chicano Machine in House Race
description: CHICAGO, May 28A conservative e Roman Catholic priest who carried the hopes of white opposition to integration during the nineteensixties is now carrying the hopes of Republicans attempting to upset Mayor Richard J. Daley's Democratic machine in a special Congressional election.

title: BUTZ SAYS INQUIRY ON GRAIN SPREADS
description: WASHINGTON, May 28Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz said today that the investigation of alleged corruption in the handling of grain shipments had spread to every maior grain port in the country.

title: 3 Americans Freed In Laos After Week
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, May 28The eightday occupation of the local headquarters of the American aid program by students and employes ended today nearly as quietly as it had begun.

title: U.S. Complains of Violation
description: VIENTIANE, May 28 (AP)A United States Embassy spokesman said today that the Laotian Government had left a police force in the agency's compound in violation of the agreement ending the studentworker demonstration.

title: The Knicks Open the Kareem Talks
description: While the search for tomorrow by the other National Basketball Association teams begins in today's draft of college scnoiars, the New York Knicks would prefer to obtain the instant knowledge of a postgraduate, a doctor of philosophy under the backboard, summa cum experience. Quietly, the Knicks have begun negotiations with the Milwaukee Bucks for Kareem AbdulJabbar, the 7foot4inch center of gravity in the N.B.A.'s balance. Despite a salary of perhaps $500,000 a season, Kareem somehow doesn't appreciate Milwaukee the same way that, for example, Henry Aaron does. And last week Eddie Donovan, in his second term as general of manager of the Knicks, and Mike Burke, in his second childhood as their president, met in Milwaukee with Wayne Embry, the Bucks' general manager, and Bill Alverson, their president.

title: DR. IRVING GOLDMAN
description: Dr. Irving B. Goldman, a retired plastic surgeon who practiced here died Tuesday in Miami Beach. He was 76 years old.

title: About the Mets ...
description: Gary Gentry, one of the Mets' pitching heroes of 1969, was released by the Atlanta Braves three weeks ago but has agreed to test his right elbow for the Mets again. He will report to their doubleA farm team at Jackson, Miss., and could even rejoin the Mets in the next few weeks. The big question concerns the bone chips that supposedly were removed from his elbow last year.... George Stone, who stopped pitching for the Mets last August after tearing muscles in his left shoulder, worked nine innings Monday in a minor league game in St. Petersburg, Fla. He also could rejoin the Mets but nobody is taking any bets yet.... The Dodgers, who lead all baseball in cash customers every year, have already drawn 981,849 at home. That's more than twice the Mets' attendance. Last year in Los Angeles, the Dodgers drew 2,632,747 to their California gold mine. Dave Lopes stole two bases against New York Monday and two on Tuesday. His season's total: 18 in 25 attempts.

title: JAMES W. WEST
description: James W. West, president of the MacCrellish & Quigley Company, printers in Trenton, died there on Tuesday. He was 63 years old and lived at 169 East 69th Street.

title: Mets Win On Run in 8th, 43
description: The New York Mets made no medical news for a change last night but they still showed remarkable stamina by rising up out of their sick beds and defeating the Los Angeles Dodgers again, 43.

title: SAXOPHONE FACILITY BY SONNY FORTUNE
description: Sonny Fortune is a saxophonist (both alto and soprano) who draws out the full tonal qualities of his instruments in much the same way that Duke Ellington's great baritone saxophonist. Harry Carney, did. Richncss and conipleteness of tone are combined with great facility in almost everything he plays. And Charles Sullivan, the trumpeter in the quintet Mr. Fortune is leading this week at the Village Vanguard, has a crisply crackling attack that is an excellent balance to Mr. Fortune's playing.

title: Jersey Rector to Serve Church of Incarnation Here
description: The Rev. Canon Robert James Lewis, rector of St. Mary's Episcopal Church in Haddon Heights, N. J., since 1971, has accepted a call to be the ninth rector of the Church of the Incarnation, Madison Avenue and 35th Street.

title: Airbag Fault Causes Recalls
description: DETROIT, May 28 (AP)The accidental release of an air bag in one car has prompted General Motors to recall 2,000 1974 and 1975 Cadillacs with the safety device. The company said the release might have been triggered by a short circuit and told dealers to inspect wiring harnesses for proper routing. It also said that if the harness was not correctly routed, it might sit against a steering pulley and wire insulation could be rubbed away.

title: Boy, 9, Held in Killing
description: DETROIT, May 28 (UPI) The Detroit police took a 9year old boy into custody early today, charging he shot and killed a 13yearold schoolmate following a street fight. The police said the boy, whose identity was withheld, was detained in the shooting last night of a fellow student, Cedric Topping, outside a West Side home.

title: Action on Energy
description: President Ford's stopgap effort to get some kind of oil conservation program under waythrough doubling the import fee, initiating gradual price decontrol for old wells and a proposal for a windfall profits taxis far from an adequate substitute for Congressional action, as the President emphasized. What the country and the world need is a comprehensive energy plan that stimulates alternate sources of supply as well as more effective conservation. Only the Congress can authorize that.

title: Bankruptcy Predicted for 25 Hospitals If Doctors Act on Threat to Cut Service
description: About 25 hospitals in the state could go bankrupt within a week to two weeks if doctors opposed to the new malpractice law stop sending patients to hospitals, Dr. John Connorton, the executive vice president of the Greater New York Hospital Association, said yesterday.

title: In Movies Again, George Burns Is Still All Sunshine
description: My advice to the whole world, says George Burns. is to get into show business!

title: Ezzard Charles, 53, Dies; Held Heavyweight Title
description: CHICAGO, May 23 (UPI)Ezzard Charles, the world heavyweight boxing champion from 1949 until 1951, died today at the Veterans Administration Hospital here. He was stricken in 1966 with arnyotrophic lateral sclerosis, a muscledebilitating disease, and had been confined to a wheelchair. He was 53 years old.

title: 3 Americans Freed In Laos After Week
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, May 28The eightday occupation of the local headquarters of the American aid program by students and employes ended today nearly as quietly as it had begun.

title: Bill to Aid Consumer Suits Passed by the Legislature
description: ALBANY, May 28The Senate today gave final legislative approval to a bill that would permit consumers to band together in classaction lawsuits to seek redress against companies that had defrauded or overcharged them.

title: Unbeaten Sets Defeat Lobsters
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., May 28The New York Sets extended their unbeaten string to 14 tonight when they defeated the Boston Lobsters, in a World Team Tennis match before 1,265 spectators at the Nassau Coliseum.

title: MANUFACTURERS POSTPONES OFFER
description: The Manufacturers Hanover Corporation, the big bank holding company, announced yesterday that it was again postponing the sale of debt issues totaling $200million because of the current unsettling factors affecting the debt market.

title: A CONEY ISLAND NEAR THE LOUVRE
description: PARIS, May 28 They haven't yet devised a French translation for Fun City, but Paris has proclaimed itself a summer festival this year.

title: ALGERIA CANCELING FRENCH OIL BARTER
description: ALGIERS, May 28 (UPI)Algeria announced today she) was canceling a 42million barter of her oil for French. trucks on grounds that the deal was creating rumors Algeria was selling her crude at cutrate prices.

title: Gasoline a Prime Target
description: President Ford's new import fee on oil could mean increased costs of living in the New York area that would work out to $10 a year for the average Consolidated Edison electricity customer, $11.25 for the average motorist and $22.50 for the average onefamily home using heating oil.

title: Notes on People
description: From the overseas podium of a Tokyo breakfast for American businessmen, Jimmy Carter, former Governor of Georgia and an announced candidate for the Democratic Presidential nomination, made a foreignpolicy statement yesterday during what he said would be his only trip outside the United States this year.

title: Ezzard Charles Dies
description: Ezzard Charles, the heavyweight boxing champion from 1949 to 1951, died in Chicago. He was 53 years old. Page 38.

title: U.S. Confirms SovietLibya Arms Deal
description: WASHINGTON, May 28United States intelligence officials said today that the Soviet Union had agreed to sell Libya more than $1billion in modern military equipment, but apparently did not obtain permanent naval or air bases.

title: Nonfiction Proves Today's Best Sellers
description: In hardcover, nonfiction books sell best, especially howto and selfhelp books. Largeformat paperbacks. with price tags up to $8, do very well. Massmarket paperbacks walk off the racks. So do remainders. Hardcover fiction you can't give away. unless it's by Arthur Halley or James Michener.

title: People and Business
description: On May 9, 1974, a day after resigning as Secretary of the Treasury, George P. Shultz announced that he would join the Bechtel Corporation, the giant San Franciscobased engineering and construction company. He said he would have the new title of executive vice president, would serve on the board and would be a member of the executive committee.

title: E.P.A. BARS STAY IN U.S. STEEL CASE
description: ATLANTA, May 28Despite warnings that economic hardship would result, the Federal Environmental Protection Agency refused tonight to give the United States Steel Corporation another year to clean up its Birmingham, Ala., operation. Instead, it ordered the company to begin phasing out its polluting facilities starting in five weeks.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: FORD,IN BRUSSELS, AFFIRMS SUPPORT FOR NATO NATIONS
description: BRUSSELS, May 28President Ford arrived here today for a meeting of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization and declared that our commitment to this alliance will not falter.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP) Money rates for Wednesday.

title: Port Authority Asks Aid Of U.S. on PATH Project
description: TRENTON, May 28Governor Byrne announced today that the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey had applied for $277.6million in Federal funds to pay part of the cost of extending the PATH rapid transit system form Newark to Plainfield.

title: Judge Urges 1Cent Cut In FirstClass Postal Rate
description: WASHINGTON, May 28An administrative law judge recommended today that firstclass postal rates be cut from 10 cents to 8 cents. It was stunning surprise to the United States Postal Service, which had been planning to meet a deficit by raising the price to 13 cents.

title: MEAT KICKBACKS BLED CONSUMERS
description: A kickback scheme devised by several executives of major New York City supermarkets, union officials and wholesale suppliers in the meat industry cost consumers 1 to 3 cents extra for each pound of meat and netted the group millions of dollars from 1968 to 1972, according to a prosecutor who investigated the alleged operation.

title: State Employes Consider A Walkout in Connecticut
description: HARTFORD, May 28Leaders of Connecticut's 40,000 state employes said today that support for a strike was growing now that all promise of pay raises for state workers this year appeared to have been blocked in the General Assembly.

title: British Leftist in Vocal AntiMarket Drive
description: LONDON, May 28The most controversial figure in British politics these days is an intense grayhaired man who is alienating his Cabinet colleagues, angering his Conservative opponents and doing his best to get Britain out of the European Common Market.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: A Chorus Line, the highly acclaimed musical, will close its run at the New York Shakespeare Festival's Public Theater July 13 and reopen July 25 on Broadway at the Shubert Theater.

title: Cambodia Says That TakeOver Of Rubber Estates Is Completed
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 28 (Agence FrancePresse)Cambodia has completed the nationalization of rubber pdantations, the Phnom Penh radio said today.

title: MAHEU DECLINES TO TESTIFY ON C.I.A.
description: LOS ANGELES, May 28 Robert A. Maheu said today that he had declined to give testimony to the Rockefeller Commission, which is investigating the Central Intelligence Agency, regarding reports that the C.I.A. sponsored an attempt in 1961 to assassinate Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba.

title: Night Owls Celebrate Bronx Zoo's 80th Birthday
description: To celebrate the Bronx Zoo's 80th birthday, Its gates were thrown open last night to an animated pride of some 500 social lions.

title: U.S. Aides Criticize Tanzania and Zaire On Kidnapping Case
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, May 28 (UPI)United States officials said today that Tanzania had been too hasty in rejecting demands by Marxist guerrillas who are holding two American students and a Dutch woman.

title: Woolworth Profit Shows Sharp Drop
BUTZ SAYS INQUIRY ON GRAIN SPREADS
description: WASHINGTON, May 28Secretary of Agriculture Earl L. Butz said today that the investigation of alleged corruption in the handling of grain shipments had spread to every major grain port in the country.

title: Governmental Privacy...
description: In a speech to the City Bar Association last month, Attorney General Edward H. Levi seemed to be contending that the need for governmental secrecy was rooted in roughly the same values as are the rights of ordinary citizens to privacy. We do not agree.

title: Bus Coin Vaults Robbed Of $380,000, Says Merola
description: Bronx District Attorney Mario Merola announced the indictment yesterday of two of hundreds of Transit Authority employes who he said had stolen more than $380,000 from city bus coin vaults in the last 18 months.

title: Norwalk School Strike
description: NORWALK, Conn., May 28, (UPI)Twelve per cent of the city's 7.400 elementaryschool pupils showed up for classes as officials opened lowergrade schools today for the first time since a teachers' strike began Thursday.

title: ... and Individual Rights
description: Mr. Levi's general thoughts on governmental confidentiality and individual privacy are being put to a very specific test by the request of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence for a substantial amount of information from the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The request, termed by Justice Department officials as the broadest demand for classified materials ever made the bureau, ranges from information about the famed counterintelligence program to the electronic surveillance of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: The United States Golf Association is being taken to court by a group of amateur golfers who contend that their new tournament is being harmed by the U.S.G.A.

title: The Government's View
description: WASHINGTON, May 28President Ford's action last night imposing an additional $1abarrel import fee on oil will take back from the economy during the remaining seven months of this year approximately $1billion of the $23billion stimulative tax cut enacted by Congress, Government officials said today.

title: Gurney Contradicted by F.B.I. Agent
description: TAMPA, Fla., May 28An F.B.I. inspector testified here today that former Senator Edward J. Gurney told him in a 1971 interview that Larry E. Williams, a fundraiser, ?? for him.

title: Deaths
description: Berger, Jack

title: CAREY AIDES OFFER CITY FISCAL PLAN
description: ALBANY, May 28A three part plan to control New York City's cashflow problem was sketched at a private meeting here today by Governor Carey's four special fiscal advisers, then outlined by the Governor to reporters.

title: Imitations of His System Flatter Shero of Flyers
description: him out, Clarke said, as well as figure out what he's trying to do, but we can't. He comes on as a simple man, but he's full of complexities.

title: Americans Relinquishing Land Title in Philippines
description: MANILA, May 28Almost 7,000 acres of Philippine land owned by United States citizens are being turned over to Philippine companies as a result of the expiration yesterday of parity rights enjoyed by Americans.

title: Saigon Will Base Local Government On Family Groups
description: HONG KONG, May 28 (Agence FiancePresse)The Saigon radio, describing how localities were being reorganized, suggested today that a subdivision of about a dozen families would be the basic unit of Communistgoverned South Vietnamese society.

title: CoOp City Tenants to Withhold Rents
description: At an enthusiastic meeting of 2,000 CoOp City residents last night plans were announced to withhold monthly payments beginning May 30 to protest a proposal to increase maintenance costs and to put pressure on Albany for state assistance. The proposed increase, based on rising costs of fuel and electricity, would increase monthly charges for the project's 55,000 tenants to $291.25 for an average twobedroom apartment from $220.

title: Crimson Tide Leads in Devon
description: DEVON, Pa., May 28 (AP) The Crimson Tide, owned by the Stillmeadow Farm of Stonington, Conn., won his second event and pulled into the lead for the intermediate jumper championship today at the Devon Horse Show.

title: Stulberg, 74, Retiring as President of the I.L.G.W.U.
description: Louis Stulberg. 74yearold labor leader art member of the A.F.L.C.I.O. executive council, announced his retirement yesterday as president of the International Ladies Garment Workers Union.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The State Supreme Court in Mineola, L. I., ruled yesterday that Mortimer J. Abramowitz, Superintendent of the Great Neck School District, had not been defamed in a report prepared by the president of the school board. The court denied a request to prevent the circulation of the report, which dealt with a May 19 budget meeting, to 14,000 families in the district. The suit had been brought by Mr. Abramowitz and Frank Phillips and Claire Speciner, minority members of the board, against Nina Taft, the board president, and Marilyn Kritchman and Lawrence Rose, who with Mrs. Taft constitute the board majority. The majority had unsuccessfully tried to dismiss Mr. Abramowitz.

title: Band and Applause Greet Refugees in Pennsylvania
description: FORT INDIANTOWN GAP, Pa., May 28As the Northern Lebanon High School band blared a welcoming march and Pennsylvania Governor Milton Shapp ran up the plane ramp to greet them, the first of about 15,000 South Vietnamese refugees arrived today for what is supposed to be temporary settlement on this sprawling National Guard training base.

title: State Unemployment Rate Placed at 11.6% for April
description: TRENTON, May 28 (AP)The unemployment rate in New Jersey rose to 11.6 per cent in April, an increase of a half percentage point over March the State Labor Department said today.

title: FordSadat Meeting Deemed Crucial Test
description: CAIRO, Thursday, May 29 (AP)  Foreign Minister Ismail Fahmy of Egypt said today that the meeting early next week between President Ford and President Anwar el  Sadat will determine America's fitness as a great power with a special responsibility toward international peace and security.

title: KALLINGER GETS BRAINWAVE TEST
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., May 28Joseph Kallinger spent nearly five hours at Harrisburg Hospital today for neurological tests, after which his attorney added the name of the testing neurologist to the list of defense witnesses in his client's robbery trial here.

title: AfricanCaribbean Trade Spur Is Sought
description: American business representatives and economic officials of 33 African and Caribbean countries began discussions here yesterday aimed at expansion of trade and investment partnerships.

title: GOLAN PEACE UNIT EXTENDED BY U.N
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 28The Security Council today approved a sixmonth extension of the United Nations force separating Syrian and Israeli troops in the Golan Heights.

title: Houston, Energy Capital for World, Ignores Warnings of Crisis
description: HOUSTON, May 28Houston is still on its cheap energy binge, unsobered by warnings like those issued by President Ford last night that natural gas supplies are dwindling and that another Arab oil embargo would throw the nation deeper into recession.

title: $200Million Suffolk Loan To Tide Over City Studied
description: High city officials said yesterday that they were negotiating with Suffolk County administrators on a county offer to lend the city $200million or more to help it meet its $1billion cash need between now and the end of June.

title: Shero Hailed By Rivals For System
description: Why do the Philadelphia Flyers keep winning hockey championships? What is their secret? What are they doing that the other teamsBuffalo Sabres, Montreal Canadiens, New York Rangers, for instancearen't? With two Stanley Cup titles in a row, they must be doing something rightand different.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: CLOSE HARMONY Your Father's Mustache (6754630), is a hearty, familystyle Gay Nineties citadel in Greenwich Village. On an outside wall of this festively decked corner building, Seventh Avenue South at 10th Street, the bill of fare advertises banjos, beer, booze, oldfashioned singalong with the world's worst banjo band. It's not; they're bragging.

title: New Economic Indicators Would Have Seen Slump
description: WASHINGTON, May 28The Government announced today drastically revised composite index of leading indicators of the economy, which, as it turns out, would have forecast the current recession as early as the summer of 1973.

title: C.U.N.Y Y. Proves It Continues to Get The Top Students
description: The proportion of city highschool graduates with grade averages of 80 or better who go on to the City University of New York has increased since the openadmissions program was started, and the university is using the figures to disprove rumors that open admissions has driven smart students away.

title: Wife Takes Stand At Husband's Trial In Son's Poisoning
description: HOUSTON, May 28 (UPI)Daynene O'Bryan, her face drawn and emotionless, sat in the witness chair, avoiding the gaze of her husband, who is charged in the Halloween candy poisoning of their 8yearold son. Timothy.

title: Pirates, Getting a Good Start For a Change, Beat Astros, 30
description: Last year, as the major league pennant races approached Memorial Daythe traditional first milestonethe Los Angeles Dodgers led the Western Division, and they stayed there right through the season.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Ezzard Charles Dies
description: Ezzard Charles, the heavyweight boxing champion from 1949 to 1951, died in Chicago. He was 53 years old. Page 38.

title: China Appears to Caution North Korea Not to Attack
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 Administration officials said today that China had indicated strongly in recent weeks that she had cautioned North Korea against launching a military attack against South Korea.

title: Airline Group Rejects Plan To Check Pilot Performance
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (UPI) The Airline Pilots Association announced today its refusal to help the Department of Transportation plan a program to monitor pilot performance with spot checks of cockpit voice recorders and flight recorders.

title: The Government's View
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 President Ford's action last night imposing an additional $1abarrel import fee on oil will take back from the economy during the remaining seven months of this year approximately $1billion of the $23billion stimulative tax cut enacted by Congress, Government officials said today.

title: Skylab Tests Point to Cosmic Ray Layer
description: Numerous light flashes observed by astronauts aboard a Skylab as they flew through the South Atlantic Anomaly last year have been interpreted as evidence for a previously unsuspected form of radiation there.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX AND OTC LOWER
